I came here for breakfast on an early Chicago morning while staying for a work trip and was instantly greeted by a warm, cozy atmosphere and upbeat service. The restaurant can get busy (always a good thing) but it never feels rushed or pushy like more popular brunch spots in Chicago. The food itself was great; I have 0 complaints on that front and the mimosa (or 2 or 3) that I had was standard fare.

Things I tried & liked:

Avocado Toast - Topped with fresh avocado, the light and airy bread pairs well with the grains and greens put on top. For those looking for a more citrusy avocado toast-- look elsewhere. Otherwise, definitely try this side!

House-Made Belgian Style Waffle - The name is a bit deceiving; you get 4 small waffles with a beautifully done, light sweet cream reminiscent of mascarpone. The waffles are topped with fresh strawberries and garnished with a small helping of mint leaves and syrup. The dish is great; everything pairs well and it's not too heavy. However, it is a relatively small portion so if you're in the mood for waffles/pancakes, then go for the lemon pancakes (which offer a larger portion size).

Light & Fluffy Lemon Pancakes - These are pretty straighforward. You get 2 light and fluffy lemon infused pancakes topped with powdered sugar, lemon zest, and blackberries. You get Beatrix's wonderful syrup on the side. They taste great (though a bit egg-y for my palette) and are filling without bloating you afterwards.

Mimosas - The mimosas are standard fare, though you can get them in orange, blue, or red. They're worth having, though I believe they'd be more fairly priced around $6 or $7 each.

Overall, Beatrix is a fantastic breakfast/brunch spot. While it may not be as popular as other restaurants, it's a welcome addition to the food scene in Chicago that doesn't have ridiculously long wait times. Everything from the food, the service, and the ambiance is well-rounded and feels like a complete package. When tables are full, I recommend sitting at the bar to avoid having to wait in line.

I'd say the food was a 3.5, the service was a 5 and the dessert was a 5, so I averaged to a 4.

We were here for a bridesmaid lunch before my cousins wedding. First I ordered the Poke bowl. I knew it was going to be a little different than traditional Poke because of the type of restaurant, but I love Poké so I ordered it. I think the flavors for the most part were good but it was overly salty and the fish didn't taste the absolute freshest. Everyone else's salads looked amazing.

Now service and desserts at a 5. When the waitress found out we were celebrating a bride they brought us out 3 different desserts on the house. So kind of them! We all tried everything, the chocolate cake, apple pie pastry thing of sorts and caramel pie. The chocolate and the apple one were absolutely amazing.

I would for sure go back and get these pastries again and I'd go back for food to give it another try because if the service!

I don't have anything to say that hasn't already been said. The food is delicious and fresh. I got the quinoa cake with poached eggs and a blueberry mimosa. The quinoa cake was delicious and light which paired well with the yolky deliciousness of the poached egg, all on a bed of some kind of tomato stew. If you don't like runny eggs, skip this. The quinoa cakes are cooked to perfection. I was starving before I was seated and I left full. This meal is sufficient in every way. My mimosa was good too, nothing too special, but it was refreshing. Service was great. I was dining by myself and I appreciated that the server treated me the same way she treated the larger parties

There was a 30min wait when I arrived. They take your number and they text you when your table is almost ready

Couple people last night told me to try this place for brunch. Bit disappointed because I had high expectations. Service was something to be desired. I was sitting at the bar for a good 7 minutes before I was even acknowledged. Yes it is busy but maybe they should have more people on a Sunday. I ordered chimichurri steak and eggs. It was ok. And now I've been waiting for someone to look at me so I can ask for my check. I would really like a mimosa but I am not paying $9 for a glass. I'm gonna go and have some Mango mimosa for $4 at the Irish bar across the street lol

I have to update my review and change it to 4 stars. While I was waiting, the Manager Kelsey walked up to me and apologized and comped my meal which was a great gestures. Very appreciative of this amazing gesture by the manager. She saved the day

Came here for a friend's birthday dinner and ended up having a vegetarian feast- burrata, hummus, ahi... This place is very "River North," which isn't so much my scene. However, I would definitely go back if invited!

I'm gonna go with disappointing.
I felt like this place should have been amazing.  Cool concept, felt like it might be a healthy lunch option.

First, the service stunk!  I mean baaaddd!  We were with a large group (18) and had a pre set menu for lunch.  They were not prepared for us and it took about 2 hours for or meal. Further, they messed up and served tree nuts to two people with stated allergies!

The food itself was fine- some I liked, some I didn't. I got to try a lot.  

Liked:
Ricotta ravioli
Superfoods salad (though it was a very weird mix of ingredients)
Meatball
Carrot, ginger and apple juice
Carmel pie - sugary, but a small bite was nice

Disliked:
Brussels- drenched in sauce
Ahi tuna- lacked flavor, very bland (and I normally looove tuna)
Chili salmon - super fishy

pics.caption: Carrot, Apple & Ginger - tasty (not heavy on ginger - wish they actually had used more!)
Tuna - super bland. This is a no for me

review.des: Very delicious place. Went for brunch. Had a 45 min wait. Just went to the coffee bar area and ordered a yummy vanilla latte and angel food cupcake thing (so good) while we waited. Friend got the slice of the chocolate cake roll which was decadent. For brunch, had the egg white omelette, which was perfect and seemed like nice filling, lighter option. Husband got the lemon pancakes which had a uniquely eggy, melty texture. Flavors were great. I don't typically like lemon flavor items but this was good. Ambience was nice and chill.

This is going to be a very, very specific review. I eat out a lot. I use Uber Eats a lot. I'm used to just about everything from packages of food arriving in bags so greasy, I worried about sending them my building's garbage chute lest they combust spontaneously, to cartons coming apart at the slightest touch.

Today, I ordered a golden hash brown and an egg and shishito pepper sandwich. The food is always perfect at Beatrix and I'm kicking myself for not having also ordered coffee but that's beside the point.

Look at how nicely they packaged my meal. They put the food in these little plastic containers, separate from each other, and it was about the temperature I'd expect for table-side even though a Uber guy had to schlep it over.

Thank you for caring, Beatrix! That's damn fine service!

pics.caption: Look at this lovely packaging. That's aces and proof that Beatrix values their delivery customers.

review.des: Hmmm... I read the good reviews and heard so much about this place but yet I was very skeptical to try them out. Especially after 1.5 hours stated wait time for Sunday brunch. But I am glad that we had waited because it was a wonderful experience and Beatrix might be my to go brunch spot form now on. A helpful tip: they do take reservations for weekend brunch so make sure to call ahead of time. I ordered egg white omelet and my fiance got spicy chicken tinga along with some fresh squeezed juices and some cookies for dessert (peanut butter and guilt free). Everything was just exceptionally delicious! I will most definitely be back and will recommend this place to everyone!

I stopped by Beatrix today for my friends birthday brunch! The place was packed! Such a good vibe in here. I had the fresh squeezed pineapple, pear and ginger juice as well as the eggs your way entree. The brown sugar bacon was perfection! Service was great and our waiter was very nice. I also tried the Sadies crunch cake for dessert. Everything was delicious. This is one of my favorite spots and I can't wait to go back!

Beatrix. Cool name. Cool vibe. Standard urban "American new" brunch fare. But overall, just falls a bit short in multiple areas and is more "meh" than marvelous. Admittedly, I'm from Portland (yes, it's just like the show Portlandia. Please stop asking.), so I have some pretty high brunch standards. This place seemed like it was a pretty good bet - busy, lots of hipster light bulbs (Edison bulbs are to hipsters what porch lights are for moths), lots of greenery and a menu filled with farm-to-table SOUNDING fare.

I came here for an 8-person brunch so had an opportunity to try a lot of the menu. My kale salad fell flat in a few ways: One, it was gritty. Like maybe there was dirt in it. Half the leaves were rubbery and wilted. And it just... wasn't that good. I tried one of my dining companions' hash browns, and they were literally mashed potatoes that had been browned on one side. My other dining companion was deeply disappointed in his too-sweet sangria. And another friend was given the wrong number of pastries, half of which he reported weren't good anyway.

The coffee was meh. The service was fine, I guess. And the acoustics of the place are all wrong - the din is intolerably loud, making conversation next to impossible. Beatrix is like a brunch-based nightclub - don't come here to have quiet conversations with good friends, come here to have drunken hookups with strangers you regret the next day.

One positive is that the food was passable. And unlike the Land of Brunch from whence I hail, Beatrix takes reservations. Be still my beating heart! No more 10-city-block-long brunch lines? I'm ALMOST willing to accept mediocrity in exchange for such sanity. Almost, but not quite.

We were planning a day browsing around Magnificent Mile, and found Beatrix River North as solid brunch place according to Yelp.  Apparently, so did everyone else since this place was packed with 30-45 minute wait despite being a good-sized restaurant.  Its a very laid-back, loud place to enjoy lunch with classic pop music from 80's and 90's.  

Both our dishes were very good, and they have generous portions!  Wife got the egg-white omelet with white cheddar and baby spinach with a tomato-avocado side.  Very soft and fluffy eggs, but the star is their big pieces of turkey bacon.  I got the chimichurri flank steak with scrambled eggs and grilled shishito peppers.  Perfectly-cooked beef with a nice seasoned sear and good tenderness.  Both entrees came with wheat toast, though the steak also comes with hash browns.  

I can see this place being extremely popular for lunch and even dinner.  Even the hotel connected to it (Aloft) seems very hip with vibrant colors.  Its not all fun and games though - for those workaholics, there's also a nifty video stock ticker in front of the common restroom area.

pics.caption: Digital Stock Ticker in front of common bathroom area, next to Aloft hotel, for those workaholics!
Egg White Omelet with white cheddar, baby spinach, tomato, avocado, and thick slab of turkey bacon (5 stars)
Chimichurri Flank Steak and Eggs with Grilled Shishito Peppers (5 stars)

review.des:
Heard so many good things about this place from friends and also people I've met randomly. Did I enjoy the food and service? Yes. Did it live up to the hype? Unfortunately, no. The food was great, but I wasn't overly impressed. Nothing made me think "I have to come back!"

The restaurant is connected to the ALoft Hotel, so you can valet through them. First three hours with validation is 15 dollars.Our group of 4 started off with the Kung Pao Brussel Sprouts, and Ahi Tuna Crudo. The Ahi Tuna was aboslutely delicious, the fish was fresh and had just enough flavor! However, I felt like the Brussel Sprouts didn't have a whole lot of flavor and was seasoned mostly salt and just a touch of sauce.

I ordered the Chicken Bebe. Chicken was cooked to be nice and tender, and smothered in a lemon-y sauce. I love adding lemon to food, so this was an added plus for me! There were about 5 pieces of asparagus on top of the chicken, I wish there were more! All in all, I enjoyed it and would order it again! I also got to try some of the Straight "A" salad, which had arugula, avocado, pears, and almonds. Looked like a very basic salad and did not have that many pieces of avocado or pears, so that was a tad disappointing. I will say that the avocado and pear pieces that I got were fresh! My boyfriend ordered the Skirt Steak Chimichurri, which did not have enough chimichurri on it, and was way too chewy. I tried a piece and had to cut it into four smaller pieces to make sure I didn't have to chew for too long. Our teeth and jaws were tired from all the chewing.

Visiting our son and discovered this restaurant on Yelp. Made a reservation the night before and arrived to a bustling atmosphere on time. We were promptly seated however unfortunately were apparently caught between waiter/waitress shifts and were forgotten about for 20 minutes. Upon realizing the mishap the Manager promptly arrived with an outrageously delicious giant piece of baked praline French toast on the house.

My wife and I both had the breakfast enchiladas verde which were outstanding, and our son had a traditional eggs/sausage/hash browns combo which was spot on.

When the check arrived we were shocked to discover they had picked up the entire bill for our brief inconvenience, AND gave us three delicious pastries to carry out.

The food gets 5 stars by itself, management and customer relations would get 10 stars if Yelp had such a rating. Definitely a breakfast destination worth going to in Chi-town.

The filet mignon roast had good flavor. The roast was falling apart perfectly, however, a few bites were still chewy. Great overall, though. The mashed potatoes were great, as were the snap peas.

Service was fantastic. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable about the entire menu. She provided great recommendations.

pics.caption: Filet Mignon Roast with Mashed Potatoes (horseradish sauce on side) and snap peas.

review.des:
It's devil magic, I say!!!  How could anything as good as everything here at Beatrix come out so ridiculously quick?  It doesn't seem humanly possible for a pork shank that's as tender and succulent as this one, could come out in less than 10 minutes of us ordering it.  There is some dark, glorious magic happening behind the scenes here at Beatrix...like they say, if this is wrong then I don't ever want to be right.  

My partner-in-crime and I strolled into bedazzling Beatrix on a cooler summer night when the windows to the sidewalk were open, letting in all the wonderful sounds (or not so wonderful construction hoppers and noises) of Chicago.  Beatrix is cozy, but airy, making it the perfect place to dine in any season.  The restaurant truly is beautiful, especially at night when you are able to enjoy the wonderful mood lighting accompanied by the lights of the city.    

The atmosphere was well complemented by the fantastic service we received!  I walked away from Beatrix repeatedly commenting on how wonderful our service was even though our waiter made the mistake in telling us the Three Floyds bomber they had was something different than what he brought out.  I mention this, but I was by no means mad because 1) the fact that they had a Three Floyds bomber was legit and 2) I pretty much like all Three Floyds beer.  Don't worry, we educated him on the wonderful world of Three Floyds before we left.  My job is done.

Our waiter told us how the menu worked - as you make your way down the menu you'll find progressively richer items.  We went with the richest one of all - the pork shank.  It was devilishly divine!  The meat fell off of the bone, and the mashed potatoes and peaches that lied at the base of the shank were amazing.  Right before getting the shank, the hummus we'd ordered was brought out.  I loved this hummus so very much that I would probably rank it as the best hummus I've ever had.  The texture was great and it was given in just the right amount.  The caramel pie, though, is dreamy...truly heavenly.  I asked for the recipe to the caramel pie, but he wouldn't give it to me...darnnit.  

This was, without a doubt, one of the best meals that I've had in Chicago.  I still think about this meal as weird as that may sound.  Though it was on the pricier side of things, I'd go back again and again.  I doubt if there is a single item on their menu that isn't worth ordering.  Once again, LEYE didn't let me down.

pics.caption: I've cream to go with our pie
Caramel pie...you can't leave here without ordering it

review.des: Healthy food in a beautiful setting. Love the decor and ambiance here. Had a salad for my entree and enjoyed it.

I've been here three times and it was incredible each time. All dishes that I tried have been great. My favorites were the turkey neatloaf and the ricotta ravioli. Cocktails were great too, especially the pineapple habanero margarita. Will be back!

Came for a lunch meeting. It was hopping at noon but we had a reservation and were sat fast. Service was great, place was clean, and food was good. I had kale salad and a latte. Been dreaming of the kale salad since. Hence the review. I'll be back.

I went here in July and had THE BEST pancakes of my life. They literally melted in my mouth. I thought the lemon based syrup would be odd but after getting regular syrup I quickly realized the chef knew exactly what they were doing. It paired perfectly!! They were so good I had to slow down to savor the taste. I also had a blueberry Collins and that was perfectly done. Overall a great experience that I'm definitely going to try again next time I'm in Chicago and will be recommending Beatrix to friends!

Dang........this is a tough one, you guys! I love LEYE and I wanted to love Beatrix, but my dish left me pretty disappointed. However, hubby's meal was delish, so alas, I'm struggling.

I ordered the cauliflower grits, that comes with crispy brussels sprouts and fried eggs. I imagined a healthy style of grits, with ooey gooey yolk drizzling within. Instead, I received two fried eggs with cooked yolks. Ick! In fairness, the menu didn't say "over easy" but I've never had a grit & egg dish with hard yolks (who eats those, anyways??).

My husband, however, made a very smart choice with the pot roast & egg sandwich. Sounds like an odd combo, but I could eat that every week. Flavors were on point for sure.

We also ordered the rainbow toast, which was a great way to get some "sweet" in our savory dishes. Nothing out of this world, but very good!

We questioned what the Malted Freddo was, and it was described as a "grown up chocolate milk". Hubby isn't much of a coffee drinker so he took a chance........and it was a risky one indeed. The "chocolate milk" was more like a shot of espresso and sugar water (literally - there was sugar at the bottom of the glass). There was hardly a hint of chocolate...I love coffee and even for me it was a bit much! On the other hand, my latte was fabulous.

I'd for sure give Beatrix another try but we were about 50/50 for our items. Service was great and location is perfect.

Lemon Pancakes, 8/10 - Had a custard flavor and the lemon wasn't too overpowering. Came with blackberries on the side.

Avocado Toast, 8/10 - Delicious. Came with a Parmesan-like cheese with a pea purée and greens.

Blueberry Boost Juice, 7/10 - A little sweet, but a great day-starter.

Service, 10/10 - No complaints here.

Two thumbs up, would highly recommend Beatrix to a friend.

pics.caption: Very good Avocado Toast. Tasted kind of like a great Caesar salad on toast.
Lemon Light & Fluffy Lemon Pancakes were exactly that. Not too sweet or lemony. Struck just the right balance.

review.des: Great little spot tucked in the River North food/beverage scene. Quaint enough for a date but lively enough for a girls night or after-hour-happy-hour. Stopped in with a friend for some drinks and bites. I had the pineapple habanero margarita, perfect strength and spice! She had the ginger sangria, she loved it. We shared a few appetizers, Brussels sprouts, burrata and fries. All was delicious. Service was friendly and attentive. Looking forward to coming back to enjoy dinner.

Visited this pretty spot for a group work dinner and it was wonderful from start to finish. They had arranged a set family-style menu for us so there were no hard choices to be made... isn't it great when you can just sit down, sip a glass of wine, and have tasty treats presented to you?

I loved the straight 'A' salad, the deviled eggs, the lemon ricotta ravioli, and the skirt steak. At the end of the meal they brought out a truly impressive looking tray of chocolate cake and caramel pie slices. Though extremely photogenic, the dessert course was the only one that didn't rock my world as much. I think it's simply because the two selections were both so rich and similar in consistency, and I would have loved a fruity/flaky/not so sweet option. But really, can you think of a more first-world problem? All in all the meal was perfection.

The service was friendly and on-point, not always easy to do with such a large group. We were seated in a side area of the space so we weren't shouting to hear each other, another nice touch.

I'm always impressed with my eating experiences in Chicago and Beatrix was no exception. Hope to be able to come back here someday to try other items on their menu!

One of the best brunches I've ever had. Their homemade juices are delicious. All of the food is so fresh and makes you not feel like you need to take a nap post brunch. The egg white omelet was phenomenal and I still dream about the rainbow toast! A must-visit in Chicago!

Beatrix is a must if you are a foodie or simply enjoy good clean eating, appetizing dishes made with the freshest ingredients. Weekend brunch is a must. Great dinner option as well.

Great setting, very comfortable and open-air restaurant. The decor is a bright industrial chic. Service was good, and again the food was great!

Really great brunch conveniently located in Aloft hotel.   They have a delicious coffee and pastry bar.  We went this morning at 845 with a reservation and it was already packed.   Yummy food.  Excellent service.

I went here a couple weeks ago and it was delicious with a very nice ambiance. It was a little dark, but your eyes adjust after a while. My bf's parents were in town from the West coast, so I wanted to go somewhere nice with a lot of options, including some healthier items. This fit the bill! All the juices looked delicious. I got the blackberry lemonade, which was very refreshing. I also got the pork shank, which like the other reviews mentioned, was very large! I had a hard time finishing it, honestly. But it was very tender and had great flavor. I'd definitely recommend it. My bf got the short rib, which he said was also tasty. Since the dinner experience was great, I'd like to come back sometime to try the brunch.

pics.caption: Caramelized Pork Shank with Cider Reduction Dinner

review.des:
Today the service was subpar (very slow) we didnt even get anyone to the table with water for at least 10 mins. Our food took a very long time after the waitress finally came to take orders. I have had similar problems with Beatrix but it still one of my favorites.

The food today meh... My go to favorite the brussels with cauliflower mash was a bit on the cold side, the turkey bacon was under cooked and my drink was not good. The french toast that we ALWAYS order for the table was a bit doughy. We had to send my friends salad back because they gave her iceberg lettuce :( where they do that at? And it stated on the menu that it didn't contain iceberg. Seems like when they are ON they are ALL the way ON but when they are OFF its a definitely miss.

I will continue to support I still love it here but y'all got to be consistent! Dang!

I am upset they switched out one of my fav drinks tho...

pics.caption: This French toast is so amazing tho

review.des: One of my go to places for any meal. The fresh squeezed juices are great. My favorite thing on the menu has to be the crispy kale salad (unfortunately only available on lunch and brunch menu). And the shakshouka (only available on the breakfast NOT brunch menu). If I could change anything, I would want these menu items on every menu :)

I took some guests here on Sunday of Labor Day weekend. It was really crowded - heard there was an hour wait - but I made reservations and we were seated on time. I had asked them to make sure I got the check. I emailed them a form w/cc information and I never saw the bill - done seamlessly. I'm sure that there are many restaurants out there who would screw up something that was really important to me. Food and service were outstanding and my guests loved the restaurant!  Thanks for making this a really positive experience.

We ate here for dinner one night, for no other reason than it was attached to our hotel (Aloft).  It was busy but we managed to get a table without a reservation.  We ordered the short ribs and the housemade risotto ravioli.  Both were tasty but I wouldn't say they knocked it out of the park.  However, we spent a great deal of time that weekend at the breakfast bar, ordering coffee and turmeric chai, which were outstanding.

We had reservations to meet friends here for brunch, but the hotel/restaurant coincidentally suffered a pretty serious water/sewer leak that same morning.  The staff was pretty busy cleaning all that up, however, they were able to transfer our reservation to the Fulton Market location, which was a great experience that I'll review separately.

I came here for dinner and then again for coffee the next morning.  Dinner was great, but service was not so great.  Hopping place, so I suppose our waiter was just really busy.  Definitely recommend making a reservation and grabbing dinner.

While waiting for my food to arrive, I was seduced by the coffee and pastry bar.  When I came by the next morning I was able to get a cup o' joe and an amazing bacon breakfast pastry (hey, you can always use leftover dinner bacon for breakfast!).  

Put this place on your list to check out.

Fresh Squeezed only means they squeeze some juice into carbonated water.
I ordered the mint and cucumber fresh squeezed drink, it was mostly carbonated water and a few sprigs of min and a bit of cucumber flavor, I guess this goes down smoother with some alcohol, so you don't realize this should not qualify as fresh squeezed anything. When I think of fresh squeezed, I think of a something more fruitful, like OJ. Not some water and a fresh squeeze of some essence of mint and cucumber.
Hi Spencer!! Love the service the food the ambiance. Basically everything. We from la and we love it

Love the ambience and the location of this restaurant. The food is always good. I've come here for brunch and always enjoy sitting at the kitchen counter to eat. The dinner menu is good too. This time I ordered  Chilean Seabass ($32) expecting a couple of sides but there or northside at all. Only the fish. I left the restaurant quite hungry!

After refusing to wait in the amusement park lines at Beatrix many times, we finally woke up one morning early enough to enjoy a 10 minute wait to see what all the fuss is about.

The best stuff we had was the fresh squeezed juice (pineapple pear ginger, yum!) and the lemon pancakes.

The avocado, bacon, and chicken tinga were decent, but nothing special.  Service was great, we were in and out in about an hour.  The decor and ambiance are typical for river north brunch spots.  Somewhat upscale and loud, though dress is casual.

Overall it is a good spot to grab brunch, but I personally wouldn't wait in any lengthy line for it.  Reservations would be your best bet, because dropping in without one will not really work on the average day.

While vacationing in Chicago, I had dinner here with my sister to celebrate her birthday.  I made a reservation on Open Table but didn't really need it as the restaurant wasn't as busy as I was expecting it to be (which is not a bad thing).  My sister ordered the ravioli and I got pork shank- both were amazingly delicious.  We probably should have ordered appetizers but after seeing the dinner menu, I knew we'd be stuffed on the entrees alone.  I asked our waiter for the dessert menu because it was my sister's birthday.  While we were browsing the options, he surprised us with the chocolate cake and a candle.  Not only was this what we were planning to order but it was SO GOOD.  Like, seriously so good.  Overall dinner was fantastic, the atmosphere was really cool, and the staff were all super friendly.  I would definitely return if I'm back in the River North area on future trips to Chicago.
Great menu and the food was great. The pastries were also really delicious and they had gluten & dairy free options.

So lovely! From the gorgeous furniture and decor to the hearty portions of gourmet comfort food, Beatrix was perfection. We had 16 people in our group, and they didn't miss a beat with service. Food and drinks came out at just the right times, and everything was beautifully presented. They cleared our plates a little too swiftly, but only because there was a parade of more goodies to come.

Desserts are insane! Save room, they are no joke.

Definitely recommend for a group dinner, for business biz or personal biz.

pics.caption: Group dessert- caramel pie and tall-dark-handsome chocolate torte

review.des: Loved this place! Very cute ambience for a girls brunch. The lemon pancakes were amazing and the avocado toast was really good and healthy!
Food was good but small amounts and Expensive. Ambience was lively and but it had Fox News on the TV kind of destroyed the mood.

Vegetarians and vegans, did you know that Beatrix is stocked with vegan options? After speaking with River North's extremely helpful GM, Steven, he helped identify vegan options for brunch, lunch, dinner, AND dessert. Take a look at their vegan options as of November 2017 in the picture attached and on my site here: veganchicago.co/restaura…!

For more vegan options around Chicago, follow me at @vegan_chicago on Instagram!

Found this place on a google search while in Chicago for a short pleasure trip!
Needed a brunch spot that was walking distance from my River North hotel and close enough for me to get to Navy Pier afterwards.
This place is beautiful inside and outside. Hence why I wish there was more outdoor seating! I would have loved to enjoy the Tuesday morning Chicago streets.

The Good:
- I was seating fairly quickly (party of 1)
- large windows that allow you to feel like you have outdoor seating while inside
- Server was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive
- They offer fresh squeezed juices and give multiple combination options!
- Price point is very reasonable
- Ambiance
- They offer almond and soy milk for coffee options
- Location

The 'meh':
- The food was OK.. that's it, just ok. I had The Steak Chimichurri and Eggs. Ordered the steak medium. It came more well done and was a bit tough. Dish also came with hash browns which we not good at all..

The bad:
- Those mushy hashbrowns. Maybe offer a substitution (maybe fruit)
- The cappuccino was not good. Coffee had that burnt taste and it took forever to come. They were probably busy burning it.

I'm giving three stars because, it's a restaurant, you should serve good food. I expect good food first! Although there were a lot of good things about this restaurant, I came to EAT and was not wowed at all!

Up until this week, I'd been to Beatrix previously for coffee... their baristas are fabulous and I have fond memories of both their Nitro Coffee and a Honey & Cinnamon Latte.  They also offer a Bulletproof coffee that I am wishing I was sipping right about now!

I recall their breakfast / brunch / pastry menu looking amazing, but haven't yet had the opportunity to try it.  I didn't even realize that Beatrix offered dinner until Andrea R planned a group dinner for me and 16 of our closest colleagues during a recent conference.

Well, Beatrix blew us away.  Amber was our server and she rocked it with her attentive service, but the menu was fabulous.  We enjoyed a huge family style meal consisting of the following:

STARTERS
-hummus
-potato salad deviled eggs
-straight "A" salad

ENTREES
-skirt steak chimichurri
-chili & chocolate glazed salmon
-lemon ricotta ravioli

DESSERTS
-oh my! caramel pie
-tall, dark & handsome chocolate cake

Everything tasted fresh and delicious... French fries ended up making an appearance as well, and Beatrix catered to our vegan guest too.  We also had some fabulous wine and cocktails.

Definitely a challenge to choose favorite items from what we had, but the hummus, salad, steak, and caramel pie stood out to me.  It was a very memorable meal - both due to the menu and ambiance Beatrix provided, but also because of the fun conversation that always comes when I'm with my work family.

Thank you for a five star feast, Beatrix and Andrea R... I will definitely be returning and wouldn't hesitate to go for coffee, breakfast, lunch or dinner!

pics.caption: Oh my! Caramel pie + tall, dark & handsome chocolate cake

review.des:
This review is for 8/26/18: So so SO good! We ordered the green chili enchiladas and the steak & eggs. Both were excellent. There was a long wait when we got here (1 hour + for 2 people), however while ordering a coffee a seat opened at the bar. If you aren't starving, wait it out to eat here! Everything is good, food, drinks and coffee. Would definitely recommend and will be back!!!
Service was top notch.

Great River North Chicago spot. This is a great place for brunch, lunch, or dinner and is located adjacent to the Aloft hotel in River North on the corner of N Clark St and W Grand Ave. I love the River North area of downtown Chicago and this is a perfect spot. The restaurant has plenty of natural light and outside seating for nice summer days. The food is terrific and the staff is attentive and friendly. I was staying in the hotel and made several trips to Beatrix during my stay. We were there for brunch and dinner. The menu has a good variety, the food quality is consistent and the staff was great. There is a full bar along with a pastry and coffee bar in you need a quick grab and go. This is a fantastic casual spot and I definitely recommend stopping by for dinner or brunch when you are in the area.

In one word: swoon-worthy.

Whenever I think of eating at Beatrix, I literally swoon. The interior feels like a cozy, modern living room. I love the variety of cozy seating options, the plant life, the cafe vibe with a killer menu.

The cafe/pastry counter is a feast for the eyes while you wait (or on a stop-in for a lightly sweetened matcha latte and a lemon angel food cake light-as-air muffin). The brunch menu is my absolute favorite, with dishes like the "wonderful egg-white omelette" and the bread pudding as my top choices, though the quinoa cakes, cauliflower grits and chilaquiles are equally as orderable. Sample one of the tasty breakfast beverages - with or without alcohol - they make a mean mimosa, and the house-made cucumber/mint soda is the definition of refreshment.

I've just recently tried Beatrix for lunch, and LOVED the Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts. My friend and I each ordered the "Enlightened Caesar Salad" which was tasty (don't be afraid of the yogurt-based dressing), with parmesan chunks aplenty and perfectly cooked and seasoned Salmon on top. My only complaint was the plain and wimpy romaine/iceberg lettuce on this salad, when it feels like kale or some other heartier greens might be a better choice. Overall I wasn't as impressed with the lunch menu as I was the brunch menu, but that wouldn't stop me from coming back to try more of it.

This place is top notch, flavorful and healthy options with a full coffee and cocktail bar. I had the chicken kabobs on a bed of hummus and cucumbers and it was stupid good. Service was five stars and the vibe was inviting and full of energy.

Definitely a gem in the city. I haven't eaten anything I didn't like. Large gluten free menu with gluten free dessert and a few vegan options as well.
There's 2 full bars as well as a coffee bar and pastry case.
The whole place is soft industrial but very warm. Some of the tables have big comfy couches as chairs.
Everything is very clean and well kept.

All of the salads are delicious and filling. If you're in for brunch you have to get the cauliflower grits and the rainbow toast

Back again, this time for breakfast. The place is busy, even early morning! Their rainbow toast was great- a crusty piece of sourdough topped with a creamy ricotta and three kinds of fruit jam. (blueberry/blackberry, peach/pineapple, strawberry). It was plenty filling and not too sweet. Even better with a sprinkle of salt on top. Recommend!

We are still talking about the food we have Beatrix! We thought we were going for brunch, but we missed the time. That was okay! The dinner food was so good that we forgot about brunch. My husband had the chicken and it was literally glowing. That chicken was incredible. The salmon was so good. The chef clearly loves his food. The atmosphere was great and chill. The parking wasn't bad. We had to circle a couple times before we found street parking, but it was worth it. I can't wait to go back!!

Waitress was great. Moved our seating to an open window seat which was really great for people watching. Wasn't wowed by the food. I had a simple dish of grits, brussel sprouts and cauliflower - tasted like my own home version so I wasn't expecting much anyways. I will come back. I enjoyed my mimosa.
Love this place! Healthy options, good coffee and great environment!

Solid showing. Food was delicious, strait forward and delivered fast. Staff is awesome too.

Highly recommend the cocktails!

I've now dined at all three locations. While the Fulton Market location is my favorite space, the food, service and menu at all three sites are excellent. This last visit was with my partner and her out of town relatives. Our waiter was attentive, engaging, knowledgeable and helpful. Most of the table had the lightly breaded chicken breast served with asparagus, I had the Salmon. (Both were excellent.) After dinner we had coffee and dessert. I really appreciate that they still serve decaf coffee when many restaurants have abandoned it. I had a kouign amann and others had the Oh My carmel pie. Warmed with some ice cream would have made my amann a six star dessert

It's funny, Chicago has a reputation for being the pizza, beef, Italian epicenter, but in the last couple of years, I've noticed more healthy options. It might just be that I'm more aware, but I appreciate that there's an evolution in the food scene in Chicago.

I love visiting Chicago. Even the worst restaurants are decent. It's a tough place to be successful in the restaurant business but Beatrix has filled a much-needed niche.  

I was in Chicago for work and a colleague suggested Beatrix. My office is at 77 West Wacker, so it was an easy walk. The place was super busy, but we made a reservation online and were seated right away. The menu makes full use of greens, grains and lean protein. They had a number of juices, and my colleague suggested a power green juice that was made with a variety of greens and pineapple. It was super! There was a slight saltiness to it, which I think accentuated the sweetness of the pineapple.

For appetizers, we ordered Kung Pao Brussels sprouts and turkey meatballs. The Brussels sprouts were the best thing I ate all week. I have to figure out how to make those at home. The meatballs were good too. Full disclosure...I make Asian turkey meatballs and burgers that have green onions, cilantro, ginger, hoisin, garlic, etc, so the taste was similar. I really enjoyed them.

For my entree I got the enlightened Caesar with salmon. It was ginormous!  Overall it was tasty, but desperately needed a little more acid. A squeeze of lemon would have made it!  

I really enjoyed this restaurant. I thought the decor was warm and modern and the food super high quality. I get why people flock to this place.

We came here for late lunch and had a wonderful meal! I had the pot roast sandwich which was very tasty! I love that they served it with a good horseradish sauce!  My wife had the chicken sandwich that was very tender and juicy sliced chicken.  

We came at 3p in Friday and was seated immediately.  Service was prompt and attentive.  

The menu is short but diverse. Choices for all dietary types.  The prices are quite reasonable too.

Would come back again.

Heard good reviews about Beatrix, had the opportunity to check it out for lunch. After moving to Chicago in June and overall disappointed with the service industry in this town, I am greatly satisfied with the service at Beatrix! Jesse B was great, from recommendation to her friendly service.  Thank you and I will be back!

We visited Beatrix a few weekends ago with a very large group (16 people) on Saturday brunch, and were very pleased with the service, atmosphere, and the drinks.  The food was underwhelming in terms of brunch, and we left still hungry, but the other aspects of our visit were outstanding.  Expect to spend some coin.  We'll be back, but only for drinks next time

Easily one of the best brunches I've had in Chicago! Got the spicy chicken tinga, which wasn't really that spicy (thankfully there was Cholula on the table) and it was a very filling meal. Not as pricey as other kind of bougie places in the city, and I'd say so definitely got my money's worth.

The restaurant itself is gorgeous too, and the service was friendly.

Went in for a late weekday breakfast on a recent business trip and really enjoyed it! It's semi-connected with the Aloft hotel, which at first made me worried...would it be a mediocre hotel restaurant. Short answer: hell no.

The setting is inviting and cool. With a walk up area for those wanting to grab something from the espresso bar and a light snack or generous seating for full service dining. When we arrived it was definitely busy, but still relaxed.

I love that they have such a great menu with something for everyone. Mostly healthy menu with fresh pressed juices, oatmeal, simple egg dishes, and toasts. In addition, something for those of us who partake of carbs: lemon pancakes and vanilla waffles.

I had the lemon pancakes and a soy vanilla latte and was incredibly pleased. It came with a lemon syrup that was incredibly balanced and put the pancakes over the edge. My eating companions ordered chicken tinga dish and waffles. Both were beautifully plated and totally awesome. We were all pleasantly satiated.

I definitely recommend it and will be back when next in Chicago.

Awesome brunch spot. Visited beatrix with a 10am res on a Saturday (and it was ALREADY packed to the gills) over the chicago marathon weekend. It's a pretty large place so the crowds definitely proved how popular it is. I loved the vibe on the inside - modern chic meets relaxed comfort.

I ordered the jasmine green tea that came in this personal steeping device (pretty damn cool) and P ordered a spicy bloody mary. I ordered the oatmeal and a cup of melon and berries on the side (eating basic before the marathon), but thankfully the oatmeal was flavorful. P got the green chili enchiladas and a side of hash browns and loved both. It's hard to find real has browns nowadays for some odd reason....

Would definitely come back here if we visit chi town again!
Ordered the ginger sangria and poke bowl.  So yummy!  Lots of interesting menu items.  Fun, trendy atmosphere.

pics.caption: It's pouring rain, but I finally get to sit down for lunch.  I love an adventure trying a new place.

review.des:
I like coming here for lunch and grab a cup of coffee during weekdays. Less crowded and I always get seated right away!

It was my friend's recommendation and she took me here for coffee. I never had bullet coffee before. It was very rich taste and I loved it so much! I consider it as sweet and bitter in one cup, so no physical sweet stuff like baked goods necessary :) I tried some latte and cappuccino, but milk was not poured beautifully and lost the rich texture which made me disappointed. And I feel taste is not consistent.

Lunch menu is not very exiting nor extraordinary, but it's very healthy and good for people who wants to eat healthy and be satisfied. You can add chicken or salmon for your salad (forgot the price) even if it didn't say on the menu. Even though you don't add any proteins, you'll love the salad! I love their dressing and fruits for some sweet kicks. I love the fresh squeezed juice too. I wanna try them all!!

Venue is very clean. I love the atmosphere, decor, and music. Service is very nice and stuff is friendly at most time. Only problem I had was that wifi didn't work for my PC. It worked for my phone, so it's probably some settings between the connections of my PC and wifi router.

pics.caption: Power green and Straight "A" Salad w/ salmon

review.des: Brunch here is worth the wait . We waited approximately 1.5 hrs to sit down here and the wait was well worth it . I had the honey cinnamon latte which was just amazing, rainbow toast , expresso and Pecan Praline French toast.

I really enjoyed this brunch spot! Super friendly staff and fast service. We came on a busy Saturday but had to sit at the bar...which was odd Bc there were quite a few tables open. Whatever. Best Bloody Mary bar I've seen... SO many options. I was so so full after my Bloody Mary alone lol. Here are the food items we tried and enjoyed. They weren't anything crazy, but def tasted fresh and yummy:
Straight A salad--huge...very filling
A wonderful egg white omelet
Cauliflower grits and eggs
Brown sugar bacon--MY FAV!!!
Chicken sausage--expected links, got patties

Will be back here to try more!

A visually inviting atmosphere of delicious and fresh food is always a win for this busy city.  I really love the options of fresh juices and awesome and non boring food choices that they have here.  The service was prompt and everyone was so nice helping me and my friend.  

We had the Kennebec dries which seemed to be a fried lemon with a few few or sautéed shishito peppers with some kind ranch and a dash of cayenne.  The halibut was a wonderful summer dish on a bed or watermelon, basil and grape tomatos.  The neatloaf tasted like a healthy Thanksgiving dinner on a platter.  The peppermint chamomile tea was fragrant and great.  Definitely will come back again.  I can't wait to come back and try other dishes next time as it is often hard to find an upscale healthy food restaurant.

pics.caption: Halibut with watermelon and nuoc cham vinegrette

review.des:
This review is for breakfast, I have been here 3x for it and for me it's not as good as the dinner-

I made the mistake yesterday of ordering this "self serve" option-Didn't really pay attention to it until the waiter brought me a plate stating "I can go as many times as I'd like" My order was chilaquiles so I find the area to get them and it's in the class buffet style, then plates with cheese, salsa, gauc etc.

Now the dish itself maybe some loved, but I thought it was gross-In the heated catering container were eggs, chicken, cheese and then tortilla chips mixed in, some were all soft and mushy, others were hard-

It just looked bad and didn't taste great, I was expecting what I had gotten the prior day at Summer House, now that was good-

The other entrees I've gotten have been so bland, so I think I will stick with dinner here-

My restaurant week experience here was highly disappointing. I chose this place given the decent vegetarian options and good reviews. I can confidently say that I'll never return due to the following reasons:

1) There was something crunchy in the burrata. Burrata should not be crunchy.

2) My friend found a palm-sized piece of plastic in her crab cake dish. What?!

3) As I made my way through my mushroom braise dish, I found a small piece of hair stuck to the sauce in the bottom. Again... what?!

I don't know if this was an off day or what, but at least the juice was tasty. Everything else was just terrible, though. We should've said something, but we were both tired from work and knew we wouldn't come back despite this being down the street from us. At least I was able to use my Lettuce Entertain You holiday bonus card!

pics.caption: Juice was tasty, but there was something crunchy in this burrata. At least it photographs well?

review.des: The service here was fantastic, everyone was very friendly and helpful with explaining the brunch dishes, and overall an appetizing start to my day.

We went on a Friday morning and the wait wasn't too bad. We had reservations and arrived about 20 minutes early and they were able to seat up within 5 minutes. There were lots of people waiting, but many empty seats so I don't know what that was about. The food was delicious and came out at a reasonable time. I recommend the waffles and  avocado Benedict and the power greens juice!

The food and ambiance here is superb. Not to  mention the amazing customer service. This is my 2nd time in Chicago and I will be telling all the other tourists to come by when they're in town.

Must get: the short ribs!!!!!! Absolutely amazing. It literally melts in your mouth.

Desserts: the caramel pie was pretty good, but it's a little toooooo rich for me. :)

pics.caption: caramel pie on the left, chia seed pudding on the right

review.des:
Started what was a lovely evening with a special lady friend at the beautiful Beatrix River North. The subtle dark ambiance set up for an exceptionally romantic evening. However, I felt that the waiter should have inquired about food allergies or intolerances because the Brie, while delightful, let to very uncomfortable gas. (Uncomfortable for both myself and my lady friend.) I should mention that I am lactose intolerant.

Anywho, after starters, I had the Wagu beef. It was tender, delicious, and worth every penny. But, I quickly felt the cold chills and sweaty palms that I know very well mean indigestion. I excused myself to the restrooms, which are exceptionally clean...or at least they were. Although I did not fully make it inside the stall, the wait staff was understanding and polite about what was an incredibly embarrassing situation.

Overall, wonderful establishment. 5 stars!

This isn't anything fancy or over the top. It's just a good old reliable LEY restaurant. I've never been disappointed when I've come here and the staff is always helpful and polite. I came with a friend recently and got a caesar salad and added salmon to it and OMG. It was so good I actually keep thinking about it. Dessert is also yummy as I've come with friends JUST for dessert and been beyond happy with what I ordered. To me this is one of the best LEY restaurants because it's just always reliable and you can always find something delicious at a fair price.

A huge thumbs up for having plenty of veg options for my companion and none of them seemed like an afterthought. It's rare that he has a tough time making a choice. Ultimately, that choice was the ravioli which was well received. I've got no complaints about the chicken Bebe either. The sauce was lemony and salty but not overly so. We also split a salad that was pre-divided on two plates in the kitchen. I always find that to be a nice touch.

Our server was friendly if slightly in the slower side and my cocktail was pretty basic but the freshly squeezed juice was nice.

I'd come back if I'm in the area wanting to burn or earn some of those LEYE points.

Why have a traditional Mimosa, when you can have a blueberry Mimosa?  Bulletproof coffee (a steal at $9), perfect grits with soft egg and Brussel sprouts, and a pot roast sandwich that will keep you coming back time and time again. This place is a perfect snapshot of sunny days, sidewalk eating, and the best parts of Chicago...  A well curated menu, that is executed flawlessly every time. Our first, and last stop, on every visit.

I'm feeling a bit generous today so I'll give Beatrix four stars. The ambience and beverages are definitely worth four stars - the fresh squeezed Valencia orange juice was fantastic, as was the honey cinnamon latte, and I really enjoyed my blue mimosa. I ordered the quinoa cakes with poached eggs, which was delicious - looks simple but the red sauce complemented the quinoa perfectly. However, my husband thought his omelet was just ok, and there wasn't quite enough egg to go with the veggie filling. The side of hash browns was nice and crispy on the outside but mushy on the inside.

The low point was the lemon ricotta pancakes. We were debating between them and the day's special, the pecan French toast. Our server told us both were good, it would be a win-win decision. The pancakes turned out to be incredibly wet and mushy. The texture was off-putting to me. My husband thought they tasted awful. I guess the staff immediately noticed our dissatisfaction and came over to explain that's how it is supposed to be..."souffle like". Maybe they should have said that on the menu, instead of describing the dish as "fluffy". Fluffy they were most definitely not. It felt like we were being served a bunch of excuses and that we were weird because we didn't like mushy pancakes. However, the manager(?) did replace our dish with pancakes made with their "regular" batter, which was significantly better than the "souffle" version.

Finally, I was rather irked when our server handed us our drinks by passing them over the rail seating we were next to, rather than walking the extra couple of steps to come around to our table side. After the pancake incident, he didn't return to refill our glasses anymore either.

Overall, I had an enjoyable meal, but maybe next time we'll just come for coffee and fresh juice at the coffee bar.

Why 5 stars? Because this was a great group dinner.

  ---   ---   ---

I've had many group dinners in my day with many colleagues from Yelp. Beatrix was like just about all of them - delicious and with enough amazing food to go around, we could have fed many others.

The problem with these types of meals, is that they are bad for review writing. With all of the plates being tossed around, 15 people taking pictures of the food, and having rare face time with co-workers from around the country, it's not easy to make notes of all the dishes, but here's what I can tell you:

The skirt steak chimichurri was the star of the show, for me. I wish I could have had an entire plate of this for myself, because it was ridiculous. Everything else we had ranged from good to great.

The place itself was adorable, the servers were friendly and I would totally love to visit again.

We came for Saturday brunch and were impressed with the atmosphere, service and food! Brady was our server and was attentive and very polite. They have alternative milk options and lots of vegetarian options on the menu. I had the quinoa cakes and poached egg, which was amazing. The marinara sauce with it was the best part. My husband got eggs your way with salmon sub. He said it was good but standard. We'd definitely come back!

We stayed at the aloft hotel which is attached to Beatrix. You can literally walk into this restaurant from the lobby of the hotel.

Now, like most of you (probably), I generally avoid restaurants attached to hotels, but this one was excepted out of sheer convenience and being too lazy to walk around downtown anymore that day.

So glad that we tried this place. Everything was so good we ended up back here twice more during our stay. We tried everything from the appetizers to the mains, and all were fantastic. I don't really feel like you can go wrong here.

Service was excellent, and there is also a full coffee shop with all the typical caffeinated beverages in addition to a bakery and juice bar. I initially thought this a little strange, but being able to order from a real coffee bar after dinner was really nice.

During warmer weather, the large doors open and you can sit right up next to the sidewalk with a large flower box between you and the masses. Really, the perfect mix of indoor/outdoor.

All of the dishes we tried, from burratta to the pork shank were excellent and had their own little flare to indicate a real pro back in the kitchen.

Don't overlook Beatrix, it was one of our favorites in the city.

Protip: There is happy hour during the week M-F where they offer $5 pours on select wines.

I had the chicken tinga, fruit waffles and my wife had Greek yogurt. We loved everything, if only I had enough room in my stomach I would have ate all the chicken tinga. The granola in the Greek yogurt was fresh and the Greek yogurt itself tasted like it was homemade. Highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch.
AMAZING! The honey cinnamon latte was so good, I ended up having two haha I also ordered the quinoa cakes with eggs, and it was unreal! Can't wait to go back!!

I love this restaurant as a breakfast, brunch, and lunch spot!

The menu is constantly changing adding seasonal twists and specials to the food items.

Everything is made from a health conscious perspective, but still tastes delicious enough that you don't feel like you are sacrificing flavor for health.

The quinoa cakes are awesome, but if you can make it in for breakfast or brunch their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best pancakes I have ever had! Seriously, these pancakes melt in your mouth, and while they are fully cooked, the whipped ricotta gives them a batterlike softness which I love!

The restaurant is a lettuce entertain you restaurant so make sure to download the app and check in to write your check in number and accumulate points (which lead to rewards and free food)!

Best brunch I had in Chicago.

The restaurant was cozy but spacious, service was friendly and quick, and the food was great.

I ordered the cauliflower with grits, which also came with crispy brussel sprouts. The dish was seasoned so well and unusual for a brunch menu. I'll be dreaming about it for weeks.

Some girlfriends and I were planning to bike around the lake and I suggested we stop here for brunch, having really enjoyed my lunch on a previous visit. We made a reservation a few days in advance and we're excited. Unfortunately, our experience was a major letdown and I couldn't find myself recommending this place to anyone for brunch.

We requested a window table on our reservation and we were not sat near the wall of windows, but rather in the middle of the crowded dining area. This was a disappointment, however, this restaurant has a really beautiful interior so we made the best of it and looked around and noted how great all the plants and lighting were.

We ordered the red and blue mimosas, which were strawberry and blueberry respectively. They were really good. They tasted fresh and heavy on the champagne.

We had a hard time deciding what to order, as a lot of the menu items looked great. One of the people with us went with the chicken tinga based on the waitress's recommendation, while myself and my friend both went for the steak and eggs. We both ordered our steaks medium rare and our eggs poached. The dish also came with toast and a hash brown. Our food came out pretty quickly. The girl who ordered the chicken tinga said it was "just ok, not great". Our steak and eggs on the other hand was a mess. Our toast was cold, which was confusing because it came out quickly so we didn't think it sat long. While we were waiting we did notice a table next to us touching each other's toast, so I assume other people had this issue. The hash browns were greasy and lacking any flavor. Both of our steaks were overcooked, more on the medium well side. Also, the eggs were a mess. They were served in a small bowl, like a teacup. They were clearly taken from the pot straight to the cup because they were sitting in a good amount of water, which, in itself was gross because when you went to put them on your plate it just made for a watery dish. Also, the poached eggs were overcooked to a medium/hard boil. We let our waitress know about our huge disappointment and she offered to have our eggs remade. That was nice, except they once again came out in a cup with a decent amount of water in the cup and our plates had been taken so our only option was to eat watery eggs.

Our waitress was great. She was attentive and checked on us regularly despite it being busy. She was friendly and full of suggestions.

I am giving this experience 2 stars instead of the 1 star is deserves because the waitress did offer a replacement be made and the manager came over to talk to us. They made efforts to make the situation right (took our meals off the check) and also gave us some pastries to go. The pastries were fantastic. There was an angel food cake muffin, a type of coffee cake covered in icing and sliced almonds, and a blueberry muffin. All were truly fantastic - they tasted fresh, moist, and not overly sweet. I would definitely recommend checking out the pastry counter here.

Overall, I've come here and experienced a great meal with lacking service, and alternatively, great service and a severely lacking meal. This place is a bit too inconsistent and our brunch was a huge letdown. Brunch was expensive for small portions and cooked too poorly to justify the price.

pics.caption: "Medium rare" steak, well, the pieces that had any pink on them.

review.des: Awesome food and mellow upbeat vibe! If u like variety on menu and baked goods-this is the place. Healthy clean food and yummy comfort food. Mimosas r not bottomless but bloody marys are strong and tall-side of celery n bacon. Sunday specials were praline crusted french toast and  enchilada buffet. Both scrumptious. We split french toast that came warm with bourbon vanilla syrup. I had poached eggs on quinoa with a tomato sauce (?)- amazing!! Attentive servers. The baked goods include gluten free and huge variety!! Love this place-True foods suggested we tourists chk Beatrix out. Want to def return visit!

I am confused as to why this place is so highly rated for their brunch. I found it underwhelming. The pastries, particularly the kougn aman and the morning bun, were very tasty. The honey cinnamon latte was also good, but nothing amazing. I got the poached eggs/tomato sauce/kale dish and while it was good, it didn't excite me. The menu was all in all bland and unimaginative for a highly rated place.

Drinks were amazing- Strawberry Basil Punnet and Ruby Soho. I had the slow-braised short ribs which were very delicious, and my boyfriend had the wagyu pot roast filet mignon. His dish was very similar to mine in terms of tenderness of meat. I loved his horseradish sauce and used some for my short ribs. We were seated next to a loud table but other than that, our experience was fabulous!

Loved it all. The deviled eggs, the "meatloaf" and ravioli and the drinks were amazing! Then came the caramel pie. Worth a trip back for the pie alone! I admit that I'm picky with restaurants but they really have it right here.

Despite the hip, industrial-looking interior, the food at Beatrix still feels like your standard hotel restaurant (it's in the lobby of Aloft). Which means not too interesting dishes but a safe bet for many occasions; and it opens for breakfast lunch/brunch dinner and even carry-outs every day.

Tsukune (Japanese-style chicken meatballs) with chile-cilantro glaze is a good appetizer to start with. The salmon with chile chocolate glaze offers a nice combo of savory & sweet and the fish is done very tender. It's served with corn tortillas and smoked almond slaw, which adds a nutty crunch. But the cleverly-named "Straight A Salad" - of arugula, avocado, asian pear, asiago, almonds - seemed just 90%+ arugula. And the ricotta ravioli is not fresh, probably frozen and reheated, told by the hard edges. Can't really comment on the cocktails since both my and my friend's arrived already tasting watered down.

Story goes that Beatrix was created out of Lettuce's test kitchen, comprising of dishes that couldn't quite make it into their other more cuisine-focused establishments. That could explain the Japanese-Mexican-Italian-everywhere-else hodgepodge of the menu; but unfortunately, albeit several solid dishes, I did not see the creativity that the sound of "test kitchen" let off.

Great, classy vibe. We went on Saturday for the brunch, but they stopped serving it at 3 so we ordered of the normal menu.

I got the honey cinnamon latte which was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend. We also got ravioli which was good, but a very small portion. Good thing we weren't too hungry. The mushroom dish with salad that was ok.

The fries with lemon were also a hit.

Overall a great place in the city to share a few dishes with your friends. Get the latte!

Came here for brunch on Saturday morning. Place was busy but didn't have to wait long for a table, their space can accommodate a lot of people. They even have a little bakery and coffee bar you can sit at while you wait.

I'm not a huge fan of brunch, mostly because I hate feel fat and sluggish the rest of the day. They have those types of hearty entrees and brunch cocktails, but also had a lot of light options which I appreciated. I got the avocado toast with tomatoes and the rest of the crew got egg white omelettes, which were fresh and yummy! I def want to try one of their juices the next time I'm there.

Service was friendly and fast. Loved sitting next to the windows which open all the way in nice weather. They also have sidewalk seating.

Good vibes and plenty of options to accommodate everyone!

What a great space!  I was lucky enough to stay in the Aloft Hotel and have to say it was fabulous to have this little gem in the lobby. It's quite popular and you definitely want to make reservations for brunch on the weekend.  Aside from the coffee bar (which we visited) and the delicious pastry counter (which we visited) you will find a small and well balanced menu containing something for everyone.  

We dined at brunch time and even though it was busy, really busy, once seated our experience was leisurely and very pleasant. The tables are spaced nicely and we got a window seat with super comfortable chairs.

I chose the enchiladas and my friend had the cauliflower grits and eggs.  Hers was the more healthy choice but I have to say mine was really tasty.  There was a small hiccup in that mine was cold when it was brought out. At first I thought it was just the sauce but a bite into the enchiladas and I discovered they were cold as well. As to be expected at any decent dining establishment they took care of it right away. The manager brought the popping hot replacement back and informed me they had removed it from the bill. Classy.

I would come back here in a heart beat, and more than likely will since I love the Aloft and it will be my choice when visiting Chicago again!

I didn't know that brunch is only during the weekends :(

Lunch was kind of pricey but still very good. I'd definitely come back here to try their brunch.

I'm not sure what's kept me from trying Beatrix as long as I have, but I'm kicking myself for it.

We were looking for a place to meet up for dinner before a play at Steppenwolf and Beatrix fit the bill. I had the misconception that Beatrix didn't have many options for a pescatarian, like me, and was pleasantly surprised to be proved wrong.

We started out with the kung pao brussels sprouts and some cocktails. I started out with the pineapple habanero margarita, which was good, but very light on the heat. For dinner, I had the chili and chocolate glazed salmon. The dish, served with tortillas, is sort of like desconstructed salmon mole tacos. It was very tasty and something I'd order again. To accompany my dinner, I ordered the Brooklynite. The only thing odd about my drink is that the manfriend had ordered the same one when we arrived and his was served differently (up) and the hue was noticeably different. A taste test showed that the taste profile was different too. I don't know whose was right, but I did enjoy the drink. My dining companions seemed to enjoy their meals as well.

We were all in the mood for something sweet for dessert, but didn't want to stuff ourselves. Fortunately, our server noted the dessert portions were large enough for the four of us to split the warm apple streudel, which was delicious as expected.

I was very happy with my meal at Beatrix. The food was good and didn't feel heavy and unhealthy (streudel not included), the service was impeccable and it was a reasonable price point for dinner in the area. I'm a fan.

UPDATED REVIEW:
They have a great staff and management which has evolved since their opening.  They have great bakery.  Not a gluten-free fan, but their blueberry bundt cake, which is gluten free is amazingly tasty!  

Their Nutella cookies are a must try, particularly if they're warmed up.  Their hamantashen (I'm a gentile, don't expect me to spell it correctly!) has a very buttery crust and a lot of flavor that really complements the apricot or cherry filling.  

Their pot roast breakfast sandwich is amazing, and even better with avocado.  

This place is consistently full every weekend, and busy during the week, ever since they opened. Another winner for Lettuce!

Love Beatrix, favorite place for breakfast and brunch.  Entire team is great and special thanks to Kristen, Jackie, Shelby, Hunter, Rene and Camilo for their amazing service the last couple of visits.  Highly recommend the egg white omelette with Brussels sprouts and salmon and their oatmeal butterscotch cookies

This place was cute and I love their happy hour, I can never say no to five dollar glasses of wine. My drink for the night was the Horseshoe & Hand grenade, I normally don't drink red wine because it's too dry for me but this one had a little bit of sweetness to it but not too much. The atmosphere was nice and staff was friendly, I'm sure to come back for again.

An awesome breakfast nook. Our party of 4 had 4 different breakfast selections. I had the eggs my way with chicken sausage. Delicious, sausage was the best I have had EVER. The steak and eggs my fiend had looked absolutely to die for. The oatmeal was fresh and yummy. Drinks were hot and flavourful
A definite stop on anyone's trip to Chicago.

What a dinner! I'm not quick to hand out a 5-star review... but Beatrix certainly earned it.

We had a unique table including a couch for two of the chairs. We ordered and ended up with the Pork Shank and the Strip Steak... all of which were out-of-this-world AMAZING!

The Pork Shank was served over a bed of potatoes. Looked and smelled lovely. The Strip Steak was fantastic... served with a lovely garnishment of herbs and pomme frites. It was all brilliantly done!

Staff was quite accommodating and made sure our experience was wonderful! This is a must next time you are in Chicago!

I went in for brunch with my mom and sisters on a Sunday morning. I had the Enlightened Caesar as well as the Light & Fluffy Lemon Pancakes. Both items were absolutely delicious! The addition of capers and the Greek yogurt dressing elevated the salad. To drink, I had the Boozy Banana Joe as well as the Pineapple Pear & Ginger Juice. Both drinks were good but not my favorite. The Boozy Banana Joe was too sweet for my liking but I expected it to be. If you have a sweet tooth you'll definitely enjoy this! I liked my juice a lot until I had a sip of the Mango Orange & Pineapple Nectar, that one was more suited to my taste. Overall we had a great experience and everyone enjoyed their meal. We will definitely come back!

We went to Beatrix to try the nitrogen coffee because one of my friends is opening a cafe in Guadalajara Mexico..... and wanted my "expert" opinion.
We almost forget to try it!!

Because we were into the food so much
The raw tuna was wonderful.
The vessel sprouts were very good.
The soup had a nice flavor.
The salmon was very tasty and the chia pudding was surprisingly better than what I expected.
Our server was phenomenal..
So...if you come to Chicago give it a try.
Ah and the nitrogen coffee....
I detested.... but I don't like cold or black coffee....
my wife enjoy it.

They offer more unique healthier options versus a traditional restaurant, they have nice sized menu with these offerings that can give you what you want if you're looking for this type of place or a nice change up. We only had breakfast here, they are open for lunch and dinner as well.

The food we tried were the oatmeal pancakes, they were pretty good. I like oatmeal style, this is a good first try if you're new to them. The chicken sausage was very good, I would get them again. The chicken tinga was very delicious and it had a lot of flavor.

They are doing some fun things here, worth a stop in anytime of the day.
I had an amazing lunch here while visiting Chicago. We loved our waitress (I wish I could remember her name), had the best bottle of bubbles, and such amazing salads.

Great brunch and lunch spot! I stayed in the attached Aloft hotel and was happy to see such thoughtfully prepared, healthy (or not, your choice), and delicious menu options. The staff was also very nice and when I asked for a meal 'to-go' they happily obliged.

Very disappointing - worst ceaser salad I've ever had. Presentation looked like something ejected by my garbage disposal, tasteless, avoid at all costs. Gazpacho was ok but have had much better.  Service is rushed and Applebee's like.  I won't return especially at this price point.  You are better off having a burger at the goat.   Sorry, a million better chicago restaurants to choose from.  You've been warned.

This restaurant was attached to the hotel where we were staying, so we went there for dinner the day we arrived in Chicago.  Knowing we had an evening show to catch, the waiter did all he could to accelerate our order, and he made some awesome recommendations.  The dinner menu offered some unique selections, and the food tasted great.  The atmosphere was casual and relaxed, but pleasant. The Beatrix has an attached juice/tea/coffee bar, which offered some interesting seasonal Fall flavors.  I got addicted to their turmeric chai latte, and enjoyed it several times during our stay.  We were supposed to have brunch here the last day of our stay, but on that morning, the hotel experienced a sewage main line break, so we had to switch plans and go to another Beatrix location.  Overall, the two Beatrix restaurants have impressed me so far.  I would go back again for sure!

I really enjoyed this place! On a recent trip to Chicago I came here with friends for a bottle (or two) of bubbles and light snack. We clearly came at an off time, later evening on a week night, so the place was a little empty but perfect in my opinion. The service was great and the drink/food selection was perfection! I will definitely be back on my next trip!

We had a wonderful experience here.  First of all- make a reservation especially if you are dining for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday.  People were waiting for over a hour- this place gets packed.  Second, Neil was our waiter and he definitely brightened up our day. His recommendations were on point! We got the honey latte and the peppermint cold brew to start. He also recommending the green chili enchiladas and the lemon ricotta pancakes, which just melt in your mouth.  Third, loved the ambiance-its all happening and trendy.  I highly recommend this spot for brunch and the portions are quite large.

I came on Friday night, we had a reservation and were seated right away. I would recommend making a reservation as there appeared to be a lot of people waiting to be seated.

We ordered the kung pao brussels sprouts, a little spicy for me, but I can be a baby when it comes to that, otherwise roasted nicely and delicious.

For the main dishes my friend ordered the lemon ricotta ravioli which was rich and delicious, definitely a more heavy meal. I ordered the pork shank which was huge! This can easily  feed two people, depending on how much you eat.  The pork was very tender and on top the best mash potatoes ever.

The waitress was great, very knowledgeable about the menu and friendly. I definitely want to come back for brunch, as they are known for their fresh squeezed juices.

Only thing that needs to be fixed is the bathroom, lots of broken things like stall handles, paper towel dispenser,  but that won't keep me from coming back.

Not sure why this is listed as a vegan friendly establishment. I stayed in the Aloft that's connected to Beatrix and had dinner once and (foolishly) breakfast a couple days later.

When I had dinner, my server suggested a few salads and a mushroom dish as vegan options. I ordered the mushroom Milanese. Literally as everyone else's meals were coming out, my server told me that what I'd ordered wasn't vegan and that I needed to pick something else. O-k? So I ordered the crispy kale salad that was the equivalent of bland kale chips on top of a sad salad.

For breakfast, I asked about vegan options and settled on the hash browns and avocado toast. But the server came back and told me all of the potatoes they serve are cooked in butter. So I ended up with some bland avocado toast. Good thing I wasn't hungry.

P.S. I tried to order a vegan cookie at breakfast time  (because I could see them on display) and they wouldn't sell me one because cookies aren't breakfast food. No bueno.

Avoid if you're vegan. Trust me on this.

Whatever you do, DO NOT sit at the bar to eat. Two out of the three servers behind the bar really need a lesson in how to interact with customers. In particular, the young lady behind the bar acted as if I was bothering her to the worst degree when I asked for something as simple as ketchup. I try to avoid writing negative reviews, but a couple of the servers working the morning before Memorial Day behind the bar need lessons in not just customer service, but human interactions 101. I mean, if you dislike dealing with customers, why obtain a job in customer service?! Also, my breakfast was cold, and when I asked for ketchup, the server who brought me my food never came back with it after I asked him very politely if I could please have some ketchup. After waiting, I asked the young lady, who ignored me until after the eighth time asking. When I asked her nicely for some ketchup, she stated coldly "Hold on," and after I proceeded to wait for several more minutes, she put out on the counter in a very rude manner a very, very small portion of ketchup (The couple  next to me even looked at me in semi-dismay on how I was being treated). I talked to the manager after my horrendous breakfast experience, and he was professional and apologetic, even giving me his business card, telling me to ask for him when I come back. However, I will not be back. I always tip 20% or more, and this was one of the first times I have not done so (I was a server, and do know how necessary tips are). I guess common sense manners, etc. do not apply towards obtaining a job at this establishment. To summarize, I was treated as a major hindrance, not a customer.

Update: A manager did offer to contact me, which is a professional gesture. (I hope to speak with him tomorrow).
