However, I posted the same review as the one I posted on Yelp via Facebook this morning, and upon going on the restaurant's Facebook page, my review somehow "disappeared." So, I reposted it again. (I have no idea how my review could "disappear" as it did)....I checked again, and my Facebook review was once again deleted. I would assume a restaurant representative would not delete Facebook reviews, positive or negative...

Food good. Ambience good. But excellent excellent service. The manager Chelsea is the nicest woman ever, and my server Risha was also super kind. So impressed! Thanks a lot you guys, you made my last Sunday in Chi town def a memorable one!

I came here after work with a few girlfriends for a drink and a salad. I wasn't expecting much but was blown away by the beautiful atmosphere. The drink I ordered it had something to do with blueberries and vodka was nice and strong. I also ordered a kale salad and it was probably one of the best salads I've ever had.

I am so happy and will be taking more friends in the future.

To start with, the food was delicious, the service was spot on, the ambience was amazing! I loved the atmosphere here and would go back again in a heartbeat, if I revisit Chicago!

We ordered kennebec fries, Kung Pao Brussels sprouts - the best take on Brussels sprouts, Vegan asparagus soup, Ricotta ravioli and their Oh My Caramel pie for dessert - is a must try, and I also had a blackberry lychee lemonade that was phenomenal.

Mmmmm my mouth is watering just thinking about Caramel Pie!  Definitely check this place out.

pics.caption: Caramel Pie - oh my !!! A must try....

review.des: I'm in love with this place. Ambience is modern and upbeat, music is calming and relaxing and not too loud, and the service is excellent. I had cauliflower grits which is basically what dreams are made of. The kids menu is probably as good as the regular menu. My son got the vanilla pancakes and the pear ginger juice which were both amazing. I also had a honey cinnamon latte which was perfection. Our bill was under $30, which is great. Especially for the area. I'll definitely be back.

Got seated right away even though we were 20 minutes late for our reservation. Wait staff was very polite and fast. Got our food probably 10 minutes after ordering it. I had the egg white omelette and was so pleased with it!! Love this place and I can't wait to visit again soon.

Super easy to make a reservation ahead of time on opentable so you don't have to wait.  Had brunch here and their pot roast breakfast sandwich was SO GOOD, and for a pretty good price.  Most breakfast places charge over $10 nowadays for a filling entree and this baby was under $10 and super delicious.

Rainbow toast was good, but I would probably not get again.

They also have an extensive gluten free menu for those who are gluten free or have friends who are.  Their gluten free joy cookie is delicious!! don't be scared by the gluten-free sign if you live a glutenful life, they're totally worth getting.

If I was living here I wouldn't come back just because it wasn't anything special. The place and the food was just decent experience nothing special! The bartender over charged us and didn't leave us the receipt. He charged us different amount even tho we had the same drinks.

I always get great service!  The food is fantastic but beware, the menu changes on the weekend!  There are tons of healthy meal choices that are tasty and I the only real complaint is the construction that makes it hard to find parking.  The atmosphere is great for a meeting or lunch with a friend!  The bathrooms are trendy as well when your ready to powder your nose!

This place was amazing from start to finish. I had the cauliflower grits. Never thought you could turn a veg I am not particularly fond of into grits so i had to give it a go. Cauliflower provided smooth texture with bits of crunch which was nice. Also shaved Brussels thrown in added a bit of bitter to cut the sweet and more crunch. Go eggs over easy and use the yolks to make the dish even richer. My friends got egg white omelette and eggs/hash/sausage and they were pleased as well. So this place does healthy and upscale greasy equally well. A rare feat!

I made brunch reservations for 11:15 and got there at 11. I checked in at the host stand and waited for my friend to arrive. When she got there, I checked in again and asked how long they thought the wait would be. They said probably around 10min and that I was at the top of the list. Then we watched numerous people get seated before us and finally at 11:45 we asked why. They said, "oh we've texted you twice and we called out your name." I was in a chair directly next to the desk; they definitely did not call it out.  Apparently they thought they were doing enough to let me know our table was ready by sending a text that says: "Your table at Beatrix - River North will be ready soon. Please make your way back to the host stand. Text '1' to tell us you are on your way. Text '9' to cancel." I wasn't looking at my phone because I had no idea that's how they planned to engage with us, since I'm already right there and have checked in twice. That's not normal. 45 minutes...so that was pretty frustrating. They didn't apologize or anything, just treated us like we were at fault. Lame.

The food was fine but overpriced. And there's a running stock ticker on the wall in an otherwise nice-looking dining room. Insert eyeroll emoji.

Not going back here.

We were in town visiting and decided to come in for dinner as we walked by. We came on a weeknight in November so there was no wait. The scene was lively and the atmosphere was intimate. We were a little nervous because we had a toddler with us so we weren't sure how long the food was going to take. However, the service was amazing! Our waiter must have noticed our toddler and told the kitchen because our food came out in record time and we really appreciated this. We ordered the braised short ribs, the semi fried chicken and a pasta for the little one. They even have a kids menu which was great! Overall, all the food was great but I would definitely recommend the short ribs. They were so tender and flavorful. The service though was definitely the best part of our experience!

This restaurant is located right next to the lobby of aloft so if you happen to be staying there, it's really convenient to have a meal there. There's also the wxyz bar if you need drinks with screens if you want to cAtch up with news or sports.

As a Canadian, I find the portions very reasonable as most of the restaurants we went to around the area gave us so much but that could partially be because of what we ordered.

Breakfast/brunch there was amazing. I highly recommend the quinoa with the poached eggs and the brew if you're up for it. If you're not sure what some of the drinks are, we had a waitress who was able to give us a thorough explanation of some of the drinks so don't be afraid to ask. It will get busy on the weekends, but if you come on a weekday you will probably be able to get a spot without the restaurant being too empty.

Beatrix never disappoints. The lemon pancakes are to die for; so delicious and light (the secret is ricotta cheese!) Staff is also very friendly. It can get pretty busy on the weekends so best to make a reservation to avoid a wait.

Overall: fresh, delicious food. Never disappoints for brunch or lunch. Outside patio opens in the summer, but they open all the windows too so even if you're sitting inside it almost feels like you're on a patio. Awesome little coffee bar and pastries too if you just want to stop in to grab a Bullet Proof coffee.

Food: stopped in around 3 for appetizers and bloody Mary's. We ordered: burrata - sooooo good and fresh, served over some pea mash creation (the pea thing wasn't my fav. But the cheese on the toast was good); deviled eggs - yummmmmmmmmmmmmmm they whipped the shiz out of the yolks, light and fluffy with some creamy sauce on the plate; kung pao Brussel sprouts - I'd like to eat these every single day, the char they get on the Brussels combined with the sauce and peppers  is phenomenal; Caesar salad - big portion for a salad, lots of arugula and it's fun that they put a big dollop of sauce at the bottom of the plate; bloody Mary's - the garnish is nothing great, but the mix itself is really good, also very spicy/peppery so if that's not your jam, be careful.

Negative Nancy: always poppin and a little noisy.

pics.caption: Bloody Mary's - garnish is whateves but the mix is great. Very spicy! Oleé
Burrata - the cheese was good, mashed pea wasn't my fav
Kung Pao Brussel Sprouts sooooooooooo good

review.des: Had brunch here on 3/11. Yes, there was a 30 minute wait however it was more than worth it! Such a cool vibe here! Although it was very busy, the service was still great and we did not feel rushed nor pressured to hurry up and leave after finishing our meals. The grits with brussel sprouts and cauliflower was AMAZING! The drinks were great, my mother got a pineapple habanero margarita and she loved it! Will be back next time I'm in the city!

Dined for lunch and sat outside. It took the server 15 minutes to come see us after we had been seated. We were likely only served because we got up and asked host whether anyone knew we had been seated. While we waited we discovered our forks were not clean and had gunk on them.

I ordered a glass of wine that took 15 minutes to get to our table. On the good side the Kung Pao Brussel Sprouts were delectable.

After entrees came no one came back for 25 minutes to check on us. We were seated outside during a prime lunch hour on a beautiful Thursday day. Lunch took nearly 75 minutes because of all of the delays and the service detracted from what should have been a fun meal.

Not a good experience. Had a 3pm reservation via Open Table. Was asked for name and quickly told in a not very friendly way we must have wrong location as no booking. I explained we were at the right place and only then did host really look for our reservation and find it. Table wasn't ready but that was no issue as we were about 15 mins early. Had mimosas at bar which were great! Waited and no one came over but lots of tables cleared and ready so went back to host and yes table was ready. We had all picked our meals while at bar and were ready to order. Only to be told no it was dinner menu now and no exceptions could be made even though we arrived as brunch was being served. Our friend had run the marathon and was really looking for eggs again no exceptions. Okay it is what it is but very disappointed. Then we waited almost 45mins for our appetizers which were simple items like burrata. Waiter was great and apologized and explained the delay was due to the kitchen switching between brunch and dinner service ‍‍. Great service and food was good but also lots of room for improvement for customer experience

Eating at Beatrix is a real delight. The selection is simply stunning. Most of all, I have to say that their breakfast or Brunch is their absolute showstopper! They make great coffees and amazing muffins and other pastries that get your morning off to a great start. With new and exciting recipes they make an old and boring breakfast into a fun experience.

The lemon pancakes and the steak with eggs were to die for. On top of that the location is great! Just a short walk to the center of Chicago with all the shops and such.

The atmosphere is not too bad at all. The vibe is very much one of an uptown New York cafe, very hip, very modern. I personally enjoy this type of restaurant a lot but I also understand if people want something a bit more calm and relaxed with a more traditional menu.

As for service, it's also a great option. However, I must say that not all of their staff works at the same efficiency and some of them could use some training on how to deal if a lot of customers at the same time. Alternatively, they could hire more waiters to deal with the amount of customers during peak hours. This is why I had to take one star off as it's otherwise pretty much flawless.

Overall, I highly recommend this place. If you're on holiday in Chicago and are looking for a place to have breakfast or are a local and want to try out something new, Beatrix is gonna be great option for you.

This was one of the first places I went to when I first moved to Chicago! It's definitely a city favorite and for good reason! It's great fresh and clean foods when you're feeling something healthy. It's also great for vegetarians and vegans! They've got interesting veggie options and can always make substitutions for you. The wait can be a bit long, but always well worth it! It's also busy but super fun. They've also got some great coffee drinks!

These people are idiots. Drop in for breakfast at 10:40 am. Told it would be 15 minutes for a table and that it would be lunch menu. Sign says breakfast until 11. Multiple tables open inside and outside. Ok. Drop back in 15 to be told we could be seated but will not take food order for 30 minutes. Wats our time. Off list

We came here for brunch on a Saturday with a reservation. We arrived a little early but was seated quickly. They have a good variety of fresh squeezed juices with or without alcohol. Kids menu is $5.95 with a juice too. I had the cauliflower grits and eggs. It was a good comfort food dish. Not heavily seasoned nor greasy. I enjoyed it. The kids liked the Belgium waffles and eggs and hash brown with bacons. The fruit jam for their toast was really good. The red mimosa was delicious as well. Service was friendly and quick. Conveniently located next to our hotel.

Busy brunch place with a good selection of brunch items for all palates. Coffee was rather light and weak. The spicy chicken tinga with two sunny side up eggs, pulled chicken in a spicy (a tad salty) with avocado sliced and corn tortillas. Very good if you're craving salty and spicy. The lemon pancakes with blackberries is another popular dish. You get three medium sized pancakes. The interior feels a tad undercooked but it was explained it's supposed to be like a soufflé style. The pancakes were not overly heavy and had a light touch of sweetness. Side of turkey came with three slices. It was decent for fake bacon.

Service was friendly and food was fairly prompt.

I've been coming to Beatrix for years, since they first opened in fact.  This used to be one of my favorite, go to places because the service was good, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the food was consistently tasty.  @Beatrix, you have likely had some staff turnover and it is starting to show.  My last several visits have been a poor experience, most due to the staff.  Rude, slow, inattentive.  I would much rather go somewhere with just okay food and amazing service, than a place with stellar food and shit service.  Unfortunately, this will be my last visit at this particular Beatrix, maybe you other locations are better?

SO GOOD!

What I love about their menu is that a lot of their dishes are healthy! I have to admit as a picky eater some of the dishes do not sound appealing to me, but every time I try a new dish, I surprisingly like it! So bonus points for having a unique healthy menu offering.

I have had the roast beef egg sandwich. It was good but a little too big to eat. I ended up taking the egg off because it was just too much. Given that, the flavor profiles were still great.

I had the enlighten caesar salad. I normally never feel full after eating a salad anywhere, but it was so good and filling! I asked if they could use darker lettuce and they mixed the lettuce for me, which was very nice of them. The portion size was huge and I ate the whole thing! I added chicken to the salad which I would highly recommend, especially if you are feeling hungry.

I tried some of my friend's enchiladas, which sounded gross to me because I have never had enchiladas made of kale and eggs, but oh my gosh, they were amazing! That is the next dish I will be ordering.

Last, but not least, is their amazing pastry selection. Everything looks so visually appealing and delicious. Everyone raves about their cinnamon roles which I haven't tried yet. I had just a basic chocolate chip cookie, but it was probably one of the best cookies I have ever had. I like all the unique options they have as well, such as a s'mores cookie or angel food cake.

Tip: sign up for their email club for a free pastry!

Terrific time at beatrix this past Saturday at brunch with my parents.
I highly recommend the crispy Kale salad. Amazing white balsamic vinaigrette...just delish, and in my opinion just what you want for brunch fare. My out of town folks loved the place, and equally we all loved our server, Ruby! She was so fantastic, and properly attentive. She had great suggestions, and was very kind. I will certainly be back to try more dishes, and enjoy this quaint atmosphere. Or quite possibly for some spicy bloody mary's... Love
Outstanding food, good portions, reasonable prices, and friendly staff. And they seated us almost immediately and without any fuss despite a full restaurant and our need for space for a stroller!

My boyfriend and I went to Beatrix last Saturday for a date night and we were very happy with our dinner. We were able to make reservations the night of even though it was pretty crowded when we arrived.

We were really hungry so we ordered the following dishes:  
Potato salad deviled eggs (4/5) - These were yummy but nothing special.

Wild mushroom risotto (5/5) - I'm just a sucker for truffle oil.

Pot roast filet mignon (5/5) - My boyfriend thought it was very tender and delicious. Prior to ordering, the waitress was kind enough to let us know that it wasn't a cut of filet mignon, but named such because of its shape.

Brioche crusted branzino (5/5) - This was my favorite dish of the night. I loved the crust and the fish just flaked off with my fork. I think the sides (roasted carrot, parsnips & fennel) could have used a little more seasoning though.

Will definitely come back to try their lunch!
Order brunch here often. The egg white omelet is delicious. The turkey bacon is not the best but other than that the food is excellent.

We dug everything we had here. The staff was cool and on point which we always appreciate. Started w a killer juice then some app's. Split a perfect short rib with cauliflower puree and finished w specialty coffees as killer as the juice!  
Also they gave my baby some free juice to boot!  Nice peop's here.

I do not know where to begin with how amazing everything tasted at this place. My boyfriend and I went for breakfast. The waffles were light and fluffy with a whipped sweet cream that was to die for. The chopped strawberries and syrup on top were a perfect touch. My boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs. The steak was so tender he could cut it with his fork. We ended breakfast with a heavenly honey butter cinnamon roll. I would recommend anyone who finds themselves in Chicago to try it out. You will not be disappointed!

pics.caption: A ton of amazing fresh bakery selections .
The best Belgian waffles and Steak n Eggs you'll ever have.

review.des:
For Valentine's Day, I put in an order for pickup from Beatrix and ordered their amazing Kale salad, burger with bacon, and two orders of caramel pie.

I wanted to surprise my husband with the caramel pie that he's been obsessing about since our trip during restaurant week. I pretended that I wasn't able to get "the Beatrix caramel pie," but got something similar around our area. Initially, he ate the burger and kept gawking about how delicious it is. Finally, when I surprised him with the pie, he took ONE look and knew it was the Beatrix caramel pie. He was ecstatic and savored every bite, and then I told him there was another one hidden in the fridge. Haha, let's just say it was a great Valentine's Day dinner, all thanks to Beatrix !

Thanks again for the amazing meal! Even as a take out, everything was perfect.

This place has a fabulous menu with creative, healthy juices and amazing salads. The service is friendly and attentive. I had their kale salad and it was delicious, plus, plus. I almost ordered an extra one to go for dinner! I didn't try their pastries but they looked homemade and fresh. This restaurant is located within but off to the side of a hotel. The bathrooms are in the hotel lobby. Anyhow, I will be back for more of that kale salad and to try something new too!
Lemon pancakes are very delicious and so is brown sugar bacon. Our server, Hunter was the best! Very attentive and considerate of my mom's allergies.

Four solid stars instead of five due to service, overcrowding, and my food.

Service was just okay, the lobby area was really tight and overcrowded; the layout was just not structured properly to accommodate people waiting for their table.

As far as food is concerned, we split the light & fluffy lemon pancakes which were exactly that: so refreshing. They came with this lemon "syrup" which had a very watery consistency, but it didn't matter because the pancakes were so good.

My hubby had the spicy chicken tinga which was really tasty. If you're looking for some good hangover brunch food, this is it. I didn't feel that it was overly heavy, and when it comes to savory brunch, I've got a lighter stomach and can't really take in richer proteins like duck and bacon. But his entree was really good.

I myself had the quinoa cakes with poached eggs. Now let me preface this next paragraph by saying that I knew I was trying to get something on the "healthier" side by getting quinoa. That said, the plate fell flat. It was just really bland and needed something extra, like spice, or additional greens or flavor. I don't know. Just because something is going to be "healthier" doesn't mean that the flavor has to be lacking. I was pretty disappointed. Fortunately, the lemon pancakes and spicy chicken tinga overcompensated for my entree.

They have a section of pastries that you can choose from as well: think croissants, cookies, muffins, scones, etc. We got the pineapple bran muffin to go (I love pineapple upside down cake and was hoping that the bran muffin would be comparable) and let me tell you: oh so good. Whenever you hear "bran muffin", you usually think that the thing is going to taste like cardboard, but it's got this nice sugary, crispier texture on the outside. I highly recommend.

What I liked: the ambiance was ok; nothing special but it feels kind of cool
What was meh: most of the rest of the menu; maybe it's because I went during restaurant week, but stand it to say, I haven't been back. Seems unpopular, but it's a hard pass for me.
Wonderful dinner and service!! Couldn't have asked for a better dinner experience. Thank you Jose!
Lemon pancakes were fluffy, light and very tasty. Great food. We also took Green chili enchilada - very flavorful. Good ambience. Good drinks.

On a recent trip to Chicago, my wife and I stayed at the Aloft in downtown Chicago and we were pleasantly surprised to see the Beatrix in the lobby of our hotel constantly filled with people whether it was for a late night drink or Sunday brunch. With outdoor seating in the summer, it's a popular place!

We went to Beatrix twice of breakfast and enjoyed their coffee and pastries. Even though my wife wasn't a huge fan, I LOVED their angel food cupcake. So unique and the chocolate topping was on point.

One evening, we grabbed a drink here and enjoyed their cocktails. I ordered the one hard cider on their menu and I wasn't a huge fan. It tasted like vinegar.

Other than that, we recommend the Beatrix if you're in the area.

Revenge is a dish best served cold....

Oops...where am I? Oh yeah, Beatrix....pretty hip place kiddos!

We stopped in here for breakfast before we all went our separate ways.  There was a bit of a wait, but it's one of the few places near the hotel that served breakfast late...11.  Stopped dead in my tracks at the sight of the S'mores cookie!  Our server was friendly, but I felt it was a little disingenuous.  

I ordered the braised short rib and egg sandwich which was deeeeelicious!  I had a side of hash browns which were average.  I also had the blue boost mimosa which was a great change from the standard.  One of us had the steak chimi and eggs...said the steak was a little tough.  The other two had the eggs anyway and they said it was decent...I mean, how can you screw that up, right?

This place is good to come to.  I would try to get here without the crowds.  It is adjacent to a hotel, so hence lots of people, especially families.  I didn't get that cookie...sad face!

Made a reservation at Beatrix for lunch on Saturday. The menu intrigued us and we weren't disappointed. The cauliflower grits were excellent as well as the chicken sausage. Loved the hummus with tomatoes. We had a person with gluten free needs and there were several yummy options in both food and desserts. We bought some baked goods for the road and, everything was good, but the angel food cake muffins were amazing. Highly recommend trying them. Service was also great. We will be back.

This restaurant is dope. I'm staying in the Aloft hotel above it, and just happened to wander in here during Chicago restaurant week (lucky me!). My server Amelia was so warm and helpful as I navigated the menu w a mild gluten allergy (spoiler: it wasn't hard to do, considering they have asterisks next to every dish that can be made gluten free). I had the Brussel Sprouts (not gf but so worth it!), the Zucchini Parpardella (INCREDIBLE ) and the chia pudding, all for 22 bucks! Will definitely be coming here again on my next trip to Chicago!

pics.caption: The Brussels were extremely filling and just a little spicy like I like it!
The combination of sauce, cheeses and zucchini is mouth watering

review.des: Great Prime Burger! It was crowded Saturday morning but a few of us walked right up to the bar and ordered with no problem.

The pot roast sandwich on a cheese bun is delicious! The bartender, Aaron, clearly takes pride in his work.  It is nice to see a restaurant that is always trying to be at their best.  Luis, the manager, comes across as a down-to-earth, thoughtful person.  I really appreciate restaurants that aim to consistently impress and Beatrix certainly does that.

Great dinner enjoyed in nice comfortable atmosphere. Waiter was very good and added to the experience.

Had the hummus as appetizer, BeBe chicken as entree along with a tasty Malbec. All was delicious! I generally don't order dessert but split the "Oh My! caramel pie... It was a great finish to an enjoyable meal.

Came here to try the Bulletproof Coffee, lot of hype behind it but for great reason. Creamy and delightful while leaving a wonderful oily aftermath on your top lip with every sip. The Crispy Kale Salad and Hummus with Veggies were excellent also. Well done, Beatrix. Well done... that being said, all of this cost a pretty penny just for a quick lunch, ouch!

pics.caption: Bulletproof Coffee, lot of hype behind it but for great reason. Creamy and delightful.

review.des:
I returned here for dinner last night assuming it wouldn't be quite as good as brunch, and I was completely mistaken. As I said in my last review, the space and menu items remind me a lot of California, which is such a nice change of pace.

We started with drinks. I just had wine, but my roommate tried both the Pineapple Habanero and the Goji Berry Blossom. The Pineapple Habanero was complex and full bodied while the Goji Berry Blossom was sweet and a little underwhelming.

Daily Special; Crab Cake: The cake itself was more meat than breading and it was served with greens, avocado, and a tomato/corn salad. The salads actually held their own in terms of flavor, and weren't there just to add color to the plate.

Chicken Bebe: So rich. I had a brief photo shoot with our entrees when they came out (lol), and I could smell the parmesan even from a distance. It was also surprisingly filling. Unexpected for an entrée that consists of meat and a few asparagus stalks.

Escarole & Potato Ravioli: Similar in flavor to the chicken, actually, but the escarole adds something interesting. It's one ravioli, but don't be fooled, it's one ravioli that occupies the entire plate. Also very filling.

Jose, our server, was accommodating, friendly, helpful, etc. The cherry on top of a wonderful dining experience.

pics.caption: Daily Special; Crab cake served with greens, avocado, and tomato & corn salad.

review.des: Great ambiance, fun and casual. Had a delicious salad and some hommus, it was a good lunch.

Overall it had a nice atmosphere & clearly it is a popular restaurant. Was not super impressed with the food & I found the portions to be really small. I got the risotto & my friend got ravioli. My risotto was delicious though. I'd say if you are looking for a place to go for a night out, this is the place, but it is a bit pricey & for the amount of food you get, not really worth it!

pics.caption: Wild Mushroom Risotto. Small portion, but tasty!

review.des:
Other than having to meet a $1000.00 mark for large group reservation, brunch at this place was decent.
All you can eat maple bacon, hash and eggs and some type of chicken!!! Yummmm.
I did wish they had more options though.
I will give our server a 5 out of 5... because she did try her best to get our bottomless drinks and food out as soon as she could.

We reached a little over $900, because few of our group of friends weren't able to make it, but we still had to pay the extra to reach the $1000 because it was attached to a hotel. *some rule or policy they have...??

Overall, experience was good!
This is my go to place for business and personal meals!  Excellent food, fantastic and fun atmosphere!  If you have never been, you need to go! Get the bulletproof coffee too!

We were in town for a wedding and Beatrix was a quick walk from our hotel. It was packed but the staff was really sweet and accommodating. She told me the wait would be 30-40 mins. We ended up really only waiting for about 15. I wish I had caught our waiters name because he came immediately and took our orders. Our food came out in no joke, 5 mins. It was the fastest I'd ever been served. Coffee was fantastic. Boyfriend got avocado toast and oatmeal and I got the lemon pancakes. It was all delicious. I was so happy with everything.

Can't complain about a single thing!

Came here last night with a friend around 4PM- they have $5 glasses of wine from 3-6 on weekday- who knew?!  We shared the hummus plate and burrata and both were delicious.  Our server, Kevin, was funny and personable.  Definitely need to come more often for this happy hour special!!

I met a friend for breakfast on a Wednesday morning around 830 during the week. It was busy but not packed. Our waiter was extremely friendly and very accommodating. I ordered the lemon pancakes which are truly out of this world. I'm still dreaming about them. My friend ordered one of the egg sandwiches. We ordered a side of bacon to share and when it arrived the waiter suggested putting some bacon onto the sandwich and my friend said it took the sandwich to a different level.

The service was spot on! Our waiter anticipated our needs and also kept my ice tea filled.  He was friendly and attentive without being up our nose. I have been to another Beatrix that really fell short in the service department. However, the Clark location was exceptional with their service and friendly demeanor.

If you have the time to wait for slow service, then it's alright. Always much slower then other restaurants in the area. Waited 25+ min for a nitro, was not informed of the delay, clear communication would have allowed me to change my order. Lunch typically takes 90 min due to service.

Favorite brunch spot in River North, hands down. The interior of the restaurant is modern with greenery everywhere. I walk in and immediately walk to the bakery window.

I recommend making a reservation or you will be waiting. If it's just two of you, I recommend eating at the bar - will be much quicker. Enjoy!

My friend and I visited on New Years day - we got there at 10am and were seated immediately. The ginger juice was very good.

We started with the rainbow toast on our waiters rec - I would not order again. It is very sweet and the fruit does not seem fresh.

I had the egg white scramble which was very light but filling.

Would come back for an easy meal.

I went here yesterday and loved it. The food was good, the atmosphere was energized and our waiter - Edwardo was really sweet. He suggested the best foods from the menu and we really enjoyed everything he suggested. I'm only in Chicago for a month, so I probably won't go back simply because I want to squeeze in as much as possible, but I'd definitely recommend it.

I am at NW alot and can't say enough about every good experience I've had here. The service is wonderful and friendly. The food is always on point and delivered with a smile, and staff never let my coffee cup get too low :)

My favorite dishes are the pancakes. Always fluffy and perfectly balanced. The coffee is delicious.

A great atmosphere to sit down and enjoy your breakfast, brunch or lunch.
I came here for brunch and I had the burger, it was delicious. Our server Ashley was great and very kind. Thank you for your hospitality.

The people here are so nice. There was a wait for a window table but while we were waiting to be seated they were so accommodating to us and our time. The manager is fabulous! (Who was working evening of Tuesday May 1st) Food was great and ambiance was really nice! I'll definitely be back when I visit Chicago again!
Customer service was excellent. The meal was moderately price. I did not leave with a desire to want to revisit. The food was average. I was a little disappointed.

The three places I yelped were either packed or closed for brunch! So this was the closest highest rated restaurant..... I dunno why
The brunch menu was very mehhh to me
The service sooo slow BUT I will say our server was very nice.

I asked if the micheladas were made with Clamato or tomato juice, she said tomato   my quest continued.
I ordered the spicy blooded Mary, which holy moly it was crazy spicy. That's what I ordered so no complaints there lol

Now my entree: I wanted to try the chicken tinga, which the server recommended over the other dish I had in mind. Awful!
You saw the pictures, it looked cool with the eggs on top, but underneath was all tomato sauce! The chicken I dunno where it went. I got scoops of chunky sauce.

I tried to say something but our server was never around. I ended up just wanted to leave. I wouldn't come back for brunch.

The drinks looked pretty yummy though and the baked goods.

Our party of 4 had a dinner reservation on Tuesday, May 15. We were seated right away by the hostess. After we were sufficiently seated and had a minute to look over the drink options our waiter introduced himself. He explained that their juices are fresh squeezed throughout the day and that they use the same fresh fruit juices in their alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. And the juice drinks do not disappoint - they were delicious. And our meals tasted fantastic as well.

A stunning location.  Being located in the aloft hotel, I really didn't expect much but I was blown away.  The restaurant is near capacity almost all the time and over capacity at regular meal times.  Reservations are HIGHLY recommended.  

I was staying at the hotel and ate here a few times during the week I was in town.  The Chicken Bebe was delicious, spot on and looked so good that it even prompted someone near me to order it too.  The Chili and Chocolate Salmon was fantastic and whatever you imagine it will taste like will still fall short of the reality.  My favorite breakfast was the egg white omelet, but the ordinary "eggs and sausage" was really good too and not at all ordinary.  

With reservations, I highly recommend this.  If you don't have reservations, shame on you, you should have had them!  The food is really good, but I wouldn't wait an hour - because I don't like waiting.

Beatrix has seriously become one of my go-to places in the city. Every time I've gone, the food is consistently great (no matter what I've ordered), the coffee gets me through the day, and the service is always awesome. My favorite thing I've had here was for breakfast - a raspberry ricotta toast of some sort. So delicious. Anyway, it's a great place with a great vibe, they have Wi-Fi for getting work done, and they're a lettuce entertain you restaurant so you can get rewards! Yay!

We got a table after a 30 minute wait which is decent for a Saturday! The food was decent, some dishes better than others.  The eggs your way dish was basic, for example.

It was the service that really killed it for me. Our table was given away, and we had to ask for silverware three times. Even after getting our food, there was still no silverware. We also didn't get refills of water until everything was gone. The hostess was not very accommodating  either but it just might have been the busy atmosphere.

pics.caption: Pot roast egg sandwich was also very good, and the salsa paired with it was perfect!
Praline French toast, very good! Good balance of sweetness and crunch!

review.des:
I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this one as I have been here multiple times!

Beatrix River North seems to be my go to spot for weekend brunch or when dining out with friends visiting from out of town. But in the end, I must say brunch here is my favorite. Get ready for it...

CHIL-A-QUIL-ES! *clap clap, clap clap clap*

Do it for da chilaquiles. All you can eat, but just make sure it's after 10am on the weekends because that's when the build your own chilaquiles bar opens up. Go HAM.

I would also recommend their cold pressed juices. Really refreshing and delicious! And if you please, you can add a shot of your choice to it for an additional charge.

Don't forget your lettuce entertain you rewards card! 'Til next time, cheers!

Food presentation better than the taste, decent service but above average price tag for River North.

Very busy for weekend brunch, but quick and easy to get seated at the bar.  Waited a bit to get the bartender's attention, then ordered, and the food came out quickly.  The raspberry ricotta toast sounds good, but is incredibly tart since there is lots of raspberries and little ricotta (i was hoping for something similar to Davanti Enoteca ricotta toast but was disappointed).  The Spicy Chicken Tinga is a make-your-own taco set-up.  The chicken is well seasoned and very tasty, the tortillas are warm, eggs over-easy so you can break the yolk and spread it around.  The avocado pairs nicely and allows one to temper the spiciness (which is not very spicy) if one so chooses.

pics.caption: Raspberry ricotta Toast very, very tart

review.des:
Attached to the ever-wonderful Aloft hotel, I could not have been more pleased with my breakfast. Upon check-in, I typically opt for the hotel points over a "free continental breakfast" (I'm not much of a breakfast during the week person, and continental breakfast isn't usually worth it for me, whereas points go further) - but when they said they didn't have continental breakfast but were offering a $20 voucher to eat at the Beatrix attached to the hotel, I had to jump on that option, and I'm glad I did!

I started with a green juice - something with kale and pineapple. I'm not a big kale fan (and I shouldn't be eating much of it for health reasons, ironically), but I found the juice to be a pleasant blend and guzzled it quickly. I was also unsure what to order - the waitress recommended a few dishes, one of which was a spicy chicken chili topped with eggs - SOLD. And I must say, it was one of the better "breakfasts" I've had in a while. The chicken was tender, the chili just the right amount of morning spicy, and the eggs were cooked to perfection - I would definitely return, and would love to come for a brunch!

An old kickball teammate did the design for Beatrix Fulton Market, which is how this restaurant  popped up on my radar. I wanted to take my friend down to the River Walk, since she had never been there, so I was happy to find out that they had a location in River North. We really lucked out with street parking, and were so happy to be out and about on a Sunday enjoying brunch. Boy, was I glad that I made a reservation on OpenTable because it was packed! I really recommend taking 2 minutes to make a reservation because I have no idea how long the wait would've been otherwise.  The restaurant was really nicely designed and very spacious.  We were seated at a cozy table (loved the leather chairs with the wheels on it...I need to find out where they got them so that I can get one for my studio) and ordered away.  My poached egg with fresh herbs over a quinoa cake and tomato reduction hit the spot. The quinoa pancake had nice crispy edges and was a nice healthy option (as opposed to the fried chicken that I had last night).  If you're in the River North area, drop by!

pics.caption: Poached egg with quinoa cakes , fresh herbs, and tomato sauce

review.des:
We went to Beatrix for an early lunch this past Monday for our final meal in Chicago. They tried to seat as us at the last table before the hotel lobby, which we promptly rejected, and then proceeded to watch two other parties also reject it. The restaurant wasn't close to full--we didn't understand why they kept bringing people to the worst table in the house.

Our waitress was nice and not around that much. We shared the Supernatural Chopped Salad and the Grilled Chicken Sandwich. Supernatural? Misnomer. There was a healthy amount of greens, but the dressing tasted like air and most of the ingredients were missing: no migas, a couple of green beans, and we saw literally one tiny piece of dried corn. Nothing was really chopped. (Beatrix should either rename the dish or follow through on its description.) The sandwich was slightly better, but just a regular ole sandwich, nothing special, with boring chips.

On the way out, we grabbed two baked goods for the plane: the apricot hamantaschen and the chocolate chip cookie. Those were actually really good. Our advice: skip the food and the wannabe-LA/NYC scene, and grab some treats and coffees to go.

My friend brought me here since it is his favorite brunch spot in all of Chicago. I thought it was great and all but I was honestly distracted by so much that was going on. The place is pretty large and the food is fine but man, talk about great people watching!

There is a cafe area for baked goods and coffee, if you're in a hurry. They have some really delicious cookies and wow, I can dream about their gluten free triple chocolate chunk cookie all day lunch!

I will return but maybe not on a busy Saturday so that I can focus more on the food.

Sat at the bar for solo dining. Wanted a drink that wasn't too sweet. The friendly and helpful bartender guided me to The Sinker: scotch, pineapple, ginger. Delicious. I then had the turkey "neatloaf" for dinner - also delish!

Unfortunately, forgot to take a copy of my receipt for my expense report. Called them that night and asked how I could get a copy. They emailed me a copy of my receipt the next, saving my forgetful butt from a potential audit!!

In summary, interesting cocktail menu, comfort food with excellent execution, and terrific customer service. Wish I were staying in town longer to visit again. Next time would love to try more of their fresh juices.

pics.caption: Turkey "neatloaf." Filling, comforting, turkey flavor not overwhelming. Get it!
The Sinker = scotch, pineapple juice, ginger. Highly recommend!

review.des: I came here over the summer for brunch and really liked it! We were able to easily get reservations the same day. The interior is beautiful, trendy, and spacious. It was packed and vibrant on a Saturday. They also have really nice outdoor seating. We got seated inside next to the windows which were open so it was nice and breezy. I ordered the green chili enchiladas which was good but not something I would rave about. I also tried the steak chimichurri & eggs which was again ok. I thought the steak was too chewy. My friend ordered one of their juices which was delicious. The portion sizes here are just right. Overall great ambiance but the food is just ok in my opinion. I would come back but would order other items
This was my first time here. Loved it! The wait was a bit much but worth the wait for the Quinoa cakes! Holy crap, party in my mouth.
Really loved what we had! I had the mushroom risotto (pictured) and it was outstanding. The Kung pao Brussels sprouts might be some of the best I've  ever had.

This place is so awesome! Imagine a restaurant, cocktail bar, and delicious coffee shop all rolled into one! For lunch, I had the burger and fries (a classic), a soy latte which was made to taste extremely smooth, and I had a Magic Cookie for dessert! Everything was extremely on point. The staff was great and let me charge my dying phone in one of the outlets. Next time I visit Chicago, I need to come here for a mimosa and also some more dessert!!!

We've been wanting to go to Beatrix for lunch for quite some time, and with family in town we have the perfect excuse to make a reservation for 4 for brunch. The overwhelming consensus of the group was lack of flavor. I had the egg white and pepper breakfast sandwich, and I could scarcely find any shishito peppers (or any peppers for that matter) on the sandwich. It was also advertised with two types of cheeses, again that I certainly couldn't find. All I tasted was egg whites and Focaccia. Yay. The side tomato and avocado that I ordered was a paltry amount (like a 1/8 of an avocado and 4 slices of a Roma-sized tomato) for $5.
My husband had the oatmeal, which was unremarkable. He also ordered the avocado toast, which looked beautiful, but badly was in need of seasoning. We also didn't understand why it would come with fried quinoa that provided absolutely no flavor, when obviously it was supposed to be a healthy option.
Now for the redeeming qualities of the meal. My mom's waffles looked amazing, and my father's Burger and fries were completely on point (even though they forgot the avocado that he added on). So we were two for four. Maybe we just ordered wrong, but giving it was our first time and we were really underwhelmed in a city with great brunch options, we will be unlikely to return anytime soon.

YUM. All I have to say. The waitstaff was beyond attentive and the food was amazing. You cannot leave without getting dessert. The caramel pie was soooooo yummy and the cookies are also amazing. I love Beatrix. I would even go as far as saying it is one of my favorite Lettuce restaurants! Highly recommend.

pics.caption: The oh my caramel pie that is out of this world

review.des: Avocado Benedict was yummy. Delicious food. Friendly staff. Lovely. Will definitely return.
Really great spot that will make your breakfast your way! I wanted poached eggs, bacon and avocado, and they did it for me. Great spot if you are in Chicago and want breakfast!

Almost three years later, and I'm a very frequent customer of Beatrix; I average going here about once a week.

My favorite thing about Beatrix is that no matter my mood, I can always find something I want to order. If I'm feeling like I want to eat a bit lighter, I go for the Supernatural chopped salad or one of the daily vegetarian specials; if I'm feeling naughty, I go for the pot roast sandwich. Point being, anyone can find something to eat here.

And speaking of their vegetarian specials: they're always pretty great. And while I'm by no means a vegetarian, more often than not, I'm pleased at what they come up with. My favorites include the mushroom braise over cauliflower puree, zucchini papardelle with roasted tomatoes and mozzarella, cauliflower milanese, or the grilled cheese covered in crispy parmesan. They're all so satisfying that you definitely won't miss the meat.

Their mocktails are all really good too. They're a bit pricey but I can never resist getting one. The hard part is choosing which one. The cherry-chia and blueberry-basil are so fresh, and taste exactly like pureed fruit. They don't use any fillers. And yes, they're even better with alcohol!

Beatrix is a great place for your morning coffee and pastry, a light (or not) lunch or dinner, a mid-afternoon snack, weekend brunch, or a cocktail after work. There's something for everyone, and I'm still a big fan.

pics.caption: Spaghetti with tomato Parmesan broth, blistered tomatoes, fresh basil, and shaved Parmesan.

review.des: I can't say enough great things about this place! The breakfast and service was simply amazing. Quality food, great atmosphere and noteworthy drinks.  I ordered the egg white omelette with a side of hash browns and a pancake. The omelette was fluffy and very flavorful along with the pancake. The hash browns weren't the typical - a bit thicker with a mashed potatoe filling, but still delicious.

pics.caption: A Wonderful Egg White Omelet. A must!

review.des: Coffee is great here - Mexican iced coffee, bulletproof coffee (this one is a little bit heavy), cafe freddo (light and cinnamon-y) are a few of my faves. In terms of food, definitely try the egg white omelette, poached eggs with quinoa cakes, lemon zest pancakes, and crispy kale salad. The dark cherry sangria is a good brunch drink if you prefer the sweeter side of ETOH. The pastry display is phenomenal. I tried the sadie's crunch cake and the turmeric tangerine cake (think lemon pound cake).The wait here can be crazy during the weekends, but it's so worth it. The service is great, too.
Yum night out with my family! The cauliflower salad was amazing!!! I will come back soon!!

For breakfast I tried the avocado Benedict and the iced banana joe. The iced banana joe was an interesting flavor, sort of like a coffee smoothie. The avocado Benedict had 2 slices of avocado in place of bread and the eggs laid on top. It had a Mexican flare and was medium spicy and very delicious! The interior of the restaurant is very modern and cool.
Blue mimosa and braised pot roast egg sandwich was amazing.  We also got the steak chimichurri and eggs which was delicious.  Great place for brunch and not over priced, like most river north spots.

Beatrix is a regular brunch favorite for my wife and me since it opened. The food is consistently solid and for the most part reasonably priced. Our go/to favorites are the spicy chicken tinga and chilaquiles bar. They've increased the price of the chicken tinga by 20% in the past year which seems a bit excessive given the small portion of avocado included. That said, it's an excellent and filling high protein entree with optional corn tortillas on the side. The chilaquiles, while exceptionally less healthy, are usually served with fluffy scrambled eggs and a generous amount of pulled chicken along with a nice range of toppings including guacamole. I recommend taking a look at the chilaquiles which are located to the left of the coffee bar before ordering. Sometimes they haven't been replenished recently and the chicken and eggs are picked over.

Unlike the food, service at Beatrix can be pretty inconsistent. It's usually good but sometimes is abysmally slow/absent. Having visited 30+ times at all of hours of the day, I've found no rhyme or reason to this.

Any of Beatrix's locations should be near the top of the list for brunch in the downtown area.

Loved this place for a healthy breakfast! I'm vegetarian and it was perfect for me, plenty of options. I ate the Cauliflower grits with avocado toast and I loved it! So yummy! Absolutely nothing to complain about. The service was a little slow but that was an exception because it was busy.

pics.caption: This is my type of place! I love the vibe here and the breakfast food was amazing. And the view was nice too  nothing to complain about!

review.des:
For lunch, this is a bright and welcoming restaurant. Lots of open window seating and bright cheerful decor.

Drinks:  I ordered the Pineapple-Habenero Margarita (two actually). I got the second one EXTRA spicy, which I would recommend asking for if you enjoy spicy cocktails. It was still fruity and refreshing with the pineapple juice and I thoroughly enjoyed my two drinks (the send a little more)

Food:  Great light lunch options. I went with 2 other girlfriends and we all ordered a salad. I ordered the Straight "A" Salad, which comes with asiago, asian pear, avocado, asiago, almonds (see how it gets its name?!?), but I ruined the straight "A" theme be adding Salmon. It was really tasty and light, but left me satisfied for lunch! I would recommend this salad and my friends seemed to enjoy their salads just as much!

Definitely a great lunch spot and great drink options if you want to turn it into a boozy lunch!

Deeelish!!!!  I've been eyeing Beatrix for several months - we have friends that live in the area and I must say I'm a bit jealous of their access to amazing restaurants.  Beatrix was chosen for a weeknight Girls Night Out and what a choice!

We arrived right on time for an early reservation (that I made on Open Table) so the place was quiet when we got there - but that changed quickly and by the time we walked out a few hours later, the place was bubbling with restaurant, bar and counter activity.  The hostess and our server were delightful and I loved the decor...we were seated in a perfectly sized round table for five in a spot where we could see everything that was going on.  

We stared with cocktails and an appetizer (the burrata and figs) and browsed the menu - there were also a few specials that looked inviting.  I was really curious about at least six entree items so I had a hard time deciding which one to pick.   I eventually landed on the Salmon and friends had the Short Rib and the Pork Shank.  All three were excellent choices!! Each entree was very generous in size and so flavorful.  The Asian Almond Slaw on the side of my salmon was so delicious....it included sliced jalapenos (which I normally don't care for) which added some heat...every bite was fantastic!  

We were stuffed but managed to squeeze in room for dessert and coffee and tried the Caramel Pie and another one that I didn't taste.  The pie was amazing...a cross between salted caramel and cheesecake with fresh whipped cream on the side.  Our evening at Beatrix was an uber hit and we can't wait to go back and tell all our friends.

Absolutely no reason to take away a star- everyone I was with would agree. Every dish had a twist to your classic brunch menu. The portions, prices and service were all perfect! If I ever come back to Chicago (which I definitely will) this will be my go-to brunch place.

pics.caption: Quinoa cakes with poached eggs and tomato basil

review.des: We went for dinner last night and opted out of restaurant week.  I had a terrible experience here. The service here was pretty bad. The hostess seated us 15 minutes after our reservation at which point we would've been better off walking in since it was already lye at night. Our server literally took our order and disappeared for the entire meal. I wanted extra accoutrements but he didn't show up until 25 minutes after we received the food. We made the mistake of asking for dessert menus and he disappeared again for another 10- 15 mins. I don't really know what to say, but we made our displeasure known via tip.  The food was okay but they've got to work on service at these price levels.  I've had better service at Burger King and Shake Shack.

Convenient location, great atmosphere, delicious breakfast, juices, and coffee! I had a power greens juice that was perfect after a weekend of eating all that Chicago has to offer! I ordered the pot roast egg sandwich with jalapeño relish...SO SO GOOD! The meat was so tender it just melted in my mouth! My husband had the Belgian waffles and they were probably the best I've ever had!

Had the best service (and food) today -- first, our waiter was smoking hot so that always helps.

After a 90 minute wait (worth it, and not that bad for a late Saturday morning), we got a much wanted spot outside. We ordered way too much food for two women who are neither drunk nor hungover, but everything sounded amazing. 3 entrees, 2 sides, 2 pastries, 2 nitro coffees.

The pork and egg sandwich, slam dunk. The cauliflower grits, unreal. The kale salad, fucking amazing. I could leave both the avocado and rainbow toast but it was worth trying.

The real game changer was when we were visited by not one, nor two but SEVEN bees. Like angry, aggressive bees. Not those cute fluffy ones. They literally were pollinating our food. Two landed in my hair. They were ALL up in our shit. We started freaking a bit, but having ate about half of all the food we were ready to just pay and leave.

BUT the hostess and manager both insisted they could move us inside and would replace our coffee and ALL or food -- yes, they refired 3 entrees, 2 sides, 2 pasties and 2 coffees for us -- most of which we had already eaten. For bees. That they had no control over whatsoever.

That's not normal, yo.

Long story short, we made some dents in our replacement stuff, they set us up with to go boxes and I left a 3-digit tip (told ya that waiter was smoking hot).

Super super impressed with the service and the food as always is amazing. I'll be a Beatrix fan for life.

This place was awesome. The food was really good but the staff were even better!  The gluten free choices were abundant and I could have taken one of everything on the dessert menu home but I opted for the tall and dark flourless Choco cake.   Let me tell you it was like heaven in every bite.  Love this place! Now I have to try the other locations as well!

Everything tasted good and wasn't over-designed. I had the Shakshouka which wasn't delightfully spicy. A little messy, but it was fun and different. My partner got the braised pot roast and egg sandwich. He said the sauce that comes on the side is definitely with having with it. The bacon and rainbow toast were also good. I liked that the rainbow toast wasn't overly sweet. Just enough to go with the fruit.

pics.caption: Braised pot roast and egg sandwich

review.des:
It is nice to know you can always count on LEYE and their myriad of restaurants will always provide, good food, good portions, and good service. But, this time we were kind of blown away. Despite a 7 minute lag of getting attention, the server than made up for it just by actually being, get this..friendly! So nice when you don't wear shorts with your ass hanging out with a shoulder baring blouse you can still get great service;)
Good coffe, really good. ,Excellent quinoa and poached eggs, cauliflower grits, chicken sausage and avocado toast (although some lemon would brighten it up)
Wanted to try so much more, and plan to soon!

Beatrix is my favorite place to eat in the city. They have a few locations throughout the city which is great. I have been there for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and the menu and food for each meal has been phenomenal. The menus have a great variety of options and the food is healthy and reasonably priced. In my most recent visit for dinner our waitress, Emma, was attentive, personable, and helpful. You MUST get dessert-either from the pastry case, or menu. GET THE OH MY CARAMEL PIE. It's the greatest dessert I've ever had. You will not regret it. If the pie fell on the floor, I would still eat it-it's that good. Beatrix is a great venue with a modern and trendy atmosphere. Don't miss dessert!!

Met co-workers for breakfast. This is in an Aloft and you might wonder about the quality (not a fan of Aloft). I am told the hotel was quite nice and the food was a surprise. I had two eggs and the chicken sausage; simple meal with a ton of flavor. The chicken sausage is really good; it is memorable good. The cost isn't cheap but the food was really good; downtown Chicago is expensive but you get a great meal.

I absolutely love Beatrix, and have come with friends several times.  The food is always delicious, and there's always good service.  But tonight really stood out above all my other experiences here!
I brought my family that was visiting from out of town, and by the end of the meal they were really raving.  We got to the restaurant a little before our reservation, but were still seated right away by the super friendly hostess.  
Cocktails: Turmeric Rush, Give an Inch Tiki a Mile, and Blueberry Vodka Collins.  All were absolutely delicious!
Food: Kennebec fries (starter); Chicken Bebe, Ravioli, Chocolate and Chile Salmon, Prime Burger.  We all shared bites of each of the entrees because they were too good to keep it to ourselves! Everything was absolutely perfect, and in line with what the menu says (my pet peeve is when a menu doesn't accurately describe what the meal is - this was not an issue here!).  
Service: Our waiter (I didn't catch his name but I wish I had) was absolutely wonderful! He was so polite, checked in on us often, kept up with our jokes, and gave wonderful suggestions.  He really is what made the meal, and the main reason I'm writing this review is because he was so great.  The food came out quickly too, but was still spaced out enough after our app.

I've dined in for breakfast/lunch or picked up carryout from Beatrix on at least a dozen occasions. I've never had a bad meal or a bad experience. The food is always fresh & delicious and the service is always solid & friendly. The light & fluffy lemon pancakes are as described and not to be missed! And don't get me started on the joy that is the Sadie's crunch cake....

My sisters and I went to dinner here for one of my sister's birthdays. The cocktails were refreshing and delicious. I got the strawberry basil and thought it was excellent. We got the zucchini special, Brussels, and burrata for appetizers and the burrata was amazing, although all three were great. We enjoyed our entrees but the highlight for sure was the caramel cake for dessert. It is a must have if you go!! We would go back for that dessert alone.

Brunch here! Lunch here! Or just do a quick coffee and pastry run. Beatrix has such high reviews for a reason. I always look forward to staying downtown, just so I can take a morning walk to this fine establishment. If you have time and the weather is right, sit outside and get in some people watching while enjoying their amazing coffee. And seriously, if you're a fan of real coffee, not that instant stuff, then you'll love Beatrix's! Just thinking about their cup of Joe with a house-made pastry, makes me oh-so-happy! It also makes me wish I was still in the area...

I've never had a bad meal here and I love their vegetarian friendly, health-based meal options. Don't forget their fresh squeezed juices too.

I actually really love Beatrix! My little bro-in-law brought us here for our first Chicago meal, and I loved it. It's trendy, light, and has an adorable bakery. It reminded me a lot of the restaurants we have in LA. The thing I loved most about this place though, is the variety on the menu. They have some lighter fare as well as some heavier options if you need to feed the beast. After spending a week eating out in Chicago, I came to the conclusion that a lot of restaurants don't do balance well. There are a ton of really heavy menus with little room for those who don't want to fall into a coma after the meal. I appreciate Beatrix and their yummy options.

I opted for the cauliflower grits which are accompanied by crispy Brussels sprouts and a beautiful egg. It was a delicious bowl of veggies that made me happy. It filled me up, but I didn't feel stuffed at the end of the meal. My hubby had the French toast, which was yummy and decadent. Everything was delicious, and the vibe of this place is cool. You can dress a little laid back, or you can dress up, no pressure.

In short, I love this place and highly recommend it for brunch. I just wish I would've hit up the bakery, but I was trying to be a good girl.

Service was gruff and courteous. I ordered the Quinoa cakes with poached egg as I thought it was a unique dish that I wouldn't cook myself. Egg was cooked right and the tomato basil sauce was absolutely delicious. Friend favored the green verde enchiladas, pictured. We both enjoyed the  sweet pecan French toast. Decor is modern and bright. I will definitely return for an American brunch or dinner!

The food was really good, other than the avocado toast which was oddly a bit sweet. But we both devoured our main meals... I had the cauliflower with grits and an egg, and my husband had the green enchiladas. We had a 1 p.m. reservation and arrived ~20 mins. early, were told we had to wait until 1, which was totally fine and were seated not long after 1. I got the impression that others who were waiting and perhaps did not have reservations were standing around for awhile. It was crowded and kinda scene-y so fun for people watching. Noise level was average to slightly noisy at brunch-time on a Saturday.

Excellent for breakfast! I ordered an avocado toast with wheat bread and it was delicious. My husband was more traditional he got the egg omelette with maple bacon , hash brown and toast, ok and the best cappuccino in town. Service was super quick and friendly.Definitely a great place for breakfast in Chicago .

I've been to both Beatrix locations in River North and Streeterville. This is a great lunch and dinner spot!

Atmosphere- It can definitely get packed here but if you make reservations you should be ok. The second time I visited we only waited for 10 mins which wasn't bad at all.

Service- Service was ok. We'd have to hunt the waitress down for things like water but it was busy and by no means ruined the experience.

Food- I love the chocolate glazed salmon I've had it twice. It's such a great combination of flavors with the salad and the tortillas and a very filling portion (but not an excess). I also highly recommend their delicious caramel pie-- one slice to share is just enough as this is pretty sweet but so worth it! Even if just for the pie, visit this spot! (seriously you can't eat here and not make space for pie.)
I had this delivered to my room while staying at the Aloft.  I had the prime burger on wheat and it was pretty good.  The fries are amazing and I suggest the squeezed mango juice.

It pains me to not be able to give this location 5 stars.  We stopped in for brunch today.  It was crazy busy & we got seated w/no reservations after 35 minutes, just like they said.  Food was definitely 5 stars.  The lemon pancakes so delicious & the cauliflower grits & eggs even impressed my skeptical husband.  The problem was with service.  We ordered cappuccinos after sitting down and for some reason they were delayed (backed up) ... after having waited to get a table, I was really ready for some coffee.  Our server took our food order.  Unfortunately our server was busy with a large table of 10 or so & hard to get a hold of.  Thought maybe we could at least get a cup of coffee if no cappuccino.  Go figure, that Beatrix could prepare our food before the cappuccinos.  They did eventually arrive & they were comp'd which was the right thing to do but I wasn't happy about the situation.  Server never even came back to ask how our food was.
If you want great food ... definitely go, just know, it's loud & very hectic & because of that your service may suffer.  I'll go back but not at peak meal times.
Got the prime burger, very very solid lunch place, amazing atmosphere too. Cookies are a must try, macaroon was amazing!

Based on all of the outstanding Yelp and Open Table reviews, I made a reservation for brunch at Beatrix on my weekend jaunt to Chicago and I couldn't be more pleased with that decision.  It was AMAZING!  

As my boyfriend said, they have a little something for everyone.  They have a full coffee bar as well as a juice bar and a cocktail bar.  They serve easy to-go items such as muffins and other baked goods and they have an excellent menu if you're dining in.

I was so glad I made a reservation because Beatrix is clearly a very popular place.  When we arrived people were lined up at the door.  This influx of people didn't keep Beatrix from promptly seating us at our reservation time.  We were seated at a table that offered a big comfy couch as part of the seating.  It was very cozy and comfy.  The restaurant is huge and because of the crowds it was noisy but it was a very energetic noise that somehow felt right with the atmosphere.  They also played a lot of awesome music in the background so my boyfriend and I were singing along a lot.

The menu itself was overwhelming.  I wanted so many things!  I decided to go with the Ginger Sangria made with their housemade natural juice. My boyfriend did the same with a blueberry juice with gin.  Both of our drinks were delicious!  They were so refreshing and tasty!  The fresh fruit in the drinks made them all the more appealing!  As good as the drinks were, dare I say that the food was even more delicious?  I had the eggs, cauliflower grits and brussel sprouts and I can't stop thinking about them!  They were the perfect consistency and were popping with flavor - I want to go back and get them now even as I'm writing this.

To top it all off, we had excellent service from a young lady who was very enthusiastic and efficient.  We left Beatrix feeling like we won the lottery.  Beatrix, please come to Columbus, Ohio and open a restaurant.  Love, Erica R.

pics.caption: Cauliflower Grits and Eggs - SO GOOD!
Delicious cocktails made with fresh juice!

review.des: tasty breakfast and pastries but holy crap the napkins they use shed on your clothes EVERYWHERE. Seriously, don't wear black to this place, or anything you care about. Expected more quality napkins from a Lettuce restaurant, huge downer

Soooo I didn't have to wait too long for this place as I sat at the bar. There was a TV for entertainment and the atmosphere was really busy. The bartender was really nice and attentive. I was very hungry and brunch was my main intention of going there. Let's begin:

I needed a little pick me up because I was so sleepy that day, so I did what any other person would do and that was to get a little caffeine fix with a kick. I got the spiced freddo which had chocolate liqueur and cream. Delicious!!

I ordered the braised pot roast and egg sandwich. It was either that or the quinoa cakes but bartender recommended the pot roast. It was absolutely delicious! I hadn't had pot roast in a while but this was moist, tender and flavorful. The eggs also complemented it well and the jalapeno relish gave it a kick! (to be honest, it kind of reminded me of the braised beef sandwich at Tortas Frontera...maybe that's why I liked this so much!).

Both things were very filling and I would like to try their other items some time. The wait can be kind of long so try to get there early!

Beatrix is one of my go to brunch places. They have something for everyone. My favorites are the egg white omelette and the lemon pancakes. Normally, an egg white omelette wouldn't be my go to brunch dish, but this one comes with avocado and a delish homemade salsa that has cherry tomatoes in it. It also comes with turkey bacon. I'm the biggest turkey bacon hater, but some how Beatrix manages to make theirs great!! I also enjoy their 10 grain oatmeal. It's oatmeal with a fun added flare of other grains and a yummy cherry topping. At dinner I also love the turkey neatloaf. Turkey, kale, and sweet potatoes all combined into meatloaf goodness. And the mash potatoes it comes with are great! My favorite dining companion also swears by the caramel pie if you're looking for a good dessert.

If you don't have time to wait around for a table, I recommend making a reservation because this place gets packed, especially at brunch. Or alternatively, order your food to go from the bar. Beatrix also has a coffee shop / bakery area that serves some pretty yummy coffee and baked goods.

So why 4 instead of 5 stars? The restaurant is a little too crowded for my taste and I've had a weird server or two. Also, the quality of the food varies from day to day, which is annoying. But overall, yet another win by Lettuce Entertain You.

This is a solid brunch spot and I can see why it's so popular. I dined here recently with a group of women and had a great meal. It was definitely accommodating for the six of us with a large table and the ability to split checks.

I ordered the Earl Grey tea and the quinoa cakes with poached eggs. The cakes were good and the eggs were even better. They also have a gluten free menu as well as gluten free pastries and desserts. I was surprised at how quickly our food came out seeing that it was busy, so that was good too. Overall it was a good brunch and I look forward to dining here again.

Food - 3/5 (nothing to write home about)
Service - 2.5/5 (horrible waiter, great hostess)
Value - 2.5/5 (large portion of poorly executed dish)
Will I return - you can't pay me you eat here for brunch again, but I'll consider a fully subsidized dinner/lunch

Visited on a Sunday for a group brunch. Being vegan, I called ahead & the hostess was helpful with menu options. Ordered the Avocado Toast ($14) with fruit instead of eggs at the same time as everyone else.

When we had a late comer, the waiter was nowhere to be found. No menu, water glass, setting, nothing. We're a large group; he's guaranteed a 20% tip. This is the service we get?

The food arrived for the whole table & mine was inexplicably missing. Trying to flag our waiter down was futile. When it finally arrived, the potatoes were under seasoned, fruit nicely ripe & avocado generous. However, the "toast" was tough sourdough rind. After awkwardly eating 1 piece, I gave up. I just scraped off the avocado.

Was good. Value for money too.
I had Thai 'fish & chips' - which worked better than it sounds.
Reports from the boss lady that her salad and soup were good too.

Told the caramel pie was 'award winning', not sure what award, but didn't quite hit the spot for me.

All in all, a better than nice meal in a busy, buzzy room with great staff.

pics.caption: Thai fish 'n' chips. Better than it sounds.

review.des: Definitely deserves a five star review. Everything we ordered was delicious. Form the soy chai latte and malted freddo to the light and fluffy pancakes that were extremely light and fluffy my dad and I had an amazing experience.

Do you want a Caesar salad that costs 1.5 times what it should but you don't even care because it's so good? Beatrix is the place for you. Friendly service; nice, busy ambience; and a Caesar salad to rule them all. God I love Caesar salad. Add salmon if you're rich. *chef's kiss*

(The cookies are good too.)

I came here for a work lunch, and all my colleagues loved the food! The atmosphere is very fun/trendy/comfy (not sure how they make that work, but they do), and service was great and prompt.

I was a little hesitant at first, since half of their lunch menu is salad, which is not for me... but I ordered the warm pot roast sandwich and a number of us got the prime burger, and they were SO good! The pot roast sandwich was served on some kind of cheddar bun-- I'm not sure what they did to it, but it was like buttery-cheesy-toasted heaven. Their fries are also amazing as well. At around $14 for a sandwich/burger, this place is pretty on par with River North prices, and you don't leave hungry. Definitely worth a try in my book.

The customer service here is amazing. Everyone is so nice from hostesses to waitresses.

It's also a nice bright ambience. I love to lunch and brunch here.

Today was my second time there. I enjoyed brunch with a delicious juice they make in-house. The yogurt and granola was very good. I got the eggs, toast, hash browns, and bacon combo. The combo was just average. I would definitely go again for brunch and try a dish that isn't so basic. It seems that their other dishes are their specialty.

I joined my friends here super late for brunch due to a delayed flight into Chicago from Miami and was under the impression that I couldn't order since I was late and the waiter had already taken everyone's order so I was just fine with hanging out for a quick drink. The waiter was super nice and welcoming came and expressed to me that he can put in a rush order for me. So I was able to eat with everyone and the food here was excellent. The only thing negative I have to note that the group I joined had an awful experience with a rude hostess due to the fact that I was late and did not want to seat them until I showed up even though I was originally just planning on drinking and not eating so it wouldn't hold up service. But they got seated without me and I ended up eating anyways

Everything I ate at Beatrix was delicious!
The kennebec fries with crispy lemons are so good, the flavor of the lemon with the fries makes it special. Quinoa warm cakes yum! The kale salad is crunchy and flavorful.  I had the warm apple strudel and an almond latte for dessert, and it was so delicious! It was the best strudel I had so far, and it is always good when a restaurant serves good coffee.  A rare thing, that is why I appreciate so much.

The service is great, attentive and helpful.  Good portions. The restaurant has a  simple but nice decor.  Kid friendly and good for groups.

Love this place, that being said, vegetarians have lots of options here, vegans not so much.  You can find something to eat if you are in a vegan diet, but you will need to request some changes to the dish.  They do have soy and almond lattes though!
Love this place! Such a great place for brunch :) Price is also very reasonable for quality and size

I would like to nominate Beatrix for an award:
1) attentive and thoughtful staff
2) healthy creative dishes

I have eaten breakfast at Beatrix many times. I have also had great lunches here. But dinner tonight - it really put the restaurant at a new level for me.

I arrived late at the bar - i needed substance and i was hoping dinner would be as amazing as I knew the breakfast. I was delighted at how they exceeded my expectations.

Eric was my bartender/server as i sat alone at the bar. He steered me through a very attractive menu. I didnt know what I wanted but i had a guide who was patient and willing to help.

He suggested the tuna crudo. Omg. A light flavorful dish that blew my mind. He helped me select a wine that fit it perfectly.  Enough flavor but soft enough for Ahi. I knew i was in good hands. I trusted his judgement.

Next - his fav - roasted cauliflower. He recommends it with salmon - i knew i wanted more dishes so i forgoed the salmon to save room. Ok - i gotta say - Eric killed it. What an amazing salad. I mean - I could not have been happier w his recommendation. It was everything I wanted. Light and hearty. Refreshing and nurturing. He also gave me a new wine to enjoy w this dish. Again - perfection.

I wanted more. So i got the Prefect A. Another great dish. It was erics favorite until the roasted cauliflower came on the menu. Ok - enough said. I let him pick dessert. We clearly have the same pallets. I trust him. He did not let me down!!!

Gluten free banana bread. Killer. I loved every last  bite.

I must say - the food here is healthy AND delicious. You feel good after you eat. AND the staff made my experience.
