Erics attention to details, his thoughtful suggestions, and tolerant approach to my needs made this place go from a "breakfast spot" to a more regular dinner location for me!!! Ty so much!!! Cant wait to come back.

Just average. Very trendy spot, quite disappointed in the menu. Online it states they accommodate for Vegans but the selection was very very sad. The actual menu didn't even point out what could be Vegetarian or Vegan.

Went for brunch on a saturday afternoon. Wait time 45 min but the phone text helped so we walked around near by. Brunch menu was good and the drinks were good...but felt they were average in experience and taste.  Perhaps I need to come back for dinner.

I went here for brunch while on vacation. I made reservations well in advance using OpenTable, and, in my opinion, if you don't want to starve during your hour-long wait at peak brunch time, the reservation is a necessity.

I ordered a power greens juice (kale, romaine, celery, pineapple, & mint) to start. It was a good amount of juice and was a tasty flavor combination. My tablemate and I started off the meal with the light & fluffy lemon pancakes with lemon syrup and blackberries, & they indeed lived up to their name! The order came with 3 pancakes so we split those evenly and they were a great kickstart to the meal! I order the green chili enchiladas filled with scrambled eggs, baby kale, chihuahua, & pepper jack cheese for my meal. There were 3 sizable enchiladas and they were delicious - savory and filling - the very epitome of breakfast + lunch.

The food was delicious and service was great! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great brunch spot in the River North area.

pics.caption: Gin fizz tropical & power greens juice

review.des: OMG this burger was delicious BUT the fries were even better!!! Excellent food! One of the best burgers I have had in a lot of years. Pickles were perfect!

I've always passed by and seen this place in River North, so I was excited to come for Sunday brunch. For what it was (a Sunday brunch), it was as good as it can get. Had a reservation and was seated 7 minutes after arrival. The place is pretty popular so it was extremely crowded! There's a to go section of the restaurant where one can order drinks/pastries (kind of like Goddess and the Baker-esque).

The food here was delicious and so, so savory! Beatrix's menu items are p unique. My bf had their 'Spicy Chicken Tinga', which had guajillo chili, sunny eggs, avocado, and corn tortilla on the side for a make-your-own taco kind of thing. I had a bite of his food and the chicken was very flavorful. The presentation of his dish was wonderful.

I had their 'Steak Chimichurri and Eggs' which was also delicious. Ordered it MR but it came out medium. The chimichurri sauce on the steak was amazing and the steak itself was tender/juicy. The hash browns were thin and crispy (my preferred style), but I wish they had given a larger portion of it.

I also tried Bullet Proof Coffee for the first time here (branded coffee blended with grass-fed butter)! $8.95 for a cup and over-priced IMO

Excited to come back to try their other menu items!

As a follow-up to my previous update, I had a nice conversation with the manager, Chad, who invited me back to give them another try. I ended up going tonight and my experience was much better. It was a very quiet night during the first snow-day of the season which was a nice change as it can get loud in the restaurant when it's packed.

I had the caramelized pork shank with yukon potatoes and sweet potatoes. Absolutely delicious. It's a huge portion and the pork was cooked perfectly. It was tender and flavorful, and overall one of the best pork dishes I've had. I usually order beef or lamb when I go out, but this pork dish was a real winner. In fact, my fiance almost never eats pork but she liked this dish.

My better half had the special, which was a pot roast ragu. When it first came out, it looked a bit dry and I was worried that it would have the same issues as the last special I ordered, but those fears turned out to be unfounded. All of the flavor and moisture were infused into the dish, and it was delicious. She only let me taste a few bites of it before she ate every last bit on her plate.

We had the chocolate cake for dessert, which was one of the best I've had. Full of chocolate flavor with just the right amount of bitter and sweet. One small thing is that I wish they paired it with ice cream instead of whipped cream.

Overall, a great experience and I look forward to coming back again in the future.

Love Love Loved our breakfast today!
This was the second time that we came to Chicago and ate at Beatrix! It didn't disappoint!
Hunter was our waiter and he recommended the Chia Cereal Bowl for me because I'm a vegan. It was so good that I will go back to Beatrix the next time i'm in Chicago just for this.
My daughter is also a vegan so he had her order the Pepper and Egg White Sandwich, minus the egg and cheese, plus avocado and tomato. Also wonderful.
My non-vegan daughter had the Egg White Omelet.Loved it!
Hunter was so sweet and brought me a vegan cookie for Mother's Day!
All around excellent food, service and atmosphere.
Best pot roast breakfast sandwich and egg white omelet! Great service, nice atmosphere.

Stopped by for brunch. Staff was very accommodating.

Coffee bar was impressive. It is a tad pricey ($9 bullet coffee) but worth it!

Quinoa cakes with poached eggs had a tomato basil sauce which was lightly tasteful.

Ordered lemon pancakes which are light and fluffy. Too soft for my liking as its not a dense pancake.

The spicy chicken tinga was messy as it was served with a guajillo chili, sunny side egg and avocado. Careful, the yolk gets messy!

The food here is great, the drink menu is good as well as creative. The Gin Fizz really hits the spot for me and the Rose All Day drink is excellent, and made with Pisco -- not something you see in North America every day!  At $12 per drink I felt the price is a little high and I found the service to be kinda slow at times.  

I wrote a review about a some negative experiences I had with Beatrix while staying at the adjoined Aloft hotel. I'm editing my review because the manager of the restaurant reached out to me and was genuinely concerned and wanted to hear about the problems and find a way to resolve. One suggestion for hotel guests:  The bar closes at midnight, and the kitchen closes at 9pm on Sundays. That is not published anywhere that's very evident to hotel guests, but important to know.

Pleasantly surprised at the delicious version of meatloaf, pretty delicious.

Will have to come back again.

Walked by Beatrix on a stroll up to the magnificat mile and gotta say, this is probably most magnificent out of our meals for the long weekend in Chicago.  Are there better breakfast places?  Perhaps.  But for the price to value I give this place a 5-star.

We ordered Mixed fresh juices all combinations were good.  For breakfast we ordered their mini waffles, Jake salad wth salmon and fried eggs with cauliflower grits and Brussels sprouts.

Waffles are fluffy and light just like the real thing in Belgium, salmon cooked perfectly and the cauliflower grits I think makes me rethink what grits can be like.

Friendly staff, wasn't a long wait time and they also have seating by open bay windows.  Wished we had a chance to come back and try dinner items!

Very friendly straff, good food and nice atmosphere. We had tsukune for appetizers and Wow! black cherry sangria to drink. Entrees: Turkey, sweet potato & greens neatloaf that was very good and Bourbon Glazed Pork shank that was so tender and delicious. Highly recommend everything we had

This is truly a 3 1/2 star establishment, but it was solid food with a lot of vegetarian options so it gets rounded up!

Let's first talk about the five star  crispy kale salad salad.... it was amazing, perfectly dressed, crunchy, flavorful and enough for a main entrée or to split.

The lemon poppyseed ravioli was just OK. In their defense the bartender tried to steer me away from it and to have the braised mushrooms instead, but it sounded interesting with the poppyseed sauce. Tasted more like something I would have for brunch then dinner.

For dessert I had the caramel pie with ice cream, it was so rich and delicious but not really edible for more than a couple bites. Would be great to share with a few people.

I'd like to go back for brunch, because their pastries looked delicious.

The food: 4/5. I've been there once for dinner and a few times for brunch. It's more of a brunch/lunch spot for me than dinner, because their dinner menu is not terribly creative and can't compete with the abundance of other trendy places in the area. However, I like their brunch. The portions are on the smaller size and maybe a little more expensive than elsewhere, but the food is also light and the drink menu is good. Definitely try the spicy chicken tinga for brunch.

The service: 4/5. We've had a fairly good luck with the servers so far. They usually know the menu very well and are more than willing to give recommendations.

Overall: 4/5. Check it out for brunch.

This place is cute! All the plants are fake which is something that really grinds my gears, but don't worry- I didn't take that into account when rating this place as it doesn't seem like the best grounds for judgement. Only 3 stars to Beatrix because I had high hopes for this place, and the food fell short. Their menu has some really interesting, healthy goodies, and maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but I was underwhelmed. I ordered the Wonderful Egg White Omelet. What came was a not-so-wonderful, flavorless omelet. The avocado and tomato salsa was delicious, but you better like tomatoes because it only had 2 chunks of avocado in large scoop it was served with. Aside from that salsa, there wasn't an ounce of flavor in the dish. They somehow made white cheddar cheese lack flavor (how?!). I would be okay with trying this place again, because it was very lively at 2pm on a Saturday and had some fun vibes. But it's at the bottom of my list.

I was recommended by the front desk at our hotel to check out Beatrix for brunch. They said this place would be better than any brunch I've ever had, and the receptionist was right. My friend and I shared the cauliflower and grits, and their quinoa eggs benedict. I never thought quinoa could ever taste so good. The portions were perfect, or even a little more - as we weren't able to finish the food, but the dishes we had were delicious, and it didn't leave us feeling lethargic after. Definitely would come to eat here again if I ever come back to Chicago
I'd specifically recommend Spicy Chicken Tinger! You must ask for more cilantro which would heighten the flavor! Really nice!

Get the kennebec fries! You won't regret it! Lemon and chili fries with a great dipping sauce. Loved sitting out on their sidewalk seating on a beautiful Chicago summer evening. I had the mushroom milanese and it was a good balance of crispy and flavorful.  Very filling, too.

The BEST COOKIES IN CHICAGO period! Whenever I pass by any of their locations - I have to go in and grab one (or 5). They even have Vegan ones that are ah-mazing! Obviously the spot is gorgeous and typically super busy, but if you want to grab a good coffee and delicious baked goods - check out Beatrix.

An excellent place for breakfast.. the ambience was cool and hip (for both families, groups and couples alike), the food was excellent (try the granola), the juices have a different twist (pineapple, pear and ginger is a must try), and the coffee hit the spot! And if you get a chance ask for Christopher - he was superb!

Had breakfast a second time and was great service by Jesse B. The Quinoa Cakes w Poached Eggs was excellent as was the blue boost juice.

Apparently, this is the spot to take out-of-town people based off of the Yelp reviews that I read....annnnnd I fell into that demographic. Best. Decision. Ever.

We made reservations for 1:45pm on a Sunday to try out their brunch menu. Even with the reservation, we had to wait about 10-15 minutes because the place was packed.

The restaurant is pretty spacious with plenty of tables and chairs. It's a very open atmosphere, which was nice.

We ordered the pecan and praline French toast, quinoa cakes with poached eggs, chicken sausage, and melon & berries. I had the quinoa cakes based off of a couple of Yelp recommendations. It was decent, but the pecan and praline French toast was just completely mind-blowing. I was incredibly jealous that I didn't order that and pictured myself gobbling up the entire thing a couple times throughout the meal, but that wouldn't be nice of me, would it? :D The chicken sausage was pretty good as well.

I didn't get to try any of the drinks but will make it a point to when I return next time.

pics.caption: Praline and pecan french toast (top) and green chili enchiladas (bottom)
Power greens juice (left) and carrot, apple, and ginger snap juice (right)
Pecan and praline French toast, chicken sausage, scrambled eggs, melon &  berries, and quinoa cakes with poached eggs

review.des: Great breakfast and Brunch stop. Place to be with friends after a long night like St Patty's Day. Order The bulletproof coffee or a Bloody Mary as you won't regret it.

I'm not sure of what to say about Beatrix. I tend to shy away from "American" restaurants but I visited on a "hamburger kind of day" where all I could think about was finding a gluten free burger and Beatrix was close to my hotel.

There is nothing wrong with this restaurant. The people who work here are attentive and super nice. The ambiance is cozy, warm and welcoming. It's busy and people seem to flock to the restaurant for their coffee.

All I can say is that the hamburger was rather uninspiring for a place that talks about reduction and lemon poppy seed broth and burrata served with figs... and has menu items like chilli & chocolate glazed salmon and ahi tuna crudo.

I expected more than just lettuce and tomatoes as garnishing and my bun fell apart after the first bite.

A really great place for brunch. Yummy multigrain sourdough toast. The outstanding service (twice now) makes this place stand out. This morning Hunter took care of us and he deserves an A+! He might be the best server we've ever had!
Went here on a work trip and came with nine of my colleagues. Delicious food!  Got our large group in early.  They were able to split our checks. Great experience!

The atmosphere is very hip and chic. The food is delicious! I had the pear salad with grilled salmon and it was super filling and yummy. The portion sizes are great. Also, the waiter will always make sure your water glass is full so you will never go thirsty!

Had lunch here recently with a friend. It felt more like Denny's than an upscale cafe, as it's marketed. I'm not referring to the decor, which is attractive. Or the food, which is good (but not great). My issue is with the service, which is beyond rushed.

First, about the food. My friend had the Kale salad, which looked like hedge clippings to me, but she liked it. Maybe a rabbit could fill up on it, but not the "stairmaster queen." So she asked for bread or a roll, but the only thing they could come up with was a side of toast for $3.50.

I ordered the pot roast sandwich. After one look I was pretty sure I'd be taking half home, but after one bite I knew I was wrong. It was yummy, but there was only about four ounces of meat. Perhaps a bit skimpy for $14? They were much more generous with the fries, but when I blow it, it's not on fries.

Which meant... room for desert.  We split the warm apple strudel with whipped cream. Divine and worth every calorie. If you like apples, you will love this!  The coffee was good, too, but we were never offered a refill.

Now, about the service. We each ordered a glass of wine, and I'd asked our friendly server not to rush the meal.  But after just a few sips of wine, the food arrived. My friend had just gotten back from a long trip, and I was looking forward to hearing about her adventures. Because she was doing most of the talking, I finished my meal before she did. Without asking, the busser took my plate away, even though my friend was only halfway through her kale. I saw this happening at other tables, too.

Note to Beatrix management: unless you're running a buffet, it's considered rude to clear the table until everyone has finished. When you do, those who eat fast feel awkward, and those who eat slowly feel pressured to eat faster and finish.  

What's more, our server didn't even wait until my friend was done before she offered us coffee and dessert. And of course the check arrived before we asked for it.

Who trained the people who work here anyway? The answer is management whose goal is to push as many people through as possible in the shortest amount of time.

Maybe this is only an issue at lunch and not dinner. But I'll never know, because I'll never come back. However, if you are looking for an attractive, trendy place with good food... and you don't mind being rushed through your meal... you might like it here.

As a vegan it can be tough to find a place who will totally accommodate my needs. I was very pleased with My server and experience here. I ordered the power greens juice and had the straight A salad modified for my needs. I would definitely recommend this place.
We had brunch here after having a late night the night before.  The vibe is cool.  The food is good.  We had some blue mimosas which were delicious.

Best breakfast I've had in Chicago other than Nico's.  Fantastic, friendly service by Alex G, with excellent recommendations--ask for him when you dine in.  Only negative was that my latte was terrible.

The food was magnificent--not too experimental, but definitely pushing the boundaries enough to satisfy our creative impulses, while keeping breakfast true enough to the comforts of what Americans love most about the first meal of the day.  This is not a place to come if you're looking for a traditional high-fat, massive servings kind of breakfast.  It's a place to come if you're looking for not so aggressive boundary pushing, with healthy, progressive options.

Now let me get back to my quinoa cakes with poached eggs.

Love the ambiance and decor. Food was really good and fresh. I got the beet salad, which had great flavoring.  I went for a business meeting, it can get a little noisy in there. But still no complaints. I would go back there again.

You know how they say you never have a second chance to make a first impression. Well that proves soundly true with Beatrix. I probably have never had an interaction as rude and cold by a hostess in my life and although that was followed by good food and a friendly waiter, the damage was done.
Upon entering at 12:27 for my 12:30 reservation, I was met with a cramped hallway filled with waiting customers and bustling waiters trying to weave their way through with food and drinks. After uncomfortably making my way through the crowd I was then met with an incredibly rude hostess. I stood in front of her for a full three minutes (while she wasn't talking to anyone else, just on her phone/computer) before she looked up and asked how she could help me. I told her I had a reservation and I had one person from the party who wasn't planning on eating brunch (just going to grab a drink). She refused to seat me until everyone was here. I explained this additional person wasn't eating so we wouldn't be holding up service, and since there are no three-seat tables (we were a party of 4) in the restaurant, we also wouldn't be taking up any additional space. She rudely responded, "Tell me when your whole party is here." I told her to cancel the fourth reservation and she pushed our party off to the side where we waited an additional 15 minutes in the crowd just to be seated.
From then on, everything was great. When we were finally seated, as expected, we were given a table for four people. The waiter, however, was extremely friendly and told us he was happy to accommodate a fourth person with no issues whenever she arrived. Our food was also delicious- I ordered the egg white omlette and the tomato salsa was fantastic! YUM! Drinks were also good and overall it was reasonably priced.
The first impression of Beatrix really left a very sour taste in my mouth which is unfortunate because without that short interaction, this restaurant was everything I hoped it would be. I would have loved to give Beatrix 4 stars but the unfortunate situation dinged 2 stars off my review.

Bustling,  open,  bright setting.  Fantastic coffee,  well made espresso drinks.  The pastry bar is gorgeous and the food delicious.  Make a reservation or wait for a table.  

A Wonderful Egg White Omelet. 12.95
white cheddar, baby spinach, avocado & tomato salsa, organic turkey bacon. Beautiful,  simple dish. The avocado and tomato salsa was a nice add. Served with 1 piece of toast and butter on the side.  

Quinoa Cakes W/ Poached Eggs $12.95
tomato-basil sauce, poached egg mayo, window herbs. I was a little nervous about ordering this dish but was happy I did. Cakes were light and the mayo was very tasty. Think veg eggs Benedict.  

Raspberry Ricotta Toast $5.95
Do not pass go without trying this!  Amazingly simple and wonderful.  

Overall love this spot. I have been a repeat customer and enjoyed every trip.

pics.caption: Toast with Ricotta and Raspberries.  To die for!

review.des:
Came in yesterday for our work/team lunch. Only one out of the group of six has been there so we were really looking forward to it. We were sat promptly and greeted right away. Were the drinks great? Yes. Was the food delicious? Absolutely. Why am I writing this review? Because our server Shelby was amazing!! She was so kind, friendly, guided us through our lunch, stayed on top of refills and was the best!

I worked in the service industry for 7 years and there are small things I always hope for in service and she hit them all.

We will definitely be back! :)

Amazing restaurant! The food is so delicious! Their chicken Bebe and an A Salad are to die for! And that chocolate cake...yummmmmm. Never had a bad meal there. It's my go to place because I know it's always great.

We had an amazing dinner. They were prompt, helpful and everything was delicious. Here are a couple of highlights l: (1) the dessert bar - YUM; (2) we had a picky four year old with us and they worked with us to find food that he would eat. So basically, the chef and our waitress were life-savers; and (3) they have a fantastic gluten free menu with dessert options - try the GF naan with their fabulous hummus! (It is not easy to feed a gluten free vegetarian, but they succeeded with flying colors)

Also, the Ginger Sangria, crunchy kale salad and fresh pressed juice were great.

I can't say enough good things about our experience.

A fantastic dinner was had here at Beatrix!  Both my husband and I were thoroughly impressed with the food the kitchen (had to be the A team!) put out.

We were seated in the bar area and requested one of the 2-seaters with the plush brown chairs.  Very comfortable.  After googling what it was, we opted for the tsukune (Japanese chicken meatballs) appetizer.  The texture of the meatball was kind of like a fishball, which was surprising to me, but nothing that stood in the way of the dish being quickly demolished. Husband was 100% happy with the pork shank entree: the portion size, the flavor, the speed at which the kitchen sent over our meal.  

I was tickled pink with the size of my potato and escarole ravioli.  It was buttery, but not overly so, and you can be sure that ravioli is not store bought when it's literally the size of your face.  I would highly recommend this entree, and I may or may not have the honor of posting the first pic of the p&e ravioli on Yelp.

Another note. If you order the potato and escarole ravioli, make sure you have atleast one of the following:
- floss
- a mirror
- a dining companion who will tell you if/when you have a huge piece of escarole stuck in your teeth (not that I'm speaking from experience...)

Totally worth venturing over here!  You won't be disappointed in the plethora of coffee and drink (alcoholic and non) options either.  I washed my meal down with a blueberry basil smash (+shot of gin), and it was so refreshing!

pics.caption: Blueberry and basil smash spiked with gin

review.des: had dinner here with a friend tonight and wow the Tsukune appetizer is a must! I ordered the strip steak which had a delicious sorta-spicy kick to it. super chic restaurant with delicious food. downside was that it's nearly $7 for a glass of their juice and the angel food cake and cinnamon roll desserts were nothing special. definitely want to try out breakfast here

I've been here numerous times for the past 4 years and it has never disappointed my brunch-less soul! I almost always get eggs your way (over easy) and share the lemon pancakes or avocado toast. The eggs your way is honestly just like any other eggs your way. Satisfactory for an insta-worthy brunch, but not like HOLY WHOA EGGS! YOUR! WAY! you know what I'm saying. The lemon pancakes are actually as fluffy as a cloud and just soaks up the syrup like a sponge. W-O-R-T-H. The avocado toast is a little more subpar given it's at Beatrix, but still worth a try!! Ok, also the french fries are seriously so so good.
Belgian waffles and homemade chicken sausage was excellent! The whipped cream was light and fluffy and the coffee made it all simply perfect. Thank you!

Eh sometimes the service, arrogance and attitude define a restaurant.  The food was solid, the baked goods looked fantastic.  The staff had a stick so far up you know where that a solid food experience and decent though not excellent value cant save it.

Normally I start off my reviews describing the restaurants ambiance, food, vibe etc., But in this case I'm going to start with their people. What a great team we encountered throughout our entire experience(s).  Dave, one of the Managers, is a rock star.  He's has a comfortable, authentic friendly easy going personality, is on top of his business and it shows through in the quality of the service and customer experience one receives at Beatrix. He gets Customer Service! Jose, our dinner server and Greg our brunch server two days later were also A list players and delivered excellent dining experiences.

The Beatrix experience is further enhanced by a spectacular large open loft style dining space with giant floor to ceiling windows that open to create a delicious indoor / outdoor feel.  Nice buzz and music selection but you can still carry on a conversation without difficulty.

Let's see, what else...!? Oh yeah...doink...the  food. It's Great! Fun, delicious, healthy, exciting innovative and reasonably priced. I'd describe it as a fresh innovative, healthy take on comfort food. I went for dinner and found out they serve brunch on both Sat and Sun. So...went back Sat and the brunch was outstanding. Again, fun, creative, innovative and delicious. The Spicy Chicken Tinga and side of Slider looking Chicken Sausages were fabulous.

Oh and if you're going to go down in flames and have dessert, the Sea Salt Carmel Pie is insane as is the Black Chocolate Truffle Pie.

One tip for the restaurant:  The menu doesn't tell you how many pieces of Deviled Eggs are in an order. It would be nice if we could order the Deviled Eggs by the piece, or state The number of eggs per plate (3) on the menu and perhaps offer an upcharge option for an addition egg. I assume the majority of parties eating at restaurants are two tops or four tops and it's just a little cumbersome and messy dividing up the third egg or negotiating and splitting three eggs amongst four people.

Overall it was a great meal. Coming from NYC, the price seems pretty fair. I'm giving it 4-star instead of 5 because the entree was good but not mind-blowing. We also had a hard time getting the waitress to come over to our table as she was super busy. Below are what we ordered:

Drink: Pineapple Margarita (I should have listened to the waitress. I asked for a not so sweet fruity cocktail. She told me the Pineapple Margarita was very smoky and suggested I choose something else. I like pineapple flavored drink so I still ended up ordering it. Bad decision! If you like smoky cocktails, go for it)

Appetizer: Brussels sprout (it was SOOO delicious! Must order)

Entree: Pan-Roasted Chilean Sea Bass & Chili and Chocolate Glazed Salmon (They were both good but I personally liked the Sea Bass more)

Dessert: Didn't have room for that...

Solid all around. Good food. I enjoyed the spicy chicken tinga. It was the right amount of spicy. The white sangria was too sweet for me but that's what I generally think about all white sangrias. gf got the peppered egg sandwich which she said was also very spicy but good overall.

This place was great! We walked through the rain to have breakfast, and were mildly surprised to find it was in a hotel. The coffee was great after we sent it back the first time.....dishwasher issue that left a lipstick stain on the rim. Other than that, no complaints. The Israeli tomato and egg dish was amazing!

There seemed to be a lot of client meetings happening, great vibe for conversations and good food.

It was loud and lively when we were there for breakfast but I'm not sure how the afternoon and evening crowd decibel levels get. However, since the restaurant is connected to the Aloft hotel on Clark (literally as you can walk from the hotel lobby into the restaurant without going through a door) I think it's always loud as the restaurant gets the overflow noise from the hotel lobby. I had a Chai Latte which was delicious. The GREEN CHILI ENCHILADAS were so good that I wanted to go home and make them myself for the next week or so. Just the right spiciness! My girlfriend had the EGG WHITE OMELETTE and said it was very good also. The portions are what I'll describe as average because both meals were $13 each and the size doesn't warrant the kind where you ask for a doggie bag. So, don't go too hungry!

My dad and I walked by here after looking for a place to eat after the Cubs parade. This place is connected to the Aloft hotel but it didn't seem like a hotel restaurant.

Parking: parking is difficult in this area, street parking is possible but hard. Walking or taking public transportation is the best way of getting here.

Ambience/Space: the restaurant was crowded when I went on a Friday afternoon around lunch. It seemed small but only because the restaurant was packed with Cubs fans who were hungry after the parade. The restaurant has a hipster vibe, laid back and chill. The menu was hipster too with its healthy menu options but delicious and filling. Surprisingly, my dad and I only waited around 10 minutes to get a table without a reservation and it was super packed. Other restaurants in the area told us it was a 45 min to an hour wait so it was nice not having to wait long for a table. There's a bar to the left of the main entrance and right when you walk in, you can see the bakery with yummy sweets like cookies, cakes, and muffins as well as coffee. I liked that there were a lot of TVs by the bakery/coffee area.

Menu: Our server was polite and kindly explained the menu to us first timers. The menu is very limited  with only 14 items and they list the food from light to filling, starting from the top to the bottom. The menu had some interesting choices like chocolate glazed salmon and turkey neatloaf. My dad isn't very hipster haha so he kept it traditional and ordered the Prime Burger. I ordered the Mushroom and Quinoa Burger. I honestly didn't think that a mushroom burger would fill me up but it did! I was struggling to finish my food and ended up having my dad eat the rest of my fries. The food was delicious and high quality. I was obsessed with the kennebec fries, so good!! I loved the mushroom burger because I didn't expect it to be so tasty and filling. I loved that the quinoa gave the burger its texture. If someone gave me the burger blindfolded, I would've thought I was eating an actual meat hamburger! My dad enjoyed his Prime Burger and fries as well. We both wished that they had a more extensive menu of food options but we were happy with our choices! The prices were a little pricy, our burgers were $14 each but it was delicious and worth the price.

pics.caption: Mushroom and Quinoa Burger with Kennebec fries

review.des:
SERVICE
We were seated quickly during peak morning hours on a Saturday. Our waitress was kind and helpful with questions and food suggestions.

FOOD
Try the Shakshouka, especially if you want something with a little kick to it! It was absolutely delicious and the pita bread was a nice plus. In addition, I tried the blue boost (a fresh squeezed juice) and it was flavorful. The basil gave this a very interesting flavor. I would recommend this over the power greens which was less sweet.

AMBIANCE
This place is great as its open to the outside. It felt clean and lively.

PARKING
Parking in this area is tough but there may be some street parking as well as a few parking garages.

A restaurant after my own heart- Beatrix proves you can make healthy food taste delicious. I've eaten breakfast, lunch, and dinner here now and would recommend Beatrix for any meal. The breakfast choices are so unique and delicious. Last night I had the Chicken Bebe (it was light and flavorful), my husband had the Skirt Steak with Chimmichurri and fries (he loved it- the dish was packed with flavor), and we had hummus to share. The hummus was the best tasting hummus I've had and came with warm naan bread and a light tomato salad. We also tried two of their delicious cocktails- I had the Turmeric Rush, which tasted even better than I thought possible and my husband had the Tricks are For drink which was really good, too. The service has been great every time, too!

Oh Beatrix, you just might be my new go-to brunch place in the city.  I went here for Sunday brunch about a month and a half ago, with my husband, our daughter, his best friend, wife and their 18 month old son.

What I loved:
1. Great vibe
2. Stellar service
3. Amazing menu, which is why I need to go back.  SO MUCH TO CHOOSE FROM!
4. Fair prices

What I didn't love, and why it's not getting the 5 stars that other patrons have given Beatrix:
1. Super packed.  I really felt like I couldn't even back my chair up when I had to excuse myself from the table because the table behind me and beside me was so close.
2. Not exactly kid friendly, something that has become really important since having a baby 9 months ago.

I had the Mushroom Quinoa burger: with swiss cheese, baby kale, kennebec fries and a sriracha aioli.  I love mushrooms and I love quinoa, so I had high expectations and this burger didn't disappoint at all.  My husband who hates anything healthy took a bite of my burger and even he was blown away.  Now, doesn't that say something?   The burger was homemade, flavorful and would be worthy competition for even the best non-veg burger.  You can hold me to it.

For my drink, I chose the Power Greens Smoothie: kale, romaine, celery, pineapple and a hint of mint.  This drink had serious pizzazz!  It was light, refreshing and definitely helped me start my day on the right foot!

My husband ordered the Green Chili Enchiladas with scrambled eggs.  roasted poblano peppers, baby kale, chihuahua cheese and pepperjack.  He really liked his choice and thought the baby kale was an unexpected but pleasant addition to one of his favorite breakfast items.  I had a bite of his food and would have to agree.  

Everyone seemed to enjoy their choices as judged by the empty plates and :) faces.

Bustling and energetic on a snowy Sunday morning. Waited about 30 minutes on a table for 2, not bad for brunch rush hour. We both got delicious, well-crafted coffee drinks at the bar while we waited. We both ordered the same thing.

Steak Chimichurri & Eggs   15.95
Grilled shishito peppers, eggs your way, golden hash browns

Our steaks were cooked to a perfect medium rare. We both ordered our eggs poached and they were significantly over cooked, hardly any runny yolk. The hash browns were crispy but bland. In addition, the Chimichurri sauce covering the steak tasted like a lemon sauce, and my friend who is gluten intolerant received toast with her order.

Overall, for a well-respected restaurant  I was underwhelmed at the quality of our meals and given the plethora of brunch options in the city I probably won't return!

pics.caption: Steak with Shishito Peppers & Chimichurri Sauce
A large chai latte (delicious, creamy, perfectly spiced), and small regular coffee

review.des:
This is a rave review. Although we are here for just the weekend, I wish I could come back for another meal. We went for brunch and the food and service were amazing. Just loved my egg white sandwich (although prefer wheat to white bread) with havarti and roasted tomato. Glad I added avocado too. I love green juice and theirs was perfect. Even  went back later in the day for a carrot/ginger/Apple juice. My daughter shared her gluten free almond cinnamon muffin and it tasted like the coffee cakes of my east coast childhood. Glanced at the food at neighboring tables and each dish looked wonderful. To top it off, we thought our waiter Chris was so nice and helpful and really went out of his way to provide exceptional service, even though it was just a quick brunch meal.

Almost 2 years later I returned for dinner and amazed again. What a great restaurant - it will be a must on every trip to
Chicago!
Food was excellent and came very quickly! Waiter also had great recommendations. The atmosphere is also very cool with different table styles.
Great!!! Heathy food!!! I had the burger and it was really good! I also had a vanilla latte that was maybe the best I've ever had!! They also have great margarita!
Food is amazing every time no matter what I try. The prices and the staff make it that much better, this is be a 5 star restaurant alway! Must try the blue Mamosa!!!!

Finally grabbed dinner at Beatrix, the experience transitioning it from a solid brunch spot to equally good supper place...  

We ordered deviled eggs to start - had these before at brunch and they're always a crowd pleaser... The "yolk" is a cross between potato salad and the typical deviled egg filling that works really well...

Next was the butternut squash soup - totally hit the spot on a chilly night, creamy but not too heavy, lightly sweet and had it come with a piece of bread, would have worked as a main dish

Main course was short rib with farro and root vegetables- will be going back for this during the winter when I'm craving comfort food... The short rib was tender and well seasoned, the farro added a chewy bite and the roasted vegetables were perfectly cooked.  

Dessert was the chocolate cake which was pretty awesome- had a cake/mousse consistency and was super rich and chocolatey.. Totally hit the spot...

Would totally return for dinner (or brunch), overall solid neighborhood spot

Ordered: Mushroom/Quinoa Burger with quinoa salad, Black Cherry Sangria

FOOD: Delicious. I was so impressed with the food that I went home and bought a sriracha aioli sauce and a bag of quinoa and make to try and recreate the masterpiece. It was so good and tasted very fresh.

I skipped the fries for the quinoa salad, which featured shreddings of Kale and cranberries. And possibly some lime juice? I later tried recreating this too. Less successfully, but it's okay. I forgive myself.

DRINKS: The sangria was very refreshing, and despite its color, tasted very light and summery. I would definitely order this again. My friend ended up switching his drink order to mine. I'm really such a trendsetter.

ATMOSPHERE: we went for lunch, and the lunch crowd consisted of mostly professionals. I wouldn't have felt completely out of place in short and sandals, but I was definitely more comfortable in the business casual attire I was wearing.

I came in solo for lunch during a busy Friday lunch hour but was able to get seated quickly. I had the ricotta ravioli and it was delicious! I ended the meal with some coffee and a perfect little lemon crisp. Prices are fair for the area - ranging between 11-18 for an entree. The restaurant itself is cute and the service was excellent! Hostesses and waitress were super sweet! I will return!

I always trust Beatrix with any special occasion. The food, fun atmosphere, and most of all the impeccable service from Eric- the manager. Thank you Eric for making my Beatrix experience always extra special!
One word.."Neatloaf". So good. Love the fresh pressed juices as well.

I just wanna say. I came here after a job interview  and had a really unpleasant phone call as soon as I sat down. I was arguing and crying on the phone pretty much the whole time I was here. My husband ordered for me and right after that is when the phone call happened so I didn't end up drinking my drink or eating my food. The server, I could tell felt bad but was still was very attentive even though I was a blubbering mess. At the end of the call I was ready to leave and I asked him if he could just box my food. He was SO nice and offered to just get me new food to go home with since I obviously hadn't touched mine. (His niceness made me cry all over again). I said no thank you and he boxed my food and gave me a free cookie. I ate the food once I was home and it was delicious and made me feel better about my day. I got the job and this is now one of my favorite restaurants because the food is great and so is the service. Thanks for making my bad day better, you guys are doing it right!

Very very good breakfast spot!!! It is connected to a hotel but not as at all like a "hotel" restaurant. Upon recommendation from our server, we ordered the lemon pancakes for the table to share. Very fluffy, not too sweet, good lemon flavoring. Also out of recommendation, I ordered the cauliflower grits + eggs. Although I really do not like cauliflower, it was delicious! The cauliflower is mashed up nice and small and had a nice, mild flavor.

The drinks there look really good and next time I'm in town, I plan to try them out!

Beatrix is an absolute necessity of the River North neighborhood. I cannot speak highly enough about the beautifully crafted menu. The water with lemon was to die for! My server, Michael, was a beautiful specimen of a man and his menu knowledge was purely exquisite. It was like being served by a model and comedian at the same time. His Dad jokes had me spitting out my perfectly crafted pineapple habanero margarita they were so funny.  The manager Steven was also quite the cutie!

Beatrix is a 10/10 with its great food/drinks and all the eye candy.

Excellent food and service! We came in for brunch on a Sunday afternoon, I recommend making a reservation as it was pretty busy.

Ambiance: Very chill casual environment. Ample space where you're not super close to other tables and music not too loud where you can hear one another. Being that it's River North you had people that were dressed up, but also people that were casually dressed with gym shoes (not completely grunged down or like they just came from the gym, but comfortable).

Food: I ordered the blue mimosa, quinoa cakes with poached eggs, caramel pie and kennebec fries. The blue mimosa was interesting, it was freshly squeezed blueberry juice with champagne. I've only ever had citrusy flavored beverages for mimosas so it was definitely something different, in regardless good. The quinoa cakes were really delicious! The tomato-basil sauce tasted like it was marinara sauce, couldn't really taste the basil, none the less good a good pairing with the cakes and eggs. Ordered the kennebec fries as a side to share for the table. They were pretty crispy and a big helping, between the three of us we didn't finish it. It comes with what tasted like a mayo based sauce that had a lemon zing to it. There were also what appeared to look like deep fried lemon slices and bell peppers. It was interesting, but good. Lastly, ordered the caramel pie. It came highly recommended by my roommate, she was raving about it and I have to say she was right. SO GOOD! Perfectly sized and can be good for sharing or for one person. It came with a vanilla bean tasting whipped cream. The crust was perfect, had a crunch to it and stayed in tact when you were cutting pieces out of the pie slice. The pie itself tasted like those Werther's original flavored candies (caramel candies wrapped in bright gold wrappers), but BETTER! It was like a salted caramel pie. So yummy HAVE TO GET IT. I didn't see it on the brunch menu, but asked and they'll still serve it.

Service: Our server was very attentive and despite being super busy (we went at a peak time for brunch) the food came out really fast. For three drinks, three main dishes, one dessert and one side we paid about $30 a person (tip included).

I hear great things about their dinner as well, will have to be back and try that out!

The place: Even during a downpour at 8pm on a Saturday night, this place was packed to the brim. With reservations, we still had to wait 15 minutes, but were lucky to find 2 seats together at the bar. The servers and bartender we dealt with were great, but not extremely expeditious. Big open space was kinda cool, but ill be honest, I was mostly staring at my handsome date, so didn't take note of the decor too much.

The taste: We were surprised with an appetizer on the house- the potato salad deviled eggs. Creamy and flavorful, but not something I would have ordered on my own. A little too rich for my blood. We shared the burrata (good, but I've had better at Eataly), the ahi tuna crudo (good, but did it stand out as something I need to go back and eat again?--no). And the short ribs (okay this was mostly what my date had, but he shared some and this was melt in your mouth good. Tender.... Still not sure if it's worth a return visit. I've had good short ribs in other places)

My face: four cocktails between the two of us (all pretty great) and 2 snack plates and a short ribs entree probably brought us to $100 pre-tip, but I didn't pay and actually didn't even look at the bill. (Just did some math in my head). We didn't even consider dessert...I would have if my date didn't seem so delicious....and I don't think it was the cocktails that made me feel that way.

So Beatrix is good. But I'm not sure I'd need to go back. I can probably find $12 cocktails somewhere else. Just a guess though....

Picked for its strong vegetarian options for a friend. Not too crowded when we were there on Sunday after marathon so noise was not an issue. Service was fine.  My pork was on the salty side but otherwise tasty. Chocolate dessert was yummy.

There are a plethora of Yelp reviews for brunch. So I tried and enjoyed that with my girls.

On the other hand with the dinner scene, reviews appear scarce. So I arrived Tuesday night with slight skepticism. The quick-and-easy? I left with a new love to add to my list.

First off, do something atypical and order a juice. Yes, it's dinner and you would like a douse of alcohol. Well, for just $6 more, you can turn that into a juice cocktail. I thought my blackberry and lychee lemonade was superb without the spike. Dinner mate across from me loved her virgin mango, orange, and pineapple nectar so much that she chugged two.

Onto the "second" course, we ordered the fries, hummus, tsukune, and straight A salad for sharing. Most of them were good for sharing except for the tsukune which are coarse-ground chicken meatballs that came in four pieces. We just wanted to give it a try so we sliced each piece into halves. Don't let the chili-cilantro sauce throw you off because it's just a baby spice. The straight A salad caught me off guard and swooned me. With arugula, avocado, Asian pear, asiago, and almond, this was easily a pleasant start for the evening. Coming from a person who usually shies away from ordering salad, I see myself re-ordering this upon my return. It was simplicity done at its best.

Main courses consisted of potato ravioli, pan-roasted sea bass, slow-braised short rib, skirt steak, and three caramelized pork shanks. It was a very lopsided party with lots of meat lovers. My short rib, ladled with balsamic steak sauce, was served in a rectangular block of lean meat with a thin layer of fat. Beneath the hot pile was a huge smear of mashed potatoes and on the side was a set of un-constructed salad with roasted romaine hearts and tomatoes. It was nothing complicated but everything that I wanted. The pork shank is huge with hints of fat scattered throughout, therefore it was especially tender and juicy. I liked it a little less than my short rib though. With the Michigan peaches, it was a tidbit sweet and I'm generally a savory person when it comes to entrees.

I must also note Beatrix takes pleasure in bringing out the dishes at the same time. Two of the pork shanks were cold at the first cut and bite. We brought it to our server's attention and she immediately apologized for the mishap. With no questions asked, she took the pork shanks away and returned 10 minutes later with a set of fresh-made, well-glazed, and sizzling pork shanks. Cheers to top-notch service! (And for this, I gave Beatrix an extra star, therefore capping it at five.)

Onto desserts, we skipped the pastry bar and focused on the menu offering. Among us, we shared the chia pudding, vanilla bean kulfi, and two slices of dark chocolate cake. Our server was kind enough to put a candle on the chocolate cake for our belated birthday boy. The cake was indeed as stated: tall, dark, and handsome. Dig your spoon deep into this flourless marvel of deliciousness and you will keep doing so until it's all gone. The kulfi, also known as Indian ice cream, is not to be neglected. The candied oranges and toasted pistachios were excellent complements. The ice cream itself is light by flavor but strong by physique. We almost resorted to using a steak knife to make it shareable. Nonetheless, I would order it and put my arms to work again.

All in all, Beatrix is casual and buzzy. It's a good potential for hosting baby/bridal showers, out-of-town visitors, business dinners, girls' day/night out, etc. After trying both brunch and dinner, I must say the latter was much more charming and it won me over.

pics.caption: Chia pudding with coconut, mango, and passion fruit
Vanilla bean kulfi (Indian ice cream) with candied oranges and roasted pistachios

review.des:
Love Beatrix, probably ate here on at least 20 occasions. Admittedly, I have been staying at the Aloft quite a bit for my travels and they give you a $20 per day credit to use at Beatrix for platinum members, which is just a killer feature.

SUNDAY WAIT TIMES CAN EXCEED AN HOUR. It's a very popular brunch spot and I thought that the brunch was rather spectacular. One trick to get seated faster is ask for outdoors, its first come first serve. But then again, the warm weather won't be lasting long, so you better hurry up. On weekdays, usually no wait in the mornings to get seated.

FRESH SQUEEZED JUICES. My favorite is the watermelon cooler, but I've tried all of them.

SPICY CHICKEN TINGA IS ONE OF MY FAVS. It's just so delicious, nothing too elaborate, but a very good tasting breakfast.

STEAK CHIMICHURRI. Another item I love.

MODERN AMBIANCE. Being located in a modern hotel, it has a corresponding vibe to the restaurant. The partially finished wood tables, the modern rustic furniture, I like the feel of Beatrix.

pics.caption: Shakshouka - spicy tomato sauce, poached eggs, kale, feta and naan.
My special request - the spiciest sauce they have!

review.des:
My husband and I went for dinner on our anniversary. The food tasted great and felt pretty healthy. I enjoyed the cocktails, they were mixed well.

The staff is friendly and gives great suggestions. Our server found out it was our anniversary and gave us a complimentary dessert, their pie! So good, I'd probably come back here just for the dessert! Sort of reminded me of crack pie from Milk Bar in NYC. Sort of.

The restaurant is in the lobby of the Aloft hotel. It's a bit strange because if you're sitting on one side of the restaurant there are guests coming and going constantly near your table.

It's part of the Lettuce Entertain You group and you can get points!! Don't forget to sign up for a rewards card ;)

Finally made it to Beatrix, and boy was it worth the wait!! Food is absolutely amazing. I highly recommend the potroast and egg sandwich served with a side of jalapeno relish. Meat so tender teeth are not needed lol. Colin our server was top notch! Very well informed and detail orientated, great job Colin!! We'll be back for sure!

I recently stayed at the Aloft Hotel, and Beatrix is located on the first floor.  They do the room service for the hotel, but I thought I would get the full experience and meander down to the lobby and to the restaurant to give it a try.  It was definitely a happening location on a Sunday morning!

It took a while to get seated because it was so busy and there's not a great place to wait given the space.  People were waiting wherever they could. When I did get seated, I was definitely taken care of.  I started off with a blue(berry) mimosa.   It was a delicious treat.  I got the quinoa cakes with poached eggs which came with a salsa. It was a light meal, but a perfect portion size. Service was quick, and made up for the wait. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Chicago!

Excellent service, great food and ambience. We went for dinner with a large at this place while we were in Chicago for a company training. We were pleasantly surprised by the menu selections which boasted healthy but hearty options. We ordered several plates to share and try the different appetizer options. The burrata Olive caramel figs were our favorite hands down. For dinner some of us ordered the chicken bebe, which I expected to be a safe but boring choice as I was not in the mood for a lot of frills. Boy did I get a great surprise. The chicken was anything except boring. Organic chicken parnesan crusted sometimes can be too dry or too oily. This was neither, as it was perfectly tender and crunchy on the outside at the same time. But what made it special was the sauce, which I can describe to be close to an Italian piccatta, and it went perfectly with the grilled asparagus.

For dessert we decided to try one of each. Our favorite was the caramel pie. I could eat that every day and die happy. The apple strudel was good but too hard to cut and share. You need to eat with hands or get a knife.

We were very happy with the food and service,  and our waiter was very attentive and friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone.

My favorite healthy organic local sourced protein kinda creative place downtown. Good for the vegetarian and carnivore equally. Also, serves bulletproof coffee which is hard to find but even if you aren't into it, still a good indicator for the quality standards they have... Over time, I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here. Always leave satisfied. Enjoy!
Always popular place. Always gas something new to try. Nice brunch place must to try. Hit place suggest make reservations in advance.

Pretty lousy service. There were two bartenders and what I assume were two servers behind the bar during my visit. Two of them were standing behind the bar, watching the basketball game and talking to each other. The other two were facing away from the bar.  I made eye contact and they smiled, but did not ask if we had been helped. After sitting at the bar for a good 7-8 minutes, we finally got the bartender's attention and ordered drinks, he didn't ask if we wanted anything else so I said "can we put in an order the kale salad" as he was walking away.

The kale salad had a nice presentation with shaved parmesan cheese on top. The salad was light with pumpkin seeds and what I believe were dried cranberries and papaya. For an appetizer, the presentation was very attractive and the overall portion was just the right amount.

Whether you have a client dinner/lunch or are just stopping in for some of their amazing coffee and dessert, Beatrix has it all. Local Chicagoan or visiting, I would recommend stopping by Beatrix and feeling the energy of River North.

Started out with the blue boost juice which is freshly squeezed blueberry, grape and basil juice! Probably the highlight of the meal!
I tried the lemon fluffy pancakes which were great and light. The quinoa cakes with poached eggs were delicious! A nice light and healthy breakfast.
Finished of breakfast with a butterscotch oatmeal cookie, would recommend!

Wow! Beatrix is now one of my favorite places to eat in this area. I came after a long week of work to enjoy Friday afternoon and was so happy with everything. We started off with a couple of juices. The cucumber and mint soda was super light and refreshing and the carrot, apple, and ginger snap was something I felt was innovative, healthy, and delicious at the same time. It leans heavier towards the carrot, about 50%, and then maybe 35% towards the ginger snap but then you also get hints of the apple too. Loved it!

We decided on sampling a few of their snacks since we had just recently finished lunch. The kennebec fries were great though I think I would have liked it with more potato inside the fries. My favorite part was actually the few slices of crispy lemons sprinkled on top and the delicious aioli with spices. The warm quinoa cakes were really delicious too - they were light, airy, and actually a great compliment to the heavier fries. My favorite snack was the tsukune (chicken meatball) with chili cilantro sauce. SO GOOD. YUMM! I wasn't able to taste the cilantro in the sauce so for those of you who have an aversion to cilantro, still give it a try!

I wasn't hungry enough to get a bigger entree except for a bite of the chili and chocolate glazed salmon but I totally have my eye out for the mushroom quinoa burger on the next visit!

Other non-food related points: The outside seating area is amazing on a nice low-wind day. Otherwise, they keep open windows even when you are sitting inside so you feel a small breeze. Our waitress was great; she was on top of filling our waters and asking if we needed anything else. Great experience overall.

Super healthy option for a tasty brunch.  They always have new specials that are also fresh and healthy.  I always go for the fresh squeezed blueberry juice with white grape and basil (the blue boost) as my drink of choice.  It's pricey for a glass of juice, but super fresh and refreshing-- and full of antioxidants too!

Some of my favorites from the menu:
- The house-made Belgian waffle: topped with fresh strawberries and vanilla syrup.  A healthier and lighter waffle than other restaurants that isn't too heavy and won't leave you in a food coma after.
- The spicy chicken tinga-- This is my boyfriend's go-to dish.  It comes with spicy guajillo chili, sunny side up eggs, and avocado, which you put inside fresh corn tortillas.  Think: little breakfast fajitas.  

The River North location is smaller than the Streeterville one, so I'd definitely recommend making recommendations if you're going to this location.  Overall, it's a fun atmosphere with healthy choices!  They also have a bakery so you can grab a croissant/pastry and coffee on the way out!

Extra bonus-- you get Lettuce Entertain You points if you're a rewards member.

Caught up with girlfriends for breakfast here on a weekday morning. Made reservations online and they accommodated by booth request. Service was great and they didn't harass me for lagging at the table when my friends were super late from the rainy weather. The highlight for me was the sweet valencia orange juice which took awhile because it was made fresh but definitely worth it! Also got the lemon pancakes with blackberries and lemon syrup and egg white omelet with white cheddar, baby spinach, avocado and tomato salsa with organic turkey bacon. I had high hopes for the lemon pancakes but they weren't my thing. The omelet was better in my opinion. Nevertheless, solid service and atmosphere for a breakfast/brunch in the River North area.

Went here for a work dinner and it was the perfect setting. Very clean, trendy and pretty crowded for a Tuesday night. The service was amazing - our waiter was very knowledgeable and nice. The serving sizes are a little smaller than I expected, although I was happy not to ask for a leftovers box. The bakery area was cute and I got several items (cookies were the best!)
Great experience .... excellent pastries and extremely kind and helpful wait staff. Been multiple times but never fails

Beatrix is my new go to spot when I'm looking for a laid back spot with good vibe and excellent food. If you read other reviews,  you'll realize that Beatrix is attached to a hotel. This is NOT your typical hotel restaurant.  Beatrix has figured out the formula to be chill and lively.

Now to the food. I had the Skirt Steak Chimichurri. My wife had the Eggplant Paperdelle Ragu (she's a wanna be vegetarian) and the kids had the burgers. Let's start with the burgers. The burger blend was amazing. As an "adult", I would be thrilled to have the kid's burger as my entree. My wife's dish was magnificent.  I am a carnivore and for me to say a vegetarian dish is something I would order is on the order of you spotting a unicorn.  My skirt steak was done to perfection and the Chimichurri was an amazing addition.  I'm on a low carb diet so I had one bite of the Kennebec fries and it took every ounce of willpower to not take another bite. Dessert just arrived and my wife is insisting that I take a bit of chocolate cake but Nope.

We had the cauliflower grits, cheese blintz, steak chimichurri and lemon pancakes. Every thing was well prepared and flavorful. Tasty coffee too. The service is excellent even at busy Sunday brunch. They didn't have reservations available but we were able to walk in anyway. Fun trendy decor and a peaceful setting on a beautiful street. Griselda, our server, was excellent.

Came for Fourth of July brunch while visiting Chicago. Sat at the bar right away despite the waiting time for a table (hooray for brunch for one). Ordered a michelada, enchiladas verdes, a power greens juice, and a coffee.

Service - 4/5 really friendly host stand. Bar tender didn't hear me at times and I asked to ask for coffee and water multiple times. Food was brought out in a timely manner.

Food - 4/5 enchiladas were good and different. Not the enchiladas my mother made (which are also delicious but just different)

Ambiance - 5/5 busy, and hip with a nice outdoor patio. Two bar areas.

All in all I recommend this place. They have a creative take on brunch classics, and they have a good bar selection. Would come again (and hoping not alone next time)!

Came here for drinks after having dinner next door. We were seated at the side bar which was private and nice. I was bummed to learn they only had one porter beer, so I stuck to that. My friend had the blueberry gin drink and then ordered and then ordered something off the menu which the bartender made without hesitation. Place was not crazy busy but enough for a Wednesday night. Again, I have been wanting to check this place out for some time so was glad to at least have drinks. I was turned off by the smell of seafood nearby and then I learned that this restaurant is also part of the Let Us Entertain You corp. Are they slowly taking over? Knowing that know, it kinda ruined it for me. I probably would have come back to eat but I would rather spend my $$& and try an independent instead.

When traveling, I like to have a light but tasty breakfast with amazing coffee. I found Beatrix through my fellow Yelpers. Started with my morning run and stopped in after. Party of one, outside please (note I did get sat buy a hostess). After about ten minutes of no one greeting me, I went inside and sat at the bar. After another 5 minutes the bartender finally greets me and I tell him I sat outside for ten minutes without any service.

Bartender: well you have to let a hostess know you're sitting out there. Me: Blank stare, customer next to me: or maybe the staff should check on the customer.

Moving on, I ordered a Bulletproof coffee and egg white omelette. Bartender: sorry we are out of coconut oil for the bulletproof. So I go with the honey/cinnamon latte which was great.

My breakfast came out fairly quick and I was happy. Simple, tasty and filling. Sometimes a hungry customer is not in the mood to argue about getting service. Minus one star for the rude bartender.

Been here 5 times in the past 3 months. The Oh My Carmel Pie! is AMAZINNNNNNNNNG! The salads are what I eat every time. The triple A salad is great with salmon.

Check this place out! Great for date night and business lunches/breakfast.

Incredible food and juices! Can't go wrong with the Blueberry Basil Smash. Couldn't decide on what to order for dinner because everything on the menu looked absolutely delectable! Classic American food with a fun twist that takes it to the next level. I decided on the Pork Shank with cider reduction, with mashed potatoes, apples, and sweet potatoes. So good- I would highly recommend!

Can't wait to visit again soon!

pics.caption: Pork Shank with cider reduction, with mashed potatoes, apples, and sweet potatoes

review.des:
Early for reservation. Meeting family and friends.  Sat at bar and ordered a beer.  Asked waitress what tequilas they had and pointed to one of beautiful bottles on shelf.  Friendly waitress without a second thought poured a sip of mezcal (La Purrita Verde) I asked about for me to taste.  Family and friends arrived and shortly after enjoying our initial catching-up on life, our drinks were served and entrees ordered.  The skirts steaks, ribs, pork loin and burgers were devoured.  

A lively place, great service and food.  We will be back, for sure.

My favorite place to stay is Aloft - because of Beatrix! Love any and every meal here. And breakfast is my favorite - and I don't even like breakfast!  Honey cinnamon latte, prime burger, lemon pancakes, cauliflower grits & eggs, Caesar salad, cookies - just everything is awesome!

I had a fantastic meal here.   Made reservations, and the restaurant made accomodations so we could eat outside since it was a beautiful evening.  Shared the kung pao brussels, the deviled eggs and had the pork shank entree.  The pork shank was off the chain.  

I did not feel the meal was overpriced in comparison to some other restaurants in the area.  Would love to try it for breakfast, looks like they have plenty of carbolicious treats that look dang scrummy

I am so pleasantly surprised at the food in this restaurant, not to mention the chill atmosphere. I've had 3 meals here. For Sunday brunch I had the green chili enchiladas perfectly stuffed with kale and topped with a succulent white queso all in a green chili sauce. For dinner I've had the chicken Bebe. Oh my god these tender and lightly breaded chicken filets melted in my mouth. A light lemon cream sauce added to my delight. For breakfast I've had the cauliflower grits. Grits are topped with a fried egg and sprinkled with cauliflower and crispy brussels sprouts leaves. The Parmesan adds the perfect spice. I wish I could eat here every day but alas it's time to return to Seattle.
Deliscious food, premium coffee, and great juice bar. My favorite brunch spot in River North.

Love Beatrix. Came here for brunch and dinner. Brunch menu was fun and exotic. Many different spins on your basic brunch. Service was great and friendly. Quick to seat our group of 5.

Dinner menu was also fun and interesting options. We had the special. It was delicious!

Okay so I was in the area and wanted to try Beatrix for lunch but we already got some awesome sandwiches at Xoco so we weren't starving but decided to come in during lunch time for dessert. The place was packed and the atmosphere was really lively so I can see that if you live in the area, it's definitely a fun hot spot to grab some tasty food in a fun, up beat environment.

Unfortunately, they were fully packed and a table would have been an additional 20 minutes so I decided to get some dessert to go. Looking around people had sandwiches and salads all around so lots of healthier options available. I however, decided to carry out two pieces of their much talked about Carmel pie. It took like 5 minutes and my pies were ready, served in perfect little to go boxes with silver wear and everything, they get a star alone for that. When I got home I indulged and it was fantastic. Creamy, rich, carmel flavor, not overly sweet with fantastic homemade whipped cream on the side. What's not to love. I will say I wouldn't give the pie 5 stars since the to go portions were a little on the small side and for almost $9 for a piece of pie I would have hoped it would have been bigger.

Beatrix, you left a pretty good first impression and I'll definitely be back to sample more of your goodies next time I'm around and maybe get to experience your service as well.
Best fuckin burger ever. Holy shit it's like a Chicago musical of taste. My Lord God Almighty thank you for gracing me with this burger. Good fuckin job

Girls dinner, everything was beautifully presented and delicious. We loved the ambiance and server was terrific! I've always enjoyed the Streeterville location but this is even better! Looking forward to going back!

I almost skipped this place because it was in the hotel, but man I am glad I didn't.

To kick things off the bartender, Lukas, asked me what I like and then brought me a new drink called the Montgomery Smith. It was created at PDT in NYC.  Frankly it is my perfect drink.

So the food. Started with the ahi crudo solid and tasty. Then a simple salad, not really simple but ultrafresh with a bit of earthiness that was totally unexpected.

Finished with the cider brined pork shank. Perfect way to finish a long long day.

Best bartenders ever, Lukas and Jake rock, seriously they are awesome.  

You owe it to yourself to try this place.

pics.caption: I know a simple salad, right?  Man it was tasty. Tricolor tomatoes with a simple dressing over mescaline salad.

review.des:
What a delightful spot. Went twice on a recent trip to Chicago. The first day was on my own and wanted something to tide me over before friends arrived. Ordered hummus and was delighted by the taste and that it was served with fresh cherry tomatoes swimming in EVOO and herbs. Also enjoyed their blackberry and lychee lemonade to drink. So refreshing on a hot day.
Went back for breakfast and friend ordered lemon pancakes served with lemon syrup. Very delicate and fluffy. I had the green chili enchiladas that included scrambled eggs, goat cheese, roasted peppers and green chili sauce. So amazing! Make sure you go here! You won't regret it.

I've recently had a love hate relationship with lettuce entertain you but holy perfection. One of my friends has been raving about Beatrix for years and I randomly decided to check it out on Saturday night. ( service was mediocre, idk what has been going on with lettuce entertain you service lately but they really need to re-assess their training booklet and training staff. But seriously the food was so good I will overlook the service or lack thereof for a brief moment)

We arrived about 15 min early and the restaurant was packed so we decided to grab a drink at the bar (cue the bad service) we waited a good 7 minutes before the bartender even looked our way (bar was not crowded we grabbed a seat). My friend and I ordered a Gogi Berry Blossom and a Blueberry Tom Collins, both were amazing. We waited about another 5 min and our table was ready but still no drinks. Finally a few minutes later our drinks came and WOW! Amazing cocktails.

We were seated and (sorry- cue the bad service) we waited quite a few minutes before our waiter came by. When he finally came by he dropped off the specialist menu but by that point we were ready to order. We ordered appetizers of the Burrata, Tuna Crudo, Kale Salad and for our entrée we got the skirt steak.                            

The Ahi Tuna Crudo and Burrata came out first; both 5/5. The ahi tuna was so fresh a great portion size (since we ordered a lot) and amazing flavor combo.  The burrata- WOW, a litter firmer then what I am used to but still great! It was paired with what I thought was guac but it was actually mashed edamame and artichoke ( YUM!) and some kind of yummy healthy crispy cracker.  Next came our salad, they waiter had split the salad for us which was super nice. I'm a total salad snob, salad is hands down my favorite food and this crispy kale salad may be the top 2 best salads I have ever eaten. The salad had papaya, pumpkin seeds, dates, parmesan (not over powering) with a white balsamic vinaigrette. The waiter finally decided to make his rounds by this point to check in on us and we ordered another round of drinks, this time 2 orders of Gogi Berry Blossom (sigh- it literally felt like we waited 30 minutes for these cocktails). By this point our entrée arrived- Skirt Steak Chimichurri. The steak was cooked and sliced perfectly. We were actually pretty full at this point but continued to nibble away. The steak came with fries and grilled peppers. By this point we were so full we had no room to have dessert.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere, it was very different from everything else in the River North area. The environment was very pleasant and not stuck up at all (breathe of fresh air). It was a nice restaurant but felt fairly casual. I would highly recommend everything that I ordered, although everything looked phenomenal on the menu. I for sure will be back to try some more things and definitely return for brunch.

The brussels sprouts are incredible. So good. Equally as good was the service. Our server was friendly, helpful and made great menu recommendations. The atmosphere is comfortable and perfect for a date night.

I have begun eating like a vegetarian for 2/3's of a day. I only eat meat with dinner. So it has become an issue trying to find something for lunch besides a salad, and something that doesn't cost $20. I thought I would give Beatrix a try today. I was going to grab something to go, but when I went to the bar to order carry out I decided to have a seat. They have a bakery here, they bake all their cookies and cakes and such. I am trying to avoid so many carbs, so I abstained from trying those. I did order the Quinoa and mushroom burger for lunch. It came with kennebec  french fries. For those of you who don not know, kennebec is a type of potato.  It doesn't look much different than an Idaho potato, but there is 2 differences. One is the potato has less moisture, two the flesh is firm, making them perfect for french fries and potato chips. This was my first experience having them. I must say, these were the crispiest, tastiest french fries I have ever had. So good. And you get plenty of them. The burger was fine, I think it needed some herbs or spices to kick up that flavor, it was a tiny bit bland. Since I sat at the bar, it was hard to gauge the service, I mean the guys were right in front of me. The price of eating vegetarian is more than I expected, and Beatrix was no different, but I was quite satisfied with my meal, and I will return.

Still dreaming about the "ginger snap" juice. A fresh blend of carrots, ginger and apples. The most refreshing way to kick the day off! Brilliant ingredient combo.

The party continued with the quinoa cakes topped with eggs Benedict and an herb puree. Not only was it guilt-free but packed with flavor. Oh! And for those of us who can never decide if we want to go full on sweet or savory, order the lemon ricotta pancake with lemon syrup as an appetizer for the table. You'll have one and want another. I guarantee it.

Last note, this place is huge. Perfect for groups. The bakery and coffee shop counter also make it a great pit stop for those of us who fly solo on the regular with a work laptop in tow.

Stop reading and call in for a reservation!

The chilaquiles were fire!! Great brunch spot with lots of options and great service. If you're wanting a quiet spot, I wouldn't recommend since it's so busy and can get pretty loud. But if you're wanting guaranteed deliciousness, this is your place!

Mid-winter, Beatrix was a blessing. The vibe of the space made it feel like you were dining in a garden.

It was a wonderful breakfast with some fabulous ladies, the menu had enough variety and there was something for everyone, each meal was well prepared, and service was stellar.

Enchiladas for breakfast is always a good choice - what came first, the chicken or the egg? In this case the egg. Scrambled, of course topped with salsa verde. I always prefer the savory option for breakfast but as a group we couldn't pass up the lemon pancake. It's was melty, lemony, fluffy goodness.

The coffee was strong and regularly refilled as was the water. Overall, a blissful morning before we all left town. I'd be back in a heartbeat and a close walk to the Kinzie Hotel where I stayed.

Had a delicious Sunday Brunch here. Loved that the menu had extensive options from super-healthy to super sweet or savory! The service was great from arrival to waiter, etc. We had reservations and would suggest anyone do the same; it got pretty packed even for an early brunch @ 10:45AM the wait was 45mins-1hr.
Tried on of the fresh juices (hangover remedy) mango/orange/pine and was so good! Also tried the honey cinnamon latte and great cause not too sweet for me. I went with the "all white omelet" and it was savory ; would go for this again unless my sweet tooth attacks. Hubs got the special of the day: pecan-praline French toast- what a cake! We tried the side of the chkn sausage and was very tasty. We didnt try any cocktails (I mean after our st pattys craze the day before, just couldnt...) But they have a full bar with ample cocktail menu. It is located in the same bldg as the Aloft hotel. And beware, there are two and about 15mins walking from eachother so make sure to confirm which one you are going to is the one you reserved.

BEATRIX is Great choice for brunch!!!
The kingpin Brussels sprouts were AMAZING. Service could have been better, but overall great environment and good experience.

Turns out I've been here a couple times now and I quite enjoyed most of the food each time. Service was fantastic. Wine selection was great. The ahi tuna appetizer is wonderful, melt in your mouth smoothness with the avocado and tuna. The grilled Brussels sprouts were also very tasty with a unique sweet yet savory sauce. The chicken Bebe that I had a bite of was so delicious the parmesan crust was amazing and I had total order envy bc last night I had the quinoa crusted flounder special instead and it wasn't my fave to be honest. The crunchy texture was a nice compliment to the flaky fish but there def was a lack of flavor and I found myself constantly squeezing lemon on it. But I got over it when I had some of the caramel pie which omg is pure bliss. Comes with a delish homemade whipped cream and graham cracker crust. So so good. Can't wait to come back again and try more dishes.

I am updating my previous review. Beatrix was nice enough to send me a $25 voucher to go back after my initial experience, so I went back for dinner.
