We had to wait at the bar for a table, and the bartender was very gracious and friendly. Our drinks were also top notch. Here's what we had.

Food: split the kennebec fries, turkey neatloaf and cookie for dessert.
Drinks: We tried the basil seed mule and the pineapple habanero margatirta. We both really liked the mule and ended up ordering it for seconds.

The kennebec fries are out of this world. They're mixed with veggies and lemons and they're absolutely delicious. I could eat these every day of the week. We weren't super hungry so we ended up splitting the neatloaf and it was perfect for sharing. They even took the time to split it on two plates since they knew we were sharing.

All in all, I really enjoyed the food this time, and I'll be going back. :)

Spencer was our server on New Years Eve and was amazing and so attentive.  Apps were delicious, we had deviled eggs and burrata cheese.  Burger and Ravioli for our entrees and coffee and pumpkin pecan pie for dessert.  Highly recommended.  Comfortable and not rushed as well, which I love.

Absolutely amazing (and healthy!) food, craft drinks (alcoholic + non-alcoholic: full bar, artisan juices, coffees), and DELICIOUS desserts!

Had the blueberry basil juice, turkey burner, a latte, and the triple chocolate cookie. Everything was fantastic! Always my go-to lunch spot when visiting Chicago.

pics.caption: While there's typically a wait, we can walk right up for friendly, full service at the bar.

review.des:
Shocking delicious breakfast options and perhaps the best perk of staying at the Aloft.

In the mornings, they do brisk business, and if you're eating solo, you can just grab a seat at the bar and order breakfast from there. I tried the cauliflower grits, which I thought were creative and delicious. When you break the egg yolk and let it run over the cauliflower grits, it adds this delicious flavor and dimension to the dish. The grits are super smooth and addicting and infused with the flavor of parmesan (you can also request it without the parmesan). My only nit-picky point is that I would have preferred if the cauliflower and Brussels sprouts could have been cooked for slightly longer - they still had a bitter taste (rather than that caramelized sweet taste from cooking it longer).

I've heard their waffles are also divine.

We came here for lunch and we had mixed feelings about this place.

Service is great. Waiter was friendly. It was a bit busy when we got there (about 1:30pm), so the food took awhile to get to the table.

Warm quinoa cakes - comes in 3 pieces, but it was good. This is garnished with arugula and I'm guessing citrus vinaigrette dressing??? It tasted zingy and lemony. Definitely recommended.

Burrata, figs, marcona almonds - this was okay, not great. This dish came with a multi-grain bread/cracker and a burrata. The size of the burrata was more than enough for the bread/cracker to eat with. Other than that, the veggies with the figs tasted a like chemicals, but the figs made up for it.
 
Escarole & potato ravioli - Main dish - I highly recommend this dish if you come here for lunch or dinner. It comes in 2 HUUUUGE pieces of ravioli topped with white and green asparagus. The pasta was very savory and filling. Best ravioli I've ever had!!!

They do not have a lot on the menu, so there weren't a lot of options either. But the food was okay.

I had high hopes for this place. Came here for lunch the other day. Service was super slow. Ordered a salad that came with no dressing. Felt awkward having to ask for 3 cups of dressing (since they were so small!). We had to ask another waiter and the hostess for refills, Etc. I would like to come back and try other menu items. Hopefully it will be a better experience.

So I've been to both of the Beatrix locations for brunch (Streeterville twice and River North once), and it has been consistently excellent!  Tonight, I tried their dinner for the first time, and although it was good, I wasn't as blown away.  As such, my review for their River North location averages out to 4: 5 stars for my brunch experience here last summer, and 3 for my dinner here tonight.  (You can check out my separate review for their other location on its page).

Anyway, dinner: My friend and I ordered the hummus for an appetizer, and it was excellent.  However, once we finished it, our waitress came by to grab our appetizer plates and told us that our dinner would be coming in a moment.  Well, fast-forward about fifteen minutes later, and still no dinner!  I wasn't paying attention to the time, but our dinner took long enough that my friend and I both noticed and commented on it--probably around a half hour between ordering and receiving our food.  When it did come, it was delicious--I really enjoyed the Escarole & Potato Ravlioli.  I also had the Mango, Orange, & Pineapple Nectar to drink, and although it was tasty, I don't think I could justify ordering it for $6.50 again.

The ambiance was fine but did feel a bit hotel lobby-ish, probably because we were at one of the tables in the section that opens to the lobby.  The music was also a bit loud to be conducive to conversation in such a crowded space!

TL;DR: Dinner at Beatrix River North was quite tasty once it finally came, but I think I'll be sticking to brunch here in the future!

Every time I'm in Chicago, Beatrix is a must. They offer meals that are so much healthier than your average restaurant but absolutely delicious, too! The turkey, sweet potato and greens "Neatloaf" is my fave, but I've also loved many of the salads. You have to try the house made sodas sans alcohol or with a splash!
The atmosphere is really neat and the service was decent.  Overpriced for what it is though.

Wow.  Great breakfast.  Good service great way to end a weekend. We will repeat.

I had the omelet egg white with salsa. It was truly tasty with home made salsa made from cherry tomatoes.

Reasonably priced for river North!!!

Beatrix was the first brunch spot I went to in Chicago, and it's still my favorite. It has delicious food, a coffee bar, and a great location near several hotels. Plan to make a reservation though, as it does get crowded on the weekends.

I swear by the Spicy Chicken Tinga, though some will probably find it too spicy. Smoky chile flavor, fresh tomato, avocado, and egg makes for a truly satisfying breakfast. This is one of the few restaurant meals I've actually tried to re-create in my kitchen (I was mostly unsuccessful)!

My coffee preferences are usually pretty boring, but the Mexican Iced Coffee (think milk, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg) is an indulgence that perfectly complements brunch food. Take full advantage of the coffee bar!

Overall, I highly recommend Beatrix to anyone visiting Chicago - especially if you're staying in River North.

Beatrix, oh how I love you. Thank you for a truly unforgettable brunch. Love the whimsical interior. The staff was fairly friendly and helpful.

At first glance, I thought the menu was limited and nothing really piqued my interest, so I randomly decided on the  light and fluffy lemon pancakes with a side of brown sugar bacon. Wow! Those pancakes exceeded my expectations. Just the right amount of lemon flavor. I've never had pancakes so delicious and light. The brown sugar bacon wasn't as sweet as I anticipated, but I loved it nonetheless. The chia cherry chiller was pretty good at first, but after a few sips I tired of all of the chia seeds. With less seeds it would have been better. I ordered a cinnamon roll to go. I can't believe the cinnamon roll made it the entire 3 plus hour drive to Indianapolis.  When I got home I dug in. Thank you dessert gods for this heavenly creation. I'm not a big fan of cinnamon rolls, but this roll rocked my world.

Undoubtedly the best. I will be traveling to Chicago soon and a visit to Beatrix is a must. Pancakes and cinnamon roll are a MUST. Thank you Beatrix. Don't ever change and I will love you for life.

pics.caption: Best pancakes EVER! The light and fluffy lemon pancakes with a side of brown sugar bacon. Yesssss!!!

review.des: Great food, outstanding service, and overall an amazing time. I went with my bff to catch up and to our pleasant surprise they serve dinner at 3:30pm. I had the yummy Pot Roast Filet Mignon, which I highly recommend and she had the Chili & Chocolate Glazed Salmon, which she also enjoyed. Our waiter was awesome, super friendly and made our experience at Beatrix a true celebration. We will definitely be back for brunch to try the cauliflower grits.

Beatrix is my go-to fail-safe brunch spot!

Favorite items on the menu:
- Light and fluffy pancakes - these are heavenly.. I imagine this is what it would taste like if you could eat lemony clouds.  We love these so much we almost always order at least one to share in addition to main entree.
- Pepper and egg white sandwich - oh.my. the. bread. - so perfectly toasted and ever so crispy on the outer shell but so soft inside.. I think the bread makes this sandwich come alive.  The rest of the components are a great mix of sweet, spicy, salty goodness.  I love this.
- Steak chimichurri and eggs - the chimichurri is the star here.  Love it.

Service - they get busy quickly but service is usually good

Ambiance - the ambiance is great, it is a nice modern hipster classy feel.

STILL one of my favorite brunch spots- and even dinner spots, as I'm writing a review update after 2 years. It's just a non guilty, healthier side option, bright and open restaurant, in the river north and now streeterville area!

Favorite Brunch Meal: Quinoa Cakes with Poached Eggs
Best Coffee: Honey Cinnamon Latte (not on menu- but they will make it for you) and the latte art is always gorgeous
Favorite Dinner: Salmon (Chilli and Chocolate Glazed)
Favorite Dessert: Caramel Pie
BEST AMBIANCE: Clean, Subtle, a Quiet and Lively Chatter Environment

Service is Phenomenal. From talking to the host (same one has been there for many years), from getting a table on time with your reservation, great bar space, slight changes to the healthy menu but simple and unique, great waiters, delicious pastry bar with gluten free options. This is always my favorite and number one choice restaurant to take people from out of town. I can never get sick of Beatrix.

Got the poke bowl and bulletproof coffee. Both were delicious! If you want a healthy and scrumptious brunch in the Chicago area you should stop by. They get pretty busy, so expect some wait time but it's worth it. Service was speedy and pleasant. Will be back tomorrow!

Came for lunch on a Thursday around 1pm and was seated immediately. It was quite happening on a weekday. As the waiter was going through some of his favorite dishes, everything sounded really healthy. Ended up with the crispy kale salad and added salmon (can also choose chicken). It was very refreshing and flavorful. The salmon was moist and a complemented the greens well.

5 stars for: attentive service, healthy yet tasty dish recommended by my waiter and cool lunch spot scene!

This restaurant is right beneath the Aloft hotel. Great atmosphere, open windows with flowers and plants hanging all around, natural sunlight, and fresh air - perfect for brunch.

The brunch menu is very healthy. I'm usually a meat eater but the quinoa cakes really impressed me. I didn't need a single bite of sausage or bacon!

Service was good as well. I will remember this place next time I'm in Chicago.

pics.caption: Egg White Omelette and Quinoa Cakes - Delicious!

review.des:
OK I can't quite remember what we ordered for our dinner, but the DESSERT. oh. em. gee.

Sorry that I have such a horrible memory, but I definitely remember the caramel pie. WOW. Caramel crack pie!!! It's seriously the BEST pie I've had in my life. The filling wasn't too dense or too sweet, it was the most perfect, decadent and sinful dessert that I've ever had. If you come here for dinner, make sure you leave room for this baby!

pics.caption: Seemingly innocent. Seductively decadent and sinful. Caramel pie! Yum!

review.des: I've only had one thing here and it's so good that I keep on getting it every time and haven't been able to enjoy anything else. I know, life is tough. I'm utterly obsessed with their unique caesar salad (with chicken). I'm eaten it there and for carryout. Like other reviews, they do carryout very well here- everything had separate compartments, cute bag, etc. I'm looking forward to trying even more food...meaning I go with a huge group and steal bites from them so I can have my amazing salad.

One of my favorite spots for brunch! Their juices are amazing, and don't forget to check out their yummy desserts hiding behind the host area!

Definitely suggest making a reservation as ahead as possible, as there is almost always a wait.

If I could, I would give this place 10 stars. Simply amazing! I loved it so much, I visited it twice in the same day. Once for breakfast, and then for dinner. Breakfast was perfect - great coffee, outstanding chicken sausage, homemade jam, perfectly cooked eggs. Dinner was over the top, too. I ordered turkey sweet potato meatloaf and it was to-die-for! Service was outstanding, too. Attentive, courteous and helpful. Can't recommend this place enough!!!
Brilliant food and the service is above awesome.  Do not look at the bakery items because they are deadly (in all the right ways).

Very pleasantly surprised with Beatrix! I was in town and looking for possible places to eat because I have celiac disease. After some online research, Beatrix was on my list and  happened to be connected to the hotel we were staying in. We actually ended up having a few meals here because we liked it so much, and every single experience was great! Even when they were busy we were seated quickly. Every server we had was wonderful, very understanding and helpful with my gluten free requests and ensuring the food was prepared properly. And the food was excellent! Highly recommend, I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.

pics.caption: Actually good gluten free bread is always a happy surprise!

review.des: I am a HUGE fan of Beatrix, I came here multiple times and it is as excellent every time. The first time I came I visited their coffee / drinks bar - which is awesome, because you have the option to just sit and have coffee and any pastry from their amazing selection or you can have a drink or even order food at the bar, and they have an AMAZING nitro brew coffee that i love so much. The bar is first come first serve, and it's nice since you will almost get seats without reservations because this place is always pumpin! The ambiance is amazing, it's connected to the alof hotel right next to it, which gives it a more hip/open vibe. The customer service is SUPERB, everyone is ALWAYS SO NICE i love it. For brunch I had cauliflower grits and eggs, it comes with brussel sprouts, that was wonderful . For dinner over multiple times we had the three grains salad, the straight A salad, the chicken bebe, the chocolate chili salmon, everything is just so wonderful everytime. And they have a gluten-free menu that is as inclusive as their regular menu. Wait I forgot to mention the price, for the quality of their foods? This is the best taste and quality and ambiance of food for the price thus far in Chicago.

This was our second time we had brunch at Beatrix and both times we had a solid meal! We loved everything we had this time: lemon pancakes, the cauliflower grits and eggs, the brown sugar bacon, the blue boost, and the bulletproof coffee! We will definitely continue to keep coming back for brunch and we plan to try Beatrix's dinner menu in the future.
Great brunch spot, chicken Cesar salad was fantastic as were the mimosas and coffee. Lively vibe in great neighborhood.

Great short rib dish and desserts. Disappointed in having to wait 20 minutes with reservations. Typically not an issue get a cocktail at the bar and hang out. Problem was there was so much foot traffic in that space that we kept having to move around to let people through. Very poor accommodations if u have to wait with a group of people

Found this place through a blog and decided to give it a try on a rainy (gloomy) day for brunch. I swear it made my day. The best vegetarian options I could find for brunch. I am in deep love with their lemon pancakes. It is a must must try. They just melt in your mouth. This place is a gem and no doubts it has such good reviews on yelp. This place is a must go on my list whenever I visit Chicago now.

I came here with friends for brunch on a snowy Chicago day less than a couple weeks ago. I found everything here to be A-Ok. Ok Irish coffee, ok service, ok pot roast and egg sandwich (minus the fact that they were real skimpy on the pot roast itself which was the best part; the bread was good too). What was excellent were their fries which my friends and I fought over. The atmosphere was nice and open too. I wouldn't say no to coming back if invited by friends, but there are many other places I would go to first.

pics.caption: Pot Roast and Egg Sandwich with Jalapeño Relish

review.des: Decided to check out Beatrix last Sunday since it came so highly recommended. Went early in the morning and glad I did because as soon as we got there, the rush increased exponentially. While we waited, I got coffee from their cafe section which is well stocked with breakfast foods and the coffee wasn't bad either. Along with coffee, they serve tea and freshly squeezed juice. After getting our drinks, we waited in Aloft lobby area which is attached to Beatrix. Let's talk about the food. We ordered Quinoa cakes w/poached eggs, spicy chicken tinga, green chili enchiladas and french toast. My favorite was the spicy chicken tinga and the Quinoa cakes were a close second. Green chili enchiladas were mediocre. The french toast was pretty delicious with pecans and caramel on top. It was super sweet, good to share.
Great ambiance, friendly service and delicious food. A lot of great vegetarian options. I highly recommend the Caesar Salad and the hummus w/vegetables.

Got a last minute open table reservation for 8 people on a Sunday morning for brunch which was great. The decor of this place is really nice; the service is professional and friendly.

Unfortunately, I will not be returning due to the value of this restaurant. The portion sizes for all 8 of our dishes were quite small. Specifically, I ordered an oatmeal that was so tiny and came with only a sprinkling of toppings that I finished in two minutes. I also ordered a side of raspberry jam toast for $6 and it came with only ONE slice of bread. A side of toast, especially for $6 should be at least two slices. In total, I spent $12 for the oatmeal and slice of bread and was still very hungry after. The rest of my group all liked their food although they were also disappointed by their portions.

Overall, Beatrix is a nice place that is ok if you cannot get reservations elsewhere, but I think there are many better options in the city that are a better value with bigger dishes.

pics.caption: Side of toast for $6 - only one slice

review.des:
I come to Beatrix often and find that I really enjoy the overall experience of the place.  I bring client's here regularly and find it to be a fun and approachable place for my clients who are perhaps less food forward than I am.

Beatrix is comfortable like an old, well-worn shoe.  The food is elevated comfort food, with a few interesting twists should you choose to partake.  I've always found it to be tasty, interesting, but ultimately a comfortable meal perfect for having a conversation with friends/guests.

On a recent winter evening I had the carmelized pork shank which was absolutely perfect given the weather.  Tender and flavorful, the glaze had the perfect amount of sweet (and a little sour) to be deeply satisfying. My colleague (not at all a foodie) had the short rib and was similarly pleased.  The salads are also terrific.  I recommend getting a couple of the "snack" to start the meal with (along with a drink) to kind of ease into things.  

The room is terrific, not too noisy but always with a pleasant level of energy and hum.

We heard this place was good for brunch, so we decided to take a look and it was a good decision!  The service was great.  The entire staff, from the moment we walked into the door, was at the top of their game.  Although really busy, they got us seated as quickly as they could and kept our water glasses full at all times.  
I'm giving Beatrix five stars for their customer service, their cocktails and their green chicken enchiladas (which I highly recommend).

We are big Lettuce Entertain you fans they run a great restaurant.  Not Beatrix.  2nd time there both times terrible service.  This time it was a comedy of errors and the most frustrating part is that the server had not a clue how bad it was.

A few examples:

Is there any fat or what type of fat is in mash cauliflower.  A:  it's just cauliflower very healthy.  Can you please check?  (Rolls eyes and goes check).  A:  it has butter in it...

Can I substitute something for fries.  A: No, unless you pay....seriously that was answer...he was rude and impatient and the place was empty.  5 pm on 12/24.

The icing on the cake was when he spilled hot water for tea on my back, I jumped and he wasn't even aware what he did.

As I write this I realize how pissed I am.... Never go back and may even put LEYE in penalty box for a while.

I ordered barramundi it was ok...Mom ordered burger med rare....she didn't complain but it was rare not MR

I don't think I have anything negative to say about my experience at Beatrix. If you are gluten free this is a great spot! Service was great our waiter was attentive and personable. I suggest the hummus as a starter and the pepper & egg sandwich for brunch. On top of all that there is an amazing bakery, gluten free options, that instantly makes you feel like a little kid in a candy store. Truly a 5 star rating overall excellent experience and highly recommend.

I've always loved this place.  Many healthy options from salads to burgers to full on entrees.  Definitely a place to come to enjoy a good meal and not feel guilty (just stay away from the pastry case) lol.  My fave:  the cucumber soda.  Light and refreshing.

pics.caption: Chicken Caesar salad, Greek yogurt dressing
Tsukune chicken based balls with a chili-cilantro glaze

review.des:
Such a great restaurant. It was our last day in Chicago so a small group of us walked over during lunch to grab a quick lunch.  The dining area is a good size. The menu offers salads, sandwiches, burgers and fun small plates such as amazing hummus.

Our server was very attentive and we ordered quickly so we could get back to our seminar. Very clean inside. The salads are a nice size, super fresh ingredients, and quite tasty.

All of our dishes were excellent. This place is great  for health conscious people as they offer great quality and a nice variety of low calorie options.  The prices for lunch were reasonable for the quality of food.

Service was great. Awesome place for a lovely healthy meal.

Healthy food, nice atmosphere and great service for brunch. The fresh squeezed juices are especially good. I had the Valencia Orange and my hubby had green juice (Note that the celery flavor is fairly strong if you aren't a fan). We also had the brown sugar bacon (dessert in bacon form), the oatmeal (a really great grain that reads more like a porridge) and the quinoa cakes (Andrew practically licked the plate clean!).

The atmosphere is also cute. Modern but not uncomfortably so with lots of natural light. We had fun looking at all of the different types of lighting fixtures and seating options.

Service was fast and friendly. We were amazed at how quickly our food came out after we ordered. Great option to have in the Chicago brunch rotation with something for everyone on the menu!

Came here with a group of 4 and there was an hour wait which we kind of expected so we just congregated around the bar to wait and ended up just getting a seat there. I ordered the steak and eggs, my steak was given to me well done even though I ordered medium rare; it was just a short wait to get my steak recooked and if was SO GOOD!!! It only wish I had a bigger portion of steak. A must place to visit when coming to Chicago.

Get the chicken tinga!! Very generous portion. Full plate of chicken with two runny eggs on top. Perfect combo and very flavorful. Came with sides of soft tortilla.

Love the ambiance. Cute brunch place. They also have great selection of baked goods.

I stayed at the Aloft and got breakfast here one morning.  Tried the egg & pork roast sandwich which in all honesty was the best breakfast sandwich ive ever eaten.  No joke.   Can't wait to come back here and try some of the other dishes.

Whoa, this is epic brunch with unicorns and moonbeams. This cocktail menu is to die for! They have a fresh juice bar, and this parlays over to the regular bar, thank goodness. We tried several different things and they were all absolutely spectacular, and we're a tough LA cocktail crowd.

Must try: Potato Salad Deviled Eggs. and all cocktails.

The food is healthy, hearty and unique. We will definitely be back when in the area. Totally perfect from start to finish. Bravo.

Had a perfect late afternoon bite at Beatrix. We were greeted immediately as we sat down in the really cool leather chairs by our waitress Lauren who was really sweet, helpful, & attentive. We later found out that it was Lauren's first day but we could not tell with the amazing service she provided. We ordered two chai lattes which were perfectly spiced. Creamy deviled eggs. Of course we couldn't resist the beautiful display of freshly baked sweet treats. We ordered coffee cake and two cookies. The cookies (magic & butterscotch) were out of this world. The balance between chewy, crunchy, sweet & salt was scrumptious. The ambiance, service & food all exceeded our expectations. Wish I lived in Chicago so I can come back to this awesome restaurant.

This is a great little spot for lunch or dinner or even for just a few drinks. During the summertime, they open the doors and it's an awesome spot to stop for drinks, sunshine and conversation. Everything on their menu seems extremely fresh and delicious!

Beatrix is a great place for brunch in the River North neighborhood. They accommodated a our large group of 12 people with ease. I have no problem gorging with unhealthy goodness, but I liked that there were several lighter fare options and tasty breakfast drinks to choose from the menu. The fresh squeezed juices were a refreshing treat. The cauliflower grits with eggs and Brussels sprouts and parmesan were packed full of flavor. My appetite was satisfied and I didn't suffer from a food coma. A good thing for a productive Sunday ;)!

Bottom line: Beatrix has a nice balance of healthy and great tasting food and yummy beverages.

Came here on a whim for brunch with a friend, service was very friendly and helpful. Had the quinoa cakes with poached eggs and a side of fruit. Quinoa was flavorful and eggs were poached perfectly, the mayo that was drizzled on top was a little too rich but overall very tasty. The side of fruit was a tiny cup, slightly disappointed about the lack of variety too. Friend had the chili and eggs which she loved. Coffee was good, tea was good and all in all had a great experience. Will definitely be back.

Located inside the new Aloft Hotel, this place is a cut above most. Friendly staff, comfortable seating, lots of window walls that overlook busy Clark St., and a gourmet pastry bakery on premise make this a nice choice for breakfast.

I've had their burgers, and made a pig out of myself on their truly great fries (fried with paper-thin slivers of lemon and peppers which are tossed into the fries plate, amazing), and a recent breakfast as well. GREAT coffee, lots of good breakfasts being served all around me.

Prices are good, service was stellar for both breakfast and dinner, and the food is way above average. I'll go there anytime I'm staying at the hotel. It has a nice vibe --cozy, charming, and slightly upscale-- that makes you feel good about yourself. I'm a fan.

Came here for brunch around 8:30am and it was pretty empty. I'm not much of a brunch food kinda guy, but the Spicy Chicken Tinga was DELICIOUS. It was a large plate of spicy shredded chicken with 2 runny sunny side up eggs and slices of avocado. The dish came with a couple tortillas and I had a blast making my own tacos.

I was hungover that morning  so I opted for their bottomless coffee, which made the morning even better. The place ended up getting really crowded when we left around 11am and there was a huge line waiting. I definitely recommend coming early, especially since they open on the earlier side.

Great food, cheap prices, endless coffee. The decor was fancy shmancy too. What more can you ask for?

Really good brunch on New Years day. The wait wasn't horrible at 10:30, maybe 15 minutes. Really cool vibe to this place and a very interesting menu. She had a dish of a chicken chili with avocado and an egg on top that was really good, I had food envy so stole a few bites. I had the lemon pancakes which were good also.

Very friendly service, not someone with an attitude having to work New Years day, Prices are reasonable for the city!

Give it a try.

Great food and great service!
Kevin is one of the nicest people there. He always finds ways to accommodate the customers needs. The cauliflower soup is phenomenal.

Although vegetarian items are limited on the menu the Ravioli is good. The stuffed poblano pepper vegetarian special is a must get if offered.

The cocktails are also a must try. Well made and tasty!

I can't believe it's taken me as long as it has to get to Beatrix. I am totally smitten! I think I may have been turned off due to the fact that it is connected to the Aloft Hotel next door, but don't let that deter you as it did me!

Beatrix offers some of the freshest and delicious fare I have come across in the entire city of Chicago, no joke. The food and drinks served have a California vibe, light and refreshing, each distinct ingredient tasted and highlighted. They offer a delicious array of salads, (my favorite so far being their crunchy kale with persimmons and dates), to more homey options, like the turkey meatloaf, or the chicken meatball appetizer which is called something else that I can't pronounce.

I have yet to try any of their juices that are sans alcohol, but of the cocktails I have had, I have had to really pace myself. They are so delicious and balanced I could sip them in one swift gulp! The juices used are all fresh squeezed, and you can really tell the difference. There is little or no added sweetness, and all the flavors are nicely balanced. Again, shockingly some of the best cocktails I've had in my city!

I wish I lived in the area so I could grab coffee here in the mornings, as they have a full espresso bar and what look like some damn good pastries. I'll make it over there at some point to try it out.

High five to this place. They flew under my radar for far too long. I will be back here again and again, no doubt.

Worst dining experience in many years.  Yes the place was busy but waiting 90 min for marginal oatmeal is sad.  We watched people around us come and go in that time.  The server was aware but seemed to not be able to do anything about it.  Frankly I was boiling mad but trying to make the best of it.  In the end the manager comp'd us the meal but a breakfast like that is a terrible way to start a day.

Beatrix is consistently good brunch in the loop area. There is something good here for everyone. I highly recommend the green chilli enchiladas and the French toast. My meat eating friends love the steak chimichurri. I have been incredibly happy with most meals here. The only exception so far has been the Caesar salad ( a bit too much dressing despite warning the server staff otherwise)

Book on open table and expect fast service. This place is a go to for me.
One of my favorite brunch sports. All juices can be made "boozy" and it's never a let down. Tip- reservations are worth getting and try to sit by the window on sunny days!

I will definitely come back here. The place was packed and my date was about 30 minutes late between traffic and finding parking. But they still let me sit at a table to wait for her even though other people were waiting.

Service was very nice and knowledgeable. I recommend getting a Bloody Mary - it's got a bit extra punch of celery seed which I love. The menu doesn't have your average brunch/breakfast place items/ But it has healthier options with some Mexican influences. I got the green chile enchiladas stuffed with eggs and poblanos which was amazing. My date got the quinoa cakes w/ poached eggs which was also delicious.

Here is the menu for you to check out: beatrixchicago.com/wp-co…

Enjoy!
Pot roast and egg sandwich was terrific. Latte with honey and cinnamon was great too. Definitely on my short list of breakfast places in Chicago.

We went for an early breakfast on a Saturday and really enjoyed the design and ambience. I'm a fan of Lettuce Entertain You Restaurants, so had high expectations.
The comfortable design and focus on clean food engaged me from the start. They offer both themed coffees and brunch cocktails, which were interesting and fun. I ordered a mimosa, which came I three color options, but the best part was that the juice was fresh.
My husband ordered the eggs Benedict which were nicely done. I ordered an amazing spicy chicken tinga with eggs and couldn't resist finishing all of the large plate.
I will definitely return!

Love.

Beatrix was a fantastic spot for brunch. I've been twice now and have shared the crispy kale salad and the mushroom/quinoa burger. Both are absolutely decadent. The salad is perfectly dressed (don't need to get it on the side!) and the burger is so freakin' delicious. I have had my share of various takes of vegetarian burgers and this one really hit the spot - the combo of  quinoa and mushroom is PERFECT. The burger didn't fall apart and was a hearty dish.

The service was efficient and kind. Not to mention it was packed both times I've been, so I recommend making reservations - especially during the weekends. One of my new favorites in River North.
Amazing food and great service at the bar. It gets a little congested on weekends but it's worth it. One of my favorite brunch spots!!

Divine!  Absolutely blown away by everything!

Beatrix really does go above and beyond in their service and food, which was clearly shown during my dinner on February 13, 2015.  

We had gone around 6:00pm and the ambiance here during the dinner time is much more romantic and intimate than during the brunch.  The lights dimmed low and flickering faux candles at each table makes this lofted restaurant space feel like you and your table are the only people there.  Groups of girlfriends and couples alike surrounded us, and even when the restaurant became really full (around 7:30pm), the noise level never got intolerable where you couldn't hear the person sitting directly next to you.

I had ordered the Chicken Bebe as my main entree and my boyfriend ordered the Prime Burger.  The Chicken Bebe was incredibly flavorful and well crusted.  It's served on a bed of what tasted like a lemon cream sauce, and topped with tender asparagus and baby radish greens.  There's a wedge of lemon on the side to squeeze on top if you'd like, and I highly recommend.  If you've ever had Greek Saganaki cheese (which I love), the chicken crusted in cheese with fresh squeezed lemon had a reminiscent taste of that Saganaki cheese.  

The Prime Burger was ordered with bacon and cheddar cheese on a brioche bun.  I absolutely loved the bite my boyfriend offered to share.  Only a bite though.  He was very stern on that.  It was that good.  The beef patty was perfectly season, the sweet candied bacon against the tangy housemade giardiniera gave the burger a nice crunch.  Umami is a great word to describe the flavors happening in their Prime Burger.

The Dessert is the best part!  I should've mentioned that first.  The Oh My! Caramel Pie is dreamy!!!  If heaven could be described in a forkful, you'd find it in this Caramel Pie.  Shortbread cookie crust... sweet buttery caramel... served with their homemade vanilla bean whip cream.  I would've skipped dinner to have the whole slice to myself.    We also had the Tall, Dark and Handsome Chocolate cake.  It's base is dark, flourless chocolate cake... topped with a chocolate mousse.  A bit more dense than a mousse I think.. sort of an in between and a ganache.  Superb!  The dark chocolate makes this rich dessert not so nauseatingly rich like milk chocolate could.  A perfect bite to cleanse the palate of your dinner.

Great food makes a good restaurant.  What makes a great restaurant is their service, and Beatrix really showcases how they take care of their guests.  You do feel like a guest, rather than any other bar patron.  Our server never rushed us along our meal, or forced the check upon us to get us out of our table.  The manager Steven also made a point to stop by our table and see how our meal was and made excellent recommendations on the dessert.  I thank him for my new vice; the Oh My! Caramel Pie.

Delicious and all around a beautiful meal.  It made my birthday weekend very memorable.

pics.caption: Black Cat Nitro iced coffee. Amazing!!!! Brings coffee up to the next level. Goes rest with their pot roast breakfast sandwich
Chicken Bebe is tender, savory, and the perfect portion.
The Oh my! Caramel pie really makes you say "oh! My!" After the first bite.

review.des: I ate here every single morning I was in Chicago recently. It didn't help that my hotel was attached to it! I even had after dinner drinks at the bar and one afternoon! Really loved the freshness of the food and the reliable breakfast. I wish I had lunch or dinner here but there's always next time!  I will say, the am desserts at the counter looked so amazing but where we got them, it was just ok. It was fresh and not super sweet but still expected more. The juices and coffee drinks are on point. Definitely try this place!

Went here for brunch. Super yummy :) Had the Burger Prime and Cauliflower Grits. However, asked to get the burger medium well done. Ended up getting raw-medium done :( A lot of healthy and modern dishes, would def try out this place for dinner sometime :)

Short ribs were delicious !!  Very flavorful and tender.
Jackie also gave great service which also complements a great meal.

pics.caption: Soy glazed short ribs with broccolini and potato purée with shiitake mushrooms and bacon.

review.des: We made reservations ahead of time so when we got there we got seated right away. The restaurant looks inviting and well decorated with modern music playing in the background. Our server didn't give her name but took our order right way away. As we waited for our food we enjoyed our conversation and not long we got our first dish. Brussel sprouts were unfortunately salty. But my crispy kale salad was great. We also got the crab cake that was not out of the ordinary or special. I had the short rib and it was tender and good. As for dessert we got the caramel pie and the chocolate cake , both were OK since to sweet and nothing to neutralize the sweetness so we had to take some home. The overall experience was average hope that keep improving.

I came here for brunch with my boyfriend and the food was mediocre. The service was good, but our lemon pancakes came out mushy and not fluffy at all. The eggs our way was good (hash browns were nice and salty), but the toast was cold and the butter was flavorless.

The only reason I give it 2 stars instead of 1 is because the juice was fantastic!

All in all, I wish we had just ordered juice and walked over to a differ brunch location.
Wanted everything on the menu. Will be a regular spot for me. Avocado toast and lemon pancakes were a ten. They make a decent michelada too.

First, I have to mention how awesome the name is, it's so unique. As it should be, the interior is just an extension of the uniqueness exemplified by the name.
When you walk in you'll see exposed ceilings, as they are the craze just about everywhere. The kitchen is exposed, which allows you to see the staff artfully execute the food that is being ordered. But mainly, the dining room is of simplistic design with artistic lighting fixtures to give it that contemporary feel.
As for the food, it was as good as you'll expect it to be given the feel of the place. I had a perfectly cooked burger and my girlfriend had a grilled chicken sandwich. The quality of the meats was evident with in every bite. I even noticed the they just lightly season the meat; permitting the taste of the meat to shine though. The dressings and spreads that were added served as a little additive to give the meal extra flavor.
I was delighted to come in for lunch after a busy morning. Though the place was busy itself when we arrived, we were seated quickly and our server provided excellent service. I would recommend sitting by the bar if you can, it looked nice and it seems like they have a good cocktail program in place.

Beatrix expanded to a Streeterville location, but I've always wanted to visit the original location in River North. I came to Beatrix for Saturday brunch, and was pleasantly surprised with the food offerings and service.

Beatrix has a coffee bar, but one can order drinks and pastries from the bar to be served at the table. They have a limited drink menu in print, but the chalkboard above the coffee bar features an extensive list of drinks. On this visit, I ordered the white lightening, which was a house specialty. Smooth espresso, flavored syrup, and topped with chili powder for an added spicy note, this drink was appreciated by all members of my party.

For brunch, Beatrix has a standard menu of sandwiches, omelettes, pancakes, and a daily special and family meal. The family meal is self-service, and they provide you with a plate to fill and re-fill on your own. On this visit, I ordered the family meal of shredded chicken and scrambled egg chilaquiles to share with my friends. Chilaquiles are baked nachos, and the self-service bar included additional tortilla chips, sliced green and red peppers, shredded cheese, two types of salsa, pico de gallo, sour cream, and guacamole. My friends ordered the pot roast breakfast sandwich and steak with chimichurri sauce and they were very satisfied with their entree choices.

I recommend Beatrix for brunch and their coffee bar. We had an excellent experience with optimal food, service, and ambiance.

Horrible service! No stars if possible. Arrived 10 minutes early for our 8:15 reservation and was never sat.  The hostess stand told us we would likely be sat on time with our reservation when we checked in (which is great, obviously no issue).  8:30 rolls around and the manager stops by to ask us the name on the reservation and says we should be seated shortly.  8:45 comes and we are still standing there (5 minutes away from the hostess stand).  At this point we were fed up with the overpriced joint and as I go to tell the hostess stand to pull our reservation he pulls up the computer list which doesn't have our reservation in it.  Mind you when he check us in, he confirmed my phone number from when I made the reservation and confirmed we were there.  

Net, net - long waits, for a meal you may never be served.
We are visiting Chicago for my bachelorette party and had breakfast at Beatrix this morning. Our waiter was AWESOME! Super attentive and helpful. Would absolutely recommend this place to friends!

The food was okay - I had the asparagus and potato hash which was sautéed asparagus, onions and potatoes- nothing special. The rainbow toast was good. What was really bad was the service.  All of our good came before any of our coffee and juice- we actually had to beg for our beverages. The only thing that came fast was the check!

I dined here last night with a girlfriend. I had a $10 gift card (see my review of the Streeterville location) and I've heard good things about the food so wanted to check it out.
We had resos but elected to sit at the bar instead for a more casual vibe. Bartender made some great recommendations on cocktails / wine and we ordered two snacks, a salad and entree to share. Wine was served a bit too warm but otherwise was delicious. He said he'd put in our entree a bit later so we weren't rushed and had some time to enjoy our other bites. Perfect.
Snacks we ordered were the tsukune (chicken meatballs), burrata and crispy kale salad. All were really well done and had lots of flavor.
We ordered another round of drinks and remarked to one another on how our dirty plates were sitting there for quite awhile and we had to ask for water on 3 separate occasions. Not ideal and not expected when you are literally right in front of the bartender. The bar area did fill up quite a bit but it wasn't crazy. Literally over an hour after our snacks came we finally were able to grab the bartenders attention and asked if he ever put in our entree, which he didn't. He said he could have it done on the fly and it would be out quickly but by that point we didn't even want it anymore.
Two trips to Beatrix and two less than stellar experiences. I will say my dining experience wouldn't prevent me from coming back but it's just not the level of service I expect from LEYE.

The lemon pancakes were amazing!  Light and fluffy served with homemade lemon syrup and blackberries.  I only wish I had room to get something from The dessert case ... everything looked incredible.  Go early- they get very busy, but it's Worth the wait.  A bit on the noisy side, but that didn't bother me.

I went here with friends for brunch. I had their Valencia Orange, which was really good. It reminded me of a fresh squeeze OJ. We ordered Spicy Chicken Tinga, Steak Chimichurri & Eggs, and Braised Pot Roast & Egg Sandwich. All of them were flavorful and appetizing. The Chicken Tinga doesn't have a breakfast feel to it, but I did enjoy it.

We finished our food and our waitress did not even offer us any dessert. She just handed us our bill. Also, she would check in here and there, but seem to be nowhere to be found when we actually needed her. We spoke to another staff, who apologized for this.

While waiting, we decided to get coffee. I tried their bulletproof coffee because of how the staff made it sound so inviting. I love drinking coffee and I'm up for different flavors. This coffee is an acquired taste. You could taste the butter as an after taste. I tried so much to like it, but in the end, it's not for me. The butter taste was off-putting and didn't seem to belong in the coffee. We also tried their Oh My Caramel Pie. My friends thought it was good. I thought it was very creamy and sweet. It was okay taste wise.

Overall, I like the atmosphere and vibe. I will probably be back to try other options.
Went here for brunch. Spicy chicken tenga was great and service was great too. It gets busy on weekends so make a reservation

Love love love!!! We were there for Sunday brunch. Great cocktails! Amazing food. Superior service!  Very cool chic decor. Fun vibe. We were seated in the window area that opened to the sidewalk. Great people watching in the River North area. Highly recommend.

Just stopped in for a quick snack and to get out of the cold. The hot coco and cookie was delicious. I sat at the coffee bar and saw some of the other meals the people around were eating and they looked scrumptious as well. Definitely will try a full breakfast next time I am in Chicago.

Pleasantly surprised. Great service this time around. Had the quinoa poached eggs entree (to die for...and healthy!!) and my dining partner had the pot roast egg sandwich (surprisingly affordable at $7.95).

We each had a juice which definitely tasted fresh squeezed. The only downside to the whole meal was that they were out of the cold brew coffee

Great spot for dinner with colleagues. The restaurant is a big open space with great views for every table.

The food is American cuisine made with healthy ingredients. I enjoyed the skirt steak cooked medium served w/garlic cream sauce. For dessert, I recommend the homemade chocolate chip cookies.

Reservations are not required but highly recommended, this place fills up fast. At 6pm on a Wednesday night the wait was already 1.5 hours.

The food was good, well seasoned salmon and salad. The service was attentive and on the mark. The menu is eclectic with a lot of healthy choices as well as a number of juice options. So why the three stars you may  wonder? The restaurant is painfully loud and although the wait staff were thoughtful to try and move us to a quieter spot it was really no better. The noise was distracting and really took the polish off the party.

I swear I tried super duper hard to love this place. The food was just not impressive. The coffee was good, but came with outrageous claims of it being "the only place in the world this is served". Dude, I've found the same exact thing in Boston, DC, and even Indy. Stop it with that nonsense.

This is located in a beautiful hotel and is filled with great design elements. A nice staff. The food and drinks just didn't do it for me, especially with sooo many other options so close by. Everything fell a bit flat.

4.5 our of 5 for brunch.

Pros -
- Fun, lively atmosphere.  Felt very open even with a packed house.
- Has 2 bar tops which makes waiting for your table much more pleasant
- Delicious drinks - we tried the blueberry & super green juices, the spicy bloody with extra olives (one of the best) & good ole' fashioned drip coffee (although they have a wide variety of coffees for the more adventurous types)
- Great brunch entrees at reasonable prices
- Yummy maple bacon (a little sticky but worth it)
- Super friendly service all around - hostess, bartender, manager

Cons -
- Don't take reservations & they're veryyyy popular.  We were told it'd be a 30 - 45 minute wait and we unfortunately were not sat until 1.5 hours later (which the manager profusely apologized for & gave us a complimentary round of drinks).
- Restrooms are a bit of a hike since it's in the hotel lobby

My fiance and I went here during our trip to Chicago two weeks ago and the food plus the service was fantastic! We dined here twice once for lunch and once for dinner both times we had appetizers and desserts... I usually don't order either when dining out. This restaurant is a great choice!

pics.caption: Sorry it was sooo goood i forgot to take a prephoto

review.des: Beatrix is my go-to place for brunch.  I love it.  Today was off though.  We split the chicken tinga and cauliflower grits.  The tinga was bland and not hot from a temperature or spice standpoint.  The cauliflower grits were not the same either - bland and not hot.  Any other time Beatrix is 5 stars.  Today, two at best.  We were in and out in under 30 minutes.  We missed having Sam or Mo at the bar.  They are the best.  I'll definitely be back and I hope this morning was an anomaly.

We ate Saturday brunch here this weekend--the atmosphere was a bit hustle-bustle and noisy, but once we got to our comfortable table, it felt more "energetic" than annoying. Reservations strongly recommended!

Our server was enthusiastic and friendly and made some helpful suggestions. I went with a hazelnut latte to drink and hubby got the recommended "white lightening" latte which has jalapeño and white chocolate (the spice was subtle but gave it an interesting kick--he loved it).

For my meal, I got lemon ricotta pancakes and added a side of chicken sausage. The pancakes were lovely--a soft, almost soufflé-like texture because of the ricotta and nicely balanced between sweet and tart. The chicken sausage patties were very savory with a garlic punch--not actually the best accompaniment for the pancakes specifically, but good by themselves.

Neither of our dishes came with sides and we both added one so our brunch was a bit more expensive than I thought it should have been overall, but we enjoyed the experience.

One minor note--the restaurant is attached/open to the Aloft Hotel lobby next door (which adds to the hustle-bustle) and the only bathrooms are located there. I suggest asking someone where they are as I thought they were fairly hard to find.

Decided to go to Beatriz's on a whim. We were downtown on a random Thursday. My girlfriend got the Ceaser Salad and I the Prime Burger. My burger was average. Fries pretty good, but nothing special. The Ceaser Salad's dressing had globbed to the bottom of the plate leaving the leafy greens bare. She had another side of dressing brought to her. I expected a bit more. I could have gotten the wrong items. I'd give it another try for the other items on the menu. Definitely more of a nicer dining location.

This is one of my fave places to go on a date! It's conveniently located, nicely decorated, well presented, and affordably priced.

I have been here for both brunch and dinner and enjoyed all of my experiences. I am especially a big fan of their burgers. Their drinks are awesome too! The mango nectar is my favorite.

For brunch my favorite thing to order is the steak and eggs. The steak isn't of terribly high quality, but at $16 I guess I shouldn't complain.

I would give the bulletproof coffee a five star rating but the barista who served it was not the most pleasant person. Maybe it was because she was annoyed by the Chicago Marathon... But the coffee made up for it! Would definitely go back for the coffee

Little busy, but worth the wait. Make a reservation for sure. The lemon angel food muffin and chocolate olive oil cake are both to die for! Fun craft whiskey cocktails as well. Easy to grab and go or sit for a Sunday brunch.

My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago. Every experience I've had at Beatrix has been near perfect.

I can highly recommend the blintzes: three delicately pillowed crepe-like pastries filled with a delicious, warm cream cheese filling and topped with blueberries. The fresh-squeezed o.j. is worth every penny. The lemon pancakes are fantastic and the basic egg-toast-hash browns selection is good for standard fare.

As a parent, I appreciate a kid's menu with a reasonable $5.95 price (includes fresh juice!).

For a restaurant in a hotel I went expecting overpriced, meh food and consistently get the exact opposite.

Waitstaff turnaround time is my only critique. Getting a cup of coffee (then sugar, then cream), or a pastry after your meal (actually anything after or any add ons) always seems to take an eternity. Twice now I've just walked up to the bar or pastry stand to get my own stuff after waiting too long.

Hopefully they tighten that up but in the meantime it won't stop be from visiting every time I can.

Came to Beatrix on a Wednesday morning with my daughter for breakfast.
As usual we had the shashouka and the lemon pancakes with coffee.
The hostess as usual was not pleasant but everything else was fantastic!!
The shashouka and lemon pancakes were so delicious!
The waitress, Griselda was very attentive and friendly, a first for us at Beatrix.
This is definitely my go to breakfast place when I'm up in downtown Chicago!

I've given this place to chances now. The first time I went for brunch and the food was tasteless and our waitress was extremely poor. I went there again for dinner recently and the food was very underwhelming although this time our server was pleasant.

No one wants to wake up early on vacation. So not waking up early is exactly what I did. Unfortunately Yolk, the popular local brunch place I was super excited to go to, did not agree with my idea of sleeping in. As a result I had to look up a Plan B and ultimately ended up here at Beatrix. To our dismay we ended up sitting down and realizing that we had missed brunch completely as we stared in confusion at the pricey dinner menu. Beatrix did not disappoint though.

We started off with their hummus appetizer ($7) which came with vegetables and warm naan. This was a great starter, hearty and full of flavor. For our entrée, we shared the three grain and arugula salad with Miller Farm's chicken ($14). We told our waitress we were sharing it and the chefs were nice enough to split it into two separate plates for us. It must've been a huge salad because even after they split it, our plates looked like they were a normal serving size. The salad had freekeh, millet, red quinoa, fennel, and blueberries which added a subtle sweetness to the dish. All the ingredients were fresh and went well together with the house vinaigrette. I'd highly recommend this salad for anyone looking for a healthy dish.

Overall, awesome casual atmosphere. The staff were nice and attentive. I went at an odd time, but I could definitely see this place easily getting filled up on the weekends.

pics.caption: 3 grain and arugula salad with miller farm's chicken

review.des:
Standard staples with a twist.  Excellent pricing on breakfast cocktails that is below $10.  See photo.

Sangrita ($8.95) -- sangria and margarita that is slightly a sweet drink.  Good decent portion that is not overwhelmed by ice.  Black cherry vodka, and juice.  Delish with a slight buzz.

Spicy Chicken Tinga ($8.95) -- a well balanced dish and spice that you get more chicken than carbs.  The portion may be cute and appropriate for price, but you will be deeply satisfied.  Organic avocado, or just perfectly ripen?  It was tasty that I ate the entire fruit and then some.

Buttery Bulletproof ($9) -- a ticker stopper!  (just kidding!). A diet fad in CA.  It has real butter.  Better than affogato.  Coffee and Dessert in one.  *wink*

Coffee -- a haven!  Metropolis and Intelligensia.  2 pour over brands -- Big Shoulder and Bulletproof.

Dessert -- innovative and healthy.  Gotta try Chia Pudding (first in Chicago?, $6?).  Price range is great.  There are also simpler selections at the counter.

Menu -- in addition to regular menu, there are specials in a dish or family style.

Service -- Great!  Sarah is a delightful bartender and server who is uber informative, kind, gracious and knowledgeable.  In totality, every one is nice, happy and helpful.

Venue -- plenty with nicely spaced tables.  Two bar areas allow quick seating.

I have plenty of reasons to come back.  For now, two more dishes to taste plus desserts.

We came here for a girls brunch. Cauliflower grits was so good!!  Brussels sprouts side was perfectly made. Perfect portion.

We had brunch here and the only point of frustration was the service. They were so busy that it took a while (with reservations) to get our table. Even then, he waiter was a bit slow.

The green tea mâcha latte was good. Mimosa was good but way overpriced. Overall I would come back for sure.

Nice outdoor seating.

Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. My sister and I started with the tsukune (think asian style meatballs that are soo flavorful and moist!) then had a bottle of the napa cellars sauvignon blanc. Server was bubbly and well timed. We enjoyed out food. She got the chicken bebe and I had the prime burger. Both were fabulous!! The burger was moist. I had it with the white cheddar and cant stress how good the homemade giardiniera was! (I would have never tried it but my sister made me)
My sister had the chicken bebe. Very light and fresh. Asparagus was great and we ordered extra on the side.

To end we finished with the tall dark and handsome. More like 'talk dark and OMG!' Amazing chocolate cake I cannot stress how great it was. I had to pause while eating it was so good. Think the restaurant scene from 'When Harry met Sally'. Ya.. That good. I'm away for grad school and only come home once every six months. This was wellll worth the trip home!!

pics.caption: Prime burger. AMAZING so moist and flavorful. Home-made giardiniera! Fabulous
Tall dark and handsome. If you've seen the restaurant scene from "when harry met sally" that is how id describe this dessert.

review.des:
I've heard such great things about Beatrix so when my friend said he wanted to go there to kick off Sunday Funday I was down.

Unfortunately, I picked the wrong dish for my first experience at Beatrix. I got the steak chimichurri & eggs ($16) and it wasn't worth $6. The steak was just blah, the eggs were blah, the hash browns were a little too crispy (aka a little burnt) and the toast was dry like the desert.

You may be wondering why I'm giving this place 2 stars instead of 1 if my meal was so bad...well read below my friend.

I did sample the pecan & praline french toast my friend got and it was delicious.

The drinks were good which made up for my blah meal. The pineapple habanero margarita is a must try (multiple times).

Hopefully, the next time I do brunch at Beatrix I'll get a meal that doesn't leave me wishing I had gotta a McGriddle at McDonalds and just ordered drinks here.

I very rarely write unhappy reviews, but this my second bad experience with Beatrix with their front of house staff. This time specifically I ordered a very simple Caesar salad with chicken. After picking up my order and being charged almost $16 for a salad with chicken, I walked back to my office to find that my salad indeed, did not have chicken.

I called to let them know and who I'm guessing was the manager asked if I was sure there wasn't any chicken in my salad. He then proceeded to tell me that next time I come in, to ask for a manager, and that they will double check my order for me.

As someone who has worked in customer service, I don't appreciate being asked to double check something when that's the reason I was calling. $16 for a plain Caesar salad I can get somewhere else is most likely what I'll be doing in the future.

Love Beatrix! We had a reservation made for 7:30pm, but we were not seated until 8:05pm. It was a little frustrating, however the manager came over and apologized numerous times for the inconvenience and provided us with free desserts. He was very personable and made our experience very enjoyable!

I also love all of the fresh fruit juices that had on the menu! I'm pregnant so having lots of fun juices as an option is always a bonus :)

Last night, my friend suggested that we go to Beatrix for coffee and gluten free pastries because I'm gluten free and it's her favorite restaurant for brunch. Yelp said that the restaurant closed at 9pm but Google said that it was open till midnight. Since it was after 10pm, my friend decided to call Beatrix to see if they were still open and if they were serving coffee and pastries. The man who answered the phone said that they stopped serving food at 9pm but that they were still open and he would turn the coffee on for us :).

We were only a couple minutes away from Beatrix and when we got there, we asked the host (Chad, the manager), if they were still serving coffee. He remembered and asked if we had just called; he said that he turned the coffee (Espresso machine) on for us. So nice of him!

My friend also told me about the yummy gluten free pastries that they have there but all of their pastries were put away for the evening. We were hoping that there might be some gluten free pastries left and when we asked Chad, he said, "Let me see what I have." He checked and they had coconut macaroons and double chocolate chip cookies left. I chose the coconut macaroon with a strawberry or raspberry jam center. IT was delicious and satisfied my sweet craving for the evening! I also ordered the Mexican Iced Coffee, which was also excellent. It was so smooth and refreshing. They didn't have cream out, but Chad went and got some for me. My friend got a drink- some type of citrus cocktail with Goji berries in it and she loved it.

Chad came and checked on us and he told us about the gluten free options that they usually serve during the day but that since it was so late, most of the items were gone. A few minutes later though, he came over with 3 different gluten free menus that the restaurant has for breakfast, brunch, and dinner. I was so happy to see all of the great gluten free options that Beatrix has and was so grateful for the wonderful service that Chad provided. He was kind, courteous, and went ABOVE and BEYOND the service that we expected! Thank you Beatrix for your delicious food, drinks, and staff!! We will definitely be back again!! :)
The food was incredible and our server, Emma, was professional, knowledgeable and so sweet. She truly made our experience!

Absolutely love the feel of this place, casual but nice. Went for dinner with a couple of girlfriends. Fun music playing in the background, great food, and great atmosphere. I had the Chicken Bebe and it was to die for! Definitely going back there some time soon.
Everything was absolutely amazing on the menu. We ended up getting a few things including a quinoa burger, enchiladas and some of the juices. All were exquisite.
Fell in here for dinner because we are staying at hotel. Jackie, our server was incredibly good at her job, picked great wine and food. We love her and she should be in charge of everything.

Arrived on a Friday night for dinner. They have a lot of sitting so it was about a 30 minute wait for a table for 3. This was reasonable considering we did not make reservations and the sushi place around the corner said a 3 hr wait. The food selection isn't grand but the options are tasty. My table ordered the salmon and skirt steak along with the kid's turkey meatloaf. Every dish was delicious. This is a great choice for families with children too. They brought the kid's food first (for a 1 yr old) so that we had time to feed them first. The drinks selection is simple but delicious. Would recommend to someone looking for a tasty, medium priced meal.

I stayed at the Aloft while visiting some friends in Chicago. I always stay at the W Lakeshore ( I have no clue why since their service and hotel is not that great) but saw this was $10 cheaper a night and noticed the location was absolutely divine.

I've stayed at the Aloft before, but this is the first Aloft where I have seen an onsite restaurant. After a long morning and flight, I decided to try it out. Very busy but not uncomfortable. We had a seat right by the big open windows which was great. The food? I loved! Tasty, fresh and quickly made. I am surprised. I would come here even if I wasn't staying at the Aloft. The prices were good as well, no upmarket price just for being in a hotel.

This place will make an ideal brunch setting!

Trekked from the suburbs for brunch for a friend's birthday. Our awesome server confirmed our menu choices were on point: Cauliflower grits, Chimichurri steak, Light & Fluffy Pancakes and a french toast that was on the specials menu. Everything was so good! They brought out a special dessert for the bday girl - added bonus on our server bc we didn't mention it. We fully intended to order a specialty drink from the coffee bar on our way out but we were stuffed. This place is loud, crowded, and full of life so if you want a quiet, private place, go somewhere else. For me, we will be back very soon!

Was fortunate enough to be in town for the restaurant week menu. Enjoyed the options that were available particularly the Kung pso brussel sprouts. In fact, the brussel sprouts were the best brussel sprouts of my life, no exaggeration. The portion sizes were perfect: neither two small nor too generous. The cocktails were well formulated and tasty. Our waitress was attentive and professional. The prefix menu was an excellent value and I would definitely consider coming back to this restaurant the next time I am in Chicago.

Amazing chopped salad and friendly bar tender!!  Highly recommend the place. It was a busy lunch crowd so I sat at the bar.  It was extremely fast and I ate every bit of it and took a cookie to go for later.

Pretty average spot to grab lunch. We were hoping to go for brunch, but didn't realize that the brunch menu ended at 11, and it was 11:10, so we had to order off of the lunch menu. It was small, but we both found something to get. we shared the hummus plate which was good and a decent portion. I got the chicken sandwich with arugula and pepper aioli. I liked it, as it was different. My husband got the burger, but it was just ok. Their chips are much better than the fries as well. The only downfall was the pastries. We got an angel food muffin, a brioche tart and a Nutella cookie and they were all pretty bad. We love our sweets, and to not finish them is a big one for us. I'd maybe go back for brunch or to try something else, but definitely not in a rush.

Super yummy breakfast with great service!

We arrived at 750am and the hostess seated us even though the restaurant wasn't technically open yet. The coffee bar and bakery was open to serve patrons arriving before 8am. The person serving behind the coffee bar/bakery also patiently answered all my mother's questions about the baked goods.

Our table server was also super friendly and was very knowledgable about the menu. I ordered the Chicken Tinga which I liked (very fresh tasting, tender chicken and onions in light tomato broth-style sauce served with fresh avocado and corn tortillas) but my sister ordered the cauliflower grits which I loved! The grits were super smooth and well flavored with Parmesan and crispy brussel sprouts (as well as broccoli). Mum ordered the breakfast bun which was crispy on the outside and light and chewy on the inside, sprinkled with citrus and sugar on the outside. She liked it so much she ordered another one to go for the plane ride home!

Would definitely come again for the fresh, home style cooking, great service and comfy decor!

Wow! This place is phenomenal. The Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts were the best Brussels I have ever had. I will be dreaming of these Brussel sprouts for days. I love that most of there options have fresh and healthy ingredients that do not leave you feeling overly full or miserable. The ambiance in the restaurant is very sleek and inviting. It's a great place to sit and catch up with friends over a delicious meal.

pics.caption: Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts and cocktails: Blueberry Tom Collins and Pineapple - Habanero Margarita. The Tom Collins is my favorite!

review.des: This place is amazing! Everything was really fresh and light and we walked out feeling great, which is unusual because most restaurants have you rolling out the door weighed down from heavy food. The meatloaf was amazing and next time I'll grab a cookie from the bakery!

Worst experience EVER, waiter don't even care to note my orders and ending forgetting two of then, cold food he keeps bringing one by one itens that we ordered and with a mad face like it was our fault his lack of professionalism... Really sorry that I decided to took my friend there!!!

I brought a friend here for brunch before a Bears game and ordered the light & fluffy lemon pancakes with a side of brown sugar bacon. The pancakes were exactly as described: wonderful lemon taste and not heavy, so you don't feel too full/bloated. However, the real highlight of the meal was the bacon. I'm not even a huge bacon fan, but this bacon was seasoned perfectly and cooked just right (crispy but not overcooked). I could have ordered five more servings of it!

I was also happy with the fact that they have a variety of mimosas (orange red or blue), but the red mimosa I had was pretty bland and didn't have as much strawberry flavor as I'd prefer. The waitress was also very slow with getting us our check, which was annoying as we were on a schedule to get to the game. Overall though, the atmosphere was nice and the coffee bar/bakery are big pluses. Nothing about this place was mind-blowing, but it's definitely a solid, inexpensive brunch option.

pics.caption: Light & Fluffy Lemon Pancakes with a side of Brown Sugar Bacon (must try the bacon!!)

review.des:
Came here for a Sunday brunch with my girlfriends while we were in town. This place screams Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

Our waiter, Steve Z. (I think) was hilarious and talked way too fast for me and my friends to understand, not gonna lie...he was easy on the eyes, too.

I had quinoa cakes with a poached egg which filled me up real quick. The spiked freddo was to dieeeee for!

I'd definitely come back here and recommend to anyone who is visiting.

I am big fan of this place.  They did right by me and for that I am pleased.

Highly recommend you make a reservation on opentable or otherwise.  We got to the restaurant and had to wade through about 20 people waiting to get a table and this place is pretty big. Make a reservation, trust me on this.

As we sat down it did take a bit to get menus and an even longer time to order.  But, once we got our orders in the food came out very very quickly.  Which was awesome.  

Top that off with the food being very very good.  I got the eggs and hashbrowns which were delicious.  Also, there was an egg white omelette ordered and also enjoyed it.  

This is a decent little spot and I will be sure to come back for a brunch, lunch and/or drink. The bar looked like it could be fun too.

Dear sweet Beatrix, where have you been hiding? I found out about this gem looking through restaurant week menus and boy am I glad I did! My husband and I had a 7pm reservation but ended up getting there an hour early. They sat us right away anyway which was unexpected and very much appreciated. Looking through the selections, we decided to branch off the restaurant week menu and order from their main dinner menu. Since we had dessert plans elsewhere we ended up saving a bit on the bill this way as well so it worked out great.

We started with the hummus and it was fresh and bright. The serve it with a cherry heirloom tomato and onion salad, pita, and a lemon slice. We couldn't eat it fast enough!

My entree is what really won me over though. Fork tender pot roast in a homemade BBQ sauce that was served alongside caramelized pearl onions, shaved Brussels sprouts, and whipped Yukon gold potatoes. People. People!!!! You must get this dinner! It was phenomenal and I savored every last bite.

My husband got the burger which he enjoyed but no where near as much as I did my meal. It's such a cute, trendy place and the staff couldn't be nicer.

We even noticed a pretty impressive coffee bar and multiple delicious looking pastries. They offer fresh squeezed juices as well that you can add a shot of vodka to for a healthier yet still delicious cocktail. They really blew me away here; what a fabulous evening.

Neat atmosphere hipster type vibe.  Food was delicious but small portions and not so small price tag.  Most entrees ranged in the $20-30 range, but the protein portions were small except the pork shank looked big.  I had the tuna crudo appetizer, and it was delicious but not especially memorable.  Brussels sprouts were braised (not crispy) and tasty as long you like kung pao sauce.  My salmon with crispy kale salad was good too, but nothing extraordinary.  BF got the sea bass and it was very good, but the broth was a bit strong for his taste.  The Brunch looks amazing, would definitely return to try that!

This place is phenomenal! The space itself is aesthetically beautiful- wide open windows and hanging plants with a modern vibe. The breakfast was just out of this world. To start, I got the blubbery juice- this had white grape and basil which was very unique and tasty. For food, I got the quinoa cakes and baked eggs. These were so flavorful. I also got a lemon pancake which was also amazing. The cinnamon-honey latte was mediocre- just a little too sweet for me but everything else was so fantastic. If I lived in the area I would definitely be back! The management and staff were also extremely friendly and helpful. Come to NY, Beatrix!

pics.caption: Quinoa cakes and baked eggs, lemon pancake and blue juice- delicious!

review.des:
What a gem in this city! Came here for brunch with my bff and was delightfully surprised by the ambiance and Mexican touch menu. If you are thinking about going to this place make sure you make a reservation! But they take walk-ins too. Be prepared to wait 30-45 min.

I got the quinoa cakes with poached eggs. The overall dish was great but the poached eggs were a little over done but the tomato sauce it came with was perfect a combo.

Also, got the Tsukune chicken meatballs! YOU MUSH ORDER THIS! The sauce and the seasoning for the meatball was amazing. It wished I had 5 more. It was so good I even ate the left over sauce. :)

I didn't like the Sangrita drink. It got worse and worse as I sipped it and left 80% of it. Do not recommend it at all.

pics.caption: Japanese style meatballs. A MUST buy!

review.des: Live close to Beatrix as it is our go to place for a healthy breakfast or lunch. Love the vibe and the food is made with great and healthy ingredients.

All of my friends were talking about this place so I had to try. When I first looked at the menu there wasn't anything that absolutely captured my heart but I didn't want to stick with the safe choice of omelet so I went ahead and got the chicken tinga. At first I was a little worried that it would be too spicy but it was just the right amount of kick and it was just soooo good I don't even know how to explain it. I usually try to be descriptive when I'm doing a yelp review, but I give up on this one. Go try it for yourself! Plus the raspberry toast with cottage cheese was super delicious too, it had a very summery taste, and made me crave some sparkling beverages. Super friendly staff and cute decor as well, and very convenient location. Go try!

Went for brunch today. Ordered the Chicken Tinga and was very impressed. At $10.worth it. Skip the Lemon pancakes. Grossly over rated. 3 pancakes for $12 is $6. too much. Nothing memorable nor magic about some flour, oil, and water with a splash of lemon flavoring. Overall: okay. Really only 2.5 stars. Anything over a 10 minute wait is too long for an average place like Beatrix.

Trendy, fun place to have a drink or dine.
We had 'fruit drinks' at the bar.  These are aptly named as they taste good for a juice drink but didn't seem to have much alcohol.  That was ok with me but my husband thought his margarita was pretty weak.
We had the brussel sprouts and tuna crudo appetizer.  The sprouts were tasty... very garlicky.
The tuna was good but was a small portion.

Two of us had the short ribs and enjoyed those.
One of us had the sea bass.  It was not the best.
I had the cauliflower soup.  It was not especially tasty.

The price was moderate. The service average.

An ok evening.

A hip new restaurant attached to the Aloft hotel. I have been here a few times and have always enjoyed my meals at Beatrix.

Think comfort food with a healthy spin! Casual yet upbeat restaurant that isn't your typical hotel restaurant. Have tried several delicious dishes here including the neatloaf (turkey meatloaf), pork shank and truffle pasta.

The food is usually excellent and all except this visit I felt the truffle pasta was watery and lacked the flavor I experienced before when I had the same entree.

Neatloaf was excellent with kale and mash side. Would order this again.

The service was good though I know this place gets slower when most of the tables are filled.

Overall very good but would like to see more consistency with the dishes.

Sat outside for a perfect brunch experience. We were seated right away and had a friendly waitress.
