I love the quinoa cakes, all of the salads, the braised short rib, burger, and their specials are always fantastic. I have only been here for dinner but I would love to try brunch as well.
Although the wine list is great, I would recommend looking at their fresh squeezed juice concoctions, all with you can "spike" if desired. Save room for a baked goodie from their onsite bakery, you will be glad that you did.

The waitstaff and decor is nice, music was loud for Monday a.m. breakfast, so -1 star. I ordered their honey cinnamon latte without the cinnamon and added an extra shot of expresso and it was perfect. I did not order any of the pastries (which looked like all you could ever want in a pastry) because it's summer...but I did indulge in the Chicken Tinga and it was great. Just remember to order the egg over easy unless you want it all slimy. I gave one star less than 4 because I really disliked their orange mimosa & normally I LOVE mimosas. It tasted like tang - I was then informed it was due to just a small splash of oj. So perhaps order it more balanced.

Feel so lucky to have come to Chicago during "Chefs' Week!"  Had a delicious meal here. Our server, Steve, was great!  Atmosphere was very cool; we got a table next to a window that was open to the sidewalk. We had the potato salad deviled eggs, hummus with naan, enlightened Caesar salad, spring pea soup (), the rigatoni, turkey meatloaf, chia pudding and the caramel pie. Huge portions and everything was yummy!  Definitely recommend!

My first time at Beatrix but definitely won't be  my last! The perfectly prepared food made from high quality, fresh ingredients is only surpassed by the friendly and helpful staff.  Ok...maybe the caramel pie is better than all of that but you still need the excellent servers to bring it to you. Fresh squeezed juice combinations are made more adult by adding the alcohol of your choice.  What could be better?   Oh yeah...the caramel pie! :-) If you haven't been yet, come visit Beatrix and see what I mean. Have I mentioned the caramel pie?

They are good for breakfast brunch lunch and dinner
The food is very tasty
Unique flavours

There's something about Beatrix. Every time I have an out-of-towner, I take them to Beatrix for brunch. I took my best friend from NYC to Beatrix. I took my mom from Seoul to Beatrix. We have group weekend brunches here with friends. My boyfriend and I went to Beatrix for Easter brunch. There's just something about it.

It's always pretty busy and loud, I haven't seen Beatrix less than 60% full, ever. Walking in without a reservation will result in a moderate wait time. If you're like me and wish to avoid that, make a reservation. Opentable makes it simple.

The tables are sufficiently large and fit for big groups. There are smaller tables for smaller groups / couples, too. The place itself is quite large, but they've packed a bunch of tables in that space so you may knock into someone's chair or bag at any given time. Despite the commotion, Beatrix guests are usually pretty happy to be there.

There's a LOT OF SUNLIGHT! My favorite part about Beatrix is on sunny days, they'll open the patio and let natural air and light permeate the room, and I don't know who their brilliant engineer must have been, but the restaurant glows. Coupled with Michael Jackson tracks they often have playing on loop, it becomes a lively atmosphere perfect for weekend brunch. Additional note: they display a huge candid photograph of Jagger (pictured) on one of the walls that I think adds to the ambiance.

In terms of food, I like their quinoa cake, the chimichurri, the prime burger, the hummus. The cocktails with fresh juice is great. I had a blueberry champagne once, that was delicious. For dessert I always get a cup of cappuccino (I think La Colombe supplies their coffee) as a meal-ender, palate-cleanser, etc.

Dinner review only (I hear brunch is good too):

Like the modern artsy decor, the collection of items on their menu is confusing. They try to do everything here and they mostly succeed. It's not a seafood restaurant, but you'll find a peculiar Chili and Chocolate glazed Salmon. It's not a steakhouse, but the richly braised short rib (fashioned in a cube), was flavorful and good. The pricing and portion sizes are acceptable but not exceptional for the River North neighborhood.

pics.caption: Carmelized Pork Shank with Cider Reduction $23

review.des:
5 stars for appetizers, drinks, service and desserts (amazing)! The entrees fell short for me especially for the price, small portions and nothing to write home about but the rest made up for that and now I know what to get when I come back.

My boyfriend and I came here for an indulgent night out.  
We ordered the:
meatballs: almost sweet and sour like in the glaze very good comes in 4 and are on the smaller side
straight A salad: this is an entree but we split it as an appetizer, and it was the perfect size. - DELICIOUS so crisp and fresh tasting.
Short rib: meh
Chicken with asparagus: literally a piece of chicken with asparagus

The best part: DESSERT
Oh my Carmel pie: just get it.. You have to... Goosebumps

Tall dark and handsome: gluten free chocolate cake that is out of this world. My boyfriend doesn't really like chocolate and loved this. I love chocolate and this DOES NOT disappoint.

Peanut butter jelly cookie: the peanut butter cookie is really moist and has a scoop of jelly on top, I feel like it could have been better with a heated cookie and more jelly spread on top.

Dessert coffee: malted freddo it was iced and was the perfect pairing to our desserts!

The service: so attentive and amazing. I ordered a sangria (very good and fresh tasting) and had a slight allergic reaction, it's happened once before to a random red wine. I told the waitress and she and her manager were so accommodating and made sure I was feeling ok. They took down my number so they could check up on me.

I will definitely be back here for apps, drinks and of course dessert!

pics.caption: Tall dark and handsome is absolutely right! So rich and tasty. Don't forget to use some of that homemade whipped cream
Cafe freddo and peanut butter and jelly cookie. Reccommend the drink!

review.des: I had a savory quinoa porridge that was one of the best things i have ever eaten. So delicious!  The service is fantastic at this cute cozy cafe. We loved it!

Great place but recommend a reservation for lunch or brunch on the weekend. It was packed!

Our server (tall guy, blonde hair) was fantastic. We never felt rushed and he was very accommodating and checked on us just enough. We had the egg white omelette and the waffles- each dish was great and so was the chai tea latte from the coffee bar.

Great spot, make a reservation.
Foo always good, service usually good, at times can be longer waits for things but that's primarily due to how packed it always is...

Decided to go back, since it's so close to home AND we like Lettuce.   What a difference a waiter makes!  Went on a weeknight.  We were seated quickly and pleasantly.  Ordered the wild mushroom braise.  Fantastic, hearty and very flavorful.  Hubs had the Chilean sea bass and thought it was the best fish he has eaten!  He even liked the accompanying kale.  Started with the deviled eggs and they are also some of the best in the hood. Service was friendly, un intrusive.  So, Beatrix is back on the list, just in time for winter.   Thankfully!!  It's a short walk.

The food here is just amazing.  The egg white omelette and the Belgian waffles are to die for.  Anything I have tried here has been tasty.  The prices are more than fair, and the staff is nice.  I highly recommend it!

I went for brunch late on a Saturday afternoon and was dismayed to see that they were still full. The restaurant was large, loud, and bustling, and I was the oldest person there by about two decades. It's actually a corner of the lobby of a newish hipster hotel, as you will discover on your way to the restrooms, which are through a curtain and past the check-in desk.

The host stand -- which was hard to find through the crowd of people waiting -- quoted me a 20 minute wait, and then seated me almost immediately. Not sure what to make of that.

Ordered a breakfast enchilada plate, and was initially pleased that it came out of the kitchen really fast. Then I discovered that it was dried out -- can you say precooked from a steam table? At this price range I expect food cooked to order. The flavors, however, were fine.

Coffee refills were hard to get and my cup got empty -- a red flag for me.
Every time I come here, guaranteed great food. Great service, and the smoothies are wonderful.
Amazing food,ambience,service. WE enjoyed our brunch.

Ambiance - very chic and modern without being pretentious.

If I lived in Chicago, I'd be a Beatrix regular. Everything my foodie friend and I ordered was absolute perfection and quite healthy.

I've never seen a semi-upscale, trendy restaurant leverage such healthy ingredients in such a palate pleasing way!

We shared chimichurri steak and the chili chocolate glazed salmon (my absolute favorite). The salmon was paired with a super fresh cabbage, almond, and red pepper slaw, corn tortillas, tomatio salsa and a lime. The flavor combination sounds so simple, but was to die for. I would definitely order it again and again.

For dessert, our waiter recommended either the chia pudding (healthy option) or the caramel pie and offered to exchange one if we didn't like the other - sweet gesture. We ended up deciding on the chia pudding Ansley me tell you - this may be healthy but definitely feels so rich because the chia seeds are soaked in coconut milk. Talk about a power food dessert. I loved it, and my friend and I were so pleased and satisfied when we left.

I've never been to a place that consistently delivers a perfectly prepped, seasoned, and refreshing app, meal, and dessert combination. If you're in Chicago and want a place with healthier, super-satisfying options, come to Beatrix!!

pics.caption: Chia pudding with mango purée, passion fruit and toasted coconut flakes
Hummus - perfectly spiced, moist, also refreshing paired with tomato and cucumber saad.
Potato salad deviled eggs. The sauce and capers make it super refreshing...not your typical recipe. Delish!

review.des: The Honey and Cinnamon latte is amazing and their breakfast is delicious as well as lunch. I have never had dinner here. The decor is cute and the atmosphere is fun. Free wifi so works great for a business meeting or a delicious breakfast while working.

I visited Beatrix with a group of four - two were from out of town.  I had never been to the restaurant before, but we had a restriction in that we had to eat early so my friend and her husband could start their trek back to southern Illinois.

I had heard about the restaurant but had no clue that it was in a hotel!  I quickly learned this as the spot was packed for breakfast on a Sunday!  

We had a reservation, but they wouldn't seat us until the rest of our party was there (and my friend was a tad late...).  I noticed, however, that others were seated without their complete parties, so I was a bit irritated about this.  We had to smoosh in near the bar and it was a bit confusing if we could have a drink at the bar (mimosa, coffee, whatever) or if it was for dining...  

We were finally seated and we ordered.  They were rushing us a bit (granted, it was busy, but it's also a pretty big menu).  We selected some mimosas and mostly brunch items (though I had the burger).  

I would say that the mimosa was very orange juice-y...not a lot of sparkling.  Probably ok for 10:30 am, but not necessarily for the price.

My burger was good, but a big greasy.  The sausage I tried, however, was amazing and based upon the way the lemon pancakes were gobbled up, I assume those were good, too.  I just think it was sort of ranging from really good to just ok.  I thought portions also ranged - some of the breakfast sandwiches were huge, but the other orders weren't very large.  Coffee was quite good, however.

All in all, we had a fun time.  The atmosphere was bustling - almost too bustling (I can't imagine it during lunch on a Saturday!).  Service was ok, but they did rush us and forgot some items during the course of the meal.  Food was pretty good, but not overwhelmingly so.  In thinking about if I would come back...I'm not sure... Perhaps if I were downtown, but I don't think I'd purposely go there from somewhere outside of the city.

Beatrix. One of my favorite names - I think of a girl, pretty as an English rose, fresh as a dew drop - and with that in mind, I was expecting my tastebuds to be delicately seduced by their brunch menu, which based on a quick perusal prior to arrival, looked banging - thus, I was especially saddened when Ms. B let me down in the flavor dept, becoming of somewhat of a "40-footer", if you catch my drift - beautiful from afar, but bedraggled upon further inspection.

Went on the Saturday of Lolapalooza, so it was packed full of 20-somethings in short overalls, crop tops, and those peasanty headbands that are Coachella chic - so I don't have a real sense of the crowd - but I think it's generally pretty city-hip. Pearl, my darling grandmother, at 86, was the oldest person there by a solid 45y and we had to kind of shout at each other to be heard above the excited chatter of the concert goers.

Menu features things such as "quinoa cakes w poached eggs", a DIY chilaquiles bar (aka, brunch nachos), a peach praline french toast, and ten-grain oatmeal - all of which sounded bougie enough for my heart to pitter-patter with delight - but everything was solidly underwhelming, with the exception of the coffee, Intelligensia, always an excellent caffeination choice.

My egg white omelette w avocado/heirloom salsa and a side of baked salmon was flavorless at best, with the dry salmon only edible with a copious amnt of hot sauce - and the quinoa cakes (red/white quinoa bound w parm) was no more tasty, though slightly redeemed by the bright tomato sauce on which they sat. The cripsy kale salad w papaya, dates, pumpkin seeds, and parm looked great but was small for the price...not to mention not remotely filling for $10 - the side of hummus was a bright point, served w fluffy pita and more of the heirloom/avo salad - but was it worth $7? No.

Overall, brunch for three with coffee and a fancy juice (kale, romaine, pineapple, mint, celery blended for $6) was a bit over $60 + tip, which was more than I think the quality warrants. As it stands, Beatrix needs a trip to rehab before she's ready for her close up.

Came in for brunch and although it was very busy, service was prompt and courteous. We tried an omelette, blueberry pancakes and tomato and cheese sandwich and everything was very flavorful. They have quite a menu here, with lots of choices for vegetarians and non alike. Also lots of decadent or healthy choices, your pick!They serve smoothies and fresh made juices and
also have a selection of pastries on offer and all looked delicious and very tempting.
We stuck with simple choices but I will definitely be back to sample a pastry and a healthy juice.

The menu is extensive and the bartender was so nice and offered several recommendations for our day in Chicago in the River North and Near North area.

We each had a local beer.  I can't wait to go back and try the breakfast or lunch.  

If the service we received is any indication of the food, I'll definitely be back upon my next visit in the area.

The atmosphere inside is very cute and looks updated.  Can't wait to try it!

We've dined here several times over the past year when staying at the hotel and I've rarely been disappointed. The food is hearty and fairly diverse for a small menu, and the dessert and drinks finish an evening well. I enjoy the Tall Dark and Handsome chocolate cake and also (but not alongside - I'm hearing a chocolate cake and grapefruit Cosby sketch in my head) a habanero margarita. Ask for a standard rather than a pineapple with a touch of the spicy bitters.

The neatloaf with kale is a nice healthier option and their steak with chimichurri has always been a great end to a day.

But beyond all of this is the pastry case. You have to see it to appreciate it but it will blow you away. The cookies, too, do not disappoint.

Minus 1 star for an often sparse staff in reaching dining tables, leading to a longer dining and service experience. Never had an issue in the bar area, however. Sit on the edge near the windows when it's warm enough to enjoy outside air!

The wife surprised me with a trip here.  The dining room was really lively, I enjoyed the atmosphere. Since it was brunch we got some lattes.  They have a few nice flavor combinations. Honey and cinnamon was one banana and dark chocolate was the other.  They even put those designs in the foam I always see.  

As far as the food my wife got these light and fluffy pancakes.  They were pretty amazing. Stuffed with ricotta cheese they were nothing like the dry bland pancakes I've gotten at some breakfast places.  I ordered the chilaquile bar.  I've never seen this before and I love chilaquiles. They give you a plate and you fill it up with these slightly soft tortilla chips in salsa and eggs with shredded chicken.  Then you add guac Salas sour cream and cheese.  Boom, best chilaquile I've had in a while.  I kinda regret not getting the caramel pie but I might need to walk in a get a slice sometime.

We had a delicious meal during restaurant week. I particularly enjoyed the oh my caramel pie. The food was all very enjoyable and our server was friendly. Our table, however, was very uncomfortable. It was inches away from the kitchen and so loud that it was hard to have a conversation. It was busy and crowded with the restaurant staff buzzing past our table. With out a spot for our coats or purses we had to hold them on our laps when there wasn't really room for two people and plates at our table to begin with. We had a reservation. Next time I would request a table besides the two top that is practically in the kitchen. Other than that our meal was great.

Me and a friend went May 22nd, to Beatrix. Long story short: amazing and unique food, AWFUL service. I do recommend going to Beatrix, just not this one! The service was adequate until we got our food. Once we finished, we spent an extra hour at the restaurant trying to get only a box and the check! Me and my friend are typically patient when it comes to restaurants since I used to waitress, but it took literally an half hour to get a box for our food. For some reason, our waiter completely disappeared on us. We had to ask someone else, who was working the bar to get us a box. He came out immediately with the box. That wasn't what ruined our experience. When we received our boxes, we asked for our checks (2 separate ones) but said we had no idea where our waiter went. The guy literally went, "well, I don't know what you guys had." When I work, we often try to find the waiter because he has the order. It was a simple order, we both had a burger and juice. He seemed really ticked off having to create a check for us, which I would be too if my co-worker went MIA and I suddenly had to take on a new table! He gave us our check and we sat down at the table, and reviewed our order and paid. Now the guy that was behind the table was taking order from tables around us. We waited another 30 minutes for the guy to at least grab the checks! We had to go up to him ourselves and tell him we were ready! When he was done ringing us up, he came over and slammed our checks down and the pen! Literally, no apology or anything about our old server or the long wait! I never tip below 20% because, again, having wait-staff experience, the tip is important. I had to tip 10% for the awful service, and seeing that whoever would get the tip barely helped us.

My daughter & I had a late night Salad here
Recently while staying @ the Hyatt Place around the corner, we Both Loved our Salads & the service was top notch . I really appreciated that we weren't pressured into ordering more food then we had an appetite for since it was late @ night !! The Layout & Design is Spectacular & there is also outdoor dining !! It was very ALIVE with a full house but no wait , the menu was limited which put me off a bit , but I heard the Brunch is suppose to be Outstanding

Everything I had was great, brunch especially so. The restaurant has a very cool vibe both inside and out. Have not stopped in for drinks yet, but the bar is calling my name for just such an occasion.

ate here ahead of the Tedeschi Trucks Band show at the Chicago Theater.  Had the salmon on slaw.  One of the best dishes i have ever had.  Pricey, River North.  We opted for the $15 per bottle BYOB.  Terrible espresso.  Nice place--LEYE precision. Fantastic Chocolate cake for desert.  3stars is A-OK

Friendly bartender! Only went in for a nightcap but the cocktail was crafted to perfection with blueberry and gin. Definitely worth a try!

Favorite part was the variety of seating options. Give me vintage leather furniture any day :)

Brunch, enough said.

I wrote a review that it was good not great.  Well, I have been to their brunch many times now and love it.  The atmosphere is nice, the boozy-brunch options are on point, and the portions are great.

Easily has vaulted into my top-5 brunch places in the city.  Which I will say my list of spots is better than anyones!

Girl night and Bday celebration here on a Thursday night. Delicious, farm to table freshness and everything was absolutely delightful. From the chocolate salmon, to the turkey meatloaf (which was my favorite!), to the pork rib. Really good food! I can't wait to try Beatrix for brunch with my sweetie!

This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite spaces to catch up with friends, for dinner or breakfast. With a variety of items on the menu that appeals to any sized appetite, dietary restriction, or budget concern, it's a contemporary American restaurant that feels upscale, without hurting one's wallet.

Service has always been on point, and waiting at the bar is something I enjoy when there's a crowd since the bartenders make good drinks and know both their bourbons and wines. The last time I was here, I used a LEYE gift card that had some restrictions and we had a little bit of money left on it, but since it was a one-time use card, I couldn't use it again. The manager gave my friend and I banana bread and a huge pastry in light of the gift card's restrictions. It was a really nice gesture! I'll be back.

A few of my favorite things to order:
-farm chicken
-halibut
-blueberry Tom Collins
-spicy chicken Tinga
-turkey burger

pics.caption: Turkey Burger comes with kale salad. Delicious!

review.des:
Came strictly for desserts/coffee.

They serve Intelligentsia and Metropolis coffee blends, and their recent addition is La Colombe in pour over. I undoubtedly went for the La Colombe, as I've enjoyed their coffee in the past. Unfortunately, the blend they carry is an ultra dark roast,  with a dirt-like taste (wouldn't be surprised if It's a French roast).

Spiced chai latte: pretty good, and semi-sweet.

Dessert:
pecan praline brittle: 5
Chocolate chunk (massive) cookie: 5

Large, open space. Clean. Perfectly sized, and comfortably spaced seating. We grabbed seats at the bar (best seats!), and soaked in all the energy and life from Beatrix.

Beatrix opens the entire front half of their restaurant in the summer so it's like sitting on a lanai instead of indoors. The aesthetics of this place are so pleasing, they have plants throughout, hanging ferns, and large dark brown leather couches at some tables mixed with cushioned chairs. It's classy, definitely has that California feel to it, and they top it off with creative food offerings and great service.

Hubby and I sat in one of the couches together and kicked back and chatted while waiting for our food to come out. I had a fresh-made strawberry watermelon cooler, hubby had the blackberry and lychee lemonade. For our app we had hummus with naan. For my entree I had the turkey and sweet potato "neatloaf" with veggie gravy and kale cooked in this wonderful tasting broth and spiced perfectly. My meal tasted fantastic and was very healthy, also. I love restaurants that can make healthy food that tastes amazing. Beatrix nailed it on this one.

Ambiance, aesthetics, service, drinks, and food were all superb. This was a five star experience.

I came here in a party of 8, right as Beatrix opened on the Saturday after Black Friday 2014.

A friend found Beatrix on Yelp! and we were perhaps 15 minutes early to their opening hours. Someone opened the doors for us and told us that their brunch service wouldn't be open for an hour, but that we were welcome to warm up and have a coffee. Complimentary pastries found their way to our table. Already, the service was excellent.

Eventually, about an hour after Beatrix opened, we were hungry and began to order. Most of us ordered mimosas, and their three mimosas they were offering were absolutely fantastic. Fresh squeezed valencia orange juice, strawberry juice, and blueberry juice combined with basil were the three juice options to be combined with their champagne. All three were absolutely fantastic and delicious (and they didn't skimp on the champagne).

Our server/waitress was very friendly and didn't seem bothered to talk to a somewhat buzzed to almost drunk party of eight. She was very knowledgeable about the menu, providing her personal recommendations and giving opinions on other dishes when asked. She also took a group photo for us.

I personally ordered their lemon pancakes. I don't recall the exact name of the dish but the result were these heavenly, light, mild pancakes that were filling yet not heavy in the stomach. Fresh candied lemon rind, lemon syrup, and fresh blackberries alongside, it was a wonderful breakfast after hours of walking around Chicago for Black Friday.

The atmosphere is very modern, yet rustic, and lends well to any situation. It can be a romantic setting for couples, a friendly setting for families, and a quiet respite for anyone who needs a cup of excellent coffee and their newspaper. I don't normally make my way to Chicago for food, but I will definitely return here and must recommend it to anyone in the area. Gluten free options, vegan options, so on and so forth. Inexpensive and well sized portions, as well as a full bar round out this excellent dining spot in River North.

I read all the reviews and it lived up to the hype! We loved it!! Really unusual and creative brunch entrees. My mom and I both had the cauliflower grits and it was an amazing dish! And the sugared bacon was to die for. They were very helpful about gluten free options and had lots of gluten free baked goods too. We took a bunch of baked goods home. Our server, Brady, was exceptional. Would highly recommend. Can't wait to go back!

Came here for Brunch one rainy Saturday. Made reservations ahead of time because this place is happening during that time. Loved the decor and ambience of this place. Nice fireplace, you would never know this was inside a hotel. Ordered some basic cesar salad with chicken and it had good anchovy flavor, without the actual anchovy. The lemon pancakes are very light and delishes, perfect as a dessert. Service was wonderfully attentive even though the waitress was being trained. Would come back here any day.

Tinga? What's a 'tinga'? Hm, I think it's burrito-like. Noo, maybe like a stew? We debated this for quite a while and the mystery surrounding the answer made it so appealing that half of our party ordered it for brunch yesterday. I can officially tell you that a tinga is a Mexican dish with shredded chicken steeped in a red sauce, sometimes with vegetables (thanks Google!). And if you know me well enough, you know I love anything with a Mexican flare. Sadly, Beatrix's Spicy Chicken Tinga was a let down.

I was actually super excited to try Beatrix. One of my friends claims that it's her favorite brunch spot in the city and she's never tried anything she didn't like. Therefore, I knew I couldn't go wrong, or at least I thought not. We started with drinks - my friend and I each tried one of their fresh-squeezed juices. We ordered the Blue Boost and the Cherry Chia Cooler juices. Both of them were amazing. The Blue Boost was really unique and I would definitely try to recreate it at home. The Cherry Chia Cooler was also really good, but a little on the sweeter side. However, I will say that I think that they are awfully overpriced. Almost $7 for a small serving of juice? That's almost the price of an entree. Seriously tho - my entree was about $9 so the juice is pretty pricey in comparison.

The food itself is pretty average - nothing I would rave about, but nothing awful either. Just fine. The Spicy Chicken Tinga wasn't all that spicy at all and lacked flavor. Other people have also mentioned that the portions are pretty big, but I didn't feel that way at the end of the meal. I was sufficiently full, but not stuffed or overly full. We all seemed to feel fine about our selections - Quinoa Cakes & Poached Eggs and a gluten free sandwich on the brunch menu - but our sentences regarding the food would probably end with periods. Sadly no exclamation marks! However, I can't wait to recreate the Blue Boost juice at home!

Great location, interior decor, and very good bakery/coffee bar.

Have had brunch here 3 times now, and wasn't wowed any of the times by the food itself.

Beatrix gives each table a bottle of water so guests can pour water for themselves during the meal. The last time we were here - a friend noticed a speck on the top of his water in his glass. He thought maybe it was a small bug or something but when he fished it out, it was a small shard of glass. We let our server know there was glass in our water - she looked confused and then grabbed his glass and our bottle of water for the table and replaced it without saying much else.

I was really disappointed in her response - I believe that finding a shard of glass is a BIG deal. It was just a coincidence that he noticed the shard before he drank the water - he could've easily ingested it instead.

It is fully possible the shard just broke off from the bottle being clanked against other bottles or something accidental/explained. But again, was just disappointed from the lack of concern and follow-up.

After my review, I was contacted by the manager and assured that the practice I detailed in my prior review was an aberration.  Not only have they confirmed that it was an isolated incident, but the manager has assured that the staff have now been "trained" that unilaterally "rounding up the bill" is not acceptable (at least, not at Beatrix!).  

Happy to give this place the 5 stars I think it deserves!!

As some of the previous comments have mentioned, make a reservation. I booked a reservation for dinner and it was the way to go. Just to get it out of the way: the food is good for the price. Not great, not mind-blowing, but good. What makes this place worth-while is the overall dining experience. The waiting staff was very friendly and the alcohol selection had something for everyone. The fresh and modern dining area makes this a great place to take out friends or a date ;)

I visited Beatrix this weekend for an impromptu brunch and was delightfully surprised by my dish- Cauliflower Grits. It was hearty and flavorful. Exactly what I wanted. My friend ordered the Poke bowl and thoroughly enjoyed her meal too. I would definitely come back!
The food was fresh, flavorful, and healthy. Restaurant had a nice ambience. Loved the Cauliflower Apple soup and Straight A salad ( I added steak and it was perfect--tender, flavorful!)

I'm more and more impressed with this place every time I come here. One reviewer said it was more like a Denny's? I guess it's social media so terribly unqualified people can say what ever they want. But...Squash/ Apple soup with toasted sunflower seeds was fab. Great burger... Great bakery. I stay in the aloft hotel that's attached and it's a great amenity to have a place like this in the hotel. The problem is there are so many great restaurants in the area. Give this one a try.

pics.caption: This brisket breakfast sandwich is the best I've ever had.

review.des:
Had breakfast & a quick lunch snack here.
It's located right at the hotel we were staying at so it made things so convenient!
Very home-y ambiance.

SHAKSHOUKA 3/5
Bf ordered this, one of the healthier choices to start off the day. It was yummy - especially the pouched eggs, but when I compared it to what I ordered (below), I liked mine a lot better :)

A WONDERFUL EGG WHITE OMELET 4/5
The name definitely suits the egg white omelet.. It was so soft & fluffy!! SO GOOD! I'm a big fan of avocados and they've added plenty to my meal :) Would definitely order this again.

SIDES: Chicken sausage 3/5

LUNCH - SNACK

AHI TUNA CRUDO, seven flavour chili 3/5
So much avocado was mixed with the tuna - very fresh. Paired this with sparkling wine & mango, pineapple nectar. Great for a quick bite!

Staying in River North neighborhood, concierge recommended this right around the corner. Twenty minute wait on a chilly Wednesday evening in May. Service was superb, food even better. I had potato and escarole
ravioli, companion had Be be chicken. Both plates totally cleaned. Love this place, wish  I lived closer.

Urgh. Had high expectations given the really nice ambiance and stellar yelp reviews, but the food really let us down.

Everything tasted deep fried and dripping with grease. We ordered the kennet fries, the crispy kale salad and the poached egg pasta. I get the fries are you know, fried- but this just had grease coating everything. Even my kale salad was coated with olive oil- the crispy part being that the kale seemed to be deep fried.

Walked out feeling like we weighed ten pounds heavier.

On the plus side, our waitress was the sweetest nicest creature ever, and the two juices we got (blueberry basil smash and acai pomegranate boost) were delicious. So was then citrusy lemon aioli that came with the fries.

Don't go here for lunch if you want a lighter healthier meal. Maybe breakfast though, since that's what most people seem to like...

Breakfast in Chicago w/my gal pal.

Started off with Bloody Mary's then our breakfast arrived: Spicy Chicken Tinga & Eggs our Way w/sausage

I rarely go back and raise my rating but after my 4th visit to Beatrix I just had to. I love this place! We went today for lunch and everything was perfect.  I had the special of the crab cake with corn salsa and salad.  It was flavorful and light. Perfect summertime lunch! My partner had the pot roast sandwich. He declared the best sandwich he's ever had.  It was filling though so it's not on the lighter side. Our server, Anthony, was super and spot on with everything. We ended our meal with a couple of cafe freddos and a slice of the caramel pie.

Beatrix surprised me on my first visit and each visit afterwards, they just get better. That is a sign of a great restaurant and why this is one of my favorite places.
I recently went here for brunch. Really good food and friendly staff. This is a new favorite for me.

Great spot for dinner in River North! We came here for dinner on Friday night. We had a reservation and we were seated as soon as we arrived. Everything we ordered was great! Pork shank was so good the meat was falling off the bone. The special Korean Bbq chicken was good but a little too dry to my taste but the quinoa salad was delish. Caramel pie was absolutely heavenly! Great dinner spot overall, would love to try it for brunch.

I'm a big fan of their healthy options, and they have a variety of items I've really liked. Usually I go for one of their signature salads, but anything on the menu is great! Their drinks are super delicious and always very fresh. The brussels sprouts are also amazing and are definitely worth a try!
1st time in many brunches that we were so disappointed.  The food was cold and bland.  The service was so so.  Very disappointed.

Came here on a busy Saturday night around 8pm. There was a wait for a table for 2 (didn't make reservations) but we were able to get seats at the bar (full service with food) without a problem. Our bartender was great, giving helpful recommendations on the menu and making some fancy cocktails.

We shared several of the appetizers and small plates. Everything was really tasty. Shared the chocolate cake which was delicious. Prices are what you'd expect.  The atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for on a cool late summer night.The windows are open giving it an airy, European feel. Trendy vibe, somewhat of a middle age crowd.
Soooooo good! The quinoa cakes are amazing. The potato ravioli with whit truffle to die for. Yummy!
Great dinner, good selection. Healthy options as well which is great! Delicious gluten free baked good options. The tomato soup, and chicken Bebe were amazing. Excellent service.

Beatrix is a unique place and was a delight to eat at.  It's firstly an LEYE business and sort of a trendy cafe house that also has two full bars in sight.  It's also housed with the Aloft Hotel in the vibrant River North area, and we've always had surprising good luck finding metered street parking for $4/hour around here.  We had dinner here and enjoyed their potato salad deviled eggs, their krispy kale salad, and their delicious and massive pork shank.  Our server confirmed to us that we did well and picked her two favorite dishes in the kale salad and pork shank (this seems to be said routinely to us by servers, but it was the real deal this time).  The tastes for all dishes really were top notch.  Examples were the peach sauce accompanying the pork shank and the heart shaped celery and capers that came with the deviled eggs, and made that a delightfully refreshing starter.  We were also treated to a birthday dessert of their chocolate mousse cake, which was on the slightly over sweet side but still quite good overall.  We plan on coming back to try brunch sometime.

pics.caption: Pork shank, about half done here!

review.des:
Went here over the weekend for dinner with some girlfriends. We had a reservation, explicitly asking for a sofa seat, but we were not given one originally. Once we were seated in a sofa table by the kitchen we kept experiencing a fishy smell, so we asked to move again, yea we're those girls.

Decor, pretty and simple, with a good atmosphere. 7/10

Anyways onto the food.
We ordered the Burrata appetizer to start, which was good- but not great. It was supposed to be served with crispy leeks, figs, and marcona almonds, but there wasn't a lot of that on the plate. If you were fortunate to get some of that it really brought the burrata to the next level. Sad oversight. Also they only give you 4 crackers for a huge piece of burrata, like it just doesn't make sense. 6/10

Shared the burger and the special of the day which was Zucchini Pappardelle.

Burger: Good, juicy and well seasoned. Fries were crispy, but slightly bland (thank God for ketchup). Homemade giardiniera, lacked acid and spice. 7/10

Zucchini Pappardelle: Meh- I've made a ton of zucchini "pastas" and I wasn't impressed with this rendition. I like that the Zucchini still had bite, but overall flavoring was lacking. Just light sprinkled with Parmesan, this was something that was too simple and too $$, which made it disappointing. 5/10

Chia Pudding: RICH RICH RICH. This was a treat, full of Chia Seed texture, sweet and slight tart due to the pomegranate sauce (wish there was more). 8/10

Gluten Free Macaroon: Not my taste, WAYYY too sweet but others enjoyed  3/10

Pineapple Habanero Margarita: Tasty, could use more heat 8/10

Service was attentive, but kind of impatient. I also included my Lettuce Entertain You card # but she didn't add it, so I didn't get points. What's the point of having the line on the check if you're not going to add it?

Overall it was ok, their menu is a little all over which gives you variety, but also makes it a little more difficult to order. I would possibly go back to try their brunch, but other than that I'll pass.

I've been to Beatrix several times, across different meals (brunch, breakfast, and dinner) and have never had an experience as poor as I did today.

We were prompted to wait 90 minutes, yes 90, for a table for four. The hostess(es) were incredibly cold and unaccommodating. The service continued to lag, as after we were seated, it took an age for our waiter to comeby, ask us about our drink preferences... and then it's like he disappeared and totally forgot to take our meal order.

I went for the egg white omlette with turkey bacon and ricotta raspberry toast. Both of which were good... but we didn't leave Beatrix until 3:30. Needless to say, this was the longest brunch of my life... and ridiculously unsatisfying.

SUPER

Room Service Quick and Easy! Faster than any room service I have ever received ANYWHERE!

Friendly!
Efficient
CHEAP
LIKE How are they making money CHEAP.

SUPER SUPER Breakfast Sandwich with plenty of TOMATO (the most under appreciated breakfast component in the USA.

YUMMM

Thank you.
Please I am not sure if this place is local, chain, franchise etc - LOVE.

I've ate here for both dinner and a quick coffee/dessert on the go before.  Their coffee drinks are very rich and good, as are their desserts.  For dinner, I like that they have a lot of seasonal offerings on their menu.  I really enjoyed the Pot Roast Ragu.  It was spaghetti squash in a ragu sauce with pot roast. This was a really good combination with a lot of flavor.  As far as the service here, the staff always seems friendly and helpful.

Went for dinner. Do NOT order alcoholic drinks. You will not get any in the drink. When speaking with the manager, it was shared that the "concept" is to experience the taste of the juices and he asked if we ordered a double shot (and pay the extra $6 on top of the $11 drink). Right. Then it was shared that Beatrix is best known for brunch. Oh okay. Burger was great. Service was something to be desired.

I had been to Beatrix once before for dinner, and found it so-so, but feel that they do breakfast much better. In addition to a delicious pastry case, I really enjoyed the cauliflower and grits dish I had - cheesy, vegetable-y, with nice runny yolks mixed in. Nice work!

Good brunch, for both the food and the drink. The waiting line for weekend brunch is wait of too long thus we agreed to sit the bar area. The quinoa cakes are tasty and creative.

The bartender is nice and knowledgable. After we finished our brunch, he said he would like to give us a surprise! It's delicious pumpkin pie!! What a good day!

Don't know what the hype is about. Went for brunch and waited over 40 min for a table. Tried the Steak Chimichurri & Eggs and the burger. Everything tasted mediocre. Got some pastries to-go and nothing was surprisingly good. Won't come back.

Beatrix is a nice spot with a fine-dining ambiance, mid-priced options and great drinks.  My good friend raved about the lunch, and I was eager to try for dinner based on her review especially after seeing it on the Michelin Bib Gourmand this year.

The restaurant's philosophy of taste over trend and healthy ingredients is very admirable in theory.  You don't find too many places that offer fresh juice blends that can be mixed with liquor.  However, this time I opted for the current seasonal Black Cherry Sangria - the alcoholic content seems low, but very delicious and enjoyable.  

The Tsukune was our appetitzer, and I didn't think that the bite-sized meatballs had much meat flavor, but the chili cilantro sauce gave them a nice finish.  Spaghetti squash is novel to me, and I like the taste and texture of it with the Pot Roast in the Ragu dish.  I would have thought it was perfect if not for being slightly too salty.  I was also able to get a taste of the Chicken Bebe and Cassarecce Pasta from my friends - chicken was very tender with a flavorful cream sauce, but thought the pasta was lacking.  Finally, the Caramel Pie was too sweet for my preference, but is sure to satisfy your sweet tooth.  Based on Yelp's rating system, I'm between 3-4 stars.  Open to trying Beatrix again for brunch/lunch.

Place was great for a light brunch -- really well prepared dishes that aren't too heavy.  We came here whenvisiting from out of town, and it was exactly what we were looking for.  We got the oatmeal, the quiche and the vegetarian quinoa/poached egg cakes and all were superb.  They also make a pretty decent Bloody Mary at the bar -- Grey Goose Citron vodka!

Price point is probably considered a little pricey, but it's not bad at all if you're used to SF/NY prices.  The ambiance is upscale/casual, so I guess that's what you're paying for.

The wait wasn't too bad (15-20 minutes), but it was strange how they had so many unseated tables but there was still a wait.  Service was really attentive once we were seated -- almost too attentive.  Seems like they can also accommodate large groups if you call to reserve in advance.

I wish I could come again to try their baked goods -- their cookies and baked goods look pretty ridiculous tasty!

pics.caption: Spicy Bloody Mary -- they use Citron Grey Goose Vodka!
Oatmeal with dried fruit, almonds and brown sugar.

review.des:
This place might be my new go-to! I had been wanting to go here since I saw it open, it looks great! I didn't know it was an LEYE until recently, but that made me even more excited to try it. I made a reservation on Open Table for my girlfriends and myself after work during the week. We had requested to sit outside and they were so nice to even call and let us know if it was nice, they would seat us out there. We did end up sitting on the patio, which is cute, but the restaurant is really nice inside as well. Super cool design.

We started with the deviled eggs and the kennebec fries which were awesome! The sauce that came with the fries was really good. The kale salad was nice and fresh and so was the tomato gazpacho. Really refreshing! For dinner we tried the cauliflower milanese, which was really unique and delish! My favorite dish was the poached farm egg and truffled pasta, I mean, you can't go wrong with a poached egg on anything! We also had the pork shank which was super tender and sweet. For dessert we tried the caramel pie which was really good.

I just loved the atmosphere, the menu (great variety) and I don't mind that it may be a bit healthier than your usually fare:) I definitely ill be back, hopefully for brunch! Oh and as far as service goes, top notch as all my LEYE experiences typically are!

Came in for Saturday brunch, busy spot but no wait for a table which was nice. It's connected to a hotel, but definitely doesn't seem like a hotel restaurant.  Cool trendy atmosphere.

The brunch menu is pretty varied, most of the options are fairly unique and they don't really have any normal standbys, so probably not the place if you are looking for a standard brunch. That being said, a lot of the dishes sounded really good and we had a hard time choosing which is always a good sign. I went with the spicy chicken tikka at the recommendation of the waiter. It was kind of a spicy tomato broth with shredded chicken served with eggs and avocado on top with tortillas on the side to make tacos. It was definitely tasty, but kind of felt a bit more like dinner rather than breakfast food. My friend had the quinoa cakes and he really liked them, they were kind of a take on an eggs Benedict.  Overall good place for brunch if you're in the area.

I took my mother and her best friend here for my mother's birthday.  The music was fairly loud.  It's definitely a place for a younger, hip crowd.  
We ordered:
- butternut squash soup: good, on the sweet side. You can order naan with it.
- kale salad:  wish it had my crispy kale pieces.  This is a light salad.  It was good.
- pot roast ragu with spaghetti squash:  was a good substitute for pasta.  I could taste the butter.
- prime burgers:  my mom devoured hers and love it.  Fries were pretty good too.

They were very nice and comped her a delicious chocolate cake for her birthday. Overall it was a good experience!

pics.caption: Crispy kale salad, could use more crispiness

review.des:
Wine Bar
Coffee Bar
Bakery
Casual/Upscale Restaurant

For a River North establishment, the prices are not too bad. Fresh juices with the options to spike were very nice. Love the outdoor open feel of the space and random couches used as seating. It's very ecletic and laid back perfect for any occasion from grabbing a quick bite to a long sit down dinner.

Bottom line:  The service is impecable and a great choice for the al fresco feel without worrying about inclement bad weather, very true for Chicago. Definitely come here for the beautiful garden-like, relaxed ambiance.

Beatrix is one of those places that has a great vibe - it's chic and trendy without being pretentious. The waitstaff is attentive without being pushy. And the menu has that something-for-everyone feel.  I actually enjoyed the appetizers - the tsukune (chicken meatball) and hummus platter - slightly more than the main courses (the zucchini pappardelle really felt like a plate of zucchini swimming in tomato sauce when I was expecting zucchini plus pasta).  If you're veggie-centered, it's a better bet to get the escarole and potato ravioli.  The chicken bebe is as decadent as it sounds, and worth sampling.

Service was great, ambiance and atmosphere was lovely. I ordered the Egg White Omelet and it was good but unfortunately no omelet. All the ingredients were on the side. Additionally the "avocado" mentioned in the description seemed to be 1 piece the size of the dime.
I would never say the food was bad, but in no means was it good. I'm sorry to say I would not come back here for brunch.

We loved the atmosphere and were welcomed in a very friendly manner when we walked in.

However, we waited 10 minutes before our server, Erika, greeted us to bring water, she made zero conversation and checked on us maybe three times the entire meal. Didn't even know her name until we read it on the receipt.

Besides our server, we absolutely loved the food and the rest of the staff there! The crunchy kale salad was super tasty, and we loved trading bites of our chicken entrees! We will definitely be back.

A group of 7 came for drinks only.  The wine selection was OK.  I was able to order a few bottles of Cabernet Sauvignon. The prices were decent. The service was ok.  I was glad they had a nice corner table setup very quickly to accommodate a large group. It was pretty loud in the place.  I really enjoyed the decor; but that's more of the A-loft design and not specifically the restaurant.
Cool place and ambiance, great location, poor service.  Morning host needs to improve his demeanor.

Beatrix is a nice restaurant connected to the Aloft Chicago City Center Hotel.  Parking can be a challenge but street parking is possible and we were lucky to get a spot right in front.  The tempo of the Beatrix is hipster by my definition and they have many very healthy offerings.  We were there for breakfast,  The service was great, we were seated in a very timely and our waiter was friendly and did a good job explaining the menu.  We had the Shakshouka which has spicy tomato sauce, poached eggs, kale, feta, warm naan for $10.95 and Quinoa Cakes w/ Poached Eggs tomato-basil sauce, poached egg mayo, window herbs for $12.95 and several orders of Eggs Your Way with golden hash browns, whole grain toast, choice of brown sugar bacon or our chicken sausage.  The breakfast entrees were all very good and the service was excellent.  I would recommend Beatrix as a good place for Breakfast in Chicago.

One of my favorite things about this place is the uniqueness of all the dishes and their ability to add healthy proteins and vegetables into breakfast staples. We are avid brunch-ers and do things a little differently in order to get the best/well rounded experience of each restaurant...we both got the iced Mexican Coffee to start and ordered the Light and Fluffy Lemon Pancakes to share.  Light and fluffy they were indeed. They had a great flavor, not too much lemon, and blended well with the fresh blackberries. The lemon syrup could of been a little thicker but other than that they were very good.  For our main dishes I ordered the Cauliflower Grits and Fried Egg and my husband ordered the Green Chili Enchiladas with a side of the hash browns...again, we shared.  Both dishes were great portions and had great flavors.  I am not one to usually order grits in any situation but I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor of the cauliflower and the texture. It also had Brussel sprouts which added to the dish and added some veggies to start the day (which is a win-win).  As for the Enchiladas, that was the dish of the day. It had a really unique spice to them with eggs, peppers, kale and two different types of cheeses topped with sour cream...delicious!  Our only feedback is the ends were a little over cooked causing it to be inedible for that part but we still devoured them. Overall the food would get four stars and we will definitely be back.

The final star for this review would go to our server and the overall customer experience.  To start, I was aware that we were next on the list and saw a table for two open right by the open windows. Having worked in the industry before as a server, I was reluctant to bother the already busy hostess but I requested to be seated in that spot and she kindly made a note for us to be seated there and we did, which greatly added to our first experience.  Next, our server Alyssa was the sweetest and again, made the experience very memorable. She recommended the lemon pancakes to us, which we do not regret, she was very accepting of our weird brunch style (ordering an appetizer for brunch...we know, it's weird but makes it epic) and the food came out quick and with a smile.  She checked up on us consistently and even chatted with us a bit as I am 7 months pregnant and my husband was wearing a "Baby Daddy" shirt...she gave us many compliments and even ended our stay with 2 free treats from the bakery.  Regardless of those treats, we will definitely be back and we look forward to sharing/indulging in the treats later with family. I highly recommend this place and look forward to being back! #thebrunchchronicles

pics.caption: Green Chili Enchiladas, side of hashbrowns, and the Cauliflower Grits and Fried Egg

review.des: Beatrix is my husband and my FAVORITE place to go downtown. Everything on their menu is amazing- we love the "Straight A Salad" with Salmon on top, the Warm Pot Roast Sandwich for lunch, and the Slow-Braised Short Rib Farrotto. But our absolute favorite was their Oh My Caramel Pie... everytime we're in town, we always make a second (or third) final trip on our way out of town to pick up a few extra slices to take back to Michigan with us. Last summer, we brought an Igloo and filled it with ice just so we could drive slices back with us. Last night, I made my cab driver stop by so I could bring two slices back to Michigan before catching a flight back... almost missed my flight, but SO worth it!

It is the restaurant that is part of the Aloft hotel.  While I am sometimes wary of hotel restaurants, Beatrix is a good option and likely will make another appearance in my brunch rotation.  It was busy on Saturday at 10:30 and I am glad that I had made a reservation for our group of 4.  The hostess stand appeared to be unorganized and there wasn't a lot of place to stand out of the way.  We were seated about 10 minutes after our arrival.

They offer a lot of fresh juices and you can make them all into cocktail.  The mimosa was excellent and my dining companions seemed to love their drinks too. Service was pretty good. Our waitress was friendly and helpful in offering recommendations.  She checked on us without it being too much too.

The food was also good.  Beatrix has healthy options but also had options that didn't scream "health" food so it pleased all of my dining companions. I ordered the belgian waffles which were delicious and we split a side of bacon that was very yummy.  I also had a bit of the chicken tinga with guajillo chili, an amazing broth and sunny eggs.

It came to about $25 per person with a tip which is pretty good. Overall, Beatrix was a solid brunch spot.  I am intrigued to go back again for brunch or dinner.

I absolutely love this place! Everything on the menu is phenomenal and the staff is always friends and nice. Ask to sit by the window...nice view of the city and people walking by.

Favorite dishes:
Crispy Kale Salad
Warm Quinoa Cakes
Mushroom and Quinoia Burger
Straight A Salad

***i usually get a side of salmon with my salad which is SO good***

So, I received a LEYE certificate to use at any of the restaurants. I received this message below:

Hi Joe,

I'm happy to hear you received the Beatrix certificates. The Lettuce Entertain You certificates are generated separately, but you should see them arrive sometime soon. For your reference, the company wide certificates can be used at Brasserie Jo in Boston, or at any of our restaurants in Vegas, California, Chicago, etc.

Thanks,

The Beatrix Team

I just went to Brasserie Jo in Boston, called ahead to make sure they accepted the certificate, went in, racked up a bill, then the manager came over to tell me they are not part of LEYE and do not accept this. I asked him to check, he went and made a phone call, and said they do not accept it and apologized. Then he said "you should call ahead to make sure [maggianos] accepts it", after he told me they were part of the business.

ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS. It's not about the money, it's about the principle of the situation. Beyond frustrating that I have this certificate that I don't plan on using since this place chooses to serve food nearly an hour after the order, overcooked, and with foreign objects in it.

This is probably one of the friendlier, warmest & modern (decor) places for breakfast. They had a large variety of foods (gluten free menu) & little things that make them stand out. Fresh ketchup if that's your speed. Fresh squeezed juices. Real maple syrup. And special requests were met with a smile & no problem...w/o an up charge . Verity of coffee option (lattes etc..,)Food was served fast & hot. My mom was with me & she loved it too.
Delicious! Multiple gluten free options for dinner. Wide variety of fresh baked gluten free pastries everyday. Will definitely return. Easy walk from Chicago's Magnificent Mile.

This place is always packed for bunch and yet they always manage to get us in within 15 minutes of our reservation.  Consistently good food, juices and cocktails.....and I love the atmosphere.  Our server today was extra friendly and knew the menu well.  I have a food allergy (which always makes eating out challenging), but I've never had any issues at this restaurant.  Glad to hear a Beatrix is opening up in the West Loop in the future.

Loved my girls' brunch here last weekend! They seem to cater to those who are interested in healthier foods, and I think that's great!

I ordered the quinoa cakes and the green juice and was SUPER pleased with both.  I was expecting a type of pancake when it came to the quinoa cakes, but they turned out to be fritter-like patties and were really filling and flavorful.  The green juice was really fresh and make me feel healthy and light. Yummy.

The only knock I have on this place is that it's a liiiiiitle pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for!

We came here for a last little brunch on our Chicago trip. It was pretty crowded, and we didn't have a reservation. We luckily were able to get a seat within about 10 minutes, which was awesome. It seemed like it was going to be a great meal. Got to the table, and our waitress seemed friendly. She recommended the Blueberry Collins, which was fruity and refreshing. I felt like she purposely neglected our table, because she constantly checked up on the tables that were around us. I wanted hot sauce, so of course I had to grab her attention myself (would have been proper if she checked up on us at least once during the meal). I had the spicy chicken tinga, which tasted good, but nobody does chicken tinga better than Felipe's in NOLA (seriously come visit New Orleans for some delicious tinga!). I honestly regretted making this my last stop in Chicago due to the service. I had a much better breakfast experience at Yolk days prior!

pics.caption: simple eggs, bacon, and hash browns & spicy chicken tinga (I'd rate the spice level at medium)

review.des:
Warning: This review could be slightly inflated because the special of the day was an AYCE chilaquiles bar.

This review is for brunch only.  Beatrix is a cute location to visit for brunch in the area and you don't have to pay ridiculous hotel restaurant/River North prices. Reservations are definitely recommended, else they'll stick you right by the kitchen where your view is of the expediter finishing the garnish on your plate.

Besides the chilaquiles we also got the lemon pancakes and the typical breakfast platter of eggs/hash browns/toast and instead of bacon/sausage you can substitute salmon for an extra $2. Good deal.  Everything's just a tad on the oily side.  The lemon pancakes were a tad too wet, but had nice lemon flavor.

Our server was very sweet. I would come back to try dinner.

Big fan!!   **dinner review**

Friend made resos here.  Not sure why but my impression prior to going was "meh".  Trendy, smallish plates places have seriously sprung up like rabbits.  There are a handful of other places I thought I'd rather try first.   Well.  I was wrong.  This understated, gem of a place is fantastic.  

Did I mention they take resos??  Yessss.

Food:  A
1. Quinoa Cakes: A
Not my cup of tea, but they were delicious & great texture
2. Straight A Salad: B
Solid greens & taste.  Nothing to write home about, but exactly what I'm looking for when wanting to add a lil greens before the main deal.  Tasty & light.  (Shared w/ table)
3. Skirt Steak Chimichurri: A
So... I originally wanted the slow braised pork.  They were sold out?!  I begrudgingly got the steak.  Ohhh God was shining kindly upon me.  B/c it was AMAZING.  Perfectly cooked (medium rare), strong, wonderful flavor.  Fries were crispy.  
4. Caramel Pie: A
Coerced by all the other yelp reviewers.  Ohhhh twist my arm!  Not usually a fan of pie, but love caramel  Really captured the caramel.  If you like caramel, this is a must try.  

Other people got:
They would prob rate higher (I'd prob not order the below)  So, grain of salt.  =)
5. Turkey Neatloaf: B
6. Egg & Truffle Pasta: B

Drinks: B+  (p.s. I don't drink sweet) =)
1. Carrot, apple & Ginger juice + Rye whiskey, served up w/ extra ginger juice.  A.  
2. Vodka Martini w Twist: A  (hey!  I'm picky about this one & they did gooood)
3. Blueberry Tom Collins: B  Too sweet, but my GF's loved it.

Atmos/Service:
Walked in & was a little put off (kind of reminded me of juicer or corner bakery).  I.e. looked more like a lunch spot than a dinner one.  But the rest of the area was nice. Connected to a hotel, which actually added to a cool vibe. Wouldn't bring a 1st date here though.  Was the first to arrive, so bee-lined it to the bar.  Bartender was great!  Patiently explained the drinks (you can add booze to freshly squeezed juices) & let me try a few.  Always wondered why more bars didn't pick up on that sooner (boozicing).   Service was good.  

Summary: The dinner food is really, really solid.  The price point is amazing for the quality of food.  If I lived closer, this would become part of my regular rotation.  Needless to say, I'll be back.  

Their motto: "Taste over trend".    Sold!

pics.caption: Beatrix: Straight A Salad: B - Great salad to share as a starter!

review.des:
Took my out of town visitors here for brunch the other day and we all loved it!

The interior was very nice and cozy-- mismatched chairs and even a couch at one of the tables. Very rustic feel.

Our server was so pleasant and friendly. We ordered the shashouka, egg white scrambler, and the quinoa cakes. My favorite was the quinoa cakes-- a healthy take on eggs Benedict with quinoa cakes instead of an english muffin. DELISH.

The shashouka was second-- poached eggs in a tomato sauce with kale and naan. I didn't care much for the egg white scrambler, but then again it wasn't my pick.

Would definitely recommend to others for breakfast/brunch.

I barely know where to begin on the greatness that is Beatrix!

While visiting Chicago for a wedding, I ate both dinner and breakfast here :)  

We had made a reservation for 8 for dinner on our first night in town. Our table was ready when we got there and set up beautifully. Our waitress was great at helping us decide and knowing when to pop by and check on us. We ordered appetizers, entrees and desserts to share. We started with the deviled eggs and quinoa cakes which were both excellent and left me wishing we had ordered double of both! For my main course, I ordered the chicken dish, which crazily enough came with a side of kale that was the best I have ever had (weird I know but it was seriously delicious) I wish I could replicate it at home! The sauce on the chicken was great and the mashed potatoes were perfect for soaking it up. For dessert we ordered the Carmel Pie and the Tall Dark and Handsome Chocolate cake! OH MY GOODNESS, both were incredible!

The next morning we popped by for a cup of the nitro pumpkin spice coffee (AMAZING) and the dark chocolate dipped angel food muffin. This was a light and delicious way to start the day!

Do yourself a favor and get here asap!

I came here for a solo brunch and was able to get a seat at the bar right away. It was busy but had a very welcoming atmosphere. The bartender was very nice and attentive. My food was delicious, I had the breakfast sandwich, and I can't wait to go back to try other things. My Bloody Mary was one of the best I've ever had. I asked for it spicy and it was PERFECT! I highly recommend for brunch.

Everytime someone asks for a "nice dinner spot" recommendation, I consistently point them toward Beatrix.  From the ambiance, the food, the cocktails, to the service, this place is on point.

I'm a sucker for the Straight A Salad, which is an enormous portion of all thing "A"--arugula, avocado, almonds, Asian pears, and asiago cheese.  Absolutely to die for.  I've also had the burger which is incredible, as are the appetizers I've tried: the hummus plate in particular is simple yet tasty and creative.

I've never ever had poor service at Beatrix--you can always count on some insightful recommendations from them as far as new things to try and they're so honest, too.  Nothing bugs me more than when a server simply says "it's all good!" because, well, I want to know WHAT is good.  It's a well-oiled machine at Beatrix and really sets the bar high for the type of service I expect when I dine out.

Went here for brunch and had a great experience.  Menu was great with options.  Bulletproof coffee and fresh juices are a must.  Food was hot and served in great portions.  Wait staff was great and very attentive.

Lovely place for breakfast/brunch.

Went here with co-workers for breakfast. It is a great place with excellent service and good food. They have a great bakery upfront - which even had gluten free options, which was great because one of my friends tried almost all of their gluten free options and raved about it. The food off the breakfast menu was delicious as well. My only quibble would be that it is a bit pricier for the amount of food they serve - compared to the zillion other brunch places in Chicago.

I met a friend for brunch at Beatrix on the first Sunny Spring day we had a couple weeks back. We were striking out every other place that had outdoor seating and decided to check this spot out. The first thing we noticed when we walked in was the delicious looking bakery. We had previously stopped at Firecakes to fuel our one block walk here, so we passed on the sweets.

The brunch was just okay, but maybe we should have ordered something else more exciting. We both had the Prime Burger on whole grain toast with aged white cheddar cheese. The burger didn't really have a flavor to it or maybe it was a lack of seasoning. I also thought the fries it came with weren't that great. Although I always compare any fry I have to the truffle fries at Rockit...so there already going up against some tough competition. We also tried the Ginger snap fresh squeezed juice which was Carrots, Apple, and Ginger. I thought it was quite tasty and not too sweet.

This place seems to have gotten decent ratings so I plan to revisit it and explore a different food option and to try out the bakery.

A co-worker recommended this place as I had a friend visiting from out of town.  The food was definitely healthy as my co-worked mentioned.  We started with a hummus plate which was tasty.  Oh, and their cucumber and mint soda was pretty refreshing.

I had their burger here which was pretty amazing.  One of the best burgers I've tasted so far.  Definitely want to go back to try their other menu items.

Accidentally served an entree that was different from what I ordered, through an honest mistake.

Server offered anything and everything to make it right, but it wasn't that big of a deal and I was in the middle of a business lunch, so I politely declined. At the end of the meal, the server brings us free desert to-go as an apology, anyway. And...that turkey burger ended up being the best burger I've had an an incredibly long time.

Loving Beatrix!

I had such a delicious slightly to the left meal which I really really enjoyed tonight!

Went here for an early dinner tonight and I was feeling a little adventurous so I started with the pineapple habanero margarita.... I had no idea what to expect, but it was really nice and smooth with the sweetness of pineapple (and a slice on top) with just a hint of spice. A big hit!

We then shared the chicken meatballs with chili and cilantro sauce. They were pretty tasty, but there was only 4 small meatballs for $7... so I probably wouldn't get them again.

Now to the home run entrée. wowweeee, I'm glad I was on an adventurous streak... and what's more adventurous than the chocolate & chili glazed salmon?! It was so well cooked, and who would have thought that chocolate on salmon would taste so nice. It was not sweet at all, justa good flavour and worked so well with the chilli (on the side - of course for me, it could always be hotter) and then a really great  almond and radish slaw which was great with the lime juice to cut through the chocolate. It also comes with corn tortillas. SO YUMMY. I definitely got the star meal, the BF got the roasted chicken which he said was good, but it wasn't a huge dish and he was still a bit hungry after.

The only reason this place wasn't a 5 star (for my meal anyways) was because it was a pretty empty so was lacking a little in atmosphere... not really their fault given it was snowing outside and was early dinner on a Sunday night. I really did like the set up of the place and ambience, and I feel like I need to come here for a long boozy lunch with the ladies. Maybe once I do this they'll get bumped up to a 5 star (also it wouldn't hurt to have some cider on the drinks menu, as well as some more reasonable red wine options, the cheapest was $9 and the most expensive $18 a glass!!)

I'm looking forward to coming back here soon!

Tried out this spot based on a recommendation. My lunch here was pretty great! The atmosphere is like a classy coffeehouse, and their menu focuses on real, healthy food with flavor.

I tried the quinoa and mushroom burger with sriracha aioli. The burger mix could have had a bit more flavor, but the aioli was delicious! I dipped my fries in it too.

The place seemed pretty busy for lunch at 2pm on a Tuesday. The staff was quite friendly, but it took a while for our water to be refilled.

I would try this place again and order one of the salads next time!

One a quest to try somewhere new and to kill time before birthday dinner reservations, we came across Beatrix for some pre-dinner drinks.  The vibe is cool, the staff was friendly, and the dinner menu looked intriguing.

The drink menu was limited and, unfortunately, so was the alcohol.  The SOs whiskey sour was less than impressive and my pineapple-habanero margarita was minimal habanero, way too much pineapple.  I was looking for some caliente and this left a cold taste on my palette.  No bueno.

And on a side note, what was up with the super obnoxious patron sitting at the bar hootin' and hollerin' all up in everyone's grill?  The bar was not that crowded and screaming was certainly not necessary.  Didn't your mama ever talk to you about 6 inch voices?  SERIOUS BUZZKILL.  Maybe he distracted the bartender from pouring strong drinks for us?

Came here with the hubby sometime last week. New to both of us, and menu liked good. I wasn't really hungry so I just hung out with him and he had the pork shank entree. I couldn't resist tasting it when he told me how good it was and omg was it amazing. Huge portion with a great sauce, peaches and potatoes. Service was good too- quick, helpful and very friendly. Place was PACKED on a weekday! We had to sit at the bar, which we don't mind at all. But if that's not for you I recommend a reservation. We'll definitely be back!

pics.caption: Salmon rubbed with a chocolate chili mole sauce

review.des:
I just love this place! I had dinner here several months ago and recently returned for brunch.

I tried the Power Greens juice and A Wonderful Egg White Omelet. Both were fantastic - I finished the entire plate which is extremely rare for me!

They have a great selection to choose from and I can't imagine that you could go wrong with any of their dishes.

Highly recommended!

pics.caption: Brunch: Power Greens juice and A Wonderful Egg White Omelet - both recommended!

review.des:
It's a Lettuce Entertain You place. Yay, because I love getting my points. There is somewhat of a "very good" commonality among most of their member restaurants, but something almost always amiss. I had steak and eggs and a something or other very green, very healthy and very delicious juice. The steak was good, although the chimichurri wasn't spicy at all where I felt it should be. The hash browns were a bit greasy, but I was happy with the juice so it made up for everything that wasn't quite where I wanted.
Overall it's a fun place to come with friends with an energetic atmosphere. Not a place for an intimate and romantic date, but a great place to socialize.
Definitely going back to try some other things.

PS. The avocado toast is totally overrated. Needs a sprinkle of garlic instead of the chili (and this is coming from a person who loves spicy)

I came here for lunch last week with 3 coworkers and we had a great experience.  The restaurant was packed for lunch and I can see why...the food was incredible!  The salad selection was extensive and they ALL sounded good.  I ended up with the superfood salad with peaches and green beans - seriously one of the best salads I have eaten in years!  My coworkers were equally as pleased with their selections too...superfood salad, kale salad and the caesar salad.  We shared a caramel pie and man, was it ever good!  Sharing was definitely the right choice as the pie was super sweet, but definitely worth the calories.  

The staff was very friendly and the decor was modern and reminded me of an NYC stylish restaurant.  

Definitely worth trying when in Chicago!

I have been here twice for brunch and I truly think this place is Amazing!
The place itself its cozy, the waitresses are very friendly and provide an excellent service.
The food is fantastic!!! Everything I have tried have made it into my brunch favorites. I totally recommend the white egg omelette which is not only healthy but flavorful.
The coffee selection is also great. I usually like dark coffee but I tried some of their coffee varieties and it did not disappoint.
You can actually enjoy the coffees and pastries without dinning there.

Came in for the first time on Saturday and liked it so much came back on Monday. Really enjoyed the squash and apple soup. It was unusual for me as it was lighter and less heavy than other squash soups that I have had. Tried it both nights!
Would also recommend the pot roast with spaghetti squash noodles. Squash was cooked perfectly and the dish is spiced nicely with a bit of heat that I really enjoyed.
The waiter recommended a caramel pie for dessert that he indicated was an award winner in Chicago and I can see why. Just the right amount of sweet and a very light texture.
Here in Chicago for a few more days so I might be back again!

I've been to Beatrix before for dinner, but never for brunch. So when challenged to figure out a place to meet an out-of-town friend on a Sunday for an early brunch (read meeting for brunch at 9:00 a.m. on a Sunday). Beatrix was one of the only "good" brunch places open that early. I ordered the green chili enchiladas. They were good, but the really good part was the green salsa they were covered with. The salsa was full of flavor! In fact, so much that I ordered multiple extra sides of the salsa once my entree was served, which the server graciously accommodated. The enchiladas themselves, were good but didn't have a lot of flavor without the salsa.

FYI: The server asked if I wanted a side in addition to the enchiladas, so I felt like I needed to order something because it may be small. But if you aren't starving, you definitely don't need a side because just the enchiladas are more than enough.

We had a late dinner and it was packed! Our server was attentive. The food was fresh and delicious. I loved their hummus and the deviled eggs were memorable. It was an affordable meal for what we had. I would like to come back to try other plates. I did think the sangria was a bit too sweet for my taste though.

Pepper and egg white sandwich was fantastic and very satisfying. I also had a side of the brown sugar bacon (all the heart eyes!). The honey cinnamon latte was my drink of choice, and I wish I would have ordered a second to go for my train ride home.  We will definitely stop here again as there was a lot more on the menu that we'd like to try. Great location, too!

Came here for a Sunday brunch with my ladies. The wait was about 30 minutes so I decided to grab a coffee while I waited. Well, I wanted a coffee until I saw the Cinnamon Maple Matcha Latte and I was like "Excuse me? What. YES." It's as interesting and flavorful as it sounds. And surprisingly not too sweet.

I ordered the cauliflower grits and eggs, which was so perfection. I'm from the South so I am a grit snob. These grits were legit--no seasoning needed. Absolutely perfect. My friend loved her quinoa cakes with poached eggs and tomato puree. So flavorful. We also ordered the Light & Fluffy Lemon Pancakes for sharesies. "Y'all! They are called light and fluffy and they are! So light and fluffy!"-real quote from my friend. So moist and light. The cartelized lemon zest and tart blackberries paired perfectly.

Would've loved to have grabbed a pastry on the way out--the Oatmeal Butterscotch cookie looked incredible--but we were stuffed!
