My only complaint would be how cramped it felt waiting for a table. The wait time can be lengthy, and there were only a few chairs. But hey, they are slammed for a good reason!

Finally, I made it to Beatrix.  Its been on my short list for awhile.

Anyway, I really like the space.  What a cutesy little breakfast, brunch, lunch, linner, or dinner place!

A LEYE addition to RN...shocking, I know.  Haha

easy opentable reservations!  

what a variety of freshly squeezed juices!

lots of "healthier" options.  we had two salads and both were fantastic.  i will say that my 3-grain w arugula and chicken was a little small for $13.50, BUT what do you expect with a LEYE, in RN, attached to a hotel?  exactly...just what i got.

caramel pie was amazing...there goes the "light and healthy" lunch option...sigh

service was good.  the chick was super knowledgeable about the food options on the menu and the daily special.  cheers to that!

overall, great lunch spot in the area...and it was bumping at 1pm on a tuesday so take advantage and do the easy peasy online reservations :)

First let me say the menu is delish!! My brother was visiting from out of town and knowing his style, I knew this would be a great fit so he, myself and another friend went. They started with a sangria and I started with a cocktail that was their spin on a Moscow Mule which had basil seeds (i know, different right) and was absolutely refreshing.

I ordered the "neat loaf" (turkey meatloaf) that was stuffed with yams and kale. It was GOOD however i noticed it was kind of cool. Wanting to get the most out of my meal, I asked our server Emily to nuke it for a sec and she took it right away. The manager later returned with a new entree, offered his apologies and explained that they would be comping my meal. Totally surprised but I toally appreciated it. From my plate to my brothers fish and my friends tacos, everything was good!! Just GOOD FOOD!!!

They sent us home with cupcakes, another peace offering :) I will definitely be back because I have my eyes on that caramel pie lol...  

Thank you for Emily and Michael for an excellent dining experience!

Came here for my first dinner in Chicago and I was not disappointed in the least. The waiters were extremely kind and had wonderful energetic personalities. The ambiance was very visually classy, yet comfortably casual.

I ordered the acai & pomegranate blast to start, which was a very strong, sour, almost vinegary shot of raw fruitiness. Loved the taste, and it was most appetizing.

My entree was the turkey neatloaf - which I thought was a really creative name - which was seasoned splendidly. All of the neatloaf, kale, and mashed potatoes I had were juicy and savory. It was very filling and it left me satisfied. My friend ordered the arugula salad with chicken, which I sampled and found to be very delicious as well.

The thing that knocked it out of the park was definitely the desert: the most popular caramel pie, which I can understand why. It was as if you took a pumpkin pie and replaced it with creamy, almost cloud-like caramel filling. Definitely the best thing I had all night.

Overall, I very much enjoyed the service, atmosphere, and food. I am very impressed and delighted. I would definitely come again if I visit Chicago again in the future.

I love the ambiance of this place. We went to have brunch, their lemon ricotta pancakes are awesome! I have also had their green chili enchiladas which are awesome. I highly recommend the place for any meal.

Boy!  Was I wrong about this place!  Somehow I had it in my mind that this was a coffee shop in the A Loft hotel.  Well at least I got the location right- it is attached to the A Loft hotel.  But that was where any thing I had in my minds eye ended.

We went for dinner on a Friday night.  Make a reservation as this place was hopping!  Not a seat in the place but I was able to find a seat at one of the two bars to sit and have some wine while I waited on my friend.

The ambiance is a bit crazy- mis matched ceiling fixtures, a hodge podge of tables and chairs, tables seemingly stuck in wherever they could find room . . .and all the while you kind of feel that you are sitting in the lobby of a hotel (um, you are, kinda)

Our server, John, was great!  If I could paint a picture of a perfect server it would be him!  He was friendly, knowledgeable, quick and went out of his way to make sure that we had a wonderful evening.  He even validated my parking and took the ticket out to the valet for my convenience!    He was so nice I felt like he would have driven me home if I had asked him to!

All kidding aside- the food was what surprised me the most here.  Sure- my thinking had been partially right- they do serve a breakfast menu- but also a lunch, brunch, dinner and gluten free menu as well.

We started by splitting the "Straight A" salad- arugula, asiago, avocado, Asian pear and almond all served up with a light dressing.  Large enough to split as a first course and delicious!  This is a must have!

We also had the ahi crudo served with fennel and something else that gave it just the right amount of kick.  This is a smallish portion, probably not the best thing to split.

And then on to the entrees.  I asked our server what his favorite thing on the menu was and he didn't hesitate for a second to suggest the chili and chocolate glazed salmon.  And let me tell you that this was amazing!  It is served with small corn tortillas, and an almond coleslaw that when combined, make a wonderful flavor explosion in your mouth.  It was so seriously good that I ate everything on my plate!

My friend had the skirt steak- and while good- it was clear that the winner at our table was the salmon.

The other thing that was nice was that if you are tying to eat "gluten free" as I am right now- there are plenty of delicious things (including the chocolate cake) that are gluten free.  I love when a restaurant makes things easy and tasty.  But given this is a Lettuce Entertain You venue- they are pretty consistent in doing things the right way.

If you drive-remember to get your parking validated as it is $14 with validation, $22 without.  Definitely worth the effort to ask if it is not offered up.  

Dinner for two ran just a little over $100 including appetizers, entree,and dessert.

If there is a lesson for me to be learned from all of this is not to go with first impressions.  For if my friend hadn't pushed to go here- I'd still be thinking this was a coffee shop in a hotel.  Trust me  . .it's far from that!

This was the first restaurant my roommate and I visited when we moved to Chicago, on Easter Sunday 2014 for brunch... So it will always hold a special place in my heart. We (unknowingly at the time) actually dined next to Pat Quinn while he was governor and were wondering why people kept coming up to this man to shake his hand or take photos. Anyway, we finally returned last night and brought along my boyfriend after a show in Millenium Park.

The place was packed but we had made a reservation so we sat down immediately. It was a few minutes before anyone came over to us but they were busy so it's all right. We ordered a couple beers and the habanero pineapple margarita, along with the tsukune appetizer and the burrata. My favorite was the burrata, served with some multigrain chips, an olive tapenade and halved cherry tomatoes. It was very light and fluffy and the saltiness of the tapenade complemented it well. The tsukune was okay, but just a small portion--4 tiny meatballs for the 3 of us to share. Pretty tasty though I would not order it again. We ordered the crispy kale salad, which I thought would be entirely kale but turned out to be fried kale mixed with regular greens. It also had dates, pistachios and papayas. Great combo for a summer salad. My boyfriend got the burger and didn't share any of it. He even got a little mad when I stole a bite of his kale side to compare with mine... So I know everything was good. I still want to try their nitro coffee to compare with ipsento. I'll probably eat here on my last day in Chicago before moving, just so everything comes full circle. Love this place, definitely check it out and go to one of the River North bars in the area afterward!

My friends and I had the lemon pancakes, crispy kale salad, mushroom burger, bacon and an assortment of eggs and juices. The food is very much mediocre and unmemorable. Also, this didn't affect the ratings but I made a reservation for 5 and service was still very slow.

WORST SERVICE EVER!  Staying at the hotel.  Coffee bar staffed with 4 people.  2 people in front of me.  Waited 10 minutes.  No acknowledgement. Can not serve coffee.  WTF?  NEVER EVER GO HERE EVER!!!

The brunch was fantastic! They originally said the wait would be an hour and a half (Saturday around 10:30am) but we scored two spots at the bar where we could also be served the regular menu. I had the cauliflower grits and eggs which was super delicious while feeling healthy/filling with Brussels sprouts and Parmesan. My husband had the steak and eggs which was equally tasty. Highly recommend.

I came here for brunch, and I really enjoyed the atmosphere! The coffees were great - I had the bullet...which is coffee with butter. It' supposed to have a lot of additional health benefits. I really enjoyed it!

For the actual meal I really loved my brunch meal. I had the cauliflower grits and eggs! It tasted light and buttery, but also healthy. I devoured it and wanted more! I came here previously and had the steak chimichurri. It was also good, but I didn't love it as much as the cauliflower grits.

Lastly the mimosas were a little too sweet for my liking, but pretty typical!

Out of towner here!

My husband and I walked in at 11am for brunch and didn't even have to wait for a table for 2. Staff was great. Excellent service.

On Yelp recommendations I got the Fluffy Lemon pancakes (mmmm... Very delicious and different! Best friggen pancakes I've ever had) and hubbie got the Spicy Chicken Tinga. Loved the Bloody Mary and Spiked Freddo for drinks.

Both of us left satisfied and full!

Super cute place for brunch!

Amazing bloody mart! Super chill atmosphere we sat at the bar and "bs"ed with the bartenders. Menu is really vast which will make everyone happy if you go with a group. Good portion of steak and eggs not tooooo much

Fabulous place for brunch or lunch. I haven't been for dinner, but if it's anything close to their other meals I'm sure it's superb. I have had the light and fluffy lemon pancakes repeatedly and every time am in heaven. Hands down the best pancake you'll ever eat. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu and they have a cute little coffee and pastry bar with delicious treats.

I went early weekend morning for breakfast and had an excellent experience. Had an egg white sandwich and it was delicious. They also have kids menu, and pancake from the menu was pretty good. The decor is beautiful and staffs are friendly. I loved that their restroom (actually restroom from the hotel lobby connected to the restaurant) has changing table for babies. There is a coffee and pastry pick-up bar inside the restaurant as well. We ordered coffees to go at the end of our meal. They don't have special/seasonal coffee drink on the restaurant's dessert menu, but I walked by the coffee bar and asked our server for those drinks. I like that they have interesting coffee drinks. I'll be back again!

We were staying at a nearby hotel and wanted a late night drink at a laid back place.  Beatrix looked to be the best option for this.  We picked a spot at the bar and promptly ordered some drinks.

Beatrix is a very aesthetically pleasing environment.  The drinks were served in a quick speed and our bartender was just great.  We made plans to come back the next day for brunch, but sadly did not make it.  I can't say anything about the food, but if you are looking for a classy and friendly late evening beverage, consider Beatrix.

I ordered a two egg breakfast delivered to my room.  Room service - thats the thing where you get your meal delivered in a way that you can eat like a normal person, but in a hotel room.  The breakfast came to me about 25 minutes later - which seemed pretty reasonable.  Until I got it IN A BAG.  

Now, I'm not against bags full of food.  I have happily lived out of bags of food for days at a time.  However, when I order room service, I expect that the $8 extra charge will at least win me a plate.  I got a bag full of two separate tiny plastic containers with my eggs and hashed browns, and in a small bag a single piece of toast.  Does anyone who orders breakfast expect a single piece of toast?  NO!  I expect a full order of toast - two pieces.

Since I had asked for hot sauce I did get a small, stale cup of that.  I did not get any salt or pepper.  I did not get a fork. I did not get a plate to eat my bag of food off of.

If you want a crappy breakfast, you should order from Beatrix.  It's only $20.  

If you want a good breakfast, there are a lot of better options.  Use those.

-S

Pros:
Food was great. I had the burrata to start and the burger with a glass of the power greens.
Our server was very attentive but not over the top
Prices are very reasonable

Cons:
We got there early to sit at the bar before our table but there were no seats. And even though we we there 30 mins early we were still seated 15 min after our reservation time

Has to be one of my absolute fav's for LEY places as they best combine coolness with good food, good drinks, amazing desserts. Three of us went for dinner with a friend visiting from out of town, and with a serious gluten allergy. Beatrix couldn't have been more helpful - from the rather unique mixology of drinks to the hummus appetizer, Straight A salad, unique entrees and desserts, my friend was guided by what was gluten free - and all of it was delicious. My husband and I had the  chicken bebe, our friend, the chocolate salmon, and the Tall Dark and Handsome Cake that's also gluten free, simply the best ever, and at a generally reasonable price!

First time here was no disappointment. Great crowd, environment, music, service. I shared the steak and eggs along with the homemade Belgium waffles and they were exceptional. Alyssa was great. I will definitely be back.

Stopped by at about 10:00am on Sunday for brunch, after finding out that the place we had initially planned on hitting didn't open until 11am. (Who doesn't open for brunch until 11???)

Still, glad we ended up here. We were told it would be a 30 minute wait, so happily settled outside the restaurant to pet the dogs walking by. However we were texted within 10 minutes that a table was ready. Yay!

Our group ordered the Fluffy lemon pancakes, Morning bun and Quinoa cakes with poached eggs. They also have a great selection of morning beverages. We tried a few mimosas, lattes, and juices, and all were great. The food was fantastic, and everything was recommended. Do yourself a favour, since this place takes reservations, book yourself in here for brunch.

Excellent dining experience!!!  Came in for brunch while visiting Chicago and I loved everything about this place.  Nice trendy Chicago vibe with exposed ductwork giving the restaurant a nice industrial look.  Beatrix offers a full bar as well as a coffee bar with some excellent pastry options.

We started with a traditional mimosa and a blue mimosa which was very tasty.

For our main courses we had the egg white omelet and quinoa and eggs.  Both dishes were excellent. If you do have a large appetite an appetizer is a good idea. The portions are good size, but not large by any means.  

Before we left we hit the coffee bar for a nice freshly baked cookie and king crimson tea which was awesome.  

I'll definitely be back!

I chose this place because it allowed me to do a reservation for 8 people on a Saturday night. The ambiance was phenomenal and the weather was perfect as we sat near the windows and they were all open air. Food was fantastic. Service was a little slow but the guy really did a great job at trying to accommodate all our needs despite it being rather busy. We did have to wait about 15-20 minutes to even get our orders started which I didn't like but otherwise I can't complain much about this experience. They also let us split checks however we liked which was nice. I had the short rib and one of the gin cocktails and they were really great. I also tried the ravioli and burrata which also didn't disappoint.

Would do 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll round up.
5 stars for service- our waiter was fantastic, as was the young woman training with him. They didn't rush my friend and I at all, as we were a little distracted since we hadn't seen each other in so long. They even sent us home with a little complimentary cinnamon roll, which was awesome, and that was probably the best thing I ate from there (although I just tried the frosting and gave the rest to my boyfriend).
The food was a 3 I'd say. It was good, but nothing special, and the menu was very weird. It was a strange mix of dishes with no theme, and didn't seem seasonally relevant at all.
There were very few "breakfast/brunch basics" I'd say, and most of it was some sort of sandwich.
Portions were fine, but a little pricey in my opinion, for example, to get a small bowl of fresh fruit on the side.
I had a WONDERFUL time with my friend, but the food was just not special.

Great brunch spot. Friendly service, excellent atmosphere, interesting menu. Got the poached eggs/quinoa cakes. Perfectly poached eggs, beautiful presentation, and I appreciated the unique dish.
"Amazing omelet" was a little dull.

Big Beatrix fan right here! Visited the location in Streeterville for the first time on Friday on a dinner date. The service was friendly and fast and the food is awesome. We started our meal with cocktails, the Blueberry Tom Collins and the Old Fashioned variation. Both were just ok, surprisingly. They tasted virgin to me but whatever.  The ingredients focus on local sourcing and are incredibly fresh and flavorful. My date had the potato ravioli with asparagus and raved about it. I ordered the hummus which came with a side of baby heirloom tomato and onion salad and warm naan. Very cute presentation. We also had the kale caesar salad as a main and it was delicious. We only finished about half of it and I wished we would have boxed it up later. They brought us both out free muffins at the end of the meal. My "muffin" was really angel food cake with the muffin top dipped in milk chocolate and it was FAB! I would come back just for that muffin. Perfect end to a great meal.

I've been coming here for breakfast while staying at the aloft. Excellent pastries, coffee, and lattes. Their breakfast menu is delicious too, with things like an avocado Benedict (like an eggs Benedict, but with a whole avocado as a base instead of toast), and shakshouka!

Long-time lurker, first time reviewer here--this place was just so good that it warranted sharing the love.

My friend and I split the fluffy lemon pancakes and they were easily the best pancakes I have ever had in my life. They literally melt in your mouth and each bite tastes like heaven. The quinoa cakes and poached eggs which I had were also incredible -- not a bite left over! Perfectly seasoned, perfectly portioned, and one of the best brunch places in the city by far.

Service was great and the ambiance was pleasant--has a comfortably noisy chatter (not quite in the diner-style way) and promotes good conversation along with your delicious meal.

I would give this place 10 stars if possible -- hands down best brunch place in the city.

pics.caption: Blueberry basil and strawberry watermelon mimosas
Quinoa cakes with poached eggs -- vegetarian eggs benedict!

review.des: Love Beatrix. Every meal is always very unique and fresh. The green juice is a must when here... If you are feeling sinful hop over to the pastry bar everything is incredible.

Another weekend in Chicago, another excuse to brunch! I love to brunch, and my latest stop was at Beatrix in Chicago's River North neighborhood. Located next door to the stylish Aloft Hotel, this Lettuce Entertain You restaurant was the perfect place to warm up with a hot cup of coffee (followed by a mimosa) and catch up with friends on a cold, wintery day.

First impressions are super important and Beatrix definitely made a good one, both inside and out. The façade is very clean and modern with wood panels warming it up a bit. Inside, the exposed duct work, concrete pillars, and light-colored wood beams made the space feel large and open while the bright pops of color kept it welcoming and familiar. There were a few odd features here and there, but overall I really enjoyed it! Nearly every table was filled so I guess I'm not the only one!

After first taking care of drinks (obviously) it was on to the brunch menu. The first thing that caught my eye was the Braised Pot Roast & Egg Sandwich with aged white cheddar and jalapeño relish. With temperatures hovering in the mid 20's, this comfort food option was exactly what I was looking for! The rich and flavorful pot roast with the airy focaccia and the slight kick of the jalapeno relish was delicious and this is definitely what I would order if I returned!

As for the rest of the table, we had the Pecan Praline French Toast,  Steak Chimichurri, and Eggs Your Way. In the end, plates were cleaned and everyone was happy, so I'd say we had a pretty successful brunch outing here at Beatrix!

Came here for coffee/drinks and stayed for dinner.  Surprised and glad to see it is a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.

The turkey meatloaf I had contained pieces of sweet potato and kale mixed in.  It was very tasty and made me think I was being healthy.  I would come back here again just to have the meatloaf.

I definitely recommend trying Beatrix out.  Pleasant surprise given it was connected to the Aloft hotel!

I rarely find a restaurant that merits five stars, but this place is, all around, awesome. And as a visitor to Chicago, it was a relief to find a place like this.

The hostess were welcoming and nice, got us seated quickly.

Our server, Anna, was very attentive and sweet. She was one of the bet servers I've ever had. It doesn't take a lot to be a good server, but so few people are professional and nice while they do it.

The food was very good as well. I highly recommend trying a fruit juice. The mango was an excellent choice. Pricey (6$ for non-alcohol) , but worth trying.

And the atmosphere was very unique and very well kept. Clean and fun environment.

Five stars!

My co-workers and I threw a surprise shower at Beatrix yesterday and really enjoyed the experience.

I made a reservation on Open Table and noted we would be celebrating, they were kind enough to give us a very large table and to set it back away from the hustle and bustle toward the front of the restaurant.

For our appetizers we went with the fries, quinoa cakes, and two hummus plates. Everything was really delectable and I appreciated the portion sizes of each appetizer. Our group of 8 was more than satiated with four appetizers among us.

Everyone also seemed to truly enjoy their meals, people tried the chicken sandwich, chopped salad, salmon, and ahi tuna and there were no complaints.

My only negative on Beatrix is that it took quite some time for our waiter to come over to take our drink and appetizer orders. I would've appreciated him being a little more proactive, especially considering his section did not seem overly full.

Overall it was a positive experience and I really enjoyed the ambiance and food at Beatrix.
Looks like a great menu! The restaurant was very crowded, but the hostess didn't acknowledge me at all. I think despite how good the menu looks great the service could use a bit of polish.

Definitely a popular place! Made a reservation for Saturday morning and had to settle for a 9:45 for a group of 3. Totally worth it. We all enjoyed our meals and our waitress gave great recommendations on food & drinks.
I ordered the quinoa cakes with poached eggs, kind of like an eggs benedict but over toasted quinoa, and with a tomato sauce instead of hollandaise- delicious! I also got one of their fresh pressed juices, which was a little expensive but in line with other juice bar prices, and the rest of the menu is priced very reasonably. I got the Ginger Snap with apple, carrot and ginger, while my friend got the Blueberry that had basil in it. My other friend got the espresso hot chocolate which looked like a dream! I'll definitely be back, as my visitors were pleased. PS check out their coffee bar - I had to wait to meet my friends and there are a variety of pastries and drinks to choose from before you're seated. Thanks Beatrix!

Headed to Beatrix with some friends after Xoco was closed. We were there bright and early Sunday morning (9am), so were seated pretty quickly. By the time we left, there was a large group of people waiting on tables.

They have their own coffee bar, so the regular coffee I had was great and my friend had a cappuccino she really enjoyed.

The food was pretty great, but portions weren't huge. I had the enchiladas, which left me full and found a nice balance of sauce without overpowering the plate. A friend of mine had the quinoa cakes with poaches eggs, and she had to order another meal to make sure she had enough.

Service was prompt and polite, even when we lingered a bit long to go over some paperwork. My coffee cup was never less than half full before I got a refill, and our server continued to check on us without being pushy.

Overall, nice experience and excited to get back and try something from the bakery.
Great brunch spot. Delicious fluffy lemon pancakes & sugared bacon. Good service & they can make a good spicey Bloody Mary!

Breakfast option that is definitely on the healthier side and worth it. We ordered the light and fluffy pancakes to share and the egg white omelette and eggs your way. My omelette was fantastic, definitely light and a refreshing way to start the day. My friends meal was pretty good too. The light and fluffy pancakes were slightly disappointing for both of us but not bad in general terms.

Cute decor and awesome atmosphere. Definitely recommend trying the Nitro Coffee!

Food is 5 stars, but I waited for 14 minutes before the server came and took my order. I also saw another table get up and ask the hostess where/who their server was, and two other tables were looking around for servers. Seems to be a big problem there.

I'll go back for the food, but only when I'm not in a rush.

I do like the atmosphere here, especially when the restaurant is totally opened up to the outside. The location is great in the River North neighborhood. One huge minus though is their pricing which is on the expensive side. I came here for breakfast twice. The first time I had two sunny side up eggs, hash browns, coffee, fruit, and a raspberry lemon muffin for about $23 pre-tip amount. I can understand the charge if I could later say the breakfast was absolutely great. But it was not great, it was good, but definitely not great. Another problem here is the working culture. The employees here overall are not friendly. Out of the several people I interacted with here on both visits only one young Hispanic waitress was friendly. It does not hurt employees to greet patrons with open arms and make them feel at home during their visit. Another pet peeve of mine is when the waitress places the bill on my table before I am done eating and tells me "there is no rush". If there truly was no rush, then, why place the bill on my table before I asked for it?  In addition, when I was there, the first time, the place was practically empty!  Would it have killed the waitress to wait till I was done eating? Was she too lazy to check on me later to see if I was truly done enjoying my breakfast? On my second visit is when I had the friendly waitress that was very nice. My complaint with this meal is the meal itself. I ordered chimichurri steak that did not taste like it had chimichurri on it. The steak was cooked perfectly but the sauce looked right but did not provide the zing that it should have. I have been eating chimichurri all of my life and know what it is supposed to taste like. The upside to this meal is the additional chocolate chip coffee cake which was actually very good. Great location, but only okay food. I am only giving them 3 stars because of the location.

The brunch was excellent. Their coffee and fresh juices were delicious. The chile bfast enchiladas were delicious. The mushroom quinoa burger was amazing and flavorful. Service was great but this place is always busy so make reservations if you want to go on the weekends!

Hands down the best salmon Caesar salad I've ever had...and I've had a few! I sat at the bar as was traveling solo for work and every other solo traveler near me was equally impressed. Rave reviews on the Chicken Bebe and the Neatoaf. I typically grab a Pinot Noir at dinner but decided to try one of their fresh juice cocktails, the Blueberry Tom Collins, and it was incredible. Great food, great drinks, incredible service, and a very cool atmosphere. Glad it was storming outside and I chose the restaurant attached to the hotel!
Fantastic service, great atmosphere, and the food was healthy and super tasty!!!  Highly recommend. The Mgr and Waitress were phenomenal.

I've held back in writing a review on this place because I wanted to keep it my secret. Well apparently my secret is out. Beatrix not only has incredible food for breakfast lunch and dinner, but the ambiance and wait staff are just as incredible. It's like a coffee house meets a tropical oasis blended with a lofty living room feel. I can't help but to order the quinoa cakes with poached eggs. The tsakune and kale salad are hard to beat. Oh and don't forget you can order bullet proof coffee. You've gotta get here early to get a table - but sitting at the bar with Michael is also hard to beat. A must try. Over and over again.
Solid food and coffee (strong Intelligensia). For brunch: cauliflower grits are on point. Will even get your coffee to go.

lots of reviews here for brunch/breakfast but a froworker and i came here for dinner.
love love love.

first of all, the place looks gorgeouss. if a hipster coffeehouse/juicebar had a baby with a classy farm-to-table joint, this would be it. the place feels invitingly warm and cool at the same time.

secondly, the cocktail i had was amazing. fresh blackberry lychee lemonade mixed with tito's vodka and st. germain. it was beautiful and so tasty. i took a sip of the blueberry tom collins too, which was also delicious but not quite as amazing as the blackberry lemon drop, in my opinion. if you love gin, you may prefer it though.

honestly i could've been fully five-stars satisfied with a meal of cocktails alone. but i did eat the spring pea soup and "straight a salad" which had arugula, asian pears, almonds, avocado and asiago. both dishes were solid and actually pretty filling. we noted that there are lots of paleo-friendly options on the menu too.

for dessert, i heard rumors about the caramel pie so we gave it a go, and while my first bite felt like "what, that's it?" but with each bite, the flavors started growing on me. or maybe it was the alkerhall.

in any case, this place was awesome. the price point is not even all that expensive, considering the quality of the fare. color me a very satisfied chitown tourist.

pics.caption: straight A salad & spring pea soup

review.des:
This place was nice. Our table had a couch on one side. It was a fake candlelit dinner.

My fiance and friend got the Local Option, Blood ov Kings. The waiter (who was really funny) said it was hoppy but they said it was way more sweet than hoppy. My other friend got the vodka dew and liked it a lot.

Here are reviews for the food:

Pork shank w/ cider: The pork fell right off the bones as the waiter described. There were small pieces of sweet potato and apples on top. It was pretty good! Very filling!

Salmon w/ chocolate glaze: the menu did not clearly describe this as such but it turned out to be fish tacos. My fiance liked it.

Prime burger: my friend said was good

Truffle Pasta: my friend said was really good but it didn't even fill his stomach half way.

For dessert, my friends got a chai latte and honey cinnamon lattes. They were pretty big and they liked them.

My fiance got an irish coffee, he said was good.

Dessert Time! They have very large cookies that we could not turn down. Between the 4 of us, we shared a

Caramel pie - this was very good. it was very rich, but so tiny! More of a 1 person dessert.

Chocolate cake - it was flourless so it kind of just tasted like mousse. it was pretty good, also very rich and so tiny as well

Snickerdoodle cookie- very big, good but would have tasted better warm

Oatmeal butterscotch cookie- very big, pretty but good but also would have tasted better warm.

Overall, decent experience.
____________________________________________________________
Came here for a second time....

I got the truffle pasta this time. It was super delicious but super small. It was literally two pieces of ravioli type noodles on the outside, filled with 2 poached eggs. But there was this delicious buttery sauce that made it amazing! Since I knew it was going to be not filling, I got a side of appetizer chili lemon fries. They were pretty good!

I got the strawberry watermelon drink... it was ok... nothing special.

We shared the caramel pie and OMG it was even better than I remember! Just straight up caramel, YUM!!!

I would definitely come here again to try more things on the menu!

3rd time: We got the Prime Burger cooked medium with fries. The burger itself had really good texture and was cooked perfectly; however, there wasn't much taste to the burger. It definitely needed more seasoning or sauces. The fries were good.  I got the honey cinnamon latte which was very good. My hubby got convinced to get the "amazing" nitrogen coffee... but it tasted like watered down coffee. We would highly recommend you do NOT get that.

I came here after a pilates class with some girlfriends for brunch because they were really craving some freshly squeezed juice and something healthy. Two of my friends got the Power Greens juice, which has kale, romaine, celery, pineapple, and mint and I got the Blue Boost, which has blueberry juice, white grape, and basil. They seemed to really like the Power Greens juice, which I thought was just okay. It was a little bland and tasted kind of like grass, which makes sense considering what was in it. I thought my juice was a bit sweet and the blueberry juice overpowered all the other flavors. In hindsight, I realized that while I love blueberries, I don't really like blueberry juice, but I powered through it because it was $5.50 a glass! Next time, I will probably get the Sweet Valencia Orange juice because nothing beats some freshly squeezed OJ.

For my main dish, I shared the Enlightened Caesar salad and Quinoa Cakes w/Poached Eggs with a friend. The salad was very fresh and healthy tasting, but I definitely liked the quinoa cakes more. The cakes were crispy, the eggs were poached perfection, and the tomato-basil sauce was the perfect complement to the dish! My other friends got the Prime Burger on whole grain toast and the Spicy Chicken Tinga, which they raved about.

Overall, another great LEYE restaurant, especially if you're in the mood for something healthy!

Some friends of mine said they wanted o come here for lunch one day...I always like to try new places...not to mention the menu was quite interesting.

When I came over I didn't realize it was attached to the Aloft Hotel in which I have hung out in before....cool! We made it over and the place wasn't too crowded. We were seated immediately by our very nice server...she was pretty cute as well. The space itself is pretty open and nice with a contemporary look to it.

We started out with an order of fries that came with peppers and lemons...pretty good!
I got a drink which was the cherry chia mojito. I was afraid it would be too sweet, but our server put me @ ease by saying its a perfect flavor and not too sweet. She was right as I basically gulped it...very nice summertime like drink. While I was sipping my drink, I noticed state senator Dick Durbin had strolled by...pretty cool.
My dining companions told me I should get the Pot Roast Sandwich as they have tried it before. I decided to take their advice and it was well worth it! The sandwich consisted of pot roast (obviously) and caramelized onions on a toasted white cheddar bun. I haven't had pot roast in forever and this was a helluva reintroduction to say the least...very good! The dish came with delicious fries as well. Unfortunately we had no room for some of the delicious looking desserts. By the time we finished, the place was jammed packed..pretty popular huh.

I came back for brunch as I heard the brunch here was pretty awesome! First off they have 3 different mimosas. The normal orange juice mimosa and then they have a good strawberry-watermelon mimosa that is good and a very delicious blueberry mimosa that I had to have 2 of. I decided to go with the Braised Pot Roast & Egg sandwich that came with aged white cheddar and a very nice jalapeno relish to spread. One of the best brunch sandwiches I have ever eaten! The Pepper & Egg White Sandwich is also a helluva sandwich and also comes with the jalapeño relish which is awesome. Do yourself a favor and get yourself a side of chicken sausage...good as fuck!

After looking through the menu I noticed there were multiple delicious items here which means I will have to make many return visits.
So so glad i finally got down here for brunch. The food, coffee and cocktails are spectacular!

Great spot for brunch.  Interesting menu with a lot of different options.  The coffee bar is amazing and I loved the additions to the mimosas.  Only downside is that there is always a wait, and despite reservations you always have to hang out well beyond your reservation time.  They definitely need to work on that.

I wanted to like this place because the flavor of their crispy kale salad was amazing with all the textures from the papaya, cheese and mixed greens... Sadly, I bit really hard into a date and there was an entire pit in it. Beatrix needs to pit their dates, makes me think that their food prep is sloppy and unrefined! Glad I didn't give this to my toddler.

Next, my burger bun was burnt and every bite kept giving me this vile charcoal taste in my mouth.. The server didn't ask us how our food was and I was too hungry to say anything, so I just peeled off most of the bun and burnt burger as much as I could.  Plus we had a baby with us so we didn't want to wait even more.  I regret not ordering something else, my boyfriend seemed to be okay with his chocolate salmon.

Lastly, they wouldn't let us sit in an unreserved booth table because we didn't have a large enough party but we came early before the dinner crowd piled in. We went in, ate our dinner and no one occupied the table we wanted to sit at. Hmmm. Thanks for being accommodating Beatrix.

At least our waitress was friendly enough.  There's too many good places in Chicago, this one seems like they're pretending to be something that they're not..

Service - 3 stars. It was pretty busy for brunch on a Saturday around 2pm, but service was crawling, and they weren't apologetic about it at all. I don't mind waiting if a server is slammed, but I expect them to acknowledge the wait, not pretend like it didn't just take 15 minutes to get me a cup of coffee.

Food - 5 stars! The best part was that they had a gluten-free burger that wasn't just meat with lettuce wrapped around it - it was actual GF bread that didn't taste like shoes! My boyfriend was ecstatic. I got the pot roast and egg sandwich, which was really nice.

Things I would try next time - the sides and the cocktails.

Average 4 stars.

We had eaten here several times and I am impressed by their consistency with absolutely outstanding food. Located in a lobby of one of Chicago's trendiest hotels this place has a great vibe, beautiful bar and even some outside sitting. They bake their own sweets and pastries, which are showcased at the end of the bar, to seduce those who are having a drink before dinner :) With this said their deserts are out of this world and you can also grab some tasty treats home with you to enjoy the next morning!

Some of my favorite items are their meatballs with very interesting spices and sauce, crispy kale salad where fresh and oven backed crispy kale come together with toasted pumpkin seeds and God knows what else and their presentation of salmon is unique and delicious. However, everything else we tried is solid and beautifully executed.

While this place ALWAYS had an amazing service, we hit a small hick-up last Friday night and their manager Rebecca turned this confusion into an opportunity to show us that this place cares about their guests. We had a reservation but asked to sit outside and the hostesses told us it would take an extra 15 minutes... The weather was fabulous and the folks outside weren't rushing to leave, so we ended up waiting a lot longer then the projected time. The manager comped our entire meal!

We do come to Beatrix a lot, but we certainly didn't expect this and were truly touched. Our loyalty to this place is based on many components, great variety of delicious options, a ton of by-the-glass choices on their wine list, great location and now something most other places do not offer - TLC. I just send a couple of my friends there to celebrate a birthday, I know they will thank me for it!
Horrid, rude customer service. Left shortly after being seated. Maybe a less busier day they will learn to actually talk to people respectfully?

Fresh healthy choices. I am getting the spicy chicken tinga.  Fresh juices like blueberry, white grape and badil.  I tried the ginger snap and it is great. Michele got the watermelon strawberry and she's enjoying it.  The music is good and it's not terribly noisy in here yet it is a huge industrial space that looks like it could seat 150 people and it's full.

Stop by the Anti - cruelty one block west and save a life.  They'll be very grateful.

Wow. This place was really, really good!! Food was top notch.  I found this place via Yelp ;) because it was within walking distance of our hotel (The Godfrey).  It's listed as new American, so the menu is "normal" food you would find but with a twist.  The menu is pretty small, but, complete.  Upon entering we were greeted and taken to our seats.  Mine was part of a SUPER comfy couch which was a welcome relieve after walking around downtown Chicago all day.  I ordered a pot-roast and my sig-o picked the chicken dish.  

The pot-roast was ah-mazing.  Perfect portion size and cooked to perfection.  It melted in your mouth and fell apart with the fork.  I ate the whole thing!  I had a piece of chicken and it was super moist and very flavorful.  We took the chocolate cake to go.  It was soooo rich and delicious!!

Very cool and hip interior.  Had some neat exposed wood beams and lots of mood lighting.  Since this is a new age place there was a "wine" bottle contraption with water on our table.  Various employees would fill our cups as needed, which I personally find awkward though it is good customer service :)

If I came here again I probably would bump it up at 5 stars!  YUMMY!!!
Absolutely love this place! Seriously nothing tops the service, atmosphere, and virgin juice cocktails. Love Neal, Jazmyn, Kim, and Eric , cheers

Loved this place.  We were staying next door at Hyatt whatever. Went to this place. They told us 15 min wait on Thursday night. Sat at bar. Never ordered as they texted us that our table was ready!

We ordered three things--tuna rara that was like sushi and awesome; potato salad deviled eggs that were really good; and the vegetarian special of the day that was tagliatelle noodles plus broccoli and Brussels and squash. It was great.

Our waiter was great. We sat in the bar and talked to some cool youngsters.

Bought stuff from dessert bar to go. When we got back to the hotel I basically took a bite out of everything. Here is scoop:
1.  Angel food muffin with chocolate. Ugh. Angel food is great. Not with chocolate though. Don't buy.
2.  Cookie with oatmeal and apple. Yeah!!  Great!!  Buy this.
3.  Apricot bar. Also yeah!!  Buy this.
4.  Lemon cookies at .50 each. Bargain. Haven't tried them yet, hubs wanted them. They look great.

Came here for lunch menu.

Potato deviled eggs: meh, just tastes like a lump of potato salad. Not bad but nothing impressive.

Tomato soup: very good but hard to butcher.

Chicken sandwich: tasted like a Starbucks focaccia bread Sammy with a Dijon sauce. Still confused on what the sauce was.

Arugula straight A salad: well, it's like a whole foods plastic container serving of arugula. Not bad but also could have made it  at home.

We has the sawtooth Riesling just to say I had a wine from Idaho.

I'd try to come back here for dinner menu. It's not great but definitely easy for group casual dining.
Crispy Kale Salad and Butternut Squash Apple soup  are a must try! I visited Chicago for the weekend and went there twice for their salad and soup! I wish we had this restaurant in Florida!!!

Super busy on a Saturday around brunch time, which is to be expected. I got the lemon blueberry blintzes (heaven) and my friend got the "wonderful egg white omelette." We both cleaned our plates. The wait was a bit longer than estimated by the hostess and our server was busy but attentive. Iced tea is delicious. So expect to have a bit of a wait, but when you get in, you'll have an absolutely delicious meal.

Spectacular service. Our server/bartender was phenomenal! She had amazing menu knowledge and gave excellent descriptions of menu items.   The food was also great! I've had bakery items before, but the dinner menu is definitely something to come back for.  The only sad part was there was no ranch for my French fries :(

pics.caption: The burger on wheat toast with giardenierra and French fries

review.des: Lovely place, really good service and the pot roast breakfast sandwich will make you weep.

I came in between lunch and dinner hours for a late lunch. The place was pretty empty. Beatrix is somewhere that I've been wanting to try!
Our server was very laid back and made his way over to our table once we got situated. I saw that they had a coffee counter with sweets and such, so I ordered a coffee. My friend got an angel food cake muffin that looked divine, and she said it WAS!
They still had a lunch menu, so I ordered off of that. I got some kind of turkey sandwich that had tomatoes, avocado, lettuce, and such on it. It was a cold sandwich, but the bread was lightly toasted -- my fave! It came with a cold salad that had greens, chopped apple, and pumpkin seeds- tossed in an oil/vinaigrette dressing of some kind.
I thoroughly enjoyed my whole meal. From the delicious food to the service to the ambience. The place is very open, welcoming, hip, and has a relaxing feel to it. Our waiter was attentive, filling my coffee mug whenever it looked low and making sure we had everything that we needed. I will definitely be back for some of the other dishes, a cocktail, and maybe even one of those sweets from the coffee counter!

pics.caption: Pineapple habanero margarita and a mimosa
Turkey, tomato, and avocado sandwich with a fixed apple salad - yum!

review.des: The restaurant is very cute and has great ambience. The food was also very tasty. The service was incredibly slow. The restaurant was not very busy at all but it took us an hour and 45 min from start to finish because of how slow the waitress was.

Beatrix is a classy, yet casual River North spot serving contemporary American food. I've come to expect a certain consistent excellence from Beatrix, which is why I keep coming back to it, as well as hosting family and friends visiting from out-of-town. I usually visit Beatrix for Dinner, but they do have a Brunch option as well.

After making a reservation, my girlfriend and I came to a packed Beatrix on a Thursday night. We were immediately seated at a table next to the all-glass wall facing Clark-street. As usual, the service was great.

I usually get the grass-feed beef angus burger here, but I was feeling adventurous. So we ordered the special of the day - we were told by the General Manager that this was a sort of seasonal, recurring special. Words don't do it justice, but this was a chicken breast wrapped in potato and pastry and sprinkled with a delicious mushroom sauce. It was soooo delicious!!

We also treated ourselves to their famous (award winning, we were told) caramel cake. I'm still recovering from the greatness of that treat. It was bomb.

All in all, we had a wonderful experience at Beatrix and will definitely be coming back sometime soon!

Visited here for brunch.  The décor is nice and the vibe is trendy.  They have a nice brunch menu, including juices and drinks.  

I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes with brown sugar bacon.  As many fellow yelpers have said, I'll agree: both were wonderful.  Pancakes were light and fantastic -- great lemon flavor but not overpowering and the bacon was hearty and really delicious.  

They have a decent selection of baked goods and a coffee bar.  Restrooms are in the hotel.  As far as outdoor seating goes, they do have a few tables outside.
Such a wonderful brunch experience. The food, drinks & service were all top notch with just enough choices to please anyone but not overwhelm. Well priced. Over all loved my meal here!

pics.caption: The Lemon Pancakes were seriously the best I have *ever* had. Not kidding. You need them in your belly & your life.

review.des:
Yes to everything. Yes.
literally could not have chosen an item that tasted bad. Desert - yes
Coffee - yes
Atmosphere- yes
Service - yes
By far one of the best brunch places I've been to! Grits = heavenly! Highly recommended!

Magnificent!!!! The food is just great! We ate here twice: breakfast and lunch. Their menu include natural and organic food items. Fresh squeezed juices and baked goods available. Food is fresh and innovative. Great ambiance! A must when in Chicago.

pics.caption: Carmel pie with light and fluffy whip cream
Quinoa and mushroom burger with house potatoes
Natural turkey burger with quinoa cranberry salad.

review.des: I love this place the food and the drinks are out of this world you have to get the caramel cake omg you will just die it's so good.

A nice addition to the River North scene, Beatrix offers a blend of that local neighborhood spot vibe with modern and trendy to fit the actual neighborhood it is in.  Beatrix is a good option if you're looking to grab dinner in River North and don't feel like dealing with the pretentiousness (or the prices) of most of the River North dining areas, but still looking for a unique and high quality dining experience.

The cuisine is contemporary American with Asian influences on certain items.  My main complaint is the menu is somewhat limited, especially if you are a pescetarian or vegetarian.  I'm assuming they operate with a rotating menu, but a few extra options or maybe more than just one nightly special would be nice.

They offer interesting fruit drink options that can become alcoholic beverages at $11.  It's a nice concept but the drinks were a bit overpriced for what you're getting.  I can get a mind blowing cocktail at Violet Hour for $11, so tequila with cilantro and honeydew is less impressive.

The service was excellent and we had a very helpful server who was not shy about giving her opinions and helping us decide.  For the 4 of us, we went with the kennebec fries and tsunske meatballs to start.  My friends raved about the meatballs and I thought the fries were great - they come with a poached egg mayo on top that was delicious and unique.  For our main dishes, I went with the tomato soup and the crudo tuna.  My husband got the "neatloaf".  The crudo was a smaller portion (as crudo typically is) but paired with the tomato soup it made a very filling meal.  The neatloaf dish was a hearty sized portion with kale and mashed potatoes.  The theme is "healthy" and Beatrix does manage to deliver a healthier dining experience while still classy and original.  

The crudo was fresh and very tasty but the tomato soup was more on the average side (though I did appreciate that it wasn't doused in cream like most places).  Beatrix doesn't yet rank as one of my favorite or most memorable Chicago restaurants, but I had a very pleasant first experience there and will be willing to try it again once the menu has changed a bit.

I just want to tell everyone to order the Blueberry Tom Collins, so pretty and delish!

This is a nice place for lunch, and perfect when they open the windows up!

We stopped by again last night after a brief, very cold stint outside. We were very much looking forward to warming up and warming our bellies. This time around we sat in the front part of the restaurant (near hotel part of the building). There were just a handful of people to warm the place up, it was so cold! The sliding-door windows are not meant to keep heat in during the winter. I ended up sitting with my jacket on, as did a few other guests sitting next to the window. However, again our waitress was so hospitable. At one point during our dinner she brought over some warm water with lemon! It was so nice and perfect to warm me up as we ate.

This time we ordered the Potato Salad Deviled Eggs. As deviled eggs fans my boyfriend and I enjoyed these immensely. You get three small half eggs (what do they do with that last half?) filled to the brim with a yummy yolk-mayo filling. We then ordered the Poached Farm Egg & Truffled Pasta (if you read my last post and other reviews, you know my obsession with truffles!) It was good, but lacking the over vibrant truffle taste from last time and had more of an egg flavor. Still warm and satisfying on a cold night. My boyfriend ordered the new menu item, Crab Cakes. The plate has a nice size portion of crab cakes with lots of crab and veggies. He licked his plate clean.  

For having to endure the cold room, at the end of our meal our waitress brought two complementary pastries from their coffee bar! We did not expect this or request it and was a very nice afterthought. P.S. the pastries were delightful!

This is my go-to restaurant in Chicago! The entrees are fresh and healthy and the menu is awesome My standard lunch order is the straight A salad. The Neatloaf is popular too. I am gluten-free and there is plenty to order here. Be sure to checkout their bakery. Their cookies are insane.

Welcoming atmosphere, attentive staff and good food & drink offerings. The Straight A salad was phenomenal; I could have eaten 3 plates of it. The chicken was just ok; it lacked flavor and had too much sauce. I would still recommend checking Beatrix out!

Favorite restaurant in Chicago! I love their brunch (get the taco things) and the lemon ricotta pancakes were probably the fluffiest pancakes I've ever had... I take all of my out of town friends here and make them get the honey cinnamon latte too and it's amazing. I love this place and would recommend to anyone!! Even for lunch the pulled pork sandwich was amazing and filling!! Love love love
great ambience. Nice place for salad if you want something light- tried the cauliflower salad and found it really interesting and unique. Highly recommended
Amazing food. Get all your drinks from Jake. They were so good we went back the next night with friends just to have him make up cocktails!

Remember the hotel restaurants of yore--overly formal, overpriced, mediocre food?  Beatrix is NOT that.  It's hip, fairly priced, and the menu, though limited, has some really good options.  

Tried the sweet & sour meatballs--a really nice version in a cilantro and ginger sauce.  These are chicken meatballs and they're quite tasty.  I wanted to sop up the sauce with some bread.  Guess what?  No bread. No bread in a restaurant?  Go figure.

I also ordered a straight A salad--all the ingredients start with A--arugula, assiago, you get the idea.  Very nicely done, not overly dressed, and enough for 2 people

For dessert, pastries are displayed on the long coffee bar.  I was happy to see apricot and poppyseed hamentaschen.  I ordered both.  Delicious.

They do something with fresh squeezed juices here, it's like a specialty.  I had the Vodka Dew--vodka and honey dew juice, and found it way way too sweet (to my taste.)  I switched to martinis and they were fine.

There are at least four seating areas in the coolly designed space.  There are two bars, regular restaurant tables and low lounge tables.  So pick where you want to sit for the experience you want to have.  This is not your parents' hotel restaurant.

Two thumbs up! Stayed at the Aloft and had both cocktails and brunch. For brunch we had a buffet for a family gathering and the space is very accommodating for a large group even though it doesn't look it. The food was amazing! The bacon... I highly recommend checking this place out.

Impressive! I went there with some friends visiting Chicago and I am glad I did! It did a great job at impressing them, especially considering the prices. The food, service, and environment were all top-notch - I am definitely returning.

Food/Drinks: The burger was flipping amazing. I ordered it medium-rare, and they delivered it at the perfect temperature and juiciness. Fries and sides were great, but especially for ~$14, the burger exceeded my expectations. They have a large selection of drinks, most of which are pretty moderately priced.

Environment: It was very crowded and very colorful. The restaurant is somewhere between casual and classy, so no worries about being overdressed or underdressed.

Service: The service was stellar. They were very attentive to our drinks/needs and showcased the perfect balance of being friendly and giving us space to talk. They were able to split the checks, and surprised two of my friends with free cake for their birthday.

This place is phenomenal! The vibe is great, the food is great, the service is great. I went there for brunch and got the pepper and egg white sandwich - so simple, but so good! I went there once for dessert and coffee as well and it was delicious. Make sure to check this place out especially on a nice day because they have the windows open and it's an all around fun place.
Great food. Great service. The raspberry ricotta toast and the maple bacon are a must!

Me and the girlfriend stopped by for breakfast during our quick visit to Chicago. We made sure to arrive promptly at 8am when their kitchen opens to avoid a long wait.

Andrew was fantastic in helping me decide what to chose, and the girlfriend and I both thoroughly enjoyed our breakfasts. She ordered the lemon pancakes with a latte and after some deliberation I ended up choosing the enchiladas with a fresh squeezed glass of OJ. Everything was fantastic - we wish we had more time in the city so we could return and try some of their other offerings!

Rounded up to 3.5 stars.  I was surprised by the mixed reviews for this new LEYE restaurant, but decided to try it anyways.  

I went here with two friends and we decided to share everything. This place (like most LEYE) is not your typical trendy small plates sharing type of place.

We started with the tsukune (meatballs) which were DELISH. Good portion too for snacks. Came with 4 meatballs.

Then we shared the special which was a cauliflower milanese with roasted red peppers, peppercorn aioli, and a nice salad with arugula and avocado.

The second dish was "neatloaf" with turkey, sweet potato and kale. This was so different and really tasty. The potatos served with it were awesome. Great consistency.

The last dish was the chili and chocolate salmon. This was awesome--different! Served with tortillas, lime and a great green salsa.

Since this was a birthday celebration, they brought me a carmel pie. It was INCRED. However, I took it to go and they didnt give me the whipped cream to go with it. BUMMER.

Solid new LEYE spot. Focuses on healthy food and seems like food you could recreate at home which I really liked. Service was quick.

Good food, noisy atmosphere, high prices. That pretty much sums up my review. I had the Mushroom burger and fries. The burger was flavorful especially if you add the sauce that comes on the side.  It was like $13 or so. If you add one of their signature drinks, you'll easily get to $20.  We went during lunchtime which was really busy and loud. Overall I'd probably go back. They have a really interesting menu so I'm curious to try some other items.
Light and fluffy lemon pancakes with chicken sausage on the side -- absolutely delicious! Excellent service, lively atmosphere even on a Thur morning.

Hands down... THE BEST EGG WHITE OMELET I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!

I enjoy eating healthy and Beatrix was originally suggested to me when I asked the concierge at my hotel in River North for a good restaurant.

I never did try it when I was on that trip, but now that I've been living here for a month, I finally stopped in for breakfast on a Wednesday morning.

I ordered a bulletproof coffee and the egg white omelet. The coffee was $8.95 - no surprise there. But let's talk about the omelet...

Perfectly cooked. Fluffy. The spinach was tasty. The avocado and tomato salsa was freakin' unbelievable. I could eat this every morning.

The turkey bacon could have been cooked a little crispier, but that's a personal preference.

This is my new favorite breakfast.

Went there for a dinner with a friend to catch up with her. She had been there quite a few times, this was my first. The ambiance when I was there was perfect. The day was mild so they had the large windows/doors open which let in a nice breeze. I had made a reservation for 5:30 on a Monday night thru OpenTable. When I arrived the host was warm and welcoming, confirmed my reservation and sat me right away. There was hardly one in there at that time of day (it got busier while we were there, but the noise level was never TOO loud).

My girlfriend and I had the hummus to start, really good. Nothing out of this world, but was good. We both had the caesar salad with steak added and that was pretty amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly (Medium).

But the part that blew us both out of the water was the Tall Dark and Handsome chocolate cake. OMG. It's rich (but not TOO rich) dark chocolate flourless cake with a ganache/mousse kind of topping. Along with SOME sort of cream on the side. Mindblowing. We had shared it and we both wished we had just gotten one of our own. I don't think you've ever seen a chocolate cake disappear so fast. I should note: I don't normally like chocolate cake as I find most are almost bitter to me. So it takes a LOT for chocolate cake to blow my mind.
Very nice place, packed for brunch. had the bloody mary bar, pretty cool. food was very good too, would definitely go back...

We went for dinner, really nice location and had great seating to the outdoors. I ordered the straight-A salad with salmon and it was delicious. The problem was my mother ordered the Short Rib and didn't like how the eggplant was prepared. When she asked for more eggplant the waitress was very rude. The food was really good though!

MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMmmmMMMmm...

I really like this place.  It's trendy on the inside without being pretentious.  The staff is very friendly. There is a lot of green stuff on the menu... which I'm not hating on, I love me some salad, but I come here for the Pot Roast Sandwich.  Oh my dear lord is that a tasty sandwich.  I'm not even a fry eater but I love their fries, as well.

A friend of mine got me hooked on this pastry.. which I normally wouldn't think twice about getting.  I have no clue how it's spelled so here it is phonetically: Queen-A-Mon.  Queenamon? I don't know.  It's so good I could pee my pants.

A little pricey, but average for River North.  Yaaaaaaay Beatrix.

I've been here a few times for brunch, dinner and dessert/coffee. I crave their lattes often and sad they no longer have the dark chocolate banana. I've also had the bulletproof coffee based on the suggestion of the bartender. It has an odd consistency from the coconut oil and butter, but I put that thing away easily after the initial sip. The $9 cup of coffee did what it promised, an extended release of caffeine kept me up for several hours (which would normally take me 2-4 more cups for the same effect). Food wise, love the crispy kale salad, straight A salad, steak chimichurri and chicken bebe. The only downfall I've experienced is their hashbrowns. They were once soggy and another time way too greasy.

pics.caption: Chicken Bebe, Straight A salad (split in 2), and Kinnebec fries

review.des:
A wonderful restaurant with great service!

Made a reservation on open table for 6 on a Thursday night and was really looking forward to it.  When I arrived we were waiting for another party to get up and they were taking their sweet time.  Well, after 20 minutes of waiting the GM, Michael, came over to apologize and offer us some appetizers and drinks on the house.  How nice?!?!  I was really impressed by that and took him up on his offer! :)

For apps, we had delish Kobe meatballs and fries, with a poached egg.  For dinner I had the AMAZINGLY tender pork shank that was enough pork for a family of 4 :).  This was by far one of the best pieces of pork I've had in a long time!  The place has great cocktails as well - order the refreshing blueberry Tom Collins.  And lastly, if you need a nice after dinner caffeinated drink, they have a great coffee bar.  Oh one more thing, our waiter was awesome as well (didn't catch his name but he had a great mustache)!

I really like this place.  It's got a very warm and friendly feel to it, round tables for groups which I love, and a great staff.  Can't go wrong with this place for small groups, quick drinks or date spot.

Lunch at Beatrix was the perfect way to begin our mother and daughter weekend in Chicago.  We both ordered a fresh juice drink and could taste each ingredient of the Carrot, apple, ginger as well as the blueberry, basil. Of everything we tasted the Mushroom and Quinoa burger was our favorite and the crispy kale salad was the perfect accompaniment. This enjoyable atmosphere and attentive waitstaff will bring us back again.

Ooh la la!!! If you are in the vicinity of River North area, this is a must. Four of us were there for Sunday brunch. For that time frame reservations are a must. It is busy and noisy but in a very energetic way. Quinoa mushroom burger, crab Benedict, omelettes - everything was first rate. Service was prompt, efficient and knowledgable. Spicy Bloody Mary was very tasty. Great experience in all respects.

Loved my trip to Beatrix!  Wish I could have dined here again on my short trip to Chicago.

There were so many options on the menu that i wanted to get...I ordered the pork shoulder with mashed potatoes on a chilly windy night (much more pronounced after several days on intense hot weather!) it was perfect.  The cocktail list was interesting and tasty, and they also have fresh squeezed juices...I tried two of the cocktails: ginger sangria and blueberry Tom Collins.  We sat in front of the bakery case, which I'm sure is popular for breakfast in the mornings...the baked goods looked so tasty.  We ordered the oh my caramel pie that was really sweet but delicious.  

Located on a corner spot on the ground floor of Aloft hotel, it was cozy but modernly decorated and open at the same time.  The service from the hostesses to the servers was friendly and casual.

Beatrix has long been touted as one of the best brunch spots in Chicago (the 45 min wait only confirmed this), so I was excited to give it a try. We were seated away from the host stand and near the hotel, which was nice because it was quieter, but we ended up getting lost in the shuffle....our waiter brought us water, but it took him nearly 10 minutes to come back and take our order...at which point I was starving! I understand they were busy, but throughout the meal, we barely saw our waiter. Good thing the food made up for it. I was given a plate for the build your own chilaquiles bar (a plate which was dirty I might add, ew....had to wipe it off....). But the food was delicious and the blueberry juice was AMAZING!! I'm not even super into juices and all that, preferring coffee, but this stuff was incredible. Overall, the food made this place a decent pick, but I don't see why you would pick Beatrix over other places nearby and really don't understand the hype.
Absolutely delicious food & drinks!  Great ambiance & atmosphere!  Lettuce Entertain You Restaurants never disappoint!!

Summary: Awesome take on the staple eggs Benedict (Quinoa eggs benedict). Nice interior and decent pricing. Great location. Can get fairly crowded and loud on weekend brunch hours (But that is expected for a brunch place downtown).

Detailed:

1. My girlfriend LOVES quinoa. I hate quinoa. On my first visit, I was disappointed to find out they did not have traditional eggs benedict (This is what I always order for brunch because it's what I love). However, I ordered tried their quinoa eggs benedict and ever since then... that's what I always get. It's one of the top 3 places I would go for eggs benedict. They made something I hate into something awesome. I tried other entrees and they're all pretty decent as well.

2. Nice interior and great location. Modern and warm.

3. Decent pricing. My bill is usually less than $17 or so with coffee (before tips). Serving is a little smaller than most places (vs. yolk, eggsperience, etc) but it's just the right size for me.

Through several recommendations from friends I ended up coming here. It was what I expected from an atmosphere perspective- a bit urban and a little loud. I liked that the menu was fairly simple with just enough options. The pork shank was really good where the peaches added a nice complement to the dish. Everyone at the table loved their dish so it's safe to say this is a great option for dinner.

Pros: Excellent food, creative and healthy menu, great atmosphere, super friendly staff

Cons: A bit pricey, and smaller quantities, but not too bad

Quinoa Cakes: only got 3 small cakes, but man are these delicious, and high quality. Love them!

Straight A Salad: Very light, could have had a few more almonds and other ingredients, but hit the spot and was delicious and fresh

Dr. Bob's Turkey Burger: Best turkey burger I've ever had. Really well seasoned and well cooked.

This place is a solid Lettuce Entertain You restaurant. Good food, consistent service, pleasant atmosphere, and moderate prices. I like that many of their dishes are on the healthier side. Even though the last time I was there for brunch I ordered the egg and pot roast sandwich that was likely not on the healthier side, but amazing! Their menu has options for everyone and even has an extensive gluten free section.

Beatrix is my go-to place for breakfast and brunch in river north, and it's where I take all my visiting friends and family. The food is healthy, delicious, and good value. The coffee/pastry bar is amazing. Favorite entrees include the cauliflower grits, lemon pancakes, egg white omelette (trust me, it's so much better than it sounds) and avocado toast, of course. Also, the "oh my! caramel pie" will actually change your life.

Four of us went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Good thing we had a reservation because there seemed to be a lot of people waiting and not much room to stand. We were brought to our seat right away.

Our server was wonderful! He gave insightful answers when we asked what he recommended. I got the skirt steak with chimichurri sauce and fancy French fries. It was all very tasty. We split a kale salad before our meal and it seemed kind of gritty. I think it could have used another rinse off.

We finished with some great dessert. The chocolate cake is very chocolately and so so good. The apple tart was also delicious and not too overwhelming on the apple flavor. I would go back again!
This is in Northwestern Hospital, so they have a good customer base. It's a nice sit-down restaurant with a good menu. I was there at lunch and was lucky to get a table. Good experience.

We started with the deviled eggs, tuna and fries. Of the bunch, I could have done without the fries; they were nothing special. As for our entrees, we ordered the meatloaf, the salmon and the pork shank. All three were delicious but I must admit that the meatloaf lacked loads of salt. Finally, for dessert we ordered cookies and received a complimentary pumpkin pie from our waiter. Overall great experience at Beatrix. I will be back.

pics.caption: Turkey meatloaf with mashed potatoes and kale.

review.des: Visited for brunch and was really impressed. Our waiter was friendly, the food tasted superb and the atmosphere was fantastic. Everybody at our table was really impressed with their dishes and all agreed we would visit again. The bacon is unmissable!
blueberry/basil juice, winter salad, and chicken for dinner, all excellent!  Great food and casual but nice atmosphere.

This is a fun new restaurant and a very welcome addition to River North.

I came here for lunch and got the chicken meatballs (tsetsune), they were delicious. Had the supernatural salad (special) which was filling and fresh. The hummus was sadly on the bland side, and the hamachi crudo was a little fishier than I like, but the other great dishes and the fun atmosphere more than made up for it. For dessert we got the kulfi (Indian ice cream) and it was delicious.

Great new spot and I will definitely be returning!

Food was creative and the flavor kept up but did not exceed expectations; but not negative. Overall great environment, I dig the coffee bar integration - great coffee with a meal gets bonus points in my book.  Ambience is definitely on the trendy side and a good mix of 30ish all around with others mixed in.... You barely notice you are integrated with an aloft hotel.....

I'm a big fan of Beatrix. The food they serve is delicious, they have a great menu, their house-made juices are really good, the service is on-point, and the atmosphere/location are perfect. The price is also pretty solid, especially if you're looking for a nice place to take a date/your family/friends in the area without spending the money to go to one of the nearby over-the-top steakhouses. I would highly recommend for any occasion.

The restaurant was nothing special the food was just ok. I took Raviolo (it was only 1 big raviolo) with potatoes and truffle. The pasta was really thick especially the borders and the potatoes inside the raviolo, were to big. The ambience is cool but they definitely should work on the food instead of just the location. Another thing that was really bad it was when I ordered a wine and they brought me a glass already full instead of pouring it in front of me! This is not acceptable at all. Definitely it was a bad experience

Great sport for a yummy breakfast. I also loved the ambiance here and it was even crowded on a weekday. We never had to wait for a table though. The pastry display is also very hard to resist! I started with their green juice which was very good and full of greens with just a touch of sweetness. I had the wonderful egg white omelette which came with a hearty portion of bacon and tomato/avocado salad. I thought it was good and was pleased with my meal. I also had the hash browns which were tasty. My husband had the spicy chicken tinga which he loved but didn't feel it was very spicy. It is a beautiful space with big windows and our only complaint was we were seated in the back so far from everything which was cozy I guess. Our server was excellent and very attentive. She also was very thorough with her explanation of things and we never felt rushed. We finished with the angel food cake dipped in dark chocolate which was a nice light and tasty dessert to top off our meal. We hope to visit again when we're back in town!

We had a late dinner and it was packed! Our server was attentive. The food was fresh and delicious. I loved their hummus and the deviled eggs were memorable. It was an affordable meal for what we had. I would like to come back to try other plates. I did think the sangria was a bit too sweet for my taste though.
Crowded and super busy for lunch on a Friday. Sat at the bar. Greeted with great service. I'll have to return since all I had was tea. There for a business meeting.

It's fine. It's nothing special. The interior is a really cute mix of rustic and contemporary but I didn't think the food is worthy of 4 stars.

There's a café and a bar and a restaurant. It shares a lobby with the Aloft hotel. It also shares its restrooms with the hotel lobby too. Yes...

The menu is small and for those who are vegetarian you will find several options. I thought it was a somewhat interesting menu: pumpkin and avocado carpacchio for $9 as a starter? yes, non protein just thinly cut pieces of pumpkin and avocado. I don't get it.

Whatever, we opted for the tuna tartare to start which was good. I had the short rib and he had the flank steak chimichurri. His looked and tasted good, mine was a bit skimpy on the portion but it's Grand/State area so your money isn't going to go as far. Our service was very good.

2 entrees + 1 appetizer + 1 glass of wine + tax= $77

I wasn't blown away. For those of you who eat like a bird or complain about portions being too big then you will like it here. For everyone else... skip it

Beatrix is a trendy, American-food based eatery. It's open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, so they truly offer something for everyone. I met my brother and his wife for dinner on a Monday evening and the place was packed - quite impressive for a Monday! Tables were well-placed so as not to be too tightly close together, but they still fit many people in.

I started with a carrot, apple and ginger juice - it was super refreshing! Not too sweet and it didn't taste too carrot-heavy, which was my only fear when ordering! I loved the mix of apple and ginger - it was a good balance of all of the flavors.

The menu is arguably quite meat-heavy. Their brunch menu appears to have many more veg dishes, and I would be interested in coming back for that. Still, there was a pasta dish, a few vegetarian appetizers and a few veg salads. We split the burrata appetizer, which was served with an artichoke and edamame dip. The dip was fantastic, not oily and it had big chunks of artichoke in it. The crackers it came with tasted homemade and they gave us more at no extra charge. They almost had a pumpernickel/sesame feel to them. The special of the day was a quinoa cobb salad, featuring sweet potato, toasted sunflower seeds, kale and avocado, amongst other things. Basically no boring lettuce and all toppings is a perfect salad! Each vegetable was served in its own compartment of the dish for you to mix together. All together they were great and very filling. Not too heavy! We didn't have dessert but they did look delicious!
