Service is the one thing that wasn't awesome. My brother said it's usually more spot-on. Our server was slow, didn't check on us, didn't give my dressing on the side as I asked for and seemed a bit off. She was friendly enough when she came over, but certainly made no effort to go out of her way.

Fantastic food, phenomenal service!

Cavatelli w/ slow-roasted veggies - Delicious, has a subtle kick to it, perfect vegas option

Brioche Crusted Branzino - 2nd best dish all night. The fish is light and paired perfectly with the accoutrements.

Slow-braised short ribs - A bit on the dry side, but the whipped cauliflower and balsamic steak sauce fixed that problem

Caramalized Pork shank  - best dish we had all night. The meat falls right off the bone and is seasoned to perfection.

Caramel Pie - GET THIS. Our server described it as transcending... and it was.

Chia pudding - VEGAN!! and delicious. The coconut milk is fantastic. It's almost like a tapioca pudding substitute, but so much better.

Service - amazing service. I wish I remember the name of our guy. We had a group of 10 and he made us feel more than welcome. Very personable without being overbearing; which is a very fine line!

Last night was the 2nd time I've been to Beatrix, and the food was so scrumptious I had to review it. I had the chicken, which was drenched in the most delicious lemony sauce, and very tender. Among the best chicken dishes I've ever had. Also, I'm a huge dessert fan and the caramel pie with cookie crust was rich and wonderful. It's my new favorite.

The portion sizes are just right, and the whiskey sours are quite nice. Our server was very friendly and attentive.

The only downside to our visit was sitting in the awkward two-top right by the kitchen, which is squeezed in so tight against the other tables in the row that it's hard to even get into the seats and no leg room. Regardless, we will definitely be back. The food and service were top notch.

I went on a Thursday night and it was busy but we were very well taken care of by the very friendly staff. The atmosphere was chic but comfortable. Overall, the food was excellent and I tried a bite of everyone's meal. Not a bad plate out of 7 people.
 The main reason I write this review is because I feel it is my duty to tell anyone that will listen to try the caramel pie Oh. My. Goodness. It is one of the most delicious things I have ever put in my mouth. I regret being polite and sharing it with others that night. Get your own slice. Do not share.. It's too delicious.

I came here for a business dinner with my boss who was in town. I mostly picked the restaurant for convenience but will recommend this place to everyone now!

The inside is incredibly modern but without a pretentious feel (yeah...Chicago may have a few of those kinds of places).

I love that the menu had a healthy twist to comfort dishes. We started with the Ahi tuna appetizer. I am not a fan of seafood so raw fish is not my first choice, but didn't want to look picky in front of my present company. It had no fishy flavor whatsoever, the avocado amount wasn't too much and the crunchy topping provided the perfect bite. I would easily order this again.

My boss had the chicken bebe, which admittedly had me wishing I had ordered his dish. I had the pear, almond and avocado salad which was huge! Some places drown salads in dressing but this salad was light and delicious. I also had the habanero pineapple margarita. Definitely recommend but quite strong!

What made this experience even better was our waiter.  This guy was so passionate about his job and the food. He spent so much time explaining each dish and even went on to tell us that Beatrix was originally a tester restaurant for Chefs to explore new dishes. He seriously looked like he was going to cry when he told us about the special of the night.

He gave us each a free dessert which I'm currently restraining from on my ride home, but failing. Banana cream cheese muffin. How do I deny this?

With this place just blocks from my work, I have a feeling I'll be a regular.

The brunch was pretty good.  Nothing was mind-blowing, but everything was tasty.  We had the steak and eggs, pancakes, French toast, pot roast and eggs sandwich, and yogurt.  Cocktails were good, but beware- the Sangrita is not really a Sangrita, it is their own concoction.  Coffee is great.

Overall, a decent place for brunch if you are not in a rush.
Great food, good service, healthy options. I'm a fan! I end up eating here every time I am in town (from NYC).
My new favorite breakfast spot. Great ambiance, music and food! The brown sugar bacon will have me dreaming of more until I return.

Really fun spot for brunch. All the classic items, plus some very unique ones. We waited about thirty minutes for a table on a Saturday morning, but it was well worth it. Pot roast egg sandwich was really good. Pastries were great. Bacon was ok. Overall great experience.
Love Beatrix for lunch. Somewhat healthy, nice environment and always really friendly waiters. I love the pot roast sandwich and the turkey burger and my friends/coworkers are also always satisfied.

Attractive interior, great vibe, great good.

We all really liked the fried quinoa cakes. I had a braised mushroom special with a caluiflower mash that was very good. The desserts (the caramel tart and chocolate cake) were both great.

Also not too pricey.

Beatrix reminds me of khaki pants...dress it up, dress it down, it is a reliable staple.  Gotta have it.

Beatrix is located in the Aloft Hotel, but is not your typical hotel coffee shop-ish restaurant. It's a cute little place without screaming Cute Little Place. The atmosphere is family-friendly but date-appropriate, too. The menu is familiar/comfort food-y with a twist...for example, potato salad deviled eggs and turkey, sweet potato, and greens meatloaf. Both of which are quite tasty, by the way. They have awesome fresh juices (and not just for breakfast) and yummy desserts and pastries. If you like caramel, try the caramel pie. If you can,  try to score an angel food muffin. On both my visits, I found our servers to provide the perfect balance of "knowledgeable/let me tell you about the menu/personable/do you need anything" and "I'll leave you alone".

Really, like the khaki pants...I think it's hard to go wrong here.  Beatrix will be a part of my regular downtown rotation.

Went here for brunch and split the cauliflower grits and poached eggs on quinoa cakes. Both were excellent. If possible ask to be sat in the far corner of the restaurant, I was facing into the hotel lobby area which took away from the ambience.

We've eaten here a number of times, typically with family.  Most recent visit was pleasant as usual. While the  options are healthier, everything is still flavorful. It's also a great option if dining with people who are less adventuresome diners. Ingredients and dishes are close to traditional with a bit of a modern and healthy twist. Wild mushroom braise, meatloaf and spicy choc salmon are favorites.

This is a review for the coffee bar only! I stopped in this morning after reading how good the honey butter cinnamon roll was, and I was not disappointed. It was covered in vanilla bean-y icing, and had a good crunchy outside and soft cinnamon inside. It would've been good warmed up, but the icing would probably melt everywhere.

They also had some other really yummy looking pastries on display, so I will definitely be back to try them. Some of their fresh juices looked delicious, too.

The interior was very cute and comfortable, and it looked like a nice place to brunch or have dinner with some friends.

Amazing brunch food! I was blown away at how good this place was in Chicago! Loved it and want to go back again! The table shared a few of the entrees and all were very tasty! It gets very busy so make a reservation!

We have brunch here at least twice a month and have always had a good experience (service and food quality). Today something was off.  Two of us tasted the egg white omelet w spinach and it tasted different from our past visits. The spinach was bitter. The bartender kindly offered a new omelet. The kitchen was prompt and the manager served us the new dish and apologized. The second omelet was equally as bitter as the first. We decided not to return it or finish the dish. It was removed from the bill - thank you! But unfortunately we both got sick afterwards
:(
This is an amazing restaurant. Love the ambiance, food and they make amazing cocktails! We are from Austin so we had a great time. And it's great location.

pics.caption: Love the bar set up! They have awesome drinks!

review.des: Brunch was so delicious.  Had tomato and egg white sandwich with hash browns.  Husband had egg white omelette.  We shared the waffles.  Everything was so tasty!  The cherry chia juice was yummy!  Must do reservations...gets crowded.  Our waitress was so pleasant!  Great customer service!!!
Awesome food, loved it!  Went there for brunch.  Savory and Sweet dishes were both good, and really good alcoholic drinks (Spicy bloody mary) as well as non-alcoholic drinks (juices).

If I'm meeting someone for lunch in River North, Beatrix is usually my first choice. The menu includes freshly made apple/carrot juice, complete with bits of pulp so you know it's real. My best visits are in the summer when they open the floor-to-ceiling windows for an outdoor feel. The central location means you can zip in, eat/talk, and zip out. Breakfast and lunch selections are solid.

Went to Beatrix for dinner on a weeknight with co-workers. We arrived at 6 and were promptly seated for our reservation. The place was not too busy when we arrived but by 7:00 most tables were full.  For food we ordered a few starters to share- the Brussel sprouts, hummus and deviled eggs. The deviled eggs were delicious. I could have eaten the whole tray on my own. They do come 4 in an order and there were 5 of us, so just a warning--- may want to order two for large groups so everyone gets one.  My co-workers enjoyed the Brussel sprouts a lot, however, I am not a soy sauce person and they had a taste reminiscent of soy sauce.  For dinner I had the slow roasted short rib and it was delicious, melted right in my mouth.  The kale salad was a hit with two of my co-workers as was the  mushroom braise. I would come here again for a meal.
So many vegan and vegetarian options and gluten-free. Try the lemon pancakes  with the berry juice delicious!

We had been to this restaurant a couple of times before and enjoyed it, so we decided to go there a third time. Shortly after finishing dinner, my stomach started cramping up and ended up havng diarrhea when I arrived home. I didn't think much of it, but I had given a little bit of my leftovers to my dog the next day and he got really bad diarrhea too, so that's when I figured out the culprit. I'm so traumatized that I don't think I'll ever go back to Beatrix, nor do I feel confident enough to  recommend it to anyone.
We loved this place! My husband suggested it when we had some friends in town for brunch and we were not disappointed! Declicious with great service!

We had a FANTASTIC brunch here. We ordered cocktails (, brunch entrees, and yummy desserts from their AMAZING baked goods display. The spicy chicken tinga dish was a huge hit, as were the cauliflower grits. Our server Neil was a rock-star: when I was torn about which treat to get, he assured me that if I was even slightly disappointed in the one he steered me toward, he'd replace it and that's exactly what happened. My Lemon Angel Food Muffin was incredible, as were the macaroons and croissants my friends got. Plus, we got a window along the open window on a gorgeous, sunny morning. Our only mild critique was that we had to wait 15-20 minutes despite having a reservation; they need to tighten up their table/reservations management. But, it was a tremendous brunch, and we are definitely repeating this visit!

pics.caption: That macaroon was probably our favorite ... sweet and light and and VERY filling!
The top of that muffin was wonderfully lemony and light!
The croissant was big and delicious!

review.des: Such a big fan of Beatrix! Went here Sunday morning for brunch at 10 (make sure you make a reservation; this restaurant is huge but it was packed full). Food, service, timing, everything was stellar. Never felt rushed at all. I had the steak chimichurri, which came with toast, eggs and hash browns. So yummy! And the steak was tender, flavorful and perfectly cooked. Highly recommend. This was also one of those places where I could have ordered literally anything on the menu and been happy. Every single thing sounded amazing. Definitely will be back!

The warm pot roast sandwich was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! Definitely a must try! I also had the pineapple margarita which had a perfect blend of salty and sweet. Very happy we chose this lunch spot!

pics.caption: Warm pot roast sandwich. The meat was so juicy and the cheese on top of the bread made every bite delicious!
Pineapple margarita with salt around the rim. So good!

review.des:
Went to Chicago to celebrate my birthday and this was on the top breakfast places in Chicago.
So I was like..Yassssss...
Made a resevation for Sept 12 but mistook it for Sept 13 and went there a day later.
However,they were kind enough to accomodate us and understood that we messed up the dates.
I got a dark chocolate cake on occasion of my birthday for free and that cake was so sinful,I can't explain in plain words.

We went there at 9:30 AM and it was already packed by then.
It is a very big place with lots of seating so we got a table right away.
I ordered the quinoa cake with poached egg on our server's recommendation and my husband ordered the Lemon pancakes.
Both were equally delicious although I am more in favour of pancakes and would highly recommend everyone to try it if you are there for breakfast.

I also ordered the Blue boost juice which had berries and mint and it was so refreshing and different.
I am in awe of this place and it truly deserves the best rating.
Definitely going there again if I am in Chicago

Beatrix never lets me down. Their food is always soo good and different. My friend and I made a reservation for Saturday and of course I was running late Bc of the traffic and rain they were accommodating and sympathetic. I always recommend this place to friends. It's one of the first places I ate at when I moved to Chicago. Keep up your food and customer service game is on point!!

5 stars isn't enough to rate Beatrix! The menu is ridiculous!!! Everything looked appetizing. Although we had to wait for about 45 minutes, the wait was worthwhile. Yes it can be a little crowded, but the place is great! I completely recommend Beatrix for a good weekend brunch.

pics.caption: Belgian Waffles with Strawberries and a Tequila Sunrise.

review.des: Great restaurant.   Healthy choices !   Loved everything I tried each time I went.  Can't wait to try other location!

My fav place to eat in Chicago!!! Apple ginger carrot snap juice enlightened Caesar with salmon and chili and chocolate glazed salmon are my absolute favorites! They deliver every time.You can't go wrong with Beatrix. I recently moved to Austin Texas and miss it dearly.It was my go to spot.

The boyfriend and I came here for my birthday dinner last week since I had bookmarked this place forever ago! I made a reservation on a Tuesday night at 5:30pm but it wasn't necessary.  The place didn't start getting busy until around 7.

Nick and I tried several of the drinks on their menu, but our favorites were the whiskey sour and the lychee lemonade (with St. Germain in it).  We decided to split the butternut squash soup to start. It was flavorful and very light (no heavy cream). Nick ordered the chimichurri steak and I ordered the short rib. The steak was PHENOMENAL and the sauces it came with were on point. My short rib was tender and flavorful, but I wasn't a big fan of the sauce that was on it. (I preferred my boyfriend's dish!) Our plates were enough to fill us up, but we definitely wanted to try some dessert!

After asking the waiter for a dessert menu, I started to get a tad inpatient when almost 10 min had gone by and we still had no menu. Then, to my surprise, he came out with their chocolate cake with a lit candle in it! What a thoughtful gesture, and it truly made my night! My boyfriend got the apple streusel and was enamored with it. (I think the desserts stole the show!)

Our experience overall was great and tasty, but we definitely paid for it! Expect to pay $40 a person for entree and drink. They supposedly have a phenomenal brunch here which we will have to check out soon!

This is my favorite restaurant in the city for many reasons- You can make reservations on OpenTable, the service is always good, the food is healthy and amazing.  So I've reviewed for here in the past but it was for dinner and I recently went for brunch.  My girlfriend and I split a couple dishes- there was some dish with grits as one of the highlights and I figured, why not try, its more adventurous than an omelet- it was amazing!  One of the best brunch dishes in a long time.  We also got Chiliqulies (sorry for the spelling) and it was good.  It was a serve yourself buffet type dish.  Was good but had nothing on the grits.  Great for groups, dates, girl brunches, you name it!

Great place! I actually discovered this place because of a suggestion from an App on my phone. Needed a place for lunch the next day & so decided to give it a try.

It's definitely a busy place, on weekends at least, so I strongly suggest reservations, even for lunch. Also, they switch from lunch to dinner menus at 2pm on Saturdays so keep that in mind!!

Honestly, everything was great. The potato salad deviled eggs were yummy, drinks were good & the service was spot on. Interior looks great & the tables are adequately spaced so you don't feel like you're a kid in the lunch room again!

The staff was very attentive and sat us promptly at our reservation time. Our food came fast and hot. Everyone really enjoyed their meals here. I got the prime burger and it was so well seasoned and salted it made my mouth water. Glad I gave one of Chicago's popular restaurants a try. I would love to come back and try one of their juices or coffees. My one friend got an iced Mexican coffee and it looked too good

My daughters and I recently visited Chicago and found Beatrix in Yelp. We were seated for brunch and had many questions due to a few dietary restrictions. You know you're in the right place when the waitstaff has commanding knowledge of the menu and the kitchen prep. We were so grateful to have Emma as our waitstaff. She made excellent recommendations and was well versed on how the kitchen operates using separate surfaces. Any time staff has worked their way through a menu and knows the importance of important details, you have a winner. Emma's recommendations were spot on and all items were delicious! The fresh squeezed Blue Boost really got my attention with the hint of basil! We were so pleased with brunch on Saturday, we made a repeat visit on Sunday having apple cake and coffee.
Ps. Don't try to drop in for brunch without a reservation. It looked like a long wait.

I've only been for breakfast a couple of times but the food and service I received was great!!

Had the Spicy Chicken Tinga with egg whites instead. The Tinga is DELICIOUS. Done well, good kick, good flavors. Would definitely order this again.

Second time I ordered the Eggs Your Way with egg whites and chicken sausage. The chicken sausage was more like  chicken patties of ground chicken meat and something sweet in it. I wasn't expecting it to be sweet so my taking my first bite... left me with a surprise. I was 1. expecting links 2. expecting it to be savory. Was a little disappointed that it wasn't savory but it was still tasty.

Lattes are made with Intelligentsia and they almond milk!! A rare find sometimes.

Would come back again.
Beatrix is a hot spot for our family. We love the food and the bakery is excellent. They can get busy in the am. Bring some patience and you will not be disappointed.

This nice spot in River North has great healthy options - try out the blueberry&basil natural juice and the straight "A" salad, or if you're feeling hungry, get the yummy ravioli. Great for lunch and brunch!

Beatrix is great for a business lunch. They offer a variety of elevated American dishes including salads, sandwiches and pasta specials for very reasonable prices, especially considering the neighborhood. Also unique to Beatrix is their nitro coffee (highly recommend-- I even make special trips to get this in the morning) and fresh juices. I really enjoy the atmosphere and aesthetic of the restaurant-- super modern but warm and comfortable. When I visited I had the tomato soup and the kale salad, both were delicious. My only complaint is that you can't order a half portion of a salad or just a cup of soup (instead of a bowl). Not a major issue, but the portions are very generous and generally you wouldn't want to fill up at lunch (for fear of being sleepy at work)! Luckily my colleague and I split the soup (our server had no problem splitting it into two cups), and I took the other half of my salad for dinner.

Tips: If you are visiting for a business lunch I recommend telling your server you have 45-60 minutes so she/ he is timely and attentive. Our server was a bit slow and we had to flag her down a couple of times. Also, the place was already crowded when I arrived at ten til noon, so if you need to be seated right away I'd try to get in when they open (11:30am).

Had a really great meal here. The atmosphere and the food are cool but casual. They have some really nice cocktails made from their fresh juice selection. We got ginger sangria and a whiskey sour and liked them both, very refreshing and not too sweet. For food we got the short ribs and the ravioli (really raviolo singular, one giant pillow). Both were excellent. We'd come back here any time. I hear brunch is their big thing actually, so we'll have to try that next.
The lemon pancakes were to die for! Our server was friendly and accommodating and the general feel for the place was great and hip for a Saturday brunch!

I like Beatrix and even shared an Instagram post praising the selection, but this particular location has the worst service. I would gladly trek further north to go to the other locations and avoid this one. I walk in asking if they have cafe options like the other Beatrix's and they say no. I then ask if they have matcha cupcake and voila, the cafe appears behind them. I chalked that up to simple miscommunication. I then wait in a long line for service, where they attend to each customer from credit card swipe, to signature to going back and making their coffee/juice etc., averaging about 2 minutes per customer. Interesting. The gentleman in front of me paid, signed receipt and waited for his coffee, got it, and left all before the cashier looked my way. I was in a fairly decent mood, observing the busy lunch atmosphere. When I get to the register, the cashier doesn't take my card, she snatches it. I figure she is trying to move things along. Okay. She then gets my bakery item and doesn't hand it to me. She holds on to it. Waiting, waiting. Oh, look the receipt printed. My card went through. Glorious. She still holds onto my card? I was standing there with my wallet open and my purse open hoping to start putting things away so I could quickly clear space for the next customer like I usually do at Starbucks. I don't like to linger and hold up other customers. 45 seconds go by. Cashier finally hands back my card, bakery item and receipt with a pen for my signature all at once?  Within seconds and before I sign and hand back the merchant copy of the receipt, the cashier asks the woman next to me, "What can I get for you Miss?" The woman is covered by the bakery window so she has to lean over me to order. I ask the cashier if I can have 5 seconds at the register to finish signing the merchant copy of the receipt and put my credit card away that she held on to for so long. She appeared confused as if I should have ordered a coffee if I wanted the "head start" special. I called the restaurant afterwards and the manager was of course very apologetic and explained that the inefficiency at the register was custom and I was a rare casualty so there's that... Next time, I will be quicker, to walk past this location.

A River North corner location, eclectic industrial chic decor and walls open to the bustle on the street make this large space trendy, energetic and welcoming. Dining near us were couples and groups of friends and business associates. Everyone seemed happy. The noise level was slightly loud.

Everything I ordered was really good, starting with the potato salad filled deviled eggs on a nicely spicy creamy base. The potato salad was creamy, tangy, not too sweet, not too bland. The pork shank was meaty and tasty, maybe a tad dry, but the reduction sauce balanced it. The pork was served atop a bed of mashed potatoes permeated with sauce, and surrounded with in-season baked Michigan peaches. Truly an inspired Fall entree.

My spouse's crusted and pounded chicken breast was very tender and moist. It was described as lemon chicken and was too one-note for his taste but I thought it was good. For dessert we tried the vanilla bean kulfi served with a simple mango and pistachio chutney. It was just the thing to finish a very nice meal.

Love most of the food here. The lemon pancakes and omelette is really good, make sure to try the bulletproof coffee if you're a coffee person. The only downside is there can be a very long wait for breakfast

Overall: healthy, but flavorful options in a vibrant atmosphere  

Likes:
- Similar to most LEYE restaurants, this place has a great gluten free menu
- There are a lot of healthy options on the menu (e.g. Spaghetti squash instead of pasta or Quinoa cake instead of English muffin). Despite being healthy, the dishes are flavorful. I really like the quinoa cakes for breakfast (healthier version of eggs Benedict) and spaghetti squash rage for dinner
- High energy with trendy ambiance

Gripes:
- Service was a bit slow for both brunch and dinner
- The cost for the amount of food you get is not great, but I'm thankful that their portion sizes are reasonable!

I went to Beatrix over the weekend for brunch and the place is packed. We had a reservation for 3 people, but  they won't sit us until everyone got there. Otherwise, I would have given them a 5 star. I had the waffles and they were cute and delicious!

pics.caption: A Wonderful White Egg Omelette, Spicy Chicken Tinga, Belgian Style Waffle

review.des: Terrible experience. Mediocre food, service is slow, impersonal and lacking. Our server didn't get one round of orders correct. Definitely will not be going back.

I went to Beatrix early July. It was a lovely atmosphere and the waitstaff was very nice. Dinner was good but nothing memorable. The thing I remember the most was the dessert. The Oh My! Caramel Pie was amazing. I had it in July and I'm still thinking about it in September. Will return one night for dessert and drinks.

We were just walking around before calling it a night in our hotel and ran into this place... and man were we happy we did! The food and service were equally amazing! The flavors in the dishes we ordered were delicious. The wait staff was extremely knowledgeable. When are meal came out they explained the ingredients that actually made up the dish so you knew exactly what you were eating.
Wish I didn't live 2 hrs away because I would be hitting this place up all the time! Might have to make a special trip just to enjoy this amazing place!
Great service! This was my first visit & I'll definitely be back. I tried A Wonderful Egg White Omelette & Blue Boost both were delicious!

I was looking for a place in river north to have dinner for my birthday, and a friend recommended this. My boyfriend and I made a reservation for 8pm on a Friday, which was good, because it was pretty busy. We started out with the hummus and some red wine. Not gonna lie, I had to look at the menu for quite a while trying to decide what sounded best. I even had to google something...I'm not fancy. The waitress recommended the short rib, so I went with it and my boyfriend had the skirt steak chimchurri. His was pretty good, but oh my gosh, my short rib was awesome!! I could practically cut it with a spoon, it was so tender and delicious! We skipped dessert (cupcakes at home), but service was great, drinks were good and food was AMAZING! I'm already thinking about going back.

Everything was perfection. Blueberry mimosas (definitely the best flavor- we tried all 3), amazing spicy Bloody Mary's, and the spicy chicken tinga all exceeded our expectations. Our waitress, Jen, was THE BEST. Can't say enough good about this place. Definitely a must-try!

This place is on-point!

Was staying at Aloft nextdoor and came down here for breakfast each morning. They're quick, friendly, great food, and not too pricey!

Try the chicken tinga - very very good. They also have this cold brewed coffee that's on tap and pours like a guiness - really cool experience and great tasting too.

Manager great, food fantastic, service great. Only problem was valet. Don't park your car there, uber. It cost 35.00 if you're there one min over 3 hrs they really stick it to you. Husband in a wheelchair so everything takes longer. Don't drive there!!!!! It's like watching a ticking time bomb throughout your meal, not fun.

I've been here a number of times and I absolutely love it. Wonderful service, great menu, and the food is freaking amazing. I love the unexpected ingredients, fresh pressed juices, and they make a great martini. There's an awesome gluten free menu, and I've loved everything I've tried here. I've been here for date night, brunch with friends, and even a board meeting-- great for all occasions. Everything is fresh and delicious, and extra props to them for helping me out in a tight spot for a business meeting reservation. Definitely make reservations. Worth every penny. :)

I came to Beatrix because I was looking at places to meet a friend near the mart. A co-worker recommended Beatrix, plus I've never had a bad experience with Ley. So we gave it a shot.

We had no reservations but were meeting for dinner on a Wednesday night at 6PM, so I didn't think there's be any trouble-- there wasn't. We were seated immediately and our waiter was very attentive. Although he spoke really fast, he was knowledgable! He gave us his recommendations on appetizers, entrees, fresh squeezed juices and brews.

I ordered the crunchy kale salad with chicken and my friend ordered the burger. She said it was good, but I didn't try it. Looked pretty decent though. My salad was great, although I didn't necessarily like the crunchy kale part. It seemed a bit too saturated in oil. As long as I picked around those pieces, the mixture of dates, papaya, pumpkin seeds, parmesean, kale and green was really pleasing. We didn't get desserts, but everything look pretty good.

Not too expensive for a River North restaurant, good service and healthy options. Wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but would definitely go back!
Great service, a great decor, friendly check in staff and an extensive breakfaxt menu beatrix did not disspoint!

Dropped in on a Saturday around noon, place was packed. We were wonderfully served at the bar, which was very comfortable. I had the eggs with bacon, hash browns, and mini waffles w/ creme fraiche - definitely hit the spot (the sugar browned bacon was heavenly!). The hubby had steak and eggs, which he enjoyed. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was lively, fun, and friendly. I live in LA so this was a great place to relax and fuel up before hitting the shops on Michigan.

I LOVE this place. The Caramel Pie is literally what I dream about when I go to sleep at night.

I've had their kale salad, the roast chicken sandwich on the lunch menu, and chicken wellington when it was a special one night. I would order all of them again, starting with the chicken sandwich, because it tasted like thanksgiving on a delicious bun.

I would highly recommend Beatrix. I love it.

I will definitely come back to Beatrix.  I came because of a recommendation from a friend who lives in Chicago (I'm from SF).  I got the blueberry fruit drink to start and it was delicious.  It didn't taste too organic, just real good.  I got the quinoa mushroom burger and it had great flavor.  I wasn't really sure what to expect, maybe a burger with quinoa and mushrooms on top. Nope! It was a burger made out of quinoa and mushroom as well.  I would absolutely recommend it because it turned out to be delicious.

Reservations for 9 am on Saturday morning and the place was already starting fill up. Menu has lots of great options for all types of diners with restrictions. The Ginger Snap juice was delicious and my husband had the Bulletproof coffee (coffee with butter and coconut oil) which was surprisingly tasty.  

If you are there for brunch make sure to get a side of Brown Sugar Bacon and potatoes.  

I would recommend getting a reservation, the place was incredibly crowded by the time we left. Atmosphere is great, but not ideal for having a super leisurely breakfast or brunch.

Redemption. Whether you're religious or just an optimistic American, it's always a good story. I had seen a demo once by a Beatrix chef at another location, and eaten the five star fruits of her labor. I had gone there for the first time for a weekday lunch and gave it three, because of a couple glaring holes in my experience. But a Saturday brunch with a good friend was a solid five stars.

It was a risky endeavor to return here, given that it was a special occasion and we were celebrating multiple occasions: my friend's new job, new apartment and upcoming birthday; and my belated birthday. A bottle of Champagne was in order as a liquid appetizer. My friend's egg white omelette, holding the  bacon so as not to sully her vegetarian principles, put a smile on her gorgeous face. My green chili enchiladas did the same, except to my average Joe--make that John--face. I love a good roasted poblano pepper, and though I'm not a fan at all of the food-hipster, trendy, really-a-nettlesome weed that is called kale, my bet that it would add nutrients with little of its toxic taste was a good one. While the poblanos, pepper-jack and Chihuahua were fighting the good fight with great taste, the star was the rich flavor of the green chili sauce that roped the flavors together like a suave Mexican cowboy at a tasteful rodeo. We also shared the avocado toast, which was served on hearty bread that complemented the creamy goodness of that smooth aphrodisiac.

My previous complaint about skimpy portions of beef on bun did not apply to this visit, and I had no problem with competition between hearing my companion and too-loud music. Part of this might have been because it was a perfectly gorgeous day, and the restaurants openness to the outdoors may have made the room less lively. Traffic noise was not a problem, despite the busy street outside. A good place to enjoy the outdoors without being on the street side tables.

We finished the meal with a couple of their unique coffees. My Greek-born, Aphrodite companion had the icy Freddo, to bring a flavor of home to her taste buds, and it was delicious. I tried the Nitro, which was a new taste sensation for me.

Our server was fantastic. He gave us good recommendations for our taste buds, and gave us a fascinating explanation of the coffee choices, moving from the beans to the preparation to the taste components. It was also the end of the rush, and he stopped to chat and despite in spite of his youth, he was erudite on a number of subjects, especially music, as he is has begun an interesting program in that art at Columbia College. I wrote his name down on a piece of paper to compliment him here; alas, the piece of paper got lost in the shuffle at home. Hopefully, I'll find it and add it here.

This is one of my favorite places to eat!
Great coffee, pastries, breakfast, lunch an dinner.
Friendly Manager John who creates the music playlists. Great music. Cool Decor.

I can't help it but come back to Beatrix each time I'm in Chicago. This is probably the 4th time I've eaten here since I always stay at a nearby hotel, and once again it did not disappoint. I don't even mind ordering the same thing each time because it's always that good. I've tried most of the items on the menu at this point and everything is always fresh and delicious. I love me some Beatrix! :)
This place was delicious! We had the quinoa patties with poached eggs and cauliflower and poached eggs. The service was outstanding. Great experience- Highly recommended!

This is the 3rd time I've been to this restaurant.  I came back twice because I liked their salad entrees, they were made from fresh greens, not with nutrition-free lettuce.  Served with chicken or fish and was just the right proportion and portion. They only get 3 stars because of the high noise level.  I don't recall that they even had music the last two times I was here.  A nice quiet dinner with good conversation turned out to be a shouting match fighting to be heard.  The atmosphere is okay if they were serving bar food but just totally wrong for the food on their menu, so unfortunate.

Delicious food and extra friendly staff. They know how to do it right here! Ambiance was casual but you can definitely still take a date here. I ordered the Tsukune as a app (moistest chicken meatballs I ever had) and the Brioche Crusted Branzino was my main (this was so smart as we all want the crispy skin and the crust made it crispy!). The flavors were on point and temperature was perfect. Portions were also much bigger than I thought so that by the time I got to the caramel pie, I couldn't finish it. The pie really had that caramel taste which I was surprised by. I thought it might just take like sugar. It was heavy though and the entire meal kept me full until lunch time the next day. I rarely give restaurants 5 stars but this place really exceeded my expectations.

Delicious and healthy! I stopped by for lunch after checking into our hotel. They don't offer a lot of choices on their menu but everything we ordered was great. I got  soup and the chicken sandwich. They also have a cute coffee and juice bar. Next time I would for sure try one of their juices.

After a long day of traveling I was hoping for a descent meal. I'm a vegetarian and was expecting a very average dinner. What I got was amazing, the guy who took my order was knowledgeable, the meal was delivered quickly, and the quality of the food was really remarkable. I can't wait to eat here again during my week in Chicago!

Those Melman Bros sure are taking over Chicago's restaurant scene. Light meal options, love that. Crispy Kale salad is great, light, just the right amount is flavor & a generous portion. Quinoa app was good but a little spicy so beware if you don't want spice. Atmosphere open and comfortable. Feels like a large trendy diner in a way. They had a great list of healthy fresh juice options that looked really refreshing.

Great place for lunch and ok for dinner. We wanted a light dinner so it worked out perfect for us.

Wondeful restaurant located on the corner of clark and grand. I orderef the blue booster fresh juice, it was excellent and refreshing!! For brunch I had the pot roast sandwich which was delicious. The meat had some fat on it, which normally is super gross for me, but this fat was super soft and melted in our mouth, so for once I could agree that it brought flavor to the meat... all in all I woukd order the same meal but when I go back I'll try something new!!

This place is very friendly. The music, food and service are all relaxed and fun.

I had the gazpacho and pot roast. Have you ever had in your mind what you wanted and then tasted and experienced it? That was my meal. It was exactly what I wanted.

The pot roast was rich in flavor and not full of fat or gristle. The kale and cauliflower were delicious as well. The gazpacho was light but not lacking flavor.

Cheers guys, Pat S. Here.

The other day my mother, Frinda, and my father, Skinny Pete, offered to take me out to dinner. Of course I accepted their generous offer. I suggested we go to the new Let-Us-Enner-Tain U® Restaurant, BEATRIX. My dad became furious, and after a brutal spanking I was grounded for four weeks.

Four weeks later, Frinda and Skinny Pete approached me with the same offer. I again suggested BEATRIX and was once again banished. I am 34 years old and lost my job because of this. Another four weeks passed and I no longer had a job and having my parents pay for a meal was more important than anything. I again suggested BEATRIX. Apparently my father was in a pretty serious para-sailing accident while I was grounded. Reservations to BEATRIX were booked!!

The major problem with BEATRIX is that it isn't actually a restaurant, but a hotel lobby. They trick you. I'm not sure what they're trying to go for here. You got big globe lamps and chairs that are hideous colors and also shaped like eggs. Maybe this is where the chef lays his eggs. There are TVs showing "news" and idk 3 stars

Came here for brunch on a Saturday. The place was completely packed with a few waiting outside in the drizzle. We were 15 minutes late for our reservation, but were seated immediately. Overall, we liked the decor, but the tables are little close together.

I ordered the steak chimichurri with eggs and my girlfriend got the 3-grain arugula salad. The salad was fantastic, well dressed, quite filling and lots of chicken.

Unfortunately, the steak chimichurri was disappointing: the toast arrived cold and a little soggy, the poached eggs had a completely set yolk and, in my opinion, a steak chimichurri should actually be served with chimichurri. (Okay, so maybe my preferred ratio of ~500mL chimichurri/standard sized empanada is a little more than standard preferences would dictate, but a smattering of wilted chopped parley barely visible on the surface of ~4oz of meat does not a steak chimichurri make.) The hashbrown tasted strangely of whole wheat bread, something which I cannot otherwise explain.

And I was hungry at the end. =(

The service was speedy considering the crowds, but the waitress did a poor job of explaining the specials leading us to believe that the salsas displayed prominently at a nearby table were complimentary, when they were in fact they were part of a $13 buffet option. Maybe I was just addled by hunger and a need for additional sauces to fill the horrible void in my heart that is no chimichurri.

The total came to $40 including tip and two coffees, which seemed a little excessive. (Or maybe lolcat salaries are just not what they were in the '00s, because the guy at the adjacent table with a Rolex seemed perfectly content.)

TLDR: Meh, meow meow meow. Time for a McDouble.

Went here for brunch and ordered the quinoa cakes, not sure what to expect, and they were amazing.  So delicious I ate my whole plate in a few minutes.  Beatrix is a very popular place and the little bakery they have inside is a hidden gem.

Another Melman family success! After the sticker shock from the nine dollar coffee, I ordered the Caesar salad and the burger with all the options ticked; avocado, bacon, fried egg, undercoating, floor mats... I'm an up seller's dream customer! Perfectly fried egg, delicious avocado and thick juicy and crunchy bacon. Washed it all down with a banana and dark chocolate latte (which was surprisingly only $5).
 After all that caffeine and red meat, I went home and walked the dog. Then I washed the car, cleaned the carpets, painted the house, reshingled the roof and swam across lake Michigan.
  Tonight I will dream of bacon burgers, and nine dollar coffees :)

Came here for breakfast on a Saturday morning, and while it was abuzz with activity, the hostess was very pleasant and we were seated right away. Our server came to our table immediately with water, and offered coffee and menu options/suggestions. We ordered the Spicy Chicken Tinga and the grits with cauliflower and Brussel Sprouts. Both dishes were delicious and creative!!! I would definitely recommend Beatrix and I plan to return at another time to try other items on the menu!

Great food! The staff is extremely friendly. The atmosphere and location only adds to the wonderful experience this restaurant offers its customers.

I had the quinoa cakes. It is under the appetizer portion of the menu, but it filled me up. The quinoa is baked, topped with a delicious sauce, and served toasty warm!

The cookies are huge and well worth indulging in!

I dream about them every day. i ask my husband to take me there, but parking is so rough down town. but its worth it. their caramal pie was out of this world. it's pure silk.  the salmon was terrific and the salad wonderful. good portions too!

I had a meal at Beatrix, because it is in the area and also happens to be a LEYE restaurant.  I had $40 in rewards to use when I went.  I have to say they were very accommodating.  We had reservations for 10 pm and we got there about 5 minutes late.  Their kitchen closed at 10 that night but they allowed us to get seated and still made our meal.  The juices were amazing and fresh.  The burger I had was served with gidenera, but it was lightly pickled so that was still nice and crisp, vibrant and slightly spicy.  I love that the food is created with a eye towards being fresh and health concious.  Combine that with the nice ambiance, and you have a good place to go to in an area where so many restaurants disappoint you by trying to be night clubs.

"Where's a good place to take a woman on a blind friend date in River North that isn't too expensive?" I yelled from my desk one afternoon. People yelled back Beatrix, but not before asking about what strange circumstance I'd found myself in, going on a blind friend date (but that's another story).

I made reservations because I make them anywhere that will take them (I recommend you do the same).

This place has kind of a multiple personality disorder, in a good way. It's part of the Aloft, so it's part hotel restaurant, park coffee/pastry shop and part bar. All these things work well together, and if you weren't really observant, you might not even notice the different areas.

There's a bunch of fresh juices, and you can add whatever booze you'd like to it. There's also some pretty tasty cocktails. I tried the vodka dew, which was a melon and Ketel drink.

I had the pork shank, which had some delicious carmelized sweet potato and apple with it and, I think some kind of polenta as well. Very tasty and tender. Decent portion.

I had an angel food cupcake for dessert, which I though was really blah. The frosting on it was kind of grainy.

Overall, I think this is a three and a half star place. I wish I would've tried an appetizer or a different dessert. I liked my meal but I wasn't totally wowed. I'd definitely be willing to try it again. The service was good--the waiter was kind of flirty, in a positive way.

Beatrix is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the downtown area. They always have fresh and yummy lunch specials, and their dinner is fantastic. I can't talk enough too about their oh my caramel pie and perfect salads and entrees! Everything you order here is great!
Great, delicious food and a good drink selection, however the food seemed a little bit pricey for what you get. Still worth a try though!

We've been here for lunch and dinner, and it's a bit of an unknown gem.  Reservations are usually available, and you won't be disappointed by the food!

Service:  A little bit slow (often have to wait for waiter/waitress to come by) but otherwise nice.  

Ambience: modern, very open restaurant.  Not too loud so it's great for meeting up with friends and chatting.

Food:  The juices are absolutely amazing here; for dinner, they can spike them with some liquor.  The veggies are all pretty nice here, especially the golden beet carpaccio.  And definitely order the neatloaf and the pot roast (it literally breaks apart in your mouth)!

Tucked inside Aloft hotel, this cozy restaurant is perfect for solo dining while people watching, or with a gang of your favorites for some amazing food. Perfect place for business gatherings or business meetings over f&b.

Two different bars to sit at if you choose to go that route, or plenty of tables in their comfortable, homey environment. For breakfast, try your hand at their famous Bullet Coffee (it'll be the best $9 coffee you'll ever buy, if not the only time you spend $9 on coffee). Pair that with their outstanding vanilla yogurt parfait while you're at it. Or a fresh-squeezed juice concoction.

You can't go wrong with anything on their menu, a lot (if not all?) of it is organic. And kale on kale topped with kale with a side of kale.

Highly recommend this place, especially if you are staying at the hotel. Good bar service to catch a game or socialize, and food available there as well.

I can't stop bringing people here. Location great, ambiance delightful, decor divine, staff so friendly, coffee bar and that graham cracker latte amazing, and lastly the food- not a single dish you can go wrong with. Great bold flavors, unique plates, good amount of variety, fresh ingredients- just overall perfect spot for brunch. Only downfall, the wait on the weekends. But you can alway grab a latte and juice while you wait ;)

I've already given Aloft hotel a 5 star review, and Beatrix was a huge contributing factor. This restaurant ROCKS!!!! Their menu is amazing & I was pleasantly surprised to see such creative & health conscious options that are sure to appeal to anyone. The space is pumping and is super trendy. When we came down on Sunday for brunch, the place was PACKED and the wait was about an hour. My recommendation would be to make a reservation ahead of time if that's the time you want to dine here. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area...it's REALLY worth it!

I came here for late night before and liked the sense of Healthiness of the restaurant.  Came back for brunch the past Saturday.  It is very nice that it took reservation for brunch. The green power juice tastes very healthy but the celery is too heavy.  They serve intelligentsia coffee. Buy it does not taste as strong as the one u could get in Intelligentsia store.  The potato salad deviled egg is a fresh start.  Potato salad is very smooth and u can taste Yolk . House made waffle came in four small ones and they are  cute . The egg taste is very strong.  Chicken tinga  is spicy and tasty. A little bit too tasty for early morning but very delicious.  Gold has brown is crispy. My friend loves it .

pics.caption: House made waffle & chicken tinga & hash brown & green power

review.des:
We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday with brunch and had no troubles getting an 11:15 reservation on a Saturday (granted, we called a few weeks ahead of time).

The space itself is very nice with interesting decor and light fixtures. And the place is deceptively small-looking from the outside. Inside, there is plenty of room with many, many tables. There was no wait when we got there, nor when we left. There is an outdoor area, but we weren't sure the rain would hold off (it did), so we chose a table inside, though right at the open air edge of the restaurant.

I started with a coffee, which was quite tasty. I eyed the morning cocktails, and all looked delicious, but I did not partake. I also thought about the iced coffee, but was very content with what I got.

To eat, I had the spicy chicken tinga. It was great, and there was so much of it! The chicken "chili" packed a little bit of heat, but the tortillas, eggs, and avacado balanced it out.

Because everyone's dished looked so good, we all sampled each other's. My favorites were my order, the quinoa cakes (kind of like an eggs benedict on quinoa cakes), and the lemon-blackberry pancakes, which were the fluffiest I've tasted.

I'd definitely go again.

This is definitely a go to in my book - great drinks (alcoholic if non alcoholic) and quality food. I have not had a bad meal and have enjoyed lunch and dinner on many occasions. Dessert is always good too - get the chocolate cake. Oh, and it is a lettuce entertain you resty so download the app for free points! Well worth it and I never have a problem getting a reservation.

We ate here while on vacation for a weekend in Chicago. This was my first time to the city and I've read about all the great restaurants in town. Landed on Beatrix because of the menu and also table availability (reserved last minute).

Atmosphere fit our style. Casual in the sense that you could dress up or down and not really feel out of place.

Wait staff was excellent. Our waitress was really busy and got tied up with other tables right when we were ready to order. The bartender noticed and brought us the drinks we had ordered and then took our orders.

We shared the Caesar salad to start. I had the pork shank and she had the salmon. All three were very tasty but the pork shank really stood out for me. I wouldn't definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a big cut of tender flavourful pork.

We didn't get dessert because we were too full but it looked like they had some good choices for a sweet tooth.

The reason why I'm holding back a star is because of the drink menu. They seemed to have house made juice as their thing which just doesn't jive with me for dinner. The didn't have any draft beers, only bottles of somewhat typical Chicago beers and the house cocktail menu was fairly short for the lady.

I recommend giving it a try. If they rounded out the drink menu I'd likely bump it to a 5 out of 5.

i love beatrix. food is perfectly portioned, and always healthy. i also love this spot for lunch/ brunch because it's so bright and has a great daytime vibe.

one thing that drives me INSANE every time i go: we always have the check dropped on us the second we're done with our food. without our server asking us if we want anything else, like coffee/ dessert. i know it's brunch, but half the reason we come is because the caramel pie. it's obviously something that's passed down by management because we've been a dozen times or more (we're also Lettuce Entertain You loyalty members) and it feels inconsiderate and rude. i know brunch gets busy, but we're loyal customers....the least they can do is exhaust all sales by asking if the table would like anything else before dropping the check.

What a refreshing place in the city!  Light and airy, the whole place reminds me of my favorite dish there - the quinoa cakes benedict.  The perfect combination of hearty, yet healthy.  Beautiful, yet very approachable.  

Even though its a bit expensive, you must try ANY of their freshly squeezed juice combinations.  Strawberry watermelon is currently my favorite!  Prompt and helpful service with passion about the restaurant and they menu.

Can't wait to go back and enjoy some more patio seating and refreshing food.

Great atmosphere. The music was such that I kept using Soundhound to pick out the artists. I had the braised pot roast with egg sandwich. It had a jalapeño relish on the side, which really added to the flavor. My wife ordered the lemon pancakes, which turned out to be a bit of a disappointment. She said the plate itself was super hot throughout the meal and everything tasted like it came out of a microwave. We both had the brown sugar bacon for an additional side, and it was excellent. Outside of the pancake debacle, it was an enjoyable breakfast.

In spite of the predictability of "eggs your way" and Caesar salad, there are some adventurous offerings that are definitely worth a try. The Shakshouka (spicy tomato sauce, poached eggs, feta & kale) and the poached farm egg truffle pasta provided for taste bud salsas. ( FYI I'm a fan of everything poached except for parking spots and game).

Hip atmosphere, comfy seating, great lighting and fantastic food make this a LEY spot worth frequenting especially for variations on the poached egg.

Food - amazing. Wish the portions were a bit bigger. I was left hungry with their small "eggs your way" plate so decided to order a pastry - which took the waitress 20 min. to come back with even though we were seated right in front of the coffee bar. She clearly forgot about it but played it off as she hadnt. Im giving it 3 stars because the service we received from our waitress was just BAD. She took way too long for everything. Luckily the server/bus boys brought our food at a good time. But the waitress took 40 min to ask if we wanted more coffee and just overall hardly checked back on us. She wasnt even apologetic about it. We wouldve been out of there in half the time we were actually there (which wouldve benefited the restaurant seeing how long the line is to get in) but thanks to our waitress we wasted time just sitting around waiting for her.

I'm giving a 4.5 on the food!  And pending more tastings might go up to a 5.  I had the Korean BBQ chicken special with a quinoa veggie salad.  The chicken was a little crispy which I love, the flavor on the chicken was so good I kept forgetting to dip it in the Korean BBQ sauce which was also divine.  It wasn't just the standard Korean BBQ sauce either, there was more texture and a lighter flavor to it.  The quinoa and veggie salad was a cold salad which I didn't expect but loved it.  It was nice and lemony, a little sweet, had crisp carrots, kale and other veggies.  It went perfect with the chicken.  I'm craving my whole dinner now!  

Loved the atmosphere too!  The service was friendly and fast.   I'd definitely recommend it and I'm going back again to try the rest of the menu.

This is the perfect place to nurse a hangover or get it on for boozy brunch. Do note that Beatrix is packed at 10/11am on a Sunday morning- make sure you make reservations beforehand. Overall phenomenal service and delicious food. Loved the spicy chicken tinga and quinoa cakes with poached eggs. Pretty healthy, I know.

I came here for an early dinner right after leaving the office. I sat at the bar and tried one of the special menu items for that week. It was a chicken Sharma Mediterranean fusion meal, loved it. Staff was attentive and friendly. Great river north location.

had a delicious dinner here... crispy kale salad, pork shank, pot roast served perfectly. a tip to check out their plentiful bar seating if there is a wait; we scored two seats in the bar area right in front of the kitchen... the plus was getting to see every dish prepped and brought out before we ordered. it was like our own private preview of the menu....although we heard "order" being shouted every now and then ;) the minus is that service in this part of the dining room was quite slow. we waited 15 min to get our water refilled after asking twice, leaving us disappointed... and thirsty!

overall, a lovely meal. delicious food. would return.

pics.caption: pot roast with whipped cauliflower, kale, pearl onions.

review.des: I wish I could comment on the food, but after the restaurant clearly didn't care enough to try to seat us despite our reservation, we ended up leaving to eat elsewhere. We'd made a reservation for 12 at 1:30, and all showed up 10 minutes before. After waiting until 2 for our table, where the previous customers apparently had finished and paid but were just hanging around with no intention of leaving, we gave up. The staff made no attempt to try to accommodate us at all, no attempt at any real customer service.

Was on a business trip to Chicago and got in a little late and after some hunting around ended up here. The wait for a weekend wasn't bad about 30 mins or so. The staff from the host to the waitress were extremely helpful and could not have been more pleasant. I got the burger recommended to me by the waitress and I have to say it was incredible. The one huge factor that I found a disappointment was the fries, they tasted exactly like shoe string potatoes and were not at all appetizing. Oh! A must try is the house made sriracha and mayo, it's to die for. All in all I would visit again minus the fries.

Reservation for 10 people at 1:30 PM on a Sunday. Our full group arrives by 1:20 PM, and is told to wait. That's fine, we're a little early. 20 minutes later, we're told that the group sitting in our reserved seats have paid, but the restaurant needs to wait for them to leave. As a restaurant, it's your job to ensure that customers are leaving in order to seat the next batch of reserved seats. Our group waited until 2:00 PM, for a grand total of 30 minutes past our reservation, and weren't seated. That in addition to the eyeball rolling from waiters walking past our group waiting next to the doorway, means this place gets a solid 1 star for the poorest service possible. We left for a restaurant nearby that WAS willing to seat our group.
Delicious food! Best chicken dish I've ever had but the service/management was a little underwhelming.

Came here with a few friends mid-week.

THE GOOD: The space is nice, and there are some interesting and unique options on the menu. They appear to have an amazing selection of pastries and cookies.

THE MEH: I have to say, I was a little underwhelmed with the actual food. It wasn't bad, but it just felt very assembly-line, prefab to me - in presentation and in taste. I admit that I haven't been at many Lettuce Entertain You restaurants, and I don't know if this is a thing with them or just this kitchen.

It was overall a decent meal and evening. I may give this one another shot to see if it was just an off night.
Great brunch spot. from the juices to the entrees this place knows what its doing. It's been a while since I ate there but all I remember it was delicious!

Upon writing my review, about a day later the Beatrix team wrote a Yelp message to me apologizing for my experience. This alone would make me go back.

They went out of their way.

I would consider going back the next time I'm in Chicago.

Beatrix is a cool place. The ambiance is upbeat and fun. They have a diverse menu of foods you wouldn't find at other brunch joints. I tried the blue mimosa; it was different and really good. I wanted at least four more, but I needed to participate in life for the rest of the day, sadly. :)

The lemon pancakes and cauliflower grits with poached eggs were fantastic. It is a little pricey, but it was a good experience. Give this place a shot, but definitely make a reservation. Otherwise, you'll wait quite a bit.
Spicy Chicken tinga is my go to, this is my regular brunch place, and handily beats out Yolk dishes and haven't yet had to brave ridiculous lines. Great value, healthy, good scene.

Another Lettuce venture that works. From grade level parking lot to fine purveyor of turkey burgers, this spot is comfy, friendly and conveniently located downtown. Not sure what the sauce is but is a sweet and sour-y treat. Kudos for offering that tasty, moist quinoa salad as a French fry alternative. Lunch at the bar is a treat and be sure to check out that hunky server with the bedroom smile. And those huge chocolate chip cookies at the dessert bar. Nom! :-)

pics.caption: Excellent truffle mushroom risotto with walnuts.
Most excellent caramel pie... Like eating the best Brach's right off the line. :-p

review.des:
Vey good. We started with the power greens beverage which has kale, romaine, celery and apples. Very energizing. The eggs white omelette was light and filling. My partner had the lemon pancakes and he was extremely pleased. We also had some fresh fruit and berries with the ten grain oatmeal.

The ambiance makes for a quaint yet contemporary experience. The waitstaff were attentive and extremely welcoming.
Our breakfast was great we like the new location with less wait times. Our server Alex was great at conversation and very nice.

Beatrix is one of my favorite spots in river north. Their portion size is perfect. Food is delicious and not over spiced. My friend's favorite dish is ravioli, very rich. I ordered chicken Bebe, which was juicy and tasty. My favorite is their arugula salad though. Their wine list is good too.

This was PERFECT for a large goup! We had 18 girls go there this past Saturday night for a bridal dinner, and it went off without a hitch. Christine Cossette, their catering manager, was super responsive when it came to questions I had while planning the dinner. Our waitress, Olivia, was phenomenal and on point; always refilling waters and drinks, and tending to any other requests we had. The food was amazing! We had family style since it was a large party, and there was an abundant amount of food. I was worried there was not going to be enough, but if anything, there was TOO much! All of the girls were commenting on how great the food was - we had the fries, ceasar salad, and brussel sprouts to start (those were the best brussel sprouts I have ever had), and then the chicken bebe, chili & chocolate glazed salmon and ravioli for our entrees. SO GOOD! I honestly don't know what my favorite item was, becase they were all so tasty. People were definitely grabbing for seconds and even for thirds! Also, they allowed us to bring in our own cupcakes, as well as balloons. This made it really special for the bride so we were all very pleased. It can be a taunting task planning a large dinner like that, but everyone from Beatrix that was involved made it a seamless and stress-free night. Thank you all so much! :-)

I adore this place and stop in often, sometimes for a full meal, other times just for coffee or a fresh fruit/veggie juice to go. Beatrix serves both Intelligentsia and Metropolis coffee and the baristas are friendly and competent. Their pastry counter is filled with delicious baked goods. My fave is the cinnamon roll, warmed up a little. Yum!

For dinner I like the pot roast plate and for breakfast, Beatrix serves a pot roast and egg sandwich, which is delish. I also really like the 3 grain salad with arugula and chicken. I've tried a number of other menu items and haven't been disappointed. The food is fresh and well-prepared. Service is friendly and efficient.

The restaurant is clean and spacious and the ambience is cool yet comfortable. I notice management present whenever I'm there, which I really like. I can't say enough nice things about this place. I love it!

Brunch at Beatrix is a great alternative to Chicago standbys like Yolk. The menu is insanely diverse, and very, very veggie friendly.  I'm just as likely to order lunch as I am breakfast during a brunch, and there are plenty of options on both fronts. I had the quinoa burger, which was one of the best veggie burgers I've had in recent memory. The fries were probably the weakest element of that plate, and they were not too bad.  The cauliflower grits are worth a try. The egg-pepper sandwich did not get positive reviews - is it supposed to arrive cold? We never got a straight answer.  But, man, the veggie burger is really good.  And the energy of the place is great on a weekend morning.  Of course, that means its going to be busy and you should make reservations (you can use Open Table). With our reservations we still waited 10 or so minutes. In fact, the front of the house staff were the worst part of the experience.  They were simply unfriendly.  The service was otherwise quite good.  Highly recommended!

Dropped in for lunch on Tuesday. No problem getting in.  Service was very good.  We loved the pot roast sandwich.  Fries with it were quite good.  The hummus was decent--the pita (on the menu they called it naan) was good.  The tsunke with chili sauce was good--greagt sauce. I felt the chicken meatballs were a tad bit greasy.  The blackberry-basil smash was delightful.

Best breakfast I have had in a while!
Get the Chicken Tinga! Friendly service, great coffee. I'm coming here every day while I'm in town!

Tired of all the delicious Chicago food but feel like you're getting fatter and clogging arteries with every bite into a juicy steak or decadent dessert? Well come here. Tasty, healthy options with great service and nice ambience! Enjoy! Nice options for every kind of diet. And the presentation is on point. Great if you're someone who is on the road a lot, eats out too much and just want to feel like you're doing something to stay in shape.
Great for breakfast meetings -- attentive service, inventive & delicious food, and a good atmosphere that doesn't disrupt the flow of conversation.

LOVE this place! I come to Chicago often and tried this place for the first time. Excellent food and excellent customer service. Everything was very satisfactory. Would recommend this place to all my friends and family.

I have been here for a private event, with a large group, and just with a girlfriend and all of these experiences have been quite positive. Everything tastes fresh and light - healthy for restaurant food without compromising on taste. The fresh juices are great and you can even make them boozy if you want. :) The staff are always super friendly.

If you really want to indulge, the mountains of baked goods should suffice. Overall a great little spot in River North that is reasonably priced.
Overpriced for quality and quantity of food. Loud and overcrowded. Service was decent.

This was my second visit to Beatrix...they redeemed themselves. Great food, I had the Turkey Loaf with Sweet Potato with a Mash and Kelp Salad...it was the best I've had. The Burger was also exceptional.

Great service this time. Katrina was on par, and knew her Menu.

One of my favorite breakfast places PERIOD! I find myself constantly returning to Beatrix after discovering the gem a few months back. The staff is extremely friendly and is always going above and beyond especially for the volume of customers they deal with on a regular basis. The place is always clean and the food is always DELICIOUS! It's conveniently located on Clark and Grand with plenty of street parking nearby, however I wish they offered valet service. Regardless, this place deserves 5 starts all day for their amazing customer service and delicious food!

What I liked about Beatrix was that it was rather than beaing an overly fancy and arrogant restaurant, it created an atrmosphere that was classy but also served for that was quite delivious with its own twist.  The vegetables were frsh and crisp and the service was "with a smile."  The atmosphrere is somewhat modern, in refelction of the hotel it is a part of.

With the rview below that didn't like that one item changed on the menu it isn't fair to rank something so low just because one menu item changed.

Beatrix is a wonderful to take that special person or an out of town guest.  Recommend
Great brunch spot with awesome service! Our server made great recommendations and was personable

Creative healthy food is an interesting concept. Tried the cauliflower Milanese, something I've never tried before, and it was quite a pleasant surprise. The outside was nice & crispy and the inside was cooked perfectly. Avocado salad was nice but a tad overdressed (read:oily). Friend's gazpacho was refreshing and silky smooth. The apple strudel dessert was fantastic: perfectly flaky and warm. I'm usually not a healthy eater but this place I'd happily return.

Ate here for lunch with a co-worker and really enjoyed the food.  Had a really tasty turkey burger with a quinoa,  kale, and cranberry salad on the side.  Everything tasted really fresh and very flavorful.  I tried a couple fries too and they were awesome.  Not too soft, not too crispy.

Really cool atmosphere too.  It was a nice day out, so we got a seat in the open doorway and had some really comfy leather chairs.  Our waiter was very attentive too.

Prices seemed pretty reasonable for the food as well.

We were in Chicago last year and popped in for a drink.  I was so impressed with the blueberry basil smash (a fresh-squeezed juice) that we made a point of coming back during our next visit for food.  I am beyond grateful I didn't attempt to assuage the empty feeling in my stomach at Midway.

We ate lunch at the small bar.   On the beverage side, they offer fresh squeezed juice, craft beer, wine, creative cocktails.  On the food side, there are lots of unique and thoughtful options.  I could have ordered any number of things, but I decided on the Supernatural Chopped Salad.  I seriously could eat this every day for the rest of my life.  Fresh, crunchy, satisfying.  Great blend of flavors (greens, green beans, peaches, sunflower seeds, dried corn and more and more - just wow!).  I added chicken for a little protein.   Wonderful stuff.

To my great surprise, my typically meat-eating  husband ordered the Mushroom and Quinoa Burger, which came with fries.  The burger was tremendous.  Great flavor.  Very satisfying, yet not too heavy.  The fries were really good as well (yes, I usually try all my husband's food).

Beatrix has a bakery area - we ordered a cookie to split for dessert (the cookies are really big - one is a good size for 2 people).  The restaurant is attached to a hotel(we didn't stay in it).  

With all the great places to eat in Chicago, when we are in town we don't repeat very often, but Beatrix is definitely worth a repeat visit.

We were staying at the Aloft and noticed that this restaurant is busy at all hours of the day and night.  We made a couple of attempts to get reservations but didn't succeed.  Note that if you are staying on property, it gives you zero privileges here.  We called down one morning to see if we could get our name added to the "waiting list" for Sunday brunch and were told that we'd have to come down from our room and add our name to the list in person.  Lame!   After making a special trip down from the room just to get on the waiting list, we were paged about 45 minutes later.  The brunch menu looked good.. we may have just ordered the wrong items.  We ordered the fluffy lemon pancakes which were actually quite good.  The turkey bacon needs improvement though.  It tasted like it hadn't been cooked enough.  There IS a way to crisp up turkey bacon.. it doesn't need to taste mediocre.  We also ordered the egg white omelet which was just OK.  The place was a madhouse and our food took quite awhile to come out - we were just fine with that, but without being asked they sent fresh muffins to our table, which was a nice gesture.  Our server was great.  All in all, a so-so experience.

Ok! Inside the Aloft Hotel lies this place.  Don't mind the wait, it is so worth it.  Go take a look at their pastries at the bar.  Gluten Free included, for my wife.
Egg White, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Havarti Cheese with a sweet red pepper relish.  On Gluten Free bread.  Wife, rates it awesome!
Braised Pot Roast and Egg Sandwich with a jalapeno relish and a Chihuahua  cheese.  I rate it super awesome!
Drinks:
Carrot, Apple Ginger Snap - refreshing and tasty
Cherry Sangria - Super taste, had to have 2.
Server, Ryan was very informative and attentive to my wife's allergy and our taste.

This is my first time going to this restaurant and it's a part of lettuce entertain you restaurant. The restaurant is really nice from the outside and inside. The food was good but the portion wasn't enough compare to the other brunch places I have gone to. The prices was reasonable but not enough to eat for what u would pay for. I don't think I would come back here unless someone who I know have never try it want to try it.

I was surprised how much I liked this place. It's a bit of everything- hotel bar, coffee shop, bakery, cocktail joint, and apparently great spot for brunch.

After work on a Monday night, it was easy to find a table for two. The blueberry Tom Collins was refreshing and not so sweet that you could get a 12 year old drunk, the way a lot of fruity cocktails are concocted. It was also nice to see a dinner menu that offered many healthy but delicious-sounding options. I think we could all use a break from frying everything in duck fat garnished with pork belly and truffle oil. Instead you'll find quinoa, edamame, fresh hummus, organic chicken and pork, and fresh squeezed juice.

So if your friend needs to stick to her latest cleanse diet, and you're looking to drown your work week sorrows in a martini, this is the place to please you both!
Great service.  Wonderful food. Highly recommend Bea's cheese blintzes. Reservation recommended for weekend breakfast, but it's worth the wait if you have to.
One of my favorite brunch places in Chicago. The space emanates coolness and hipness; the service and food are always memorable.

I chose this place for a cousin reunion, party of hour.  The place itself is sleek, modern and sexy looking.  The menu is diverse and offers a variety of dishes different tastes or food allergies.  Seems like the menu changes based on what is available seasonally which is always an indicator of how fresh a restaurant's ingredients are.  Everyone loved their dishes and thought the service was great.  For dessert I highly recommend the Chocolate cake and I would recommend sharing it because it's very rich.  If I ever came back to Chicago I would definitely go back.

My first time here and the food was delicious and healthy! We had wonderful service, our waitress name was Jen and oh boy was she a delight! She was fast and on point and had the biggest smile on her face the entire time ( a lot of Chicagos restaurants have grouchy servers). Her recommendations were great!  
I recommended the restaurant, the server and food to many of my friends and family. For sure coming back for pancakes and Jen!

I cannot say good things enough about this place .we keep going there for coffee which is really good .the food is also very good .

My only reason for giving four star is their hot chocolate drink. When I got it, it was all syrup taste and was a disappointment . Writing this so hopefully they change the way they make it .

I met a colleague here for a business lunch and couldn't have picked a better impromptu spot! The menu offerings are healthy yet playful. My favorite was the tuna crudo appetizer. Our server Milos (pronounced Mee-loshe) was incredible!! Very attentive and made us feel very welcome. He made some great salad suggestions (I went with the Caesar salad with chicken) and even treated us to a post-lunch gluten-free triple chocolate cookie which was amazing, even if it was more of a brownie than a cookie (this gooey treat will definitely get stuck in your teeth)!!! He told us about the fantastic brunch cocktails as well... they have red (strawberry puree), orange (Valencia orange), and blue (blueberry) mimosas. I'll be coming back for brunch and/or dinner very soon! P.S. I had the ginger sangria with lunch and it was truly delish ;)

In town for work and staying around the corner. Came for a late lunch with the boss, who isn't as adventurous of an eater as I am. Online the menu looked great. The hostess was friendly as was our waitress. She was helpful with our questions and offered to split the soup for us to share.

I had the carrot-apple-ginger snap juice. It was a full glass, since it's not served with ice. It was really refreshing. My boss had the strawberry watermelon. Looked good, but diluted with ice, which made it seem over priced.
