Even if you're not able to get seated at a table outside (my preference), the building has accordion doors and slide completely open so the restaurant is open to the elements. This was wonderful!

I felt the service could improve. It appeared many servers were working their tails off, but our guy was a bit... Dumb.

Will return again!

Came here for restaurant week. Cocktails were good. Bloody Mary had a good amt of kick.  Pineapple habanero margarita was sweet and not spicy at all.  First course, straight A salad was yummy!  They did not skimp out on portion (entree size).  Second course, neatloaf was light and tasty. Third course, tall dark and handsome choc cake was good and rich (perfect for sharing since I only had a few bites). Overall, good food and was a reasonable price $33 -3 course dinner (not including drinks).

Beatrix is a great restaurant not only because of their great food, but because of their warm, friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere.  When they first opened I was there a few times with my Uncle Peter who got to know the manager, and I was absolutely blown away at how well we were taken care of.  I have never been treated so well at a restaurant and felt so appreciated; it's service like this that keeps me coming back and happily supporting places like this that truly care about their customers.  Everything I have had to eat there is amazing as well, some of my favorites are the deviled eggs, skirt steak, and chocolate cake (holy crap, it's ridiculous).  Overall a great restaurant that I recommend you not only try out, but frequent.

Their motto says taste over trend, but I'd say the trend factor was a 4 and the taste was a 2.5. Nothing stood out as exceptional and i was with a group of 8. Nothing was bad either. Cool atmosphere and above average drinks are the reason for a visit.

Came here for a birthday dinner with friends and it was amazing. I love the atmosphere and decor. The service was also top notch. We ordered the Hummus, Escarole and Potato Ravioli, Prime Burger, and the 'Neatloaf' for our son. It was all so delicious! Highly recommend it!

The food was delicious at lunchtime! But I have to RAVE about what incredible - above and beyond - service the manager offered!! It is a long boring story but Cannon (what a cool name) personally delivered lunch for our special event - there was a mistake with the delivery and it was NOT the fault of the restaurant, but they graciously picked up the charge and rushed the order over to us. I will forever be a loyal customer. Thank you to Cannon and Beatrix.

The enlightened Cesar will have you second guessing any other salad you've ever consumed. Tuna tartar & tsukune were delicious as well. So happy to live up the street to continue trying to rest of the menu!
We had the 3A Salad and the Poached Egg & Truffled Pasta!  Best meal I had while in Chicago!  Both were delicious!!

So I recommend this place HIGHLY FOR LUNCH/BRUNCH.  Dinner is still good, but they shine during the earlier hours of the day.  The POT ROAST SANDWICH is delicious.  Salads are good too, for those who are into that.  Desserts and coffees and juices are tasty too.  Service isn't always great, but you can't have everything!  Decor/vibe are really great, too.  Wish I still lived up the street, but now we'll just have to make a special trip :)

Favorite Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.  I lived in Chicago for  two+ years and only found out about Beatrix a month before moving away. Now I make it my first stop when traveling back for business. Unlike other restaurants attached to hotels, Beatrix has a local vibe as well. Fabulous GF menu options-I still have friends ship me the vegan, GF choc chip cookies to me in NYC.  Beet salad and quinoa cakes are fantastic. Caesar salad with salmon is fabulous. Service *****. Atmosphere great for drinks, dinner, late night. Fabulous wine bar. can't get enough!

Just had the most disappointing lunch at Beatrix. Came here for work and wanted to come back with my spouse who likes to eat healthy. We were greeted rudely upon arrival and told we had to choose, lunch or dinner menu. A more appropriate way to go about it would've been to give us both menus and let us look.

The waiter was nice enough but advised that the pasta I wanted was creamy and rich with some gooey cheese mixed in. He explained it as a layer of pasta with egg on top plus another layer of pasta on top. I'm thinking like a bowl of creamy pasta or a mostaccioli dish.

No. This was a sheet of lasagna type pasta topped by two eggs with another thin strip of the lasagna pasta on top. Not mixed together at all. The sauce is oily, not creamy, so it slides right off the pasta.  Cheese is congealed on the ends of asparagus (no tips) and not part of the pasta dish. This was the worst meal I've eaten in a very long time, especially at what I thought was a nice restaurant. I cannot believe they would serve something that is so poorly conceptualized. Even the nice poaching of the eggs could not save a dish that simply makes no sense, particularly when it was described as something else. And The waiter did nothing about it. I would not recommend it.  I will not be coming back.

This place is incredible!  Visited Chicago over a long weekend and my husband and I kept going back.  Good service, nice ambiance, delicious food.  Had their waffles and enchiladas - both amazing!!  Needed to have an entree tweaked due to dietary restriction and they were so kind and took great care of us.  Would highly recommend!

Loved this place!  My husband and I met a friend here for breakfast while visiting Chicago.  It was amazing!  He had the lemon pancakes and I had the egg white omelette.  Definitely my favorite breakfast we had in the city.

Loved this place! Excellent food, service, and atmosphere. My friend & I felt that prices were very reasonable and the gluten free menu was great. We ordered gluten free options, and they were fantastic. Portions were pretty typical- not small, not huge. Did not drink, but very impressed that our water glasses were never less than half full. Will definitely be back here again to try more of the menu (and drinks)!
Solid food selection and juice-centric cocktails.

I heard about Beatrix through a speaker I had in class.  It was the VP and Managing Partner, what better way to get all the dirt?!  I went that night, after hearing his favorite dishes and found they were better than described by the man who chose the menu, himself.  I had the farmhouse poached eggs and truffled pasta and my boyfriend had the shank of pork, oh my gosh, it fell right off the bone.  We had the chia pudding, my goodness im drooling as i type.  Such an interesting array of dishes!  I'm one to try new things, and Beatrix exceeded my expectations!

I like Beatrix.  I've tried them for brekkie, lunch, and dinner.  Plus they're part of the lettuce entertain you group and I'm a lettuce whore.  Usually means good service, good food, and free points!

Atmosphere is pretty laid back.  Reminds me of a healthy-ish hipster place in San Francisco.  They have large open windows which are nice when the weather is warm.

For Brunch, I tried the fluffy lemon pancakes.  While the flavor was good, they seemed underdone.  They told me that they're supposed to be a souflee texture.  And I get souffles are fluffy, but these were thin so I wouldn't call them fluffy, more wet.  When they explained, I said I would keep them and try another bite but they got me peach waffles instead and comped it (totally not necessary but was a very nice gesture).  Waffles were good but not amazing.  I liked the peaches on top.  Friend had the shortrib sandwich on foccacia which looked good and I think the hubby had an omlet which looked good.  Another friend had the quinoa benedict thing and she cleaned her plate.

My favorite meal I had was the chicken thigh for lunch.  Very very tasty.  I've also had their salad.  Salad was fine, nothing to write home about. Tskune appetizer are also amazing.  They should probably give a description of what it is but they are tasty Asian chicken meatballs-definitely a must have.  I had a salmon special one night and it was pretty good, nicely cooked.  Another fave is the Kulfi dessert.  It's like a very frozen vanilla ice cream with candied orange around it.  Very flavorful and refreshing and doesn't feel like your arteries are going to clog from it.

I like their fresh juices, you can also add a shot of whatever booze you want and make a nice summer cocktail.  I like the blueberry basil smash with gin.  My hubby got a mimosa with the blueberry for brunch one day, we decided it's best to stick with the traditional orange.

My biggest critique honestly is that their menu is a bit small and seemed on the wintery side for summer.  If they added a few lighter dishes, I would like it even more.

Trendy spot with great food and service. We started with the Deviled Eggs with Potato Salad which were good and had a sauce with some kick. I had the Pork Shoulder (which was excellent and cooked just right) with their Whiskey Sour cocktail. I think they may have upped the ante on those drinks after some reviews on here because it was well made and anything but weak. Overall a great spot downtown, bill came in around $90 for one appetizer, two entrées, two glasses of wine and one cocktail.

Beatrix exceeded my expectations. The ambiance was warm and inviting. The service was great and the food was well prepared and delicious.  We had the hummus starter, and split the three grain salad and the burger. We will definitely be back!

Beatrix is sleek, sexy, & chic.. And that is just the decor. Delve into the food and the food rides right alongside the decore. The real winner here however has to be the pastries and cookies. Wow! That's how I can sum up the pastries absolutely out of this world!

We  shared short rib sandwich, toasted carmel pecan french toast, chicken sausage, and bacon.  Everything tasted good, especially the bacon was very delicious.  However, I can skip the chicken sausage the next time.   Good coffee and excellent service.

I can't say enough good things about this place. I have been here for brunch and lunch. Their food is excellent, portions are perfect- no doggie bags necessary. Coffee is fabulous, staff is super friendly. Perfect place for a date too. Reservations are definitely recommended for the weekends.

Been twice for lunch, once office colleague and the other with girlfriend (hubby at work). Don't understand the big deal. We came hungry, we left hungry not to mention lighter in the wallet. Food was good; not great or worthy of another return. Service was pleasant but we did say we were hungry and could eat! The server didn't offer that portions could be small. Toooo many breakfast and lunch spots nearby with a great vibe where you get better quality and quantity for your money.

We had a very good meal at Beatrix.  I particularly enjoyed the salmon with corn tortillas, which had a mole-esqe sauce and was very good.  My husband had the turkey meatloaf which was savory and delicious.  The coffee bar has a cool vibe too, I would feel totally comfortable having a seat and dining alone and people watching.

I've only been here for dinner, but everything was delicious.  I started with deviled eggs, which were unique and tasty.  For dinner I had the caramelized pork shank, which was reaaaallly good.  The sauce was perfectly sweet and savory, and it was cooked perfectly.  I wish I'd had room for dessert!  Maybe next time.  I really liked the ambiance as well.

Oatmeal+brown sugar bacon=DELICIOUS. I came here twice in the same week on vacation. I love the ambience, the food, and we had a wonderful server both times, Chris, who just started here. My husband tried the bullet-proof coffee is rich and tasted good, but not $9-cup-of-coffee good. Otherwise, I highly recommend it!
Food was excellent, drinks were fantastic (the whiskey sour was one of the best I've ever had), service was swift and professional, and the price was very reasonable. We will definitely return.

Beatrix is an oasis in the wash of downtown steak houses and overpriced Italian (I'm looking at you Eataly). The decor is modern and fresh. The food is excellent and healthy. The cocktails look great and the fresh juice drinks are fantastic. The service was friendly and attentive. The chocolate chip cookies available at the coffee bar are one of the most decadent, delicious, things I've ever eaten. I'd go back to Chicago just for the cookie.
My only complaint is with the music. I was there at 7pm on a Friday night and it was a terrible attempt at loud club music. I commented on the noise level to the bartender and he (rudely) suggested I should "chill out" and get into a weekend mood. Thanks, but it wasn't midnight. I was trying to have a quiet, early, dinner after being in meetings all day and the loud music marred what was otherwise a perfect dinner.

Just had dinner at Beatrix. Just in town for a couple day and went here because of the positive reviews on Yelp. I totally agree! Excellent everything food, service, decor. I had the braised pot roast a simple dish done exceptionally. I know there is a lot of good food in Chi town but this definitely ranks high.
Thanks for great meal

My new favorite brunch spot! The atmosphere is lovely and open. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We got our choice of table, and the waitress even changed the TV channel to a football game we wanted to watch. The modern American food is absolutely delicious. So far I've had the egg white omelette and burger, and the burger was out of this world. Will be back there soon!

Plenty of reviews on this place, and they aren't wrong! I really wanted gazpacho, so we tried this place out for dinner. We had the blackberry and lichee lemonade (w a little mint, which normally makes things taste like toothpaste, but was refreshing and delicious), gazpacho (yellow bc of the tomatoes!), potato salad deviled eggs, quinoa cakes (w cabbage on top), and hubby had the cider reduction pork shank. Everything was delicious! The flavor balance is perfect for each dish- especially the pork. We also had the vanilla kulfi (very creamy Indian ice cream) for dessert. Each dish was so unique, innovative, delicious and well portioned! Would recommend to try to sit near a window, since it is quieter. Definitely the highest caliber place, the chef is amazing and can't wait to see what other menus he or she comes up with!

I have eaten here three times in the last 2 days and I haven't had anything that was less than amazing. Their egg white sandwich are scrumptious. The lemon pancakes are one of a kind - absolutely amazing with their light airy texture. Dinner was similarly good with turkey meatloaf that was healthily stuffed with veggies but still very tasty. Definitely recommend trying out this place.

This place was pretty good. A lettuce usually never fails. I liked the atmosphere inside. We went for dinner on a nice night, so all of the windows were open. Service was great. Cucumber mint soda was very good and fresh. Same with the hummus. All food tasted healthy and very fresh. My mom liked her pot roast. My brother said his chicken was just ok. My salmon was pretty good. Caramel pie was too sweet. Overall, a good experience and solid place.

I'm staying at a hotel adjacent to Beatrix and last night a "Beatrix To Your Room" menu was under my door, so I figured I'd give it a shot today.  I ordered breakfast, they simply charged it to my room, brought it up, and that was that.  It was great food and great, professional service.  Obviously there was a charge to bring it up, plus tip, etc, but it is worth it on those days where you are too busy working to leave your room.  I will definitely try them again, if not just go into the restaurant to try their full menu.  Very convenient and yummy.

I had dinner here with some friends, our waitress was generally inattentive most of the time, but that's not the end of the world. The menu is very limited (10 items max). I had the chicken with polenta...so many things wrong...the chicken was insanely salty and the polenta had lots of lumps, if a place cannot finesse fresh polenta, then let it cool and fry it. For a place with such a small menu, how can they not get such a simple dish right, also you definitely pay for "the vibe" of the place...which includes the entryway to the apartments above. Gross.

One of my favorite places to eat downtown and I say this with no exaggeration whatsoever.  Everything we ordered, and I tried everything our group had, was amazing to my palate. I personally ordered, Potato Salad Deviled Eggs, Warm Quinoa Cakes, Tsukune, & Chia Pudding.  Beyond good.  I honestly can't recommend it more highly.  Nice selections on the menu and everything tastes amazingly fresh.

I find that the food is spotty at Beatrix.  I loved it like crazy the first 4 times I went, but last night, the kale salad was incredibly underdressed and too dry.  The papaya was mealy, and the drinks were blander than the last several times.

Went early on a Saturday night. Classy and hip. The arugula salad was good. We had a blackberry and lychee lemonade that was delicious. The burger was prepared well and tasty. The vegetarian meat loaf was  tasty too. My son had the braised ribs which he liked. Service was very good. Heck, we'll give it 4 stars.

The food was fantastic. We had the greatest waitress, Katie, she knew a lot about the menu. I had the pork shoulder and it was stellar. They do not have an extensive drink menu but we tried a couple of the cocktails that were very tasty.

Went here last night for dinner during restaurant week and absolutely loved it. My friend and I decided to just have one of us order the restaurant week special and then share the salad and dessert which worked out perfectly. The salad was actually pretty large and perfect for sharing.

We got the straight A salad, pot roast, crispy roasted chicken, and chocolate cake and enjoyed each item. The crispy roasted chicken was very moist and the creamy polenta was a delicious side. I love comfort food and this was comfort food done really well. I'm someone who often orders chicken at restaurants and this was a perfect meal for me. The pot roast and mashed potatoes were also delicious and splitting the two entrees provided the perfect amount of food to fill us both.

I will definitely be back at Beatrix for a nice date night or another girl's night dinner.
The interior is nice, the food is ok, and the juices are a waste of money

My favorite restaurant, thus far, in Chicago. I tend to eat healthily and this place makes eating clean and eating well a shared experience. I had the short ribs the first time and neatloaf (not a mis-spelling) the next. I also had breakfast there - shakahuka (probably mis-spelled). The dinners were great and the alcoholic drinks were refreshing. The breakfast was good, but small. The Bulletproof coffee got the star back. I have sampled off other plates and have never been disappointed!
Yelp directed me here for lunch today. The food was great and the portion size was ideal. I had the 3 grain salad with chicken and it was full of flavor.

We stopped in to meet other friends in town and the braised short-ribs with roasted Brussels sprout pedals and a cauliflower puree was delicious. We thought we would just grab something quick, but turned out to be pretty good, overall.

My friend made a last minute reservation on Thursday which they accommodated us on, which was great.  The witness was very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu dishes and very patient. Never had to ask for more water and she checked up reasonably throughout our time there. We started with the kennebec fries. Nice and crispy with a tasty dipping sauce. After asking the waitress a few questions I went with the brioche crusted branzino. This dish was so good I ate all up, no leftovers. My friend had the special which was a twist on beef stroganoff, which I did try and it was good. We did not have time for dessert. I plan on going back to try something else and a dessert. The waitress did recommend the caramel pie. I also want to try their bulletproof coffee. I look forward to my next visit!

This place was so promising with sleek atmosphere and friend hostess, greeters, and manager.  Our waitress, Vanity, left all lot to be desired.  We even had a hard time getting our drinks or even water!  Well she did have a lot to do, like folding napkins right next to our table for 20 min.  Don't even get me started about the specialty item of Chilaquiles, which were available via a buffet.  A majority of our group order them since they sounded so good.  Horrible idea...It took them over 40 minutes to replenish the tray after we brought it to their attention.  I felt bad for the guys we were with since they were interested in getting more, but after 40 minutes who would have interest.   Overall...won't be back.

I stayed in the Aloft which occupies the same space.
Went in for breakfast and the egg white omelet.  Service was slow and the coffee tasted weak -like it was mixed with tea.
The omelet was greasy from too much oil but the tomato avocado salsa was tasty.

Overall not a great experience.

Best French Toast special I've ever had in my life. Awesome interior. Dinner is also amazing: deviled eggs, figs, pork shank, carmel pie (!!) and apple strudel. The Harvest Punch is also phenomenal. Awesome place all around for any meal.

Sampled some food at a charity event and then finally got a chance to have dinner here. Was very pleased by the quality of food and the fact that it was so light and fresh. Had the quinoa cakes- so simple and delish. The salmon was awesome - just slightly over salted. Overall very pleased!  The prices were affordable given the quality of food.  Would for sure eat here again...and I don't say that often. I give it 4 for atmosphere. Not a fan of eating at hotel restaurants.

We around 1:15 pm last Saturday.  The place was very busy but we were able to be seated right away.  My wife had the Quinoa patties and I had the Mushroom and Quinoa burger.  Both were excellent.  Service was great, the background music and atmosphere made for a very pleasant experience.  We will definitely go back to try something else on the menu.

My husband and I had breakfast at Beatrix today. The service was excellent, the atmosphere sophisticated, the large leather chairs really comfortable. My husband ordered his traditional breakfast: scrambled eggs, toast, hash browns and bacon. He orders that everywhere and called Beatrix's presentation one of the best of its kind. I had vanilla yogurt with granola and berries. Sounds simple, but not every place can do it to my liking. This was just right with a variety of really fresh, sweet berries and chewy/crunchy granola. I also had a breakfast bun -- made with croissant dough, it was crispy/chewy and coated with cinnamon sugar. Major yum!

Great starter choices, definitely worth trying if you're up for an afternoon snack and drinks. Entrees were 4 stars, nothing too surprising but the presentation was good. Overall, a really good environment to chill and relax. Would love to go and try their breakfast menu some time.
Stayed at the Aloft Hotel & absolutely loved this restaurant.  Not anything like a typical hotel place - open to the street & busy all the time.  Food, service & especially the lattes, were fabulous!

Do you want a phenomenal brunch in river north? Look no further, this place is awesome. Best bloody I've had in Chicago. Server was awesome, he was actually bar tending and serving and we felt very well taken care of. Coffee was delicious. Food came so fast. Enjoy!

I don't normally write reviews but my fiancée and I had such a wonderful time at Beatrix that I felt compelled to share our experience.  The food was incredible. For dinner, I had the carmelized pork shoulder and my fiancée had the halibut. Both meals were unbelievable.  The flavors that came out of each dish and the creativity/presentation were amazing. Additionally, the staff was attentive, friendly, and provided an great atmosphere for a night out. We had such a great time and can't wait to go back again!

I would definitely come back for the pot roast & not have to share it.
Very good with lots of everything...we'll see

It's been a while since I've been inspired to Yelp a restaurant, and to do so at 5 stars.  The evening with wife was near flawless.  Seated us earlier than rez on a Friday night.  Seated on a table that had one part of it on a bench with pillows.  Wife loved that!  Service was attentive.  The Red Blend (from Walla Walla) excellent choice and not too expensive at $54.  Appetizers of Potato Salad Deviled egg and the Avocado/Pumpkin Carpaccio were both fabulous.  Server explained his dinner favorites and was helpful in narrowing down our choices.  We chose the Pork Shank special and wife chose the Branzino.  Hers was a 5 and mine a 4 (pork a tad dry), but the quinoa and accompanying vegetable were great.  Tall Dark handsome chocolate cake to finish was great (and gluten free).  We took a couple gluten free cinnamon rolls for the next morning.  Wow!  Upon remarking what a great meal this was, we noticed it was a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.  Now it all fits together.  How does LEYE continue knocking out great concepts like this??
this place is great! awesome cocktails! the veggie options are on point. the quinoa cakes and hummus app are delicious.

hello yelp world.

i've never been one to use any type of social media, so i'll credit a couple recent dining experiences that made me feel i needed to partake.

first, let me state that there are 4 main consideration points that i'll be using to determine "my opinion" of overall experience:

1) Service + 2) Food + 3) Ambiance + 4) Pricing = EXPERIENCE

Here goes my first review ever...

1)  the service is amazing. i've been to going to Beatrix at least once a week since they opened in june of 2013 (no exaggeration cause it's around the corner from my office), and at first, the service may not have been as smooth, but there was no doubt that the talent was there; now, the service is my bench mark--one of the best and most consistent service staff i've experienced here in the states. john m. and michael, two of the restaurant managers lead by example...you can tell they're no egos. you'll catch them seating guests, cleaning tables, serving food, anticipating your needs, and most importantly...really caring about your experience. this must be the reason why they garner so much respect from their staff (it's noticeable). SERVICE 5 stars!

2)  the food...every guest i've ever brought to Beatrix has walked away with nothing but the greatest things to say about the dishes, but i'll always give my honest "opinion". i believe their staple dishes are excellent, but when it comes to "specials", i've had a few misses...one dish i'll mention is a "pho" dish (a vietnamese noodle soup dish) the chef created when it was a bit chilly outside. the thought and idea behind the dish was great, but the dish itself unfortunately fell short. but, that being said, i still enjoy myself there at least once a week. FOOD 4.5 stars!

3)  the ambiance is a big WoW. regardless if you're there for a drink, a quick bite, a meeting, operation stuff your face...there's a spot to accommodate all. i'm a big nut for space design...and all the details have been thought of. i imaging meeting the designer one day, he/she will be wearing a simple t-shirt with the words "bus driver" written across the front. i'll wonder what that's all about...and BAM--he/she will say, "i just took ya to school!". you'll have to experience the space for yourself. i don't want to ruin anyone's experience. AMBIANCE 5 stars!

4)  the pricing...i don't have any magical formula for this. it's more of a feeling. when you take in everything you've experienced and enjoyed or haven't enjoyed and the check arrives...that moment, the moment the total appears before you...is there any sort of a shock factor, or are you at peace? Beatrix nails it. it's definitely not inexpensive, but after one great thing after another...pricing is definitely inline. PRICING 5 stars!

so, taking all of this into consideration and using my elementary math, Beatrix should receive 4.875 stars, but since that's not an option...i've rounded up.

Beatrix...you have a great establishment. Cheers to your entire staff!

We wanted to eat here but we couldn't because the kitchen was closed. It drives me nuts when a place that is substantially a restaurant posts their hours, but doesn't serve food an hour before they close.

The food here was phenomenal, which is what I've come to expect from a Lettuce Entertainment establishment.  They know how to do things right.  I was there last Saturday, April 16, for lunch with a friend.  The atmosphere was immediately reminiscent of one of their other eateries, Summer House.  We arrived slightly ahead of our reservation time but were seated promptly.  This was around 12:30 in the afternoon which apparently is one of their prime times.  Due to the varied and delicious menu selections, my friend and I decided to try a sweet and savory dish that we would then share, so we could each taste both.  We were disappointed when our server told us they could not split the entrees on 2 plates.  We asked for an extra plate and did the split ourselves but the table was really too small and it was messy, hence the 4 instead of 5 stars.  I'd have expected more from a restaurant of this caliber.  We also had to find our server to ask for an additional coffee and iced tea refill.  She cheerfully did it but would have thought she'd have been trained to ask.  The food was superb and won me over, so I will definitely be back.

Had the chocolate salmon tacos. Salmon cooked perfectly - crisp on the exterior, soft and moist inside. Served with fresh corn tortillas and a crisp slaw. Had the chiffon pumpkin pie for dessert. Fresh and served as the perfect finish. Good value, too.

Super trendy, Lettuce Entertain You Restaurant. The Quinoa Cakes and Truffle Pasta were the highlights of the meal. However, the Chocolate Salmon was just so so, and the meal essentially turned into $25 fish tacos with the Corn Tortillas they give you on the side. Overall, a good meal, but when dinner for two is upwards of $100, I tend to expect more.

Great food and a great atmosphere! Every time that I have ever been here, I have been seated promptly even if it is right around 6 p.m. and the restaurant is busy. This is the perfect place if you want to share some appetizers with friends or have a nice cocktail after work.

Since I'm writing this review, Beatrix gets 4 stars, but if my husband were writing it, he'd probably give it about 7 or more if he could.  He loves the chilaquiles bar for brunch and nearly every weekend he requests to go here for them.  I've never gotten it but have stolen a bite or two and it is excellent--I'm not sure why more people don't seem to get this since it seems like an awesome value (especially for a guy with a big appetite, he likes that he can go back for more).  I think the food is excellent (and I like taking a peek at the pastries in the coffee bar area and ordering one as a starter....Angel Food Cake muffin topped in chocolate...mmmmmm).  It loses one star for me because when I go there and look at the main menu, there is never anything that wows me or jumps out at me....I usually end up liking what I get, but nothing gets me even half as excited as my husband gets about his chilaquiles.

I have stayed at  Aloft hotel in the burbs, but this was the first time I visited the one located in the City Centre...my date recommended it. A typical Aloft Hotel offers a small self-serve commissary/snack bar and a modest, but swanky XYZ cocktail bar, but the Aloft in the City Centre was amazing!. I was very surprised by the plentiful seating accommodations of Beatrix.  Although the dining area was crowded, it was Saturday evening, we only waited for approximately 5 minutes.  We ordered bottle of the Cabernet Sauvignon...my date insisted on the one from California and not Washington state.  The wine was pretty good, not as smooth as others I have tasted, but very low in tannins, which was good.  For our appetizer, we ordered Potato Salad Deviled Eggs, which were to die for!  For our meal, we ordered the Straight-A Salad and Millers Farm's Chicken, which was juicy and delicious!    Needless to say, we had a great time and I will certainly visit again.

Went with my family for Sunday brunch and I have to say that the food was  good and the ambiance was lively and busy. We had a reservation and they had our table ready so we didn't wait at all. On the other hand I think the service fell short. We had to wait around ten minutes before a server approached our table and gave us water and the server did not notice that we needed another glass so we had to ask for it. When she brought the coffee we had to ask for teaspoons. We ordered our brunch and it came rather fast. After that our server never came to ask if we needed or wanted anything else. Muy husband wanted to try one of the delicious muffins and had to get up and order one from their  dessert bar.  Very basic and minimal effort put during service.

I came here with my Mom and Dad for lunch and loved it. Can't wait to come back.

The health focus initially scared my meat and potatoes Dad, but he was quickly made very happy with the burger and delicious "Kennebec" fries. These fries are AMAZING and deserve a trip just for themselves!

But please don't stop at just the french fries. My mom and I split:
1. Warm Quinoa Cake: Simple and delicious. Seasoned so that the quinoa really took off and was able to stand on its own.
2. Potato, Onion, and Rosemary Focaccia: This was absolutely delicious and we fought over who could have the last piece.
3. Emerald City Salad: Both were huge fans.

The only problem when I finished eating was that I wanted something sweet...and that was easily fixed with their bakery section! I had a house-made blueberry muffin that was delicious, and they also sell Firecakes donuts, so I picked up some of those as well since I had been wanting to try them.

I'm 23 and go to a lot of the hip new restaurants with my girlfriends, and this one is going to be one we keep going back to. It's in an amazing location for going out after dinner.
Service was extremely slow. Eggs Benedict were more like flat boiled eggs.

Ok so lettuce entertain you never disappoints, but this has to be my favorite of their locations. The cocktails were perfectly crafted, and the food was all outstanding. I recommend the mac and cheese, ceasar salad with yogurt dressing, and caramel cake especially. My only complaint is I've been twice and they've run out of things- I guess because they are so popular! One of Chicago's best.

I have eaten and done cocktails at Beatrix on three separate occasions. It is a very cool space and popular with locals and visitors alike. It abuts the Aloft Hotel by W and gets a fair amount of hotel traffic as you would expect. It is part open air seating inside with a few tables on the sidewalk.  The bar area is pretty narrow and seats probably 9 or 10 people.  I had dinner at the bar on my most recent trip and it is great to chat with the knowledgeable and fun bar crew.  I had a dirty martini and the cool thing is they default to olives stuffed w blue cheese. Good in my book.  I had the pot roast which was amazing. Whipped cauliflower, grilled kale and pearl onions accompanied the tender pork in a fantastic marinade/sauce. This dish was a home run. My lunches here have also been quite good. The only critique is the wine list. It is all domestic. Not one French or Italian wine which is disappointing as the list is laden w Cali wines - just not up to snuff.  A half dozen craft beers on the menu do the job but they could use a chimay or another comparable import to round out the list.  I had the Founders IPA and it was good.  Stop by - you'll be glad you did.
The Oh My Caramel Pie lived up to the hype. One of the best meals I've had in Chicago. Highly recommend!!!

Returned to Beatrix Sunday with my wife and our friend.  Our first experience was not so great as we ended up sick.  The management was very nice and sent us a few gift certificates to try the restaurant again and seemed genuinely concerned.  It's been several months since we were here last so this time we returned with our friend and had a great experience.  Food was very good, we enjoyed the shank and halibut which were both prepared well.  Our friend is a vegetarian the the menu offered her plenty of options.  She went with the special which was stuffed peppers.  We started with the crudo which was very tasty.  Overall our experience was great and we would return without concern.  Wait staff was pleasant and we all enjoyed some well prepared cocktails such as the Blueberry Tom Collins and the Jalapeno margarita.  Caramel cake was excellent as well.  They appear to have a great selection of baked goods.

Reliable and good food. They have many options in terms of price, vegetarian, healthy vs. indulgent. It is a crowd pleaser and good for groups. Beatrix is much different from any other "hotel restaurant" I have been to in the US. Definitely worth a try!

Honey Cinnamon Soy Latte is delicious! I have one every time . I swear by the lemon pancakes and brown sugar bacon; however, the last time I went I opted for the baked egg sandwich and I am officially a convert. Can't wait to go back. Thanks Beatrix!

Based on online reviews we decided to try Beatrix. Despite being a restaurant within a hotel the place is warm and inviting. We visited later in the day, before dinner and ordered salads - Straight "A' salad and a Caesar salad, both were very good. We topped it off with a slice of caramel pie, which is to die for! Will visit again!

We went based on location and menu.  We were there for dinner and ordered the pot roast with spaghetti squash, meatloaf and salmon as our entres.  We also had the soup and crisp kale salad which we shared. The food was wonderful and I cannot say enough about the service.  I the waiter was helpful in our ordering so that we could share tastes yet not order too much food.  My only disappointment was the chia pudding, but the caramel crack pie made up for it. Now I want to experience their brunch!

Stayed at Aloft and was really glad we tried this place.  Meatball appetizers were very tasty and chocolate salmon that could be made into tacos using their delicious cole slaw was really excellent.  Ambiance is lively; a hidden gem.
This is a local favorite!  We come here so often whether it is for brunch or dinner. The caramel pie is out of this world and the rest of the menu is pretty guilt-free, yet delicious.

My wife and I come to Chicago frequently to see our daughter who resides in Lincoln Park.  We have eaten at probably close to 40 different restaurants. Chicago is not short on amazing places to dine! We ate at Beatrix recently and I have to say Beatrix has moved to the top of our list of 40.  Upon arriving the atmosphere was festive, the decor chic, the hostess greeting warm and friendly. There were no available reservations until 9:30 but they graciously  found us a table .  The menu has so many intriguing dishes to choose from that it was difficult to make a decision.  Our choices were all right on the mark....deviled eggs...kale salad...Chicken with asparagus ..short ribs with mashed cauliflower ...branzino ...Everything was delectable!!!! The fish was nor quite warm enough so we asked to have it warmed. The staff was beyond apologetic and accommodating . Several different staff apologized and were so sincerely upset.  They obviously have exceedingly high expectations for pleasing their patrons.  Our waitress  Jennifer was top notch...attentive...engaging ... The manager , Cassandra,  is well deserved of the position as she went above and beyond ...apologizing for the temperature of the fish...insisting on taking it off the bill...and treating us to two of the restaurants awesome desserts.  I observed Cassandra constantly on the move ..attending to so many patrons...filling water glasses....clearing dishes...greeting guests...checking to make sure that everything was perfect for the  dining experience! She was setting a great example for her staff!!!
Overall a wonderful evening at a restaurant we will highly recommend to others and return to soon.

Great food in a casual kick back and relax kind of atmosphere.  Hostess and server were AWESOME!  I eat out a lot and can say I rarely trust a server to give advice during the entire meal, but I trusted our server to help us narrow down our options on the refreshing drinks. appetizers, entres, and desserts and she NEVER let us down.  Not sure if she was so great because of her skill or because everything on the menu was FABULOUS!  Look forward to going back and trying the rest of the menu.  Btw, my faves were the mint and cucumber drink, escarole and pear salad, pot roast and the to die for chocolate cake.
Top notch for dinner. Another Lettuce Entertain You winner. Excellent food, service and value. Novel dishes, definitely worth checking out. Can't wait to go back.

By far the best brunch place I have been too and I'm sort of brunch junkie from NYC! Hands down the best french toast ever!! The service was very nice and they even gave us free coffee because there was some confusion with our order. Definitely will be going back there!

Love the food, (the branzino and the short rib are both incredible), love the drinks and love the atmosphere!  Great place for a date night!  I come here at least twice a month.  Definitely recommend!

Had an excellent brunch here on Sunday afternoon with my girlfriend. Our server, Jake, who was also running the side bar at the time, took great care of us. He had great recommendations and was very accommodating of my girlfriends 'particular' drinking requests. Excellent food and atmosphere here, but, as with most great spots, it was the people that put it over the top. Will definitely be back.

I've been to Beatrix three times now and the food is consistently phenomenal: interesting flavors, perfectly cooked, and generally light on the stomach (which can be hard to come by at some of the more trendy Chicago restaurants). The wait staff is incredibly attentive and accommodating. Also, its nice that they have enough tables and space that you don't have to wait a million years for a table and aren't sitting on a stranger's lap. Overall, this is one of my favorite Chicago restaurants.

I really love this place for brunch!  I've been about 4 or 5 times for brunch and it never gets old.  The prices are SO cheap (especially for River North!) and the food is fresh and delicious.  The last few times we've gone, they have an option where you can purchase an entree (I think it was chilaquiles the last time I went) and it's an all you can eat style where you pay once and get a plate and go back and help yourself as much as you want.  Perfect option for my every hungry high metabolism husband. :)  The service is always really good and it's never too loud so you can fortunately hear your brunch companion talk!  Love it and can't wait to go again.
Eggs were cold, toast was soggy, coffee was weak, they don't know what shakshuka really is. Pass on this one! Waitress was sweet, but that's not enough of a reason to eat here.

This place needs work. We were scoping this place out for a group event, and it graciously removed itself from the running. I told the server that we were considering having a medium sized group come in, and she made fun of me for a couple of minutes and wouldn't tell me if they had a room to accommodate parties. Then water dripped all over the table from the ceiling. Server again made jokes but didn't do anything to fix the problem. I had to ask specifically to move to another, drier table. Food came, salad was as described, but pasta came out like a soup. The kitchen clearly didn't drain the noodles, of which there was barely any. Maybe their way of making the portion look bigger? Below average food, flat out bad service, what else can I say? Much better places in the area.

I have had multiple breakfasts and lunches here and they have all been absolutely superb. Their baked goods are out of this world. The food has a wonderfully refreshing spin on classic takes. The salads are super yummy too!

Went here last night for dinner and was not impressed.  Menu looked good but the execution missed the mark.  Dishes were underseasoned and nothing we ordered was memorable.  Definitely caters to a girls' night out crowd.  Wine prices were high and you can do much better for the price point at many other restaurants in the same area. A rare disappointment for me by the Lettuce group.

We had a great meal tonight, and want to give a special shout out to Steven the host! Last night we tried to get in but couldn't score a reservation. We stopped by for dessert and made reservations for this evening for our family. Had a great time and a great meal: tenderloin ragout, steak chimichurra and pork shank. Our table enjoyed the pork shank the most and LOVEd the Oh My caramel pie. Thanks for the nice night, we will be back and congrats on the Bib Gourmand!

My husband and I went here for lunch the Friday of Lollapalooza (I know, I'm a little late on the review). Surrounded by neon shirts and sunglasses, we navigated through the menu. It all looked so good that we relied on our sever, (it was so long ago, but I believe his name was Mike), to be the hero and make our decision for us. He did an AMAZING job. I had the pot roast sandwich, and I had even expressed my dislike for pot roast, but "Mike" knew better. It was delicious. It was probably one the best sandwich I've ever had. GET IT. My husband had a burger- he always gets the burger. He said it was good- but he liked my sandwich better. Their fries are salty and delicious as well, which complimented our lunch perfectly. I really wanted dessert but we were stuffed, so we took some cookies home with us for later.  Everything from our service to the food was a wonderful experience. "Mike" we thank you kindly for your service.

Lettuce, you've done it again. We popped into Beatrix around 12:30 on a Saturday for brunch. I would recommend making a reservation, as the place was packed. We went as a group of four and started out with cocktails, because Bloody's & Mimosas are a must at brunch. The Bloody's were alright, but nothing special. The Mimosa's on the other hand, were incredible. They offer three types: Orange, Red, & Blue. The orange was a standard mimosa with fresh squeezed orange juice. I believe the red was a fresh squeezed strawberry/raspberry combination, & the blue was blueberry. All were delicious. The blue may have been my favorite but since it's a bit on the sweeter side, I couldn't imagine sipping on more than one. The food was good too. I ordered the steak chimichurri & eggs and it was good, but just that. 3 stars for my dish. But everyone else's was delish! I was in the mood for breakfast food when we ordered, but after seeing the Prime Burger that our friend ordered, I wished I could exchange mine. My boyfriend ordered the eggs your way and everything was cooked to perfection. We enjoyed Beatrix thoroughly and will definitely be back for another brunch.
Great breakfast, the fresh squeezed orange juice was amazing, and the best bacon I've had in my life. A+

Great food. Healthy but unbelievably delicious. Try the caramel pie - oh my! Good service. I also love their infused fruit drinks. Make sure to make reservations - they get full quickly on the popular days.

Had a great weekend brunch here with a few girlfriends. The fresh squeezed juice was great. My dining companions enjoyed their food and I LOVED my light and fluffy lemon pancakes with lemon syrup, powdered sugar and blackberries. The candied bacon was also outstanding. The seating was inside but opened to the outdoors so the atmosphere was lovely. Our waitress was also very polite and friendly. I can't wait to return.

Awesome brunch food, great mimosas, and stellar customer service.  We ordered the "family style" or something to that effect - where you get a plate and help yourself to a certain dish served buffet style.  They were making a new batch and it took about 20/25 minutes for that dish to be available, and we were so surprised when they took both our entrees off the bill due to that delay, after already apologizing several times.  Both dishes were super tasty - a mexican style chicken & egg deal and lemon pancakes.  Everything else on the menu sounded great, too.  We sat outside on a beautiful day, but the inside looked fun, too - lively but not too loud or crazy.  As a sidenote the pastry bar looked to die for.  Highly recommend this place if you're looking for a fantastic brunch.  Should also note we live in San Francisco, so we know good food!
Wasn't wowed by this place. Nice atmosphere but the quality of the food just wasn't there. I tried the salmon tacos and the turkey meatballs for an appetizer, but certainly wasn't wowed.
A great restaurant with a bit of a healthy spin, but still delicious. The hummus appetizer and caramel pie are dishes I crave, so yummy!

Take-out order. Bar tender wasn't very friendly. He asked me if I wanted silverware to go and when I said yes proceeded to not put any in my bags. Also, please tell me why this establishment thinks it's desirable to have the bartender, whose hands touch dirty glasses all day, glasses that mouths have touched, to go through and open every container of food right in front of you. Are you people high? Got home. Threw out the food. Don't need to get herpes just because Joe Schmo thinks he's doing me a favor fingering all my containers EVEN AFTER I TELL HIM HE DOESN'T HAVE TO. Who runs these places?

One of our favorite places...great service, and really good food. They also have gluten free baked goods that taste decadent in spite of being gluten free.  For dessert, the Tall Dark and Handsome is a flour-less chocolate cake that is worth all the calories. Great for breakfast, lunch and after dinner drinks...and desserts!

Came here on a Saturday night with reservations.  Hostess and waitress were very nice and attentive.  I had the Neatloaf which was very tasty!  It came with kale and mashed potatoes, and so the serving size was definitely enough to eat!  I also had the blueberry Tom Collins which was delicious - I like sweet drinks and so I didn't find it to be too sweet.  We split the beet appetizer which was really good too.  The price is very reasonable for what you get - I would definitely go back!

Walked in on our way to Eataly.  My husband had the halibut and I had the salmon.  We both cleaned our plates but made room for desert, which was scrumptious.  The wait staff was knowledgable and efficient.  They made some great recommendations on wine (we went twice).  The next time I tried the chicken and it was amazing.  Nice atmosphere also. Will return.

Service was good - dinner was not. I had something called halibut. It was prepared in some odd fashion. It was like partially baked with some weird breading on it that tasted almost of syrup. The fish was poor quality and tasted bad. This might be a good breakfast place but dinner is not good. Fish was poor quality and even worse poorly prepared. Good people watching spot however.

Went here for a "quick" dinner on a weeknight with a couple friends and while the food was very good, the service was absolutely terrible. While the server seemed to know the menu inside and out, he went overboard in explaining nearly EVERY item on the menu. Then it took about 20 minutes for him to return to take our orders. Before we knew it, we'd been there an hour and we were just getting our entrees. The restaurant was not even half full so the long wait was inexcusable. The fresh, homemade juices/cocktails were pretty good but you could probably prepare one yourself at home for a lot less. I ordered the truffle pasta-a bit rich, but still good. Also the portion of vegetables was ridiculously small. The best part of the meal was the chocolate cake. I'd recommend going here either (a) only to get coffee/dessert, or (b) if you have plenty of time to kill for a 2+ hour meal. Not sure I'd go back because the poor service detracted from the whole experience.
Great food and exceptional service. The manager is great and I highly recommend checking this place out. There are many different food and drink options!

Really, this is 5 stars. From food, to service, to atmosphere. I've been here for breakfast, brunch and lunch. This is just good quality, beautiful food. Coffee is excellent, Chai was excellent, fresh fruit juices were excellent. Desserts and pastries were excellent. Salads excellent. Burgers excellent. Pasta excellent. The atmosphere is lively not super intimate, but definitely hip and modern.

I have been here twice in the past month and was met with similar reactions from the server (different server each time) when using my LEYE frequent diner club card - attitude.  Let's get one thing straight - if your servers are going to throw attitude at customers with "status", I suggest you don't offer status at all.  I use points maybe two or three times a year, which is about how often I eat at a LEYE restaurant, so I don't know all the rewards points rules.  Oh also, I'm not an idiot and understand that the rules are written "ON THE BACK OF THE CARD", but how 'bout you clarify these somewhat vague rules without acting like a little prick in the process.  To LEYE - if you are going to offer rewards points, please train your staff to courteously accept and explain them to the members if requested.  Especially since having said points in the first place infers that the customer has already spent a ridiculous amount of money at LEYE establishments previously, and will most likely spend more in the future.          

Too bad about the service, I really enjoyed most of the food.  My table ordered tried the following on the combined occasions:
Tsukune - wonderful, flavorful
Vegetable ceviche (appetizer special) - a little boring but very fresh
Spring Pea Soup - fresh, bright, would order this again
Straight A Salad - standard salad, it was nicely dressed
Egg & Truffled Pasta - good
Neatloaf - very good
Roasted Chicken - dry, plain, under-seasoned, sad
Chili/Chocolate Salmon - fish was well cooked, flavor was good, interesting presentation
Brioche Crusted Halibut - outstanding
Steak Chimichurri - small portion but delicious
Caramel Pie - outstanding
Several cocktails and juices - all outstanding

I thoroughly enjoyed this place for brunch. I went on a snow day and the atmosphere was so cozy and chic.  I wanted to spend the whole afternoon there drinking coffee and people watching on the street.  Their menu is interesting and has several light/healthy alternatives. I had their eggs benedict spin off which had quinoa cakes with poaches eggs and tomatoes.  Very light and tasty! I want to go back there for lunch and dinner.  The price was just right as well..all around a good brunch spot for a lighter and healthier meal.

Typical Lettuce establishment. The food sounds creative yet accessible but the finished product is almost always mediocre. The real reason I gave this place one star was the customer service: I had called ahead of time because I wanted to give them a credit card before meeting my friends for brunch and having everyone fight over the bill. The hostess who answered the phone informed me that I could not give my cc number over the phone but I could come in a few minutes early and give it to them in person. I showed up early but the hostess said I had to wait to be seated in order to give it to our waitress. Fine with me, whatever. I was the first one in my party to arrive since I came early, so I was seated at our table. We were seated right next to the door. It is 20 degrees out today so I asked if we could be moved to a table if the same size that I saw a few feet away that was empty. The hostess said no, that there was a larger party coming to sit at that table and that that specific table was expandable. Again, fine. Right after the rest of my party arrives, the table that I was eyeing before was seated with TWO people. Our party of four sat freezing by the door for the rest of the meal. As I said, the food was "eh". When it was time for the check, the waitress forgot that I had given her my credit card prior to the other guests arriving. She asked for a form of payment and I had to remind her in front of everyone that she still had my credit card. I thought the whole experience was pretty blasé and reminiscent of poor service I have had at almost every other Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.

Checked out Beatrix last night.  Still dreaming about the crispy roasted organic chicken.  It was very moist and tasty and the creamy polenta that  accompanied it was just about perfect.  The service was attentive, but the food was slow in coming out.  Can't wait to go back!

Was in Chicago over the summer and ate here when it first opened. The food was incredible. All five of us enjoyed our meals. My sister's meal came a tad bit later than everyone else's but our waiter apologized and gave us free pastries! The angel food cupcake was delicious and FREE!  The service here was also above average and our waiter was very attentive and engaged.  Awesome, hip restaurant.
Fantastic service, and wonderfully friendly staff! Food is tasty- just ask for recommendations!

My visit to Beatrix was on their second day open so I have taken that into consideration. It was apparent that they are taking it slow and not filling the place and spacing out reservations. Our waiter was well-informed and very pleasant, one of the high points. We were sat at a communal table which I do not mind but kind of weird when we had a reservation and there were plenty of open tables...thought they would put walk in's here.
Our apps were awesome....tsukune...which are an asian chicken meatball with a savory sauce...well done and tasty. The hamachi crudo was also perfect although the portion was small for I think 14 dollars.
We ordered a bottle, then another of a house red which was way overpriced for this type of place, sells wholesale for around 10 dollars and on the menu for $45....not a lot of thought spent to the variety and pricing of the wine list, surprising for a Lettuce place. Maybe they miss Alpana already. We ordered entrees and there was a long lag before we got them...maybe 40 minutes. One ordered the prime burger...and it was your typical upscale burger, cooked to temp. The fresh cut fries that came with looked and tasted like they had been sitting for a while, not hot of crisp and most little pieces. My birde ordered the skirt steak chimichurri....it sure did not look or taste like skirt, more like flank steak. It was not bad, but if this was skirt, I have never seen it this thick or texture. The chimichurri was not on the plate but I guess they call shishito pepppers the same thing? Weird. I had the Soy and Ginger Carmelized Pork Shoulder. It had great flavors, very tender, but the portion was incredibly small. There were about 5-6 small chunks of pork accompanied by no more than two tablespoons of mashed potatoes! The flavors were spot on but for $20...they could have at least double or even tripled the portion size and still kept their food cost in line. Maybe it was a kitchen mistake but pork shoulder is one of the most economical cuts of protein and mashed taters are very low cost.

One of my pet peeves is to see a handful of managers and the young GM walking all around the place, and not once did I see them approach a table of diners. Are they afraid of hearing something negative? I would have gladly given them some insight but they were too busy looking busy to really seem like they cared. There are other great operators in the city who take a much different approach and think they are missing the boat here.
Would I go back? Maybe to sit at the bar for a drink and apps but I think they have designed this to cater to the three new hotels on the block and will probably succeed given the traffic.
I really wanted to like it more and maybe they can turn it around but they need to look closely at the details and price points to get my business.

This place is great! Delicious lemon pancakes were so tasty and light, not too sweet. The lattes were savory and hit the spot, the best coffee! On top of all the yummy food is amazing. Annie was our waitress and she was helpful and accommodating. The only suggestion I have is to offer a few more vegetarian options.

Beatrix has an amazing vibe. Love the ambience, almost feels like a lounge/ living room you want to stay at for hours. The menu is very eclectic and everything we tried was 5  stars. Our waiter was very attentive and knew all aspects of the menu. This is our new favorite neighborhood restaurant for lunch and dinner.

Had breakfast this morning. Ordered waffles, cinnamon roll, pecan praline French toast, eggs, and pancakes. First order of pancakes came in runny. Manager was overly apologetic and remedied situation with cinnamon rolls for the table and removed pancakes from bill. Everything else was amazing! Thanks for your attentiveness. Would recommend for breakfast without hesitation!

So I usually don't write reviews but I loved this restaurant so much that I just had to! My girlfriends and I were in town for the week so we decided to check this place out since it was in the hotel we were staying at. The food was amazing! The service was the best I had ever had! And the atmosphere was so comfortable! We shared the hummus and Japanese meatballs as appetizers; amazing! And I had the Neatloaf which was surprisingly better than an actual meatloaf. My two friends got different salads which I tried and they tasted awesome! I had mentioned during our meal that it had been a rough day and our server Anthony did everything he could to make sure my evening went well he was sooo nice, loved him! Dessert was the best caramel pie I had ever eaten in my life and as soon as I get back to Chicago I will be coming here again, hands down!!! Thanks for an amazing first experience.

Beatrix is one of my favorite breakfast places in Chicago, not just because of the great food but also because of the service! Excellent atmosphere, good music and a bakery that is worth the trip alone.  Special shout out to Anthony - go bears!!
Good, the three grain chicken salad was wonderful.  The burger was a good burger!  Service was good, but the noise a bit much!!!

I just went to Beatrix for a work team lunch and it was excellent. We went to celebrate the completion of a big project and I was at first worried that Beatrix was too healthy and not hearty enough for such an event (I contemplated switching the reservations just the day before to a steak place). Healthier it was but it was also extremely hearty as you pretty much had to roll us out of there due to devouring all of our food. All 8 of us really enjoyed it and we all took advantage of the restaurant week menus. A couple of the people at our table got the neatloaf and all I can say is that I saw some members of the clean plate club. I could not finish my dish, the pot roast sandwich, but only because I was getting so full and wanted to save some room for dessert (caramel pie which was so rich and so yummy). Definitely interested in coming back their dinner and having some of their cocktails.

We found a great, new hangout in Beatrix! We had friends visiting and chose this location because it was attached to their hotel, Aloft, AND a NEW LEYE restaurant. As a hotel restaurant, we knew this would be different.
We started with house coffee, Bloody Marys and mimosas. (The Bloody Mary was delicious and well made.) We then sat for a good 30 minutes before ordering, catching up, and never felt rushed by our server, who was attentive and understanding . When we were ready she was very knowledgeable about the menu. We tried several plates of the turkey bacon and potato salad deviled eggs. The deviled eggs were amazing, seasoned with their window garden herbs. For the main course, I asked for some suggestions and was guided to the steak chimichurri with eggs. It was delicious and the eggs and steak were both cooked perfectly to order. Two of my friends had the house-made Belgian waffles, one had the prime burger, and the other had the egg white omelet which, for a healthy choice that I don't usually go for, looked amazing. Everyone was very pleased!
For dessert, we ordered several items to share; the tall, dark & handsome chocolate cake (what a great name), the caramel pie, and some house-made cookies from the pastry bar. Needless to say, nothing was left on any of the shared plates!
So far we've only eaten from the Sunday Brunch menu but we are really looking forward to enjoying other meals there as well.

I came to check out this newish place recently for date night and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere had quite the buzz and the service was excellent. Our waiter was really helpful in helping me pick out a drink from their list of unique mixed drinks and my date was happy to have a few local craft brews to choose from.... I had the Bluberry Tom Collins...it was excellent!  For the dinner I had the neatloaf  and my date had the truffle pasta... Both really good ... I appreciated that the neatloaf was made with Turkey rather then beef, a good switch for the health conscious eater. We will be coming back!

I ate here last week with a friend who was in from out of town and staying at the Aloft hotel.  I checked yelp for nearby places and this sounded good; we didn't realize it was the hotel restaurant until we got there -  you'd never guess that from the food.  Everything was spectacular from the hip vibe to our uber knowledgeable server Neil, to the food itself. After ordering a lemon drop martini and a Chicago brewed stout to drink, we started off with beet carpaccio and the famous deviled eggs, both dishes excellent in their own genres.  For the main course my friend got the caramelized pork shank and I got the chocolate chile salmon.  Each so delicious, the salmon came with mini corn (thank you!) tortillas, slaw and salsa to make exquisite fish tacos.  Not a desert person, I gave in to the suggestion of caramel pie and let me just say that for the first time I think I understand what people mean when they say sex is overrated.  It was THAT good...  My friend got the chia coconut pudding which was probably a less guilty choice but still flavorfully decadent.  We'll definitely return, would like to try the fresh juices with a choice of added alcohol next time.

Several months ago I had  lunch with friends from kindergarten at Beatrix.  We have been friends for 50 years.  It was a special day and we had an awesome time at Beatrix.  I wanted to get together with my friend who is sick and gave her 3 choices and she wanted to experience Beatrix.  I made an open table reservation and needed to extend the reservation by 15 min.  I called and the hostess was so nice.  When we arrived our server was John  was amazing.  I didn't want to rush the evening because I wanted to spend as much time with my friend.  We had a situation with the Valet.  I spoke to CANNON and she spoke to the valet.  They could not do anything,so she spoke to the hotel and CANNON informed us everything was alright.  My friend was very upset and started to tell CANNON this was unacceptable but CANNON remained very calm and professional.  I am not sure if CANNON Is the manager, but WOW she sure needs to be thanked from the management.  I will definitely be dining at this restaurant again in the future.

i really liked this place and can't wait to come back. i had lunch with work mates on a weekday afternoon. it was crowded for a late 130pm lunch. our waiter was super cool who made great recommendations so much that it made it difficult for me to decide. so i went for the sangria rather than juice and i had not doubt that i wanted the poached farm egg with truffle pasta and brussel sprouts and butternut squash. i am proud to say i was a member of the clean plate club! i hope i go back soon to try their pastries or brunch or another lunch!

Summer comfort food is the best way to describe their menu. The potato salad devilled eggs were a good way to begin our meal, but, they could have used a bit of a kick of flavor and color on the plate. My halibut was perfectly cooked although I think the creamy corn remoulade was too heavy of a sauce to dress the light summer fish. My dinner companion received her plate and bit into cold meat, unfortunately. They did re-fire her chimichurri skirt steak, and, she reported the wait being worth it. The server took it upon herself to bring complimentary dessert which was generous and very sweet. The strange part was she showed up with two bland, neutral colored breakfast pastries. We didn't need the "apology" dessert, but, if a restaurant is going to do it, they should present an actual sweet treat especially when they have a bakery on site. I may go back at some point to try their brunch, but, I might wait till they get it together.

I went to Beatrix today for Brunch with my wife. The service was very good and food was well presented but when my wife cut into her poached eggs she noticed that they were slightly overcooked, being British we were hesitant to complain but decided we would point it out when the waitress asked how our food was. When the waitress came and asked we said everything was nice but pointed out the eggs. She then  apologized and went to get the order redone. The replacement dish came out about 5 minutes later and the eggs were cooked perfectly. The manager also came over to apologize and once we had finished our brunch the waitress asked us if all was ok and informed us that our entire check had been settled. I had expected maybe a discount for my wife's meal. The manager also came over about 5 minutes later and brought us complimentary cookie and banana bread to make up for the earlier mistake, both of which were delicious. The way they handled this very minor complaint was outstanding and although ideally you would not haven anything to complain about I think the attitude is exactly what is needed for a new restaurant. My food was very good no complaints. We will definitely be going back
